text: Despite having an axe -like blade on it, it cannot cut trees.
The Palladium Pike appears to be a halberd rather than a pike, while the Orichalcum Halberd appears to be a pike rather than a halberd.

In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Ice Spikes have an additional 4.75% chance of inflicting the Frozen debuff for 2 / 2.5 seconds. Adding this to the regular 5% chance for 3 / 3.75 seconds, the Ice Spikes have a total chance of 9.75% of inflicting the debuff.
The Bestiary entry for the Spiked Ice Slime: " This Ice Slime has large ice shards in its mass from excessive exposure to the cold. Somehow, it is able to launch these at its prey. "

Wire is only available as a usable item after defeating Skeletron, as the Mechanic is encountered in the Dungeon. Although a limited amount of Wire can be obtained prior to that (by transmuting harvested In-/Active Stone Blocks or Explosives via Shimmer ), it cannot be placed without a wrench. Still, it can be crafted into timers, pumps, and other mechanism items which may have a use when combined with placed Wire that was naturally generated, i.e. in trap circuits.

The low defense of this armor can put Hardmode players at a disadvantage, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) even though it reduces enemy spawn rates. Therefore, it is recommended to take measures when fishing (e.g. a box of blocks with a floor of platforms, Peace Candles, traps, minions ) in order to prevent enemies from getting too close and/or quickly killing the player.
Fishing near NPCs also help as enemy spawn rates drastically decrease when near a town.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Angler armor is one of 3 armor sets that do not provide a set bonus, the others being Pink Snow armor and Snow armor.
Releasing a Gold Seahorse outside of water will cause it to be immobile. However, it will not die from this.

Despite the Golden Lock Box being a way to renewably obtain loot that would normally only generate randomly in the Dungeon, thus being similar to many other kinds of fishing crates, and despite the crates which contain it also containing Books (on Desktop, Console, and Mobile ), neither the Dungeon Crate, Stockade Crate, nor Golden Lock Box contain the Bone Welder. However, on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version the Alchemy Table can be fished in the Dungeon. However, on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version the Alchemy Table can be fished in the Dungeon.
In drunk worlds, players can obtain Dungeon and Shadow Chest gear pre- Skeletron by opening Golden Lock Boxes.

If the player does not have high defense or a Cobalt Shield, they may have trouble fishing, due to the increased enemy spawn rate that will constantly damage and knock them around. To combat this, the player should break all nearby Water Candles, replace them with Peace Candles, and/or drink a Calming Potion to decrease enemy spawn rates. The player may also choose to box themselves in with blocks to avoid melee-based enemies, though this has no effect on enemies or enemies with projectiles that can pass through walls, such as the Dark Caster and Cursed Skull. Clearing out nearby enemies with minions is a recommended strategy to minimize the threat they can pose. However the Starfury can be used to kill them without having to leave the box. To combat this, the player should break all nearby Water Candles, replace them with Peace Candles, and/or drink a Calming Potion to decrease enemy spawn rates. The player may also choose to box themselves in with blocks to avoid melee-based enemies, though this has no effect on enemies or enemies with projectiles that can pass through walls, such as the Dark Caster and Cursed Skull. Clearing out nearby enemies with minions is a recommended strategy to minimize the threat they can pose. However the Starfury can be used to kill them without having to leave the box. However the Starfury can be used to kill them without having to leave the box.

The explosions from Srollers are actually a special type of contact damage instead of projectiles, so they can interact with effects related with contact damage (e.g. they can be parried by Brand of the Inferno or Sergeant United Shield ).
Srollers will stay in their curled-up state when submerged in liquids until they lunge at the player and touch solid ground, in which they will then return to their normal state.
Although Srollers appear to have a visual height of 4 tiles, they can pass through 3 tile-tall spaces.
Its name is a portmanteau of the words solar and roller.
In real life, flounders are a group of flatfish species. They are found at the bottom of oceans around the world; some species will also enter estuaries.
The Money Trough is not a pet and cannot be placed into the pet equipment slot.

If the Money Trough is placed into the Flying Piggy Bank, once it despawns it will only be accessible after removing from an actual Piggy Bank or another Money Trough. Marking the Money Trough as favorite will prevent it from being placed into the Flying Piggy Bank. Marking the Money Trough as favorite will prevent it from being placed into the Flying Piggy Bank.
The Money Trough will always be facing the player, except while it is moving when spawned.
It can be used to store situational, less-used items, e.g. hammers, potions, fishing equipment, or alternate armor or weapons, which would otherwise clog up inventory space.

It is a useful item for Expert Mode players, who lose 75% of their coins upon death, and Master Mode players, who lose all of their coins, rather than 50%, due to its ability to allow a player to deposit their coins at will, regardless of their location.
The Money Trough is a useful item throughout the whole game, and can be obtained early. With some preparation, it can be obtained after a single Blood Moon.
It may be worthwhile to hold off on defeating the Wall of Flesh until after acquiring a Money Trough, as Hardmode Blood Moons have a much higher variety of enemies, making it an even rarer drop.
When buying from a vendor NPC, the coins stored in the Piggy Bank via the Money Trough will be used if there is not enough in the inventory.
To get the Money Trough faster, the player may place a Water Candle or consume a Battle Potion, as Blood Moons do not have a set spawn rate.
The Flying Piggy Bank is an allusion to the phrase when pigs fly, a figure of speech used to humorously describe something that is thought to be impossible or will never happen.
When spawning or despawning the Flying Piggy Bank, it emits an oink, sometimes with slightly differing pitches.

The Shadewood Sword can only be obtained in worlds that generated with the Crimson. If one has a Corruption world, they can either create an artificial Crimson to obtain the sword, or just simply bring one in from a Crimson world.

The Shadewood Sword's sprite is very similar to that of the Wooden Sword; however, there are some notable changes. The color of the sword is darker than the normal Wooden Sword, and seems to share the same color palette as the Ebonwood Sword. It has the same two pointy protrusions on its blade as its Corruption equivalent, but the handle on this sword appears to be parallel with the blade.
Despite it being able to wield and drop a Butcher's Chainsaw, the one it carries does not emit sparks upon contact with the player.
Unlike most other enemies, Butchers can open doors and Tall Gates with one hit.
Butchers can damage players through one-tile-thick walls.

One should exercise extreme caution when fighting Butchers at close range, as they maneuver very fast, and can kill the player quickly. Using weapons that can strike them at a distance is recommended.

The Butcher is a reference to the character Leatherface from the 1974 American horror film The Texas Chain Saw Massacre. [1] However, its sprite actually resembles Vincent Smith from the 1980 American horror film Motel Hell.

The Venus Magnum can be considered a direct upgrade of the Uzi, as it boasts minor improvements to almost all stats. However, on the Old-gen console version the Venus Magnum does not have the auto-fire feature of the Uzi, the lack of which can make it physically tiring to use.

One would need to defeat (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 230 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 460 Angry Trappers for a 90% chance of obtaining an Uzi (or (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 460 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 920 for a 99% chance).

The Uzi can be considered an alternative to the Megashark, if the player is fortunate enough to have an Angry Trapper drop it. The main differences are: The Uzi is obtainable before defeating any Hardmode bosses, while the Megashark requires The Destroyer to be defeated first. The Uzi has a 172% higher base knockback /second than the Megashark (23.333 versus 8.571). The Uzi is slightly slower but deals more damage per round. On enemies with more than 36 defense, the Uzi deals more damage per second using Crystal Bullets than a Megashark using the same. The Uzi lacks the Megashark's ammo conservation feature, which can easily be compensated for with an Endless Musket Pouch (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The bullets will still be released from the gun as High Velocity Bullets. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Uzi is much cheaper to reforge, making it less expensive to acquire the Unreal modifier. The Uzi compared to the Megashark is fairly inaccurate, with up to 15° of bullet spread. The Uzi is obtainable before defeating any Hardmode bosses, while the Megashark requires The Destroyer to be defeated first. The Uzi has a 172% higher base knockback /second than the Megashark (23.333 versus 8.571). The Uzi is slightly slower but deals more damage per round. On enemies with more than 36 defense, the Uzi deals more damage per second using Crystal Bullets than a Megashark using the same. The Uzi lacks the Megashark's ammo conservation feature, which can easily be compensated for with an Endless Musket Pouch (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The bullets will still be released from the gun as High Velocity Bullets. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Uzi is much cheaper to reforge, making it less expensive to acquire the Unreal modifier. The Uzi compared to the Megashark is fairly inaccurate, with up to 15° of bullet spread.

The Uzi is one of the 11 guns in Terraria based on a real gun, the others being the Chain Gun, Flintlock Pistol, Handgun, Musket, Quad-Barrel Shotgun (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Red Ryder (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), Revolver (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), Shotgun, Sniper Rifle, and Tactical Shotgun. It is named after the Uzi, a family of Israeli submachine guns. Out of these, the Uzi and Red Ryder are the only two to use the trademarks of the guns they are referencing. Out of these, the Uzi and Red Ryder are the only two to use the trademarks of the guns they are referencing.

Upon its introduction in the 1.2 update, the Uzi was the rarest item in the game, with a 1/80000 (0.00125%) drop chance. However, this drop rate was drastically increased in the 1.2.0.3 patch shortly afterward.

The Sniper Rifle, Uzi, and Venus Magnum all share the same tooltip. Uniquely out of these three, only the Uzi can be obtained prior to defeating any mechanical bosses (the other two are post- Plantera, which in turn requires defeating all three mechanical bosses), allowing the player to use High Velocity Bullets before they are properly craftable. Uniquely out of these three, only the Uzi can be obtained prior to defeating any mechanical bosses (the other two are post- Plantera, which in turn requires defeating all three mechanical bosses), allowing the player to use High Velocity Bullets before they are properly craftable.

Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ).
The Clothier also drops his hat, the Red Hat when he dies. Unlike the Clothier, wearing the Peddler's Hat will not cause the Traveling Merchant to display a different dialog.
Even though the Toy Sled is Christmas-themed, it can be obtained at any time of the year.
In a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), this armor set is obtainable before defeating Skeletron, as Dungeon enemies can spawn prior to defeating the boss.
The Ancient Necro Helmet has the same sprite as the Necro Helmet had before 1.0.3, thus the phrase Ancient in it.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Ancient Necro Helmet grants 1% less bonus damage than the Necro Helmet.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The set bonus stacks with other ammo conservation bonuses. When used with the Megashark, it produces a 60% chance to not consume ammo. Furthermore, using the Ammo Box from the Traveling Merchant will result in a 68% chance not to consume ammo. If an Ammo Reservation Potion is then used, the player's chance not to consume ammo amounts to 74.4%, meaning only approximately every fourth shot consumes a bullet.
Given both Cobwebs and Bones in surplus, making Necro Helmets is the most profitable way of monetizing either of them.
The term necro comes from the Ancient Greek word νεκρός ( nekrós, "dead").
It is the only armor set in the game of a 02* rarity.
The Bestiary entry for the Gold Ladybug: " Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! They are worth great coin to shopkeepers and fish absolutely love golden bait! "
The damage bonus stacks with all other emblems, including the Sorcerer Emblem, Avenger Emblem and Destroyer Emblem.
The pickup effect does not stack with the Celestial Magnet or the Celestial Cuffs.

Despite requiring the Avenger Emblem to craft, which increases all damage, the Celestial Emblem only boosts magic damage. However, the Celestial Emblem is the only accessory derived from the Avenger Emblem to provide a higher damage bonus of 15%, matching the original emblems dropped by the Wall of Flesh. Other Avenger Emblem derivatives either keep its 12% bonus or decrease it further. Because of this, this accessory can be considered a Sorcerer Emblem upgrade after all three mechanical bosses have been defeated. However, the Celestial Emblem is the only accessory derived from the Avenger Emblem to provide a higher damage bonus of 15%, matching the original emblems dropped by the Wall of Flesh. Other Avenger Emblem derivatives either keep its 12% bonus or decrease it further. Because of this, this accessory can be considered a Sorcerer Emblem upgrade after all three mechanical bosses have been defeated.
When any Gem Robe is equipped in an armor slot without a Wizard Hat, Tim 's spawn rate will be increased to 5 times.
This item is the armor analog to the Amethyst Staff.

The Amethyst Robe is one of the three items which provide bonuses when equipped in an armor slot but have a defense value of zero. The others are Wood Greaves (provides 1 point of defense if full set is equipped) and Djinn's Curse (provides immunity to fall damage).

When summoned, the sword will be spawned at the cursor, but will instantly teleport behind the player. It will also hover behind the player when idle. If more than one sword is summoned, they will arrange themselves in a wing-like configuration.
The Terraprisma has custom immunity frames, allowing it to hit more often than other piercing attacks.
Unlike most minions, the sword will immediately return to the user's side when no more targets are in range, preventing it from getting stuck behind blocks and blocking its field of vision.

The Terraprisma swords will not move/attack through blocks by default, but if they attack an enemy in direct line of sight, they will then continue to attack any other nearby enemies, ignoring blocks, before returning to the player.
The minions leave a rainbow trail while moving.

If dyed with Critter Shampoo, basic, bright, and gradient dyes will have little effect on the sword's colors due to its bright coloration. Compound and most strange dyes will work properly as they more effectively override the sword's color.
If the player's back is against a wall, door, or other solid blocks, the Terraprisma will phase through these obstructions and attack any enemies within range.

Like the Blade Staff and Sanguine Staff, the Terraprisma's precise movement, tracking, and fixed idle position make it an ideal choice for assisting the player with faster bosses and for crowd control.

The Terraprisma is commonly regarded as a contender for the strongest summon weapon in the game due to its exceptional overall combat versatility and performance in any situation, even despite the immensely difficult method of acquiring it. The Terraprisma generally competes with or outperforms many other summon weapons in the endgame once it is paired with the right armor, accessories, and whips.

Although its sprite appears to be a sword, it is actually a summon weapon. This is similar to other sword lookalikes such as the Sky Fracture, which is actually a magic weapon, and the Durendal, which is actually a whip.
Just like the Eventide, the Terraprisma seems to be based on the Empress of Light 's Ethereal Lance.
Despite the tooltip, the summoned minions look nothing like the Enchanted Sword item or the Enchanted Sword enemy.
The Terraprisma has the highest base damage of all minion-summoning weapons despite being obtainable pre- Golem and only having a rarity of 05*.
The Terraprisma and Abigail's Flower are the only minion-summoning weapons that do not have the word staff in their name.
When multiple minions are summoned, their pattern actually forms a helix. This is only visible with very large numbers of minions.
Like the Last Prism, the Terraprisma has secret color themes for developers and beta testers. This is triggered by using a specific set of character names:

The yoyo is named after the One Drop YoYo's "Format:C", a competition-oriented yoyo ("C" stands for competition). The physical yoyo's name itself may also be a reference to the Windows command format, which when used in the form format C: will destroy the filesystem on the C drive and replace it with an empty one, wiping out your Windows installation in the process. The physical yoyo's name itself may also be a reference to the Windows command format, which when used in the form format C: will destroy the filesystem on the C drive and replace it with an empty one, wiping out your Windows installation in the process.

Its effects do not stack with those of the accessories used to craft it. For example, wearing both the Architect Gizmo Pack and Extendo Grip will not grant +6 range. However, it still stacks with the Toolbox and Toolbelt. Furthermore, similar to the Brick Layer and Portable Cement Mixer, the increase in tile/wall placement speed additively stacks with the bonus from the Builder buff granted by the Builder Potion for a total increase of 75%, respectively. However, it still stacks with the Toolbox and Toolbelt. Furthermore, similar to the Brick Layer and Portable Cement Mixer, the increase in tile/wall placement speed additively stacks with the bonus from the Builder buff granted by the Builder Potion for a total increase of 75%, respectively.
Similar to the Extendo Grip, one can interact with NPCs, storage items, doors, and Switches from a slightly further distance than normal.

Like with the Paint Sprayer, the auto-paint feature also works if the Architect Gizmo Pack is only placed in the inventory and not equipped. The other features do require the accessory to be equipped in order to function. Likewise, the Architect Gizmo Pack will use the paint that is first in order in the inventory. Likewise, the Architect Gizmo Pack will use the paint that is first in order in the inventory.
The Paint Sprayer effect can be turned off with a toggle on the top left of the screen.
Even though all items involved in crafting the Architect Gizmo Pack are also available on the Old-gen console version, it is only craftable on Desktop, Console, and Mobile.
Although all ingredients and the Tinkerer's Workshop can be obtained pre-Hardmode, the Architect Gizmo Pack has an unusually high rarity of 05*.

Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the Weather Radio do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The Weather Radio may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.
If a Sandstorm is occurring within the world, the Weather Radio's information will alternate between displaying the current weather and wind speed and a "Sandstorm" alert message.
The Fisherman's Pocket Guide, Weather Radio, and Sextant are interchangeable with Shimmer.
If an event is happening, the Weather Radio will still display the weather.
The Weather Radio will not display the Slime Rain event.
The projectiles do not appear to be fired directly from the weapon but are summoned from random points near the player.
Each sword projectile can take on one of 14 different appearances.

When using the Sky Fracture, the projectiles will converge on where the player's cursor is. Because of this, the closer the player's cursor is to them, the more the projectiles will spread. Therefore, when aiming at distant targets one should try to position the cursor as close to the target as possible.
While its base damage is rather low, this is alleviated by its three-round attack and exceptional critical strike chance, making it a very powerful early-Hardmode weapon.

Since the critical strike chance of a projectile is not based on the weapon that fired it, but rather the one the player is currently holding, this weapon pairs exceptionally well with the Nimbus Rod and Clinger Staff, as their static projectiles will inherit its 24% critical strike chance after being summoned.
Despite looking like a spear, the Sky Fracture is a magic weapon.
This weapon is tied with the Obsidian Swordfish for the second-highest critical strike chance (24%), being beaten only by the Sniper Rifle (29%).
Until 1.3.5, items had an unused internal name. The Sky Fracture's name was "magic glove", [1] which suggests this item once took the appearance of a glove.

The Sky Fracture is one of a small "set" of weapons made with two shards apiece, the other members being the Onyx Blaster and the Dao of Pow. Their recipes, names, and appearances link the weapons to themes of Darkness, Light, and Balance, with the Sky Fracture representing Light. The set also includes one weapon for each of the three "classic" damage types ( melee, magic, and ranged ), where the Sky Fracture is the magic weapon.
The set bonus allows regeneration while afflicted with the Bleeding debuff.
The buff can be triggered with the player's minions ' attacks, and can be triggered when attacking critters or Target Dummies.
While not the largest or quickest heal, it can be useful for the beginning of Hardmode, especially when used with ranged weapons, to safely regenerate from a distance.

In comparison to the melee version of Adamantite armor, the melee Palladium armor is still valuable. It grants 18 less defense than the Adamantite armor, so the player will take 9 / 14 / 18 more damage. Therefore, as long as they get hit less often than every 4.5 / 7 / 9 seconds (the time needed to heal the damage the Adamantite armor would have prevented), the player's survivability is greater with Palladium armor.

The Squire armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be considered an upgrade to Palladium armor, as the Squire's Great Helm provides a constant 2 HP/sec regeneration. Later on, the Valhalla Knight armor 's breastplate provides 4 HP/sec regeneration.
The Rapid Healing buff stacks additively with the Life Drain 's buff.
With the Shiny Red Balloon equipped, total jump height increases to 23.5 tiles (10.5 tiles + 13 tiles).
This item can stack with the Cloud in a Bottle, Fart in a Jar, Blizzard in a Bottle, and Sandstorm in a Bottle for up to five extra jumps.
The double jump can be used to negate fall damage if timed correctly.

The Tsunami in a Bottle is arguably the easiest double-jump accessory to obtain, depending on the availability of bait and large bodies of water, and is a much safer option than exploring the world in search of a Cloud, Blizzard, or even a rare Sandstorm in a Bottle.

It is the only Bottle Accessory that cannot be combined with the Shiny Red Balloon, as it is instead combined with the Balloon Pufferfish. Perhaps for this reason, the combined item does not follow the convention of the other accessories and is not called a "Tsunami in a Balloon". However, when attached to a Lucky Horseshoe, it does follow the naming convention of the others.
Unlike Announcement Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Grandfather Clocks do not send status messages telling the time when activated via wire.

The clock faces of all Grandfather Clocks read 9:00, except for the Slime, Marble, Granite, Lihzahrd, Crystal, and Lesion Clocks, which read 3:00. The Boreal Wood Clock only reads 3:00 in its item sprite. The times on the clocks are indeed full hours (instead of 12:15 or 12:45, as both hands are seemingly equal on most clocks), because upon closer examination of the Glass Clock it becomes noticeable that the long hand is pointed upwards.
The Flesh Clock appears to have a Drippler in it.
The Martian Astro Clock resembles the design of Martian Walkers.
Purification Powder will not clear through Corrupt or Crimson thorny bushes, leaving the player to manually break them before they spread their respective biome.
Using the Purification Powder to Vile Mushrooms or Vicious Mushrooms will convert them into Jungle Spores.

To affect walls, there must be a block within one tile of that wall when the Thrown Powder is used on it. Purification Powder does not revert Corrupted/Crimson-infected walls to their pure form. The Clentaminator offers an easier yet much more costly alternative to converting background walls. The Clentaminator offers an easier yet much more costly alternative to converting background walls.
All powder variants cannot be purchased from the Dryad in Don't dig up and getfixedboi worlds.

Purification Powder is one of the only methods of tunneling through Ebonstone or Crimstone to reach Shadow Orbs / Crimson Hearts in pre-Hardmode without needing to defeat the Eater of Worlds or the Brain of Cthulhu, the other methods being to use explosives or (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) a Reaver Shark.
(Old-gen console version) The most profitable way to sell Bee Wax is to craft them into Bee Headgear. 80 pieces will make 10 Bee Headgears which sell for 45 GC.
It is the fastest "axe" in pre-Hardmode, with a fixed mining speed of 4, compared to 12 for the Molten Hamaxe with the Light modifier.
The Sawtooth Shark is the only pre-Hardmode chainsaw.
There are three fish tools that can be obtained through fishing : the Sawtooth Shark, the Reaver Shark (a pickaxe), and the Rockfish (a hammer).
For a list of all usable and equipable items that can be obtained through fishing, see Other fishing catches.
The Sawtooth Shark makes a buzzing noise when in use, despite not being able to have any motor.
The Sawtooth Shark is a reference to the real world species of sharks, similar to the sawfish. Both of which have sideways rows of teeth on their upper jaws similar to the titular saw.
The Hardy Saddle can only be obtained by opening Golden and Titanium Crates.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Life Crystals can be obtained by opening Golden and Titanium Crates, making them renewable.

When the player is inflicted with Confused, the control behaviors are as follows: ↷ Jump controls are unaffected. When the player is walking, riding a Minecart, or using a ground mount : ◀ Left makes the player go right, and ▶ Right makes the player go left. ▲ Up makes the player jump down surfaces. This includes platforms, Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), furniture, liquid surfaces when Water Walking, etc. Interacting with Ropes : ▼ Down makes the player grab onto the Rope, but will not make them ascend along the Rope; ▲ Up makes the player descend along the Rope. Using Featherfall Potion or similar effects: ▲ Up makes the player fall faster. Using the Inner Tube (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or the Flamingo Mount (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) : holding ▲ Up makes the player descend in liquids. Using the Anti-Gravity Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or the Static Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) : ▲ Up, ◀ Left, and ▶ Right make the player move in the opposite direction, respectively. ▼ Down has no effect. Using regular wings : the player can fly normally, but with inverted horizontal controls. Using wings with vertical boost (e.g. Jetpack ): the boost can be activated by holding ◀ Left and ↷ Jump at the same time. Using wings with hover ability (e.g. Hoverboard ): the hover can be activated by holding/clicking ▲ Up while flying, depending on the Hover Controls setting. Using flying mounts (e.g. UFO (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Lava Shark (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in liquids): ◀ Left makes the player ascend to upper-right; ▶ Right makes the player go left; ▲ Up makes the player descend; ↷ Jump makes the player ascend; ▼ Down has no effect. Activating set bonuses : when set to "Down", double tap ▲ Up to activate; when set to "Up", double tap ◀ Left to activate. ↷ Jump controls are unaffected. When the player is walking, riding a Minecart, or using a ground mount : ◀ Left makes the player go right, and ▶ Right makes the player go left. ▲ Up makes the player jump down surfaces. This includes platforms, Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), furniture, liquid surfaces when Water Walking, etc. Interacting with Ropes : ▼ Down makes the player grab onto the Rope, but will not make them ascend along the Rope; ▲ Up makes the player descend along the Rope. Using the Anti-Gravity Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or the Static Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) : ▲ Up, ◀ Left, and ▶ Right make the player move in the opposite direction, respectively. ▼ Down has no effect. Using regular wings : the player can fly normally, but with inverted horizontal controls. Using wings with vertical boost (e.g. Jetpack ): the boost can be activated by holding ◀ Left and ↷ Jump at the same time. Using wings with hover ability (e.g. Hoverboard ): the hover can be activated by holding/clicking ▲ Up while flying, depending on the Hover Controls setting. Using flying mounts (e.g. UFO (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Lava Shark (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in liquids): ◀ Left makes the player ascend to upper-right; ▶ Right makes the player go left; ▲ Up makes the player descend; ↷ Jump makes the player ascend; ▼ Down has no effect. Activating set bonuses : when set to "Down", double tap ▲ Up to activate; when set to "Up", double tap ◀ Left to activate.
On the Console version, players inflicted with Confused have reversed movement, but not reversed aiming.
The Princess is one of the starting NPCs in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds, always named Yorai.

Five of the Princess's names are Japanese, each of which have different meanings: Ai translates to "love" (愛). Hikari translates to "light" (光). Hime translates to "princess" (姫). Momo translates to "peach" (桃). Based on the translation, the name "Princess Momo" means "Princess Peach". Yuuki translates to "courage" or "bravery" (勇気). Ai translates to "love" (愛). Hikari translates to "light" (光). Hime translates to "princess" (姫). Momo translates to "peach" (桃). Based on the translation, the name "Princess Momo" means "Princess Peach". Yuuki translates to "courage" or "bravery" (勇気).
" Like my dress? Gee, thanks! Just sewed it. " is a reference to a similar lyric from the song " 7 Rings " by Ariana Grande.

Some of the Princess's names are references to characters from popular culture: Alice from the 1865 novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Ariel from the 1989 American animated musical fantasy movie The Little Mermaid. Belle from the 1991 American animated musical romantic fantasy movie Beauty and the Beast. Charlotte from the Japanese seinen manga series Berserk. Emilia from the 2014 Japanese light novel series Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. (Cure) Flora from the 2015 Japanese magical girl anime series Go! Princess PreCure. Peach (Momo; see above) and Rosetta (the Japanese name of Rosalina ) from the Japanese media franchise Mario. Rosetta could also reference the 2008 American computer animated movie Tinker Bell. Sofia from the 2013 American animated children's television series Sofia the First. Alice from the 1865 novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Ariel from the 1989 American animated musical fantasy movie The Little Mermaid. Peach (Momo; see above) and Rosetta (the Japanese name of Rosalina ) from the Japanese media franchise Mario. Rosetta could also reference the 2008 American computer animated movie Tinker Bell. The Princess has the chance to share the name Faye with the Dryad.
One of the Princess' possible names is Yorai, named after Yoraiz0r, one of the lead developers of Terraria.
The Princess is implied to be a child. Similar to the Angler, her sprite is shorter than most other NPCs' sprites, and they share the same death message.

The Princess has a happiness quote for herself: " <name of Princess> is a little unsettling to be around, but terribly cute! ". This quote cannot be legitimately seen in-game, since it requires two copies of the same NPCs to be alive at once.
Her quote calling the Truffle a "fun guy" plays on the homophone for fungi.
The quote, " The stars at night remind me of glitter on a beautiful, black dress. I shall soon have one made! " could be a reference to her Shimmered form which was added after she was introduced.

Along with the Traveling Merchant, Zoologist, Steampunker, and Cyborg, she is among a small group of NPCs who sell a new item post- Moon Lord. The Princess's item is a Music Box (which requires the player to defeat the Moon Lord during Hardmode).
The Princess is the only NPC who likes and is liked by all other NPCs.

Placing a shallow lava pit in the floor of the Clothier's house (e.g. by pouring one Lava Bucket into an 8- or 9-tile long horizontal recession of one tile height) will cause the Clothier to die and respawn often, leaving behind the Red Hat each time, which can be sold for 2 SC each. However, it is more lucrative to fight Skeletron by using a Clothier Voodoo Doll to kill the Clothier at night, which causes Skeletron to spawn. Skeletron drops 5 GC when defeated, not accounting for the other drops that can be sold. However, it is more lucrative to fight Skeletron by using a Clothier Voodoo Doll to kill the Clothier at night, which causes Skeletron to spawn. Skeletron drops 5 GC when defeated, not accounting for the other drops that can be sold.

Most of the Clothier's dialogues refer to movies starring the American actor and filmmaker Tom Hanks, namely Cast Away, Forrest Gump, The Ladykillers, Apollo 13, A League of Their Own, and The Polar Express.
One of the possible names for the Clothier is James. This is a reference to Terraria YouTuber James Benett, who is better known as ChippyGaming and uses the Clothier as his avatar.

The Clothier appears to want to eat the Truffle. This can be seen in the Truffle's quote, " Everyone in this town feels a bit off. I woke up to the clothier chewing on my foot last night. " and the Clothier's quote, " I'll give you a discount on your wears if you can convince <name of Truffle> to come over for a...sizing. " This is further confirmed by the Clothier loving to live near the Truffle, while the Truffle dislikes being a neighbor of the Clothier. Since NPCs charge lower prices when NPCs they like are nearby, this means the Clothier will keep his promise if the player follows through with his request. This is further confirmed by the Clothier loving to live near the Truffle, while the Truffle dislikes being a neighbor of the Clothier. Since NPCs charge lower prices when NPCs they like are nearby, this means the Clothier will keep his promise if the player follows through with his request.

The quote " I keep having vague memories of tying up a woman and throwing her in a dungeon. " is a reference to the fact that the Bound Mechanic is found in the Dungeon. This implies that he, while possessed by Skeletron, was responsible for the act. This is further confirmed by the Clothier's confused hatred of the Mechanic with him having very little memory of what happened before. This is further confirmed by the Clothier's confused hatred of the Mechanic with him having very little memory of what happened before.

The quote " That Red Hat of yours looks familiar... " is a reference to the player murdering him for the hat, as that is the only way to obtain it legitimately. Additionally, this quote will always override all others as long as the hat is on. This may also suggest that the Clothier may have an awareness of his previous self, as he is one of the only two NPCs to say something like that, the other being the Guide with the line " I wonder why my predecessor spontaneously burst into flames. Hopefully it doesn't happen to me... ". On a similar note, both NPCs are also the only two NPCs that can summon a boss when killed and have their own voodoo dolls. This may also suggest that the Clothier may have an awareness of his previous self, as he is one of the only two NPCs to say something like that, the other being the Guide with the line " I wonder why my predecessor spontaneously burst into flames. Hopefully it doesn't happen to me... ". On a similar note, both NPCs are also the only two NPCs that can summon a boss when killed and have their own voodoo dolls.

The name Pip may be a reference to Philip Pirrip, called Pip, the protagonist in the 1861 novel Great Expectations by Charles Dickens. Pip goes through multiple different profession changes, and eventually becomes a responsible person at the end. The Clothier starting off as an old man and then turning into a man with a stable job and income may be a metaphor for what Pip had gone through in the book.

Defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu is not strictly necessary to craft the set, as the ingredients are dropped during the fight. It can be crafted after killing an average of 9 Creepers or 27 Eater of Worlds segments.

Despite being made from Obsidian, this armor set grants no special protection against the On Fire! or Burning debuffs, whereas other Obsidian-related items do, like the Obsidian Skin Potion and Obsidian Skull.
The whip speed from its set bonus stacks multiplicatively with melee speed bonuses.
This set's unique set bonus to whip damage is possibly a reference to cowboys often being depicted with whips, as this armor is themed around a wild west outlaw.

Despite being a pre-Hardmode armor set, it gives higher summon damage boosts than most armor sets, only beaten by Spooky armor, Stardust armor, and tier 3 armors from the Tavernkeep. This makes it a viable choice for boosting sentry damage during the Old One's Army if the respective armor sets have not been obtained.

The internal names of the Obsidian Outlaw Hat and Longcoat are "ObsidianHelm" and "ObsidianShirt", which may signify that the original designs looked more like traditional armor pieces. These could also just be placeholder names.
Houses using this wall will take 4 times longer on average for an NPC to move in naturally. This is the only wall having this mechanic. [1]

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Selling the bar rather than the ore yields an extra 4 SC per bar. The bars also sell for significantly more than anything that can be made from them. Once a complete set of Crimson equipment has been made, it is more profitable to sell raw bars and Tissue Samples. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the value of Crimtane Bars was decreased and the value of Crimtane Ores was increased, such that three ores sell for exactly as much as one bar. Therefore, it is more efficient to sell the raw ores. The bars also sell for significantly more than anything that can be made from them. Once a complete set of Crimson equipment has been made, it is more profitable to sell raw bars and Tissue Samples. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the value of Crimtane Bars was decreased and the value of Crimtane Ores was increased, such that three ores sell for exactly as much as one bar. Therefore, it is more efficient to sell the raw ores.
Prior to 1.3.0.1, the texture for the Crimtane Bar was a recolored version of the Hellstone Bar.
The Demonite Bar has a flavor text tooltip, but the Crimtane Bar does not.

Chinese New Year, also known as the Spring Festival, is an important Chinese celebration. It traditionally runs for 15 days, starting from the evening preceding the new moon of the first lunar month, which can fall anywhere from January 21st to February 21st. It culminates with the Lantern Festival on the final (15th) day.

The official calendar in modern-day China is the Gregorian calendar (where the New Year always falls on January 1st), but the traditional Chinese calendar, known as the lunar calendar, is used to determine the dates of traditional Chinese holidays, and guide Chinese people in selecting the luckiest days for weddings and other important life events.

The Mythical set referred to the Lion dance, performed during Chinese New Year celebrations. Gold on the lion represents liveliness, and red represents courage. The lion head is massive, and usually requires two performers.

Real-world Red envelopes contain monetary gifts presented at social and family gatherings, such as weddings or holidays, including the Chinese New Year. The red color of the envelope symbolizes good luck and is believed to ward off evil spirits.
Real-world Firecrackers are a traditional part of the Chinese New Year celebration. They are set off to scare away evil spirits and cleanse for the New Year.
Jungle Grass Seeds have a 1/100 (1%) chance to drop from destroying any plant growing on Jungle grass.

Jungle grass will not create an Underground Jungle environment when planted just below ground level (zero depth). Natural Underground Jungles begin below -60 feet in a small world, -90 feet in a medium world, and -120 feet in a large world.
Jungle grass grows at a rate comparable to Mushroom grass, which is much slower than ordinary grass.
The Flower Boots allow creating wild Jungle plants very quickly, which makes them useful for obtaining large amounts of Jungle Grass Seeds, even despite the low drop rate.

Mushroom Grass Seeds may be used as an alternative to Jungle Grass Seeds, as Mushroom grass can be converted to Jungle grass using the Clentaminator / Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) with Green Solution. Mushroom Grass Seeds are much easier to obtain, since they can be purchased.
A much better way to get money from Lenses, rather than simply selling them, is to accumulate them to craft Suspicious Looking Eyes, kill the Eye of Cthulhu, and sell the rewards.

Later in the game, Mechanical Eyes can be crafted and used similarly, but even in the advanced game, The Twins remain a tougher opponent, and profiting off their drops is a rather more involved process.
In some of his quotes, the Merchant claims to sell Lenses, despite not actually selling them.
Water and honey will not prevent damage from a Meteorite block.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Meteorite cannot be broken by explosives before Hardmode.
Turning Meteorite into Meteorite Bars and selling them is 133% more profitable than selling the raw Meteorite itself.
Blocks between the player and a Meteorite block will prevent damage. A layer of Sand or a similar gravity-affected block can effectively negate much of the danger of mining Meteorite.

If a player places at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 75 / (Old-gen console version) 50 / (3DS version) 23 pieces of Meteorite, they can create an artificial Meteorite biome, where all enemy spawns are replaced by Meteor Heads.

While Water / Honey will not prevent the damage from Meteorite blocks, they will cancel the On Fire! debuff that Meteor Heads have a chance to inflict, meaning that they can still be useful to bring when mining in a Meteorite biome.
Meteorite, Hellstone, Luminite, and Obsidian are the only ores that do not have "ore" in the name.
The Bestiary page for the Town Bunny depicts the Angora bunny breed by default.
The Bunny's quotes reference the lack of popular onomatopoeia for bunny noises in written English (unlike "Meow" or "Woof" for cats and dogs, respectively).
Despite the real-life Flemish breed of rabbit being one of the giant breeds, the sprite is the same size as the others.
The "White" variant is a reference to the real-life Florida White breed of rabbit, with red eyes and an albino fur pattern to match.
The "Silver" variant is a reference to the real-life Standard Chinchilla rabbit breed, named after their resemblance to a Chinchilla.
The Bestiary entry for the Tomb Crawler: " The desert is home to one of the largest varieties of worms across the land. It has a voracious appetite for careless explorers. "
Placing a faulty gate lamp above a logic gate turns it blue, overriding its normal functionality and changing its behavior entirely. For more information, see Logic Gates § Faulty lamps.
These are flexible, so more than two Logic Gate Lamps may be used for a gate.
The state of the lamp is inverted with activation by wire, so placing an "on" lamp can be used to negate an input. This is useful, as there are no NOT gates in Terraria due to the wiring logic.
Stone Walls can be Hallowed, provided that there is Pearlstone or Pearlsand within range.

Stone Walls can be converted into Ebonstone Walls, Crimstone Walls and Pearlstone Walls with the Purple, Red and Blue Solution, respectively. All three can additionally be converted back into Stone Wall with the Green Solution.
Stone Walls used in housing converted into Ebonstone, Crimstone, or Pearlstone Walls will make that housing become unsuitable.
Rapid-fire weapons or weapons with high knockback will help deal with the Swamp Thing's fast speed.

The Swamp Thing is a fictional character that first appeared in American comic books published by DC Comics, first appearing in July 1971, and made his first film debut in the 1982 American Technicolor science-fiction superhero film Swamp Thing. [1]

Suffocation will only be caused by the blocks listed above, and will occur if any part of the player is trapped by them. The player will not take any damage inside any other blocks, such as Obsidian that forms over a player, or using hoiks to get inside blocks.

The Suffocation debuff icon features a blue face, which is a common symptom of asphyxiation. It also shows two open palms crossed over the throat, which is the universal sign of choking. It also shows two open palms crossed over the throat, which is the universal sign of choking.

Dying from suffocation will display one of the following unique death messages : " <Player name> couldn't breathe. " " <Player name> was buried alive. " " <Player name> couldn't breathe. " " <Player name> was buried alive. "

Although the Crimson is considered a counterpart to the Corruption, using Worm Food in the Crimson will not do anything. It is, however, still possible to summon the Eater of Worlds in a world that spawned with Crimson by artificially creating a Corruption biome (with at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 300 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 200 Corruption blocks), and then using the Worm Food within it. It is, however, still possible to summon the Eater of Worlds in a world that spawned with Crimson by artificially creating a Corruption biome (with at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 300 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 200 Corruption blocks), and then using the Worm Food within it.
Clingers are immune to lava.

Clingers are one of the three enemies that drop the valuable Cursed Flames, with the others being the World Feeder and the Vile Ghoul. Though they are more common than World Feeders underground, they do not appear on the surface. A player who intends to use Cursed Arrows, Cursed Bullets or Cursed Darts should make an effort to kill them whenever possible.

Clingers will not launch their projectile for a couple of seconds after being struck by knockback ; players can use this to their advantage and prevent a Clinger from being able to retaliate until it is slain. Additionally, Clingers' projectiles do not travel through solid objects, which players can use to their advantage while approaching.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Mining the block that a Clinger is anchored to kills it instantly; killing Clingers this way, however, prevents them from dropping any coins or items.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Despite being able to shoot Cursed Flames, they are not immune to the Cursed Inferno debuff.
They might be Corrupted versions of Man Eaters or Angry Trappers, judging from their AI and appearance.
The Clinger is the only enemy that both drops and utilizes cursed flames.
The mushrooms have no "piercing" ability, and thus disappear after hitting a single enemy.

Mushrooms appear at the point of the spear at a point during the thrust. Therefore, they will be "stacked" on top of one another if the player is retreating while thrusting, or spread out further if advancing.

Combined with the Frost armor and/or the Magma Stone (or any of its upgrades), both the weapon and the mushrooms will emit a small amount of light, making the Mushroom Spear extremely useful for exploring underground and checking for nearby caves since the spinning mushrooms can go through walls. It can also be used to harvest mushrooms in Glowing Mushroom farms. It can also be used to harvest mushrooms in Glowing Mushroom farms.
Due to the spinning mushroom mechanic, the Mushroom Spear can be used to attack enemies through walls without consuming any mana or ammo and without cooldown.
The mushroom projectiles last for a little over a second after spawning, meaning they can hit an enemy after the player has already retracted the spear.
Because the mushrooms have no knockback, it is often possible for enemies to walk through several of them. Therefore, they do not serve as an effective barrier to keep enemies away.
The Mushroom Spear deals the fourth highest amount of damage out of all the spears, beaten only by the Obsidian Swordfish, Gungnir, and the North Pole.
Orichalcum Bars can no longer be found within Wood, Iron or Golden Crates after the 1.4 update. This also applies to all Hardmode ores and bars that were obtainable through these crates prior to 1.4.
Tools, weapons and armor made of Orichalcum are generally stronger than their Mythril counterparts, but not significantly.
Adamantite Ore veins can be exceptionally difficult to spot in Crimson biomes, unless the Crimson is removed or a Spelunker Potion is used.
Ocram (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) will drop some Adamantite ore. Note that Adamantite Bars are required to craft his summon item.
On a small map Adamantite starts spawning around a depth of 1,400 feet (700 tiles), 100 feet (50 tiles) above the depth at which lava begins appearing.
On a medium map Adamantite starts spawning around a depth of 2,130 feet (1,065 tiles), 170 feet (85 tiles) above the depth at which lava begins appearing.
On a large map Adamantite starts spawning around a depth of 2,930 feet (1,465 tiles), 420 feet (210 tiles) above the depth at which lava settles in the Underworld.

Adamantite is a common sight on the ceiling of the Underworld, especially after having smashed many altars. Looking near large pools of lava can help, as lava produces enough light to see many Adamantite deposits.
It is beneficial to use Spelunker Potions and look for Adamantite near the bottom of the world.

Adamantite gets its name from adamant which has historically been used to describe exceptionally hard materials such as diamond. Adamant and variations have been used to describe materials with incredible durability in fantasy and mythology, including adamantine in Greek mythology and adamantium in Marvel Comics. The word adamant is also used for people with firm, unshakeable convictions. The word adamant is also used for people with firm, unshakeable convictions.

Adamantite is one of three fictional ores added to the world from smashing altars in Hardmode, the others being Mythril and Orichalcum. Palladium, Cobalt, and Titanium are all real-life metals, but their real colors diverge from how they are depicted in-game.
Adamantite Ore's inventory sprite is exactly the same as the one for Cobalt Ore, but rotated and colored pinkish-red.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) All slimes (except Spiked Slimes, King Slime, Queen Slime and its minions) will ignore the player entirely when the Royal Gel accessory is equipped.
A Confused enemy will always face away from its target.
