Ironically, the internal name of the Solar Tablet Fragment as used in Terraria 's source code is LunarTabletFragment.
Although not stated in the tooltip, the Haemorrhaxe can be used to destroy Altars.
Its name is a portmanteau of the words haemorrhage (the release of blood from a broken blood vessel) and axe. It is also a pun on the word "hammer-axe", alluding to its use.
The Haemorrhaxe is equal in axe power to the Luminite Hamaxes, but falls short in hammer power by 20%.
The color of the rain depends on the color of the water in the biome the player is in, and is unaffected by the helmet's dye slot. Activated water fountains will also affect the rain's color.
The raincloud itself appears similar to that of the one summoned by the Nimbus Rod, although without the intermittent blue flashes that the Nimbus Rod's rainclouds possess.
The tooltip is a reference to Wigfrid 's examination quote for the Eyebrella in Don't Starve.
Wearing the Eyebrella in the helmet slot allows the rain cloud to appear above an equipped vanity helmet.
The cloud will not be in the right place in reversed gravity or while using the Step Stool or Hand Of Creation.
Biome Mimics do not count towards and are unaffected by the Mimic Banner. With the exception of the Jungle Mimic, they have their own unique banners instead.
Wooden Mimics will only spawn in front of unsafe Dirt Walls on the surface. [4]
In drunk worlds (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the type of evil Biome Mimic spawning will change each day.

If a common variant of Mimic gets hurt by lava in its disguised state, it will start attacking. Biome Mimics in their disguised state will still remain stationary if hurt by lava. Biome Mimics in their disguised state will still remain stationary if hurt by lava.

The Corrupt and Crimson Mimics' drops encourage different play styles (not so for the dart weapons and hooks). This should be considered when selecting a biome evil when making a world. The items from the Corrupt Mimic complement a distanced fighting technique: a strong knockback flail, a wall of flames to keep enemies away, and an accessory that decreases aggro range and increases damage to compensate for the low damage output of such a technique. The items from the Crimson Mimic complement an aggressive fighting technique: one of the smallest melee weapons in the game, a weapon that provides health regeneration to recover lost health, and an accessory that increases aggro range and grants defense to compensate for the high damage intake of such a technique. The items from the Corrupt Mimic complement a distanced fighting technique: a strong knockback flail, a wall of flames to keep enemies away, and an accessory that decreases aggro range and increases damage to compensate for the low damage output of such a technique. The items from the Crimson Mimic complement an aggressive fighting technique: one of the smallest melee weapons in the game, a weapon that provides health regeneration to recover lost health, and an accessory that increases aggro range and grants defense to compensate for the high damage intake of such a technique.

Targeting Mimics can help players making their way through early Hardmode, as they drop high-damage weapons and good defensive accessories, as well as around 10 GC ( 25 GC ), which can help with Hardmode's higher prices. The Midas debuff can significantly increase how much money is dropped. This debuff can be inflicted by Golden Bullets or a Flask of Gold. The Midas debuff can significantly increase how much money is dropped. This debuff can be inflicted by Golden Bullets or a Flask of Gold.
Battle Potions and Water Candles can be used to increase the chances of spawning, as with any enemy.
If a bridge was built in the Underworld to defeat the Wall of Flesh, Mimics can be found easily by walking back and forth and watching the Lifeform Analyzer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Due to their low jumps, they can be easily dealt with by using a ranged weapon while staying out of their reach on a Rope, ledge, or hook.
(3DS version) During February, all enemies have hearts floating on them. This makes the difference between Mimics and Chests blatantly obvious.
With 3 or more players, Mimics will never stay in their disguised state. Verify
The Underground Jungle is a good place to farm Mimics, due to the increased spawns.

Mimics first appeared in the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Monster Manual, the primary bestiary sourcebook for monsters in the fantasy tabletop role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons, in 1977, and have appeared in countless publications since.
When Mimics were first introduced, it was possible for them to appear as a Skeleton instead. This was later fixed after an unknown update. Verify
Lost Girls act similar to Mimics; they disguise and then reveal themselves to be Nymphs and try to kill the player.
Despite Mimics having a rarity of 4 on the Lifeform Analyzer, they are one of the more commonly found "rare" enemies, when compared to the other rarity 4 enemies, Tim and the Rune Wizard.

Biome Mimics are one of the three non- boss enemies which are manually spawnable (excluding enemies spawnable with using statues ). The others are Wraiths, which can be manually summoned by breaking an altar, and Ghosts, which can be spawned by destroying Tombstones.
Despite their name, Biome Mimics do not actually resemble the Biome Chests found in the Dungeon. In fact, they do not completely resemble any actual Chest in the entire game.

Regular Mimics drop the second most coins out of any non- boss enemy in the game, and even more than most pre-Hardmode bosses, only beaten by the Golden Slime. Despite this, the Mimic still drops the most coins out of any non-seed-specific enemy.

Biome Mimics each drop a melee, ranged, and magic weapon, as well as a grappling hook. In comparison to the Corrupt and Crimson Mimics, the Hallowed Mimic lacks an equipment item equivalent to the Putrid Scent or Flesh Knuckles.
There is no Bestiary entry for the Jungle Mimic, as it can only spawn in Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds and cannot be manually spawned.

The Jungle Mimic drops several "useless" or "joke items", such as the Stink Potion and Coal. The amount of Sparkle Slime Balloons dropped by the Jungle Mimic is an adult joke. The Master Bait and Golden Shower drops are innuendos as well. The amount of Sparkle Slime Balloons dropped by the Jungle Mimic is an adult joke. The Master Bait and Golden Shower drops are innuendos as well.
Even though the Jungle Mimic was added along with the other Biome Mimics in 1.3.0.1, it went unused until 1.4.2.3.
The Bananarang does not autofire on the Old-gen console version.

In contrast to Light Discs, Bananarangs do not ricochet and do not travel quite as far. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) However, the larger stack size and low delay between throws means that a player can keep a greater number of projectiles in the air at once. This makes them very good at dealing with flying enemies, as well as keeping crowds at bay. Along with their autofire, they are quite powerful from early to mid- Hardmode, especially during events. This makes them very good at dealing with flying enemies, as well as keeping crowds at bay. Along with their autofire, they are quite powerful from early to mid- Hardmode, especially during events.
The Bananarang is able to be obtained as early as the first Blood Moon in Hardmode, yet inflicts more damage than most Adamantite and Titanium weapons.
Despite being a banana, the Bananarang cannot be eaten by the player.
Bananarang is a portmanteau of the words banana and boomerang.
These brick walls, along with other Shimmered bricks, use the same textures as the older versions of their modern counterparts. The current models are akin to the original Desktop 1.0 version.
The Mandible Blade can be helpful to newer players, as most other early-game weapons do not autoswing.

It may be a good choice to farm this weapon early in the game, as it remains viable up until the Light's Bane or the Blood Butcherer is available. However, if the Christmas event is active, the Candy Cane Sword is a much better option. It can be obtained from Presents and has better stats overall, although it swings slower and does not have autoswing.
Its upper half resembles the Antlion Mandible crafting material, and the Mandible itself resembles one-half of the Antlion Charger's mouth and one of its eyes.
The internal name of this item is AntlionClaw.

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ).
Despite its fast speed, it cannot autoswing.
It is the same weapon that the Stylist uses to defend herself from enemies.
The Stylish Scissors' internal name within the game source code is StylistKilLaKillScissorsIWish, referencing the Scissor Blades from the 2013 Japanese anime television series Kill la Kill.

The Onyx Blaster can be crafted before defeating any of the mechanical bosses, making it a particularly effective weapon for the point in the game at which it can be acquired. Its ingredients are not hard to farm, and it can be used to good effect in much of the early Hardmode content, being an excellent candidate against the mechanical bosses and even being capable of holding its own against later bosses such as Golem and Duke Fishron.

It can one-shot many common Hardmode enemies, and the explosion is particularly devastating against worms, being capable of one-shotting anything up to and including a Dune Splicer or dramatically speeding up the fight against The Destroyer.
Using a combination of this weapon, the Megashark, and the Endless Musket Pouch could be helpful in maximizing crowd control.

Onyx is a mineral commonly found around the world, and the name "Onyx Blaster" might be coming from both the stone and weapon being black. Despite being named the Onyx Blaster, no onyx is used to craft the weapon, nor does onyx exist in Terraria. Despite being named the Onyx Blaster, no onyx is used to craft the weapon, nor does onyx exist in Terraria.

This is one of a small "set" of weapons made with two shards apiece, the other members being the Sky Fracture and the Dao of Pow. Their recipes, names and appearances link the weapons to themes of Darkness, Light, and Balance, with the Onyx Blaster representing Darkness. The set also includes one weapon for each of the three "classic" damage types ( melee, magic, and ranged ), where the Onyx Blaster is the ranged weapon.
According to lead developer Yoraiz0r, the design of the Onyx Blaster was directly inspired by the dark, "evil" half of Monokuma, the main antagonist of the Japanese video game series Danganronpa. [2]
It is one of two firearms in Terraria to feature an operating secondary gun, the other being the Vortex Beater.
The purple stripes on the Onyx Blaster appear to glow while the weapon is being used.

The Venom Staff always shoots one projectile directly towards the cursor. This effect can be observed when running quickly along an Asphalt sky bridge, autofiring the Venom Staff without moving the mouse. The projectiles will form a neat line.

The Acid Venom debuff deals large amounts of damage over time, and the Venom Staff's projectiles apply it for 30 seconds. If the debuff is afflicted and runs its full course on an enemy, it will deal a total of 900 damage.
(Old-gen console version) If multiple projectiles hit a target, only one projectile will deal damage.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) All projectiles have a limited range, roughly 1.5 times longer than the Poison Staff, dissipating after traveling 58 tiles. Additionally, every projectile from a shot can damage a single target. Additionally, every projectile from a shot can damage a single target.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) There is a 25% damage penalty for every target it pierces. This is based on its current damage, not its base damage. Therefore, the second hit would deal 75% of its base damage, the third would deal 56.25% (0.75 * 75) of its base damage, and so forth.
The number of projectiles is determined by taking the base of 4, incrementing it by one with a chance of 1/3, then 1/4, and then 1/5. [1] This results in the following chances:
Although the tooltip says that it shoots one fang, there are actually multiple projectiles.
It is one of only four weapons in the game that can inflict Acid Venom without any buffs or bonuses, the others being the Spider Staff, the Pygmy Staff, and the Queen Spider Staff.
The Megashark's fast use time and good damage makes it a good option against mechanical bosses, if the Destroyer is fought the first, and even Plantera.

Compared to the Gatligator and the Uzi, the Megashark is the gun with the highest accuracy, lowest use time, and is the easiest to obtain. The Gatligator is very fast as well but has low accuracy and can be rare at times, and the Uzi has high velocity bullets and a good amount of damage, but is slower and much rarer. That said, both the Gatligator and the Uzi can be obtained before defeating The Destroyer (Megashark requires 20 Souls of Might, whereas Gatligator can be bought and Uzi drops from Angry Trapper), which can be seen as a point in their favor.
The Minishark has the same sell value as the Megashark, despite being weaker and an ingredient in its crafting recipe.
The S.D.M.G. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is a direct upgrade to the Megashark, though unlike the Megashark, it is an exclusive drop.
When firing straight down, one can see that the bullets appear just above the barrel, near the fins.

(3DS version) Since Lepus has a 1% chance to drop 3 Souls of Might, it is possible to obtain the crafting ingredients for the Megashark pre-Hardmode. However, it will still require a Hardmode Anvil to craft.
In the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the character's sprite appears to close their eyes while this debuff is active.
The ability to create one fragment from three others can save a player from having to endure the Lunar Events should they be missing only a few of the former.
When placed, the orb and accents on the Ancient Manipulator pulsate in the colors of the four Celestial Pillars.
Even when painted, the Ancient Manipulator continues to cycle between the colors of the Celestial Pillars. Any parts not changing in color adopt the paint color as usual.
Each Lunar Fragment appears to have chainsaw and hammer variants that are all currently unobtainable.
Internally, this item is referred to as LunarCraftingStation.
Despite the Zenith and the Drill Containment Unit being post- Moon Lord items, they are not crafted at the Ancient Manipulator. Instead, they are crafted at a Mythril or Orichalcum Anvil.
Mythril Bars can be found within Mythril and Titanium Crates during Hardmode without the need of a drill or pickaxe.

A Mythril Bar, which has a sell value of 44 SC, is made out of 4 Mythril Ore, each with a sell value of 11 SC. Therefore, if the player sells Mythril, it does not matter whether it is in bar or ore form.

Mithril is a fictional metal in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle Earth writings, where it is a rare and high-quality material used for weapons and armor. It has become a widely used material in fantasy works, particularly video games. Mythril was first called "Mithril" in a teaser, but this spelling had to be changed, likely for legal reasons, as the name "Mithril" is trademarked by Tolkien's estate. [1] Mythril was first called "Mithril" in a teaser, but this spelling had to be changed, likely for legal reasons, as the name "Mithril" is trademarked by Tolkien's estate. [1]

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Demonite Brick is the only craftable brick that requires 6 materials to craft, instead of normally requiring 2. Additionally, it is the only brick that provides more than one block when crafted: the recipe gives the player 5 Demonite Bricks. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, many other bricks share these properties. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, many other bricks share these properties.
Demonite Bricks (unlike Ebonstone ) will not spread Corruption.
Demonite Bricks are an infinitely renewable resource, since they are created when the Wall of Flesh is killed.
The Bubble Wand produces bubbles identical to those produced by the Bubble Machine, but the Wand produces them at a slightly greater volume.
Bubbles drift in accordance with the current wind speed and direction in the world, which can also be seen affecting background cloud movement at the surface.
Use to fill slots in containers to avoid automatic collection from retrieving more items from your personal inventory (e.g. Keeping some wood or stone.)

In a now-humorous tradition, parents in Western countries would classically threaten to give only coal to children as their Christmas gifts if they misbehaved, hence this item dropping from Presents, along with its tooltip.
Unlike other "junk" items such as the Tin Can or Old Shoe, Coal has a rarity of 00* instead of -1*.
Armed Zombies can only perform claw attacks when they are on the ground

Zombies sometimes spawn as either larger or smaller than normal; larger zombies have more health, damage, defense, and knockback resistance, while smaller zombies are faster and have smaller hitboxes, fitting in 1.5 vertical block gaps.
The Swamp Zombie is the fastest Zombie.

Zombies attempt to leave the screen at dawn and will despawn immediately once off-screen. Even though they appear to run away, they may still end up attacking the player, especially if their path off-screen is blocked. However, armed Zombies will not continue to perform the claw attack.
As with all Fighter AI enemies, a Zombie will leave if it cannot find a clear path to the player. They will not consider doors to be blocking their path, even if it is not a Blood Moon.

While Zombies may move slowly, they are surprisingly good jumpers. They also have a fair amount of health and cause significant damage to newer players. It is advisable that new players remain indoors at night until they gain better weapons and defense.
Zombies can be safely fought at any point by building a wooden box around the player and opening up a small hole to hit enemies through with a Shortsword or Bow.

In Classic Mode, a simple Wooden Sword swung repeatedly is enough to keep one or two Zombies at bay. Three or more Zombies will likely be able to get past the sword and cause damage. Weapons that can hit multiple enemies work best. To kill Zombies easily, build lava traps. The Spear or Vilethorn are ideal for this job. Ranged weapons also work well, like bows ; Shurikens and Throwing Knives are ranged weapons that also pierce through multiple enemies, making them good candidates as well.
Occasionally, when a Pincushion Zombie takes damage, broken Wooden Arrow shafts will fall from their body which cannot be retrieved.
The Bald Zombie is the only regular Zombie variant that cannot carry an arm in Expert Mode.
The internal name that corresponds to the Armed Female Zombie is ArmedZombieCenx, a reference to Cenx.
The internal name of the Armed Pincushion Zombie is spelled ArmedZombiePincussion.
The Bone Block item appears to be a skull while the center block in a 3×3 square (as shown in the infobox above) could possibly be bone marrow.
Despite being unobtainable, Bone Blocks can be researched (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Although Bone Blocks are generally unobtainable in worlds and characters created in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), they can be imported from a previous version of the game via third-party software.

The Man Eater differs from the Snatcher in the following ways: The Man Eater's body color is a brown/pinkish vine, as opposed to the green vine of the Snatcher's. The "head" of a Man Eater also has a red tinge along the jaw. Man Eaters drop Vines and Ancient Cobalt armor, whereas Snatchers do not. Man Eaters can extend their stems about twice as far as Snatchers. Snatchers spawn in the surface Jungle, while Man Eaters spawn in the Underground Jungle. The Man Eater's body color is a brown/pinkish vine, as opposed to the green vine of the Snatcher's. The "head" of a Man Eater also has a red tinge along the jaw. Man Eaters drop Vines and Ancient Cobalt armor, whereas Snatchers do not. Man Eaters can extend their stems about twice as far as Snatchers. Snatchers spawn in the surface Jungle, while Man Eaters spawn in the Underground Jungle.
When lit on fire with weapons such as the Sunfury, their erratic movement patterns may cause them to reveal hidden caves with their light.
Caution should be advised even when the player seems to be out of the Man Eater's reach, as they can extend their stems and thus improve their reach rapidly.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Mining the block that a Man Eater is rooted on kills it instantly; however, this method of dispatching a Man Eater never yields any dropped items.
Despite their vine color being more brown than green, Man Eaters drop green vines.
According to the Bestiary (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Angry Trappers are created when a Man Eater undergoes a cocoon-like metamorphosis after having consumed enough human flesh.
The Chef Hat's tooltip is a reference to the Scottish born, English chef Gordon Ramsay and his frequent, impassioned outbursts.

On the Desktop version, Console version, Old-gen console version, and Mobile version, the Ice Golem will drop a Frost Core, required to craft one piece of Frost armor. On the Nintendo 3DS version, Ice Golems have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of dropping each piece of Frost armor.

The Frost armor set can easily be farmed by creating a large one-sided trench with a roof over the top of it containing a one-block wide hole. The Ice Golem will not be able to shoot the player because of its laser spawning off-center when being above it. Using Water Candles increases the spawn rate.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Dungeon Guardian is not immune to the debuff, thus making Frost armor useful in obtaining the Bone Key.

The Frostbite / Frostburn debuff is particularly devastating when used against worm enemies because it affects each segment, thereby multiplying the damage dealt by the number of affected segments. Additionally, the light and particles from the debuffs allow the player to track them through tiles. Unfortunately, The Destroyer is immune to the debuff, thus limiting the effectiveness of this strategy. Unfortunately, The Destroyer is immune to the debuff, thus limiting the effectiveness of this strategy.
The debuff is also useful for most bosses as only three of them ( The Destroyer, Duke Fishron and Mourning Wood ) are immune.
When used with a Flymeal or Rotten Eggs, Frost armor is a highly efficient way to kill friendly NPCs.

The Frostburn effect adds light to all melee and ranged attacks, including tools such as pickaxes and drills, and to ordinary ammunition, such as that used by the Endless Quiver and Endless Musket Pouch. This makes the armor set very useful for exploring caves. This makes the armor set very useful for exploring caves.
Selling Frost armor results in less profit than selling its crafting ingredients.

For melee users, pairing this armor with Magma Stone / Fire Gauntlet and a flask will inflict three different debuffs on a single hit, possibly more if the weapon itself inflicts another debuff. This proves particularly useful when used with the Shadowflame weapons.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) For ranged users, this armor has slightly more defense than Hallowed armor with the Hallowed Helmet, however, the damage bonuses are only equal to those from Mythril armor.

As a ranged user with Adamantite armor, it may be better to change the Adamantite Breastplate for the Frost Breastplate, as this will result in 11% more critical strike chance and 4 more defense at the cost of 8% damage and its set bonus, which only reduces ammo consumption by 25%.

Prior to 1.3, if the Frost Breastplate and Leggings were paired with a Gold Helmet, and all pieces were dyed with Blue Flame and Black Dye, it would cause an afterimage and pulsing aura, akin to Hallowed armor. This was the armor Redigit used to wear before his specific set was added.
The Frost Breastplate and Leggings look strikingly similar to the Molten Breastplate and Greaves.

The Frost armor is the Snow biome counterpart to the Desert 's Forbidden armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as they are both obtained similarly. However, the Forbidden armor buffs magic and summon weapons instead of melee and ranged weapons.
The sound effect when a player is struck while wearing Frost armor takes priority over other items that also alter the sound effect of a player being hit, such as the Moon Charm at night.
Unlike other armors, the Frost Leggings increase melee attack speed instead of just melee speed; but in terms of gameplay, they both mean the same.
The Seeds used by the Blowgun cannot be planted. Conversely, seeds that can be planted cannot be used as ammo for the Blowgun.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It does not receive any specialized boosts from the Shroomite armor headpieces, though it still receives the stealth boost.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It receives boosts from the Shroomite Helmet.

In early Hardmode, the Blowgun and Blowpipe are useful for firing Cursed or Ichor Darts. While the Blowgun is stronger overall, the Blowpipe fires faster and can be obtained without a Witch Doctor. Cursed Darts deal decent damage and the necessary Cursed Flames can be obtained in the surface Corruption. Ichor Darts are among the first items that can inflict the handy Ichor debuff. The Ichor needed to craft the darts can only be obtained in the Underground Crimson, though, an area that might be challenging at that stage of the game. Cursed Darts deal decent damage and the necessary Cursed Flames can be obtained in the surface Corruption. Ichor Darts are among the first items that can inflict the handy Ichor debuff. The Ichor needed to craft the darts can only be obtained in the Underground Crimson, though, an area that might be challenging at that stage of the game.
It looks very similar to the Blowpipe, but has a red ribbon on the top and is flared on one end.
The Witch Doctor uses the Blowgun to defend himself against nearby enemies.
Compared to its alternate ore version, the Tungsten Pickaxe, it has less pickaxe power (thus cannot mine Meteorite), but is significantly faster in terms of mining speed.
The total bonus to the max number of sentries is +3, allowing 4 to be summoned at once.
The Dark Artist's Leggings offer the highest increase to magic DPS for the leg slot.
The Hat and Robes give off a small amount of light.
Its male and female variants look identical.

This set has the same defense as Spectre armor with the mask option, increases magic damage by a larger percentage, and has almost double the increase in magic critical hit percentage. It does not share the Spectre set's set bonuses; however, the extra slots and bonuses to the Flameburst sentry summons allow it to place 4 powerful sentries at once. This is especially useful in arenas for boss fights, with the set bonus allowing the Flameburst sentries to attack from far away. The amount of summon damage increase marginally beats Spooky armor, while providing many other bonuses. Because of this, it makes both the Xeno Staff and Stardust Dragon Staff much more powerful. This can be capitalized on by using the Papyrus Scarab and Necromantic Scroll or Pygmy Necklace and Bewitching Table or Summoning Potion to more than quadruple the damage. Unfortunately, unlike Spooky armor, this armor lacks minion slot increases. The amount of summon damage increase marginally beats Spooky armor, while providing many other bonuses. Because of this, it makes both the Xeno Staff and Stardust Dragon Staff much more powerful. This can be capitalized on by using the Papyrus Scarab and Necromantic Scroll or Pygmy Necklace and Bewitching Table or Summoning Potion to more than quadruple the damage. Unfortunately, unlike Spooky armor, this armor lacks minion slot increases. Unfortunately, unlike Spooky armor, this armor lacks minion slot increases.

The Dark Artist armor's emphasis on sentries and minions makes it better suited to a cautious play style. Players who have difficulty attacking while kiting bosses with Spectre armor may find this easier.
The Dark Artist's Leggings give a 25% magic critical hit boost, making them excellent for hybrid sets.
To create both the jacket and pants, 150 Rotten Chunks are required to make the 30 pieces of leather (75 rotten chunks each).
Filling out this set implies forgoing a great deal of lucrative boss -summoning, as this number of rotten chunks would help make 10 Worm Food.
This outfit is a reference to the character Indiana Jones, protagonist of the film franchise of the same name.
The Hornet Stingers are fired at a rate of once every 0.75 seconds on average. With the Hive Pack (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) equipped, it will be decreased to 0.58 seconds. [1]
The Hive Pack (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) increases the firing rate of the Hornet minion by 28.57%.
The Hornet Staff does not suffer DPS losses due to static immunity frames like the Imp Staff does, making Hornets the best stackable pre-Hardmode minion in the game.
The Hornet Staff has one of the fastest attack speeds out of all the ranged minions, comparable to the Stardust Cell Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
If the player hit a Solar Flare, the kill count on the Tally Counter will show the Drakomire kill count.
Neither of its bonuses stack with the Apprentice's Scarf, Huntress's Buckler, or Squire's Shield.
The buff does not trigger by being damaged over time by a debuff.
The Panic Necklace is especially useful at the beginning of the game if Hermes Boots (or their upgrades) have not been obtained, as damage taken from enemies will provide a great speed boost.

If paired with a Sandstorm in a Bottle, the double jump from it will go much farther than usual for the duration of the Panic! buff. This can serve as a very fast movement option, but ideally should be paired with a means of negating fall damage.

The speed boost can be triggered artificially, which can be quite useful, e.g. in boss fights. The damage taken to trigger the buff should be kept as low as possible, which can be achieved with a Slime Statue or Spikes. ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Note that Spikes inflict the Bleeding debuff, blocking natural health regeneration.) An Adhesive Bandage or one of its upgrades can prevent the Bleeding debuff. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Firing at the ground under the player's feet with a Wooden Bow and Hellfire Arrows should deal minimal damage. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) In Hardmode, Exploding Bullets fired at the ground with a low-damage firearm such as the Flintlock Pistol should do the same. ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Note that Spikes inflict the Bleeding debuff, blocking natural health regeneration.) An Adhesive Bandage or one of its upgrades can prevent the Bleeding debuff. An Adhesive Bandage or one of its upgrades can prevent the Bleeding debuff. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) In Hardmode, Exploding Bullets fired at the ground with a low-damage firearm such as the Flintlock Pistol should do the same.

The Alien Skater's buff tooltip, "How do you do, fellow humans?", is a reference to a cutaway gag in the American television sitcom 30 Rock, in which Lenny Wosniak walks up to a group of teens and asks "How do you do, fellow kids?" while holding two skateboards.
The Ancient Iron Helmet resembles the Bucket while equipped.
The Ancient Iron Helmet has the same sprite that the Iron Armor Helmet had prior to the 1.0.3 update, thus the term "Ancient".
Selling the Bone Wings instead of the individual components will be more profitable. The wings sell for 8 GC, whereas the components sell for a collective 2 GC 90 SC.
The Shiny Black Slab resembled a generic smartphone. Its sprite can be compared to that of the Cell Phone, except grayscale and with fewer details.
The Android pet was modeled after the mascot for the mobile operating system of the same name.
In Celebrationmk10 and Get fixed boi worlds, a Pyramid is always generated at the center of the main Desert, replacing the original entrance to the Underground Desert.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Desert is the least popular biome for housing (discounting invalid housing biomes like the Corruption and the Crimson ). A total of five NPCs either hate or dislike living in it, more than any other biome.
The Desert and the Glowing Mushroom biome are the only surface biomes without a biome-exclusive boss.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Desert is the only biome not to contain any special fishing catches.
According to the Bestiary (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) entry for the Sand Shark (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), a saltwater river ran through the Desert in ancient times.
Since Pyramids are made out of Sandstone Bricks which cannot be corrupted, they can be helpful in blocking the spread of evil biomes or the Hallow.

An experiment generating one hundred small worlds in 1.2.0.3.1 showed an 83% chance of having no pyramids, a 15% chance of having one pyramid, and a 2% chance of having two pyramids. However, Pyramids are slightly more common since 1.2.3 and were made even more common in 1.4.1. Another experiment generating one hundred small, medium and large worlds in 1.3.5 showed a 16% chance in small worlds, 42% chance in medium worlds and 39% chance in large worlds of having one or multiple pyramids. Another experiment generating one hundred small, medium and large worlds in 1.3.5 showed a 16% chance in small worlds, 42% chance in medium worlds and 39% chance in large worlds of having one or multiple pyramids.

Prior to 1.3, Pyramids were quite common and contained two rooms – one along the standard path and the other completely enclosed. The one along the path always had a Gold Chest while the second one only sometimes had one. If the second one did contain a Gold Chest, it would contain standard Pyramid loot. The second room would also contain an Orange Torch and two Pyramid Banners. The same also applies to the Nintendo 3DS version, as it is a port of said mobile version. The same also applies to the Nintendo 3DS version, as it is a port of said mobile version.

While the Pyramids' real life counterparts are located in Egypt, the Cactus plants that grow in the nearby desert are based on the saguaro, a species native to the Sonoran Desert, a desert spanning large areas of Mexico and the United States of America.
This structure is quite prone to cause framerate issues in the Nintendo 3DS version of the game.

If a Minecart rolls over a Booster Track while traveling in the direction opposite that of the Booster Track's setting, the Booster Track acts as a braking mechanism and slows the Minecart's movement, possibly reversing direction.
When a Booster Track is not connected to Minecart Tracks on both sides, its direction cannot be changed.

Three boosters in a row will accelerate to the top speed for the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) default minecart, at 51 mph. Three boosters and a short press of the movement button is sufficient for the Minecart at 66 mph, and five boosters (with one tap of a movement key) for any Minecart boosted by the Minecart Upgrade Kit at 102 mph.
The Creature from the Deep is a reference to the Gill-man from the 1954 horror film Creature from the Black Lagoon. [1]
If it is forced through a 2-block high space, it will stand with its arms down for a few seconds and then start moving away from the player.
This set is a reference to the 1935 American science-fiction darkly comic horror movie Bride of Frankenstein.
While the tooltip states that it can break them, Altars can only be destroyed in Hardmode worlds, i.e. worlds where the Wall of Flesh has been defeated.
The name is a reference to a series of Metroid -based levels in a level pack named "The Invasion 2" for Super Mario Bros. X, a game Redigit has previously worked on.
The Pwnhammer shares the same color scheme as items crafted from Hallowed Bars, however it cannot be crafted itself.

The " pwn " part of the Pwnhammer's name was a popular gaming term from the unofficial language " leet ". It is derived from a misspelling of "own", which denotes success and domination, usually in multiplayer. A succeeding player is "pwning" while a failing player is being "pwned".
The Achievement shows the Pre- 1.4.0.3 sprite.
The debuff icon bears a slight resemblance to the Horrified icon.

The Nebula Dye's animation could represent the pillars of light gravitating matter upwards as seen in the background of any place where the Nebula Pillar is located, or any place where the Nebula Monolith is activated.
The animation bears a slight resemblance to the visual effect which the Rod of Discord causes for a short time after using it.

The Ankh Shield is the end result of combining (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 12 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 11 individual accessories over the course of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) nine / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) eight crafting operations. Its original constituent accessories are the Bezoar, Vitamins, Cobalt Shield, Obsidian Skull, Nazar, Blindfold, Pocket Mirror (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Trifold Map, Fast Clock, Megaphone, Armor Polish, and Adhesive Bandage.

Not all items that protect from certain debuffs are used in the recipe for the Ankh Shield: The Hand Warmer (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) provides immunity against Frozen and Chilled (the latter of which the player is still immune to with the Ankh Shield on Desktop, Console, and Mobile ). The Philosopher's Stone reduces the effect of the Potion Sickness debuff. The Hand Warmer (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) provides immunity against Frozen and Chilled (the latter of which the player is still immune to with the Ankh Shield on Desktop, Console, and Mobile ). The Philosopher's Stone reduces the effect of the Potion Sickness debuff.

Despite the tooltip, there are many debuffs that the player can still suffer, especially higher-tier versions of the debuffs they are protected from: Acid Venom for Poisoned; Cursed Inferno and On Fire! for Burning; Blackout for Darkness; Frozen for Chilled; Withered Armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (or Ichor ) for Broken Armor. Acid Venom for Poisoned; Cursed Inferno and On Fire! for Burning; Blackout for Darkness; Frozen for Chilled; Withered Armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (or Ichor ) for Broken Armor.
The Ankh Shield does not require any items from Hardmode bosses (but does require Hardmode enemies), so it can be obtained before defeating them.

While it does not directly affect the Feral Bite (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) debuff, the Shield blocks all of its side effects, rendering it mostly harmless against the player, and the 20% damage bonus the Feral Bite gives can be used.

The post- Plantera Paladin's Shield offers an extra 2 defense and a multiplayer buff, and its Frozen Shield upgrade adds a 25% damage reduction, but do not prevent common debuffs. As such, the Frozen Shield is more advantageous for most boss battles.
Using an Obsidian Skin Potion renders the player immune to the On Fire! debuff, which the shield does not provide.
The Ankh Shield can synergize with the Brand of the Inferno (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to block attacks, granting the Striking Moment buff.

The Ankh Shield can be used to defuse active debuffs if it is left in the players inventory and quickly swapped with a currently equipped accessory, allowing the player to use other shields or accessories in place of the Ankh Shield when exploring or in combat. This is the main practical use of the Ankh Shield if the knockback immunity is not needed.
The Ankh Shield takes the Obsidian Shield to craft, meaning crafting the Obsidian Skull Rose or Magma Skull makes it unable to craft the Obsidian Shield without crafting another Obsidian Skull.

Finding the Aether (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) biome makes it far easier to craft the Ankh Shield, since every base immunity accessory can be Shimmered to get the other accessory it pairs with. In particular, it may be easier to get: A second Blindfold instead of a Pocket Mirror, since Medusa is relatively uncommon and dangerous. A second Armor Polish instead of Vitamins, since Armored Skeletons can be easier to farm than Corruptors or Floaty Gross due to the dangers of the respective evil biome. A second Megaphone instead of a Nazar, since enemies that drop the former (especially Pixies ) are very common, and the enemies that drop the latter are quite uncommon. A second Bezoar instead of an Adhesive Bandage, as the former can be farmed in Pre-Hardmode and the latter is somewhat difficult to obtain before defeating Plantera ( Werewolves are only present on full moons, and Angler Fish are somewhat uncommon). Additionally, one may wish to obtain a Bezoar for use against Queen Bee, especially on higher difficulties. A second Blindfold instead of a Pocket Mirror, since Medusa is relatively uncommon and dangerous. Additionally, one may wish to obtain a Bezoar for use against Queen Bee, especially on higher difficulties.

The ankh, the ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic symbol that is depicted on the shield, was most commonly used in writing and in art to represent the word for "life" and, by extension, as a symbol of life itself. The Ankh seen in-game on the Ankh Charm and Ankh Shield moreso resembles a crux ansata, a variation of the Christian cross inspired by the Egyptian Ankh which was used in the Holy Roman Empire. Additionally, the Ankh Shield is the final upgrade to the Cobalt Shield, which features a simple Christian cross on the front. These two facts could be a subtle reference to how the Roman Empire took over ancient Egypt, but adopted some of its symbols and traditions. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Of all accessories, the Ankh Shield and the Celestial Stone offer the sixth most base defense, being surpassed by the Paladin's Shield and Frozen Shield (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which have a base defense of 6, the Flesh Knuckles (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Berserker's Glove (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which have 8 base defense, and the Hero Shield (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which has a base defense of 10.
The only crafted item in the build path not crafted at the Tinkerer's Workshop is the Obsidian Skull, which is crafted at a Furnace instead.
Its components sell for more than the shield itself does.

In the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Ankh Shield (requiring 11 base ingredients and 7 crafting operations) has the most complex crafting tree. Although the Music Box (Title) (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) required one more base ingredient, it only needed one crafting operation. The Zenith (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) took the lead (requiring 16 base ingredients and 11 crafting operations) in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version. The Zenith (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) took the lead (requiring 16 base ingredients and 11 crafting operations) in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Despite providing immunity to Chilled, the crafting chain for the Ankh Shield does not include the Hand Warmer. The shield also does not give immunity to Frozen.

Despite the name, it is not actually a repaired Mana Crystal, because the item sprite of the Mana Crystal used to craft it shows that the Mana Crystal is not actually broken. Additionally, unlike Life Crystals, Mana Crystals are crafted instead of harvesting them with a pickaxe, so not only is it not broken, there is also no way that it could have broke.
Despite having a silver-colored platform below the crystal as shown in the inventory sprite, when placed down, it does not display such a platform.
Despite the fact that Repaired Mana Crystals cannot generate naturally, they still show up on the Metal Detector and are detected by fairies.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The stars of the Star Cloak and all its derivatives have local invincibility frames.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the effect is only triggered when the player takes damage from hostile enemies or fall damage, whereas on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it is triggered regardless of the source, including drowning and lava, among others.

The falling star effects of the Star Cloak, Bee Cloak, Mana Cloak (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Star Veil do not stack. Only three stars will fall at a time no matter how many of these items are equipped.

The Star Cloak is effective even when deep underground, as the stars will pass through blocks until they are near or past the height of the point where the player took damage. After that point, any foreground block will stop them.

The effect of the Star Cloak is similar to that of the Starfury, but the stars fall faster, and the focal point is the player rather than the cursor. Furthermore, unlike the Starfury's effect, the stars emit light while insubstantially passing through blocks. This lighting effect is much more pronounced than that of the light particles that fall after the stars hit the ground and can be exploited by deliberately taking damage to map out dark areas above the player. Furthermore, unlike the Starfury's effect, the stars emit light while insubstantially passing through blocks. This lighting effect is much more pronounced than that of the light particles that fall after the stars hit the ground and can be exploited by deliberately taking damage to map out dark areas above the player.
The Star Cloak is of less use when dealing with a ranged attacker, as the stars will not impact any enemy that is not close to the player at the time.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) With high defense, one can stand on a Spike with the Star Cloak equipped to accumulate large numbers of stars.
The Star Cloak may be preferable to the Star Veil; while the player will take damage faster, stars will also fall faster, doing more damage.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Bee Cloak 's, Star Cloak's, and Star Veil 's projectile is called Hallow Star.
With modifiers that increase 10% speed or more, the streams fired per use are increased to four.
In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Golden Shower can only deal 75% base damage to The Destroyer and its Probes. [1]
When fighting any worm -type enemy, the debuff only applies to segments that are hit by the stream.

While in-game testing may make it seem like this weapon can pierce more than four times, its individual streams cannot. This is a misconception caused by piercing damage mechanics. The invincibility frames granted to the first few enemies pierced by this weapon will allow the third stream to pass through and strike more enemies behind them, but no stream will damage more than 5 enemies.

Despite firing 3 projectiles per use, only up to 2 of them can hit a single enemy due to piercing damage mechanics, reducing the theoretical base DPS of this weapon from 233/339 to 154/227 without/with the defense reducing debuff, respectively.
The Golden Shower's fast speed and piercing ability make it a great item for fighting large groups of enemies (e.g. events ).

Its ability to reduce defenses makes it effective against bosses, as one can attack with it and then equip a stronger weapon to deal even more damage. Alternatively, one can use a Flask of Ichor, Ichor Bullets, Ichor Arrows, or the Bladetongue, though the Golden Shower and Bladetongue retain the advantage of not being consumable. However, crafting the Golden Shower requires farming 15 Souls of Night first, while the craftable alternatives only require some Ichor and resources that are easier to obtain. However, crafting the Golden Shower requires farming 15 Souls of Night first, while the craftable alternatives only require some Ichor and resources that are easier to obtain.
It is one of the best magic weapons for taking out worm -type enemies before obtaining a Magical Harp.
The Ichor debuff vastly improves the DPS of weapons that deal many hits per second, such as the Crystal Storm, Cursed Flames, or the Magnet Sphere.
Enemies hit by the stream will glow even in complete darkness, and the glow is bright enough to match that of a Hunter Potion.

It is one of very few weapons acquirable in early Hardmode (or in the game at all) that remains valuable at the end of the game. Although its damage will be very minor, the debuff can be used to increase one's DPS.

Since it is easily obtained early on in Hardmode, and is very useful for surviving the increased difficulty, obtaining it should be a priority as soon as the Wall of Flesh is defeated in Crimson worlds.

Even though The Destroyer is immune to the Ichor debuff, the Golden Shower is effective against it because it can damage many segments at once. However, the Golden Shower can only deal 75% base damage to it in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), reducing its effectiveness. However, the Golden Shower can only deal 75% base damage to it in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), reducing its effectiveness.
If used along with the Betsy's Wrath, the player can subtract a maximum of 55 defense from enemies, allowing for even more damage.
The Golden Shower's ichor streams, in terms of appearance, are completely identical to the ichor streams fired by Ichor Stickers.
In Greek mythology, Zeus approached Danaë in the form of golden showers, a union from which she begat the legendary hero Perseus.
"Golden shower" is a slang term for urolagnia, a sexual fetish. The name in Terraria is likely referring to the fact that the attack resembles a stream of urine.
Lead Anvils will never generate inside underground cabins, even in a world that has Lead Ore instead of Iron Ore.

Despite the anvils being classified as furniture and appearing to have a flat surface, as well as being able to be stood upon like a platform, they do not fulfill the NPC housing requirement for a flat surface, nor can the player place items on them.
Neither of its bonuses stack with the Huntress's Buckler, Monk's Belt, or Squire's Shield.

It's bonuses are exceptional for the place in the game it's acquired. Essentially acting as a Necromantic Scroll that grants a sentry slot rather than a minion slot. Even non-summoners may want to consider using this, as the list of pre-hardmode accessories that grant offensive boosts is rather small.
The Tablet Fragment's sprite resembles a shard of the Mysterious Tablet. This is likely the case, considering the Cultists that must be killed to summon the Lunatic Cultist are seen worshipping it.
The Tablet Fragment even more closely resembles a Solar Tablet, as the same star symbol is visible on both sprites.
The Phantasmal Dragon's buff tooltip, "It keeps looking at the Moon", likely references the Mysterious Tablet's role in summoning the Moon Lord.

Unlike most other unique loot that generates in Dungeon chests (even including Books and Alchemy Tables on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version ), the Bone Welder is not obtainable via fishing. Thus, if one does not generate in your world, the only recourse is to try to find one in a new world's Dungeon or (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) purchase one from the Steampunker in a Graveyard.
The Bone Welder can generate in any type of chest inside the Dungeon, not just Gold Chests. This is different from the behavior of several other Dungeon chest loot items.
The Bone Welder will always be the very last of the items in a chest.
At the top of the Bone Welder, there appear to be two skulls which are periodically discharging purple sparks, presumably from welding the bone.
The design of the Bone Welder is based on real-life electrical spot welders.
This item increases the player's base speed from 15 mph to 17 mph.

Certain potions' sprites use bottles that correlate with real-life flasks. These include: All of the Lesser potions, using an Erlenmeyer flask. The Strange Brew, using a Florence flask. The Ironskin, Regeneration, Swiftness, and Gills Potions all use test tubes. The in-game flasks are slight modifications of the round-bottom flasks with special stoppers. All other potions seem to be extreme modifications of the Dewar flask or Erlenmeyer flask. All of the Lesser potions, using an Erlenmeyer flask. The Strange Brew, using a Florence flask. The Ironskin, Regeneration, Swiftness, and Gills Potions all use test tubes. The in-game flasks are slight modifications of the round-bottom flasks with special stoppers. All other potions seem to be extreme modifications of the Dewar flask or Erlenmeyer flask.
All potions (excluding the Recovery potions ) use a glass stopper.

On 3DS, if the player quickly uses a potion right after they leave their inventory, the potion will be used, but not consumed. However, the buff/debuff from it will only last 1 minute. Note that this might not work every time.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Some potions can only be crafted in worlds with the proper evil biome : Thorns and Wrath Potions can only be crafted in worlds with Corruption ingredients. Heartreach and Rage Potions can only be crafted in worlds with Crimson ingredients. Both the Heartreach and Thorns Potions can be found in Chests, regardless of world type. Additionally, Heartreach Potions can be found in crates. However, this represents a limited (non-renewable) supply for Thorn Potions. Of these four potions, only the Heartreach Potion can be obtained from crates. Thorns and Wrath Potions can only be crafted in worlds with Corruption ingredients. Heartreach and Rage Potions can only be crafted in worlds with Crimson ingredients. Both the Heartreach and Thorns Potions can be found in Chests, regardless of world type. Additionally, Heartreach Potions can be found in crates. However, this represents a limited (non-renewable) supply for Thorn Potions. Of these four potions, only the Heartreach Potion can be obtained from crates.
The Bouncy Grenade does 5 more damage than the classic Grenade, though the Pink Gel can prove expensive for players without a sufficient supply.
It can also be useful in certain boss fights as it can travel much further than normal.

Water Chests have the same possible drops regardless of the biome they were generated in. Water Chests that spawn in Ocean caves (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) have equal chances of containing every primary item. Water Chests that spawn in Ocean caves (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) have equal chances of containing every primary item.
The only time Water Chests can spawn in anything other than water is on the secret world seed " Not the bees ", where most water is replaced with honey.
On the Celebrationmk10 secret world seed, Water Walking Boots are increased to a 1/7 (14.29%) chance, which reduces the chance of getting any of the other primary items.
Grenades damage all enemies within a radius of approximately 5 tiles.
Grenades are extremely useful early-game, dealing enormous damage for such an easy weapon to acquire.

Because Grenades automatically explode when they hit an enemy, using them as short-ranged weapons is risky as they can easily cause self-inflicted damage. This can be countered with good enough timing and invincibility frames. This can be countered with good enough timing and invincibility frames.

As Grenades do splash damage, they can be useful against a large number of different enemies: The Brain of Cthulhu 's first phase. Most worms : A single Grenade is usually enough to kill a Bone Serpent and sometimes a World Feeder. Groups of enemies, e.g. during events like the Blood Moon or Goblin Army or in the Dungeon. The Brain of Cthulhu 's first phase. Most worms : A single Grenade is usually enough to kill a Bone Serpent and sometimes a World Feeder. Groups of enemies, e.g. during events like the Blood Moon or Goblin Army or in the Dungeon.
Using Grenades against a Caster AI enemy is especially inadvisable. A Grenade can easily explode upon hitting one of the enemy's projectiles, often much closer to the player than anticipated.

Grenades are more useful on higher difficulties since damage inflicted by enemies becomes much higher while the self-damage of Grenades stays the same. Killing the enemies faster with high-damaging Grenades and thus eliminating the chance of getting hit by them makes up for the risk of self-damage.
The sprite is very similar to the American M67 grenade, a grenade produced since 1968.
Despite the similarities in name, it cannot be used as ammo for the Grenade Launcher.

Sunlight is defined by the following conditions: It is daytime (4:30 AM to 7:30 PM), including Solar Eclipses. No background wall is present, including glass and natural walls. It is daytime (4:30 AM to 7:30 PM), including Solar Eclipses. No background wall is present, including glass and natural walls.
A Garden Gnome will also form if there are solid blocks above the Gnome. It will not form if the Gnome is under water.
Using an Actuator to break Gnomes will count towards kill count.
Once converted into a Garden Gnome, it will not turn back into a Gnome enemy, regardless of time.
As they are relatively easy to obtain, it can be advantageous to place them wherever Luck comes into play, e.g. boss arenas and farming locations.
The way the gnome faces when it is in profile depends on the tile it is placed on; not the direction the player is facing.

Unlike other buff furniture, the Garden Gnome does not apply a visible buff to the player to show that its effect is active. One can improvise by placing another area-effect object (such as a Campfire or Sunflower ) next to the Garden Gnome and looking for that buff icon to estimate whether the luck bonus is being applied.
Gnome farms are a very good source of money and can be made in Pre-Hardmode at a Living Tree.
Gnomes have a higher chance of spawning behind a natural Living Wood Wall than a regular wall.

The following are the amount of Garden Gnomes needed for making its luck increase available everywhere for each world size. Small world: 237 Medium world: 542 Large world: 949 Small world: 237 Medium world: 542 Large world: 949
The Garden Gnome's tooltip is also shared with the Lucky Horseshoe.
The Garden Gnome's sprite as an item and tile is a reference to Noggin Clontith, an internet meme.

When spawning naturally, a mechanical boss spawns exactly 81 in-game minutes (at 8:51 PM) after the status message has appeared. Being in a layer lower than the Surface at that moment, or, in singleplayer, exiting the world during that timespan, will prevent the boss from spawning naturally.

With the 1/10 (10%) chance of spawning naturally at dusk, the resulting chance for each mechanical boss is initially 1/30 (3.33%). Once one of them has been defeated, the remaining two have a resulting 1/20 (5%) chance of spawning naturally, and after defeating the second one, the last one has the full chance of 1/10 (10%).
An Eye of Cthulhu naturally spawning will take precedence over a mechanical boss naturally spawning. [4]

A Lantern Night (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) occurring will prevent a mechanical boss from naturally spawning. However, summoning a mechanical boss using one of the summon items will cancel out the Lantern Night, just like any other boss summon.
In a Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) world, the player cannot summon the mechanical bosses separately, they have to summon the Mechdusa instead.

It is possible to summon a mechanical boss in pre-Hardmode if the summoning item is brought in from another world. However, if the Wall of Flesh has not been defeated, Plantera's Bulbs will not start spawning.
Killing both eyes is required for the boss to collectively drop all of its loot, including dropped Hearts. Thus, killing one of the eyes will not drop any Hearts.
Both eyes can drop their respective trophy when killed, regardless of which is killed first. It is also possible ( 1/100 (1%) chance) for both trophies to drop in one battle.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, if The Twins are summoned with a Mechanical Eye on a night when The Twins are also spawning naturally, both pairs will appear and all four eyes will appear connected.

Focus on defeating one eye completely first without inflicting too much damage on the other one. Battling The Twins while both are in their second form makes the battle much more difficult, especially in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Spazmatism may be a better choice for defeating first, since its Cursed Flames are difficult to avoid without proper mobility equipment and buffs in its second phase. Retinazer is less deadly, as it cannot inflict debuffs and will not charge in its second phase, which helps the player attack it from a safe distance with ranged attacks. In its first phase, Retinazer's accuracy is low enough that it will simply miss most shots against a stationary player. If Spazmatism is already defeated, even moderately tanky builds can maximize DPS for less effort by staying put, except to dodge charges. Spazmatism may be a better choice for defeating first, since its Cursed Flames are difficult to avoid without proper mobility equipment and buffs in its second phase. Retinazer is less deadly, as it cannot inflict debuffs and will not charge in its second phase, which helps the player attack it from a safe distance with ranged attacks. In its first phase, Retinazer's accuracy is low enough that it will simply miss most shots against a stationary player. If Spazmatism is already defeated, even moderately tanky builds can maximize DPS for less effort by staying put, except to dodge charges.
The Twins are only immune to Confused and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Poisoned, so using a weapon that inflicts a debuff may be useful during the fight.
A good arena for this boss is simply a long, flat plane. With Lightning Boots (or better) and a ranged or magic weapon, the player can continually outrun The Twins' attacks while firing back at them.
In its second phase, Retinazer can only attack the player if it has an unobstructed line of sight. Hiding in a box prevents it from dealing any damage.
A Gravitation Potion can be an excellent method of keeping distance from the Twins, allowing them to be attacked freely.
Retinazer's name is a portmanteau of retina, a part of the eye, and laser. Spazmatism's name is a portmanteau of spasm, meaning to twitch uncontrollably, and astigmatism, an eye disorder.
Spazmatism's second form has visible bolts along either side, whereas Retinazer's second form only has them along one side.
The Twins seem to have complete heterochromia iridum (two different eye colors).

In its second phase, Spazmatism's Eye Fire attack functions almost identically to the Flamethrower weapon ( (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) ), with similar range and damage, but inflicting the Cursed Inferno debuff instead of On Fire!.
The Twins are the only boss with two trophies, and the only mechanical boss with more than one phase.
Despite inflicting it, Spazmatism is not immune to Cursed Inferno.

The Twins are one of three bosses with a corresponding minion ( Optic Staff ), the others being the Martian Saucer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ( Xeno Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) and Duke Fishron ( Tempest Staff ).
– According to the Terraria lore pages, The Twins were one of the three mechanical recreations of Cthulhu's missing organs. They are a recreation of Cthulhu's eyes.
The Twins seem to be bio-mechanical hybrids since they are not immune to debuffs like On Fire!, Cursed Inferno, (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Poisoned, or Acid Venom, even when transformed.
Mushroom grass is immune to being converted by an evil biome, (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) while the interior Mud Blocks are not.

Use of the Clentaminator with Green Solution on a Glowing Mushroom biome converts it to a Jungle biome. However, attempting to use Purification Powder to convert a Glowing Mushroom biome to a Jungle biome will fail.
Underground Glowing Mushroom biomes do not generate within the Ice biome and the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

In Underground layer and below, while the area functionally changes to a Glowing Mushroom biome at 100 related blocks, the background of a Glowing Mushroom biome will not appear until 161 Glowing Mushroom biome blocks are present.
The Funkytown achievement requires 200 Glowing Mushroom biome blocks nearby the player.
The Funkytown achievement can sometimes be obtained by using a Magic Mirror, Ice Mirror, Cell Phone, or Shellphone while in an Underground Glowing Mushroom biome. This is likely a bug caused by lag.

An efficient way to create an artificial Glowing Mushroom biome is to put Mud Blocks in such a fashion that they form a grid of 1×1 empty cells. This way, the Mushroom grass has more blocks it can spread to, greatly accelerating the process of creating the biome. Plants and Glowing Mushrooms can grow inside these gaps.
Caution should be taken when creating a Surface Glowing Mushroom biome in pre-Hardmode, as the enemies that spawn there are much more powerful than other pre-Hardmode enemies.

It is a wise idea to make two NPC houses in pre-Hardmode in a surface Glowing Mushroom biome in preparation for the Truffle and a companion NPC such as the Dryad. This will also address the issue listed above, as having NPCs in the biome will drastically reduce enemy spawn rates.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, either Surface or Underground Mushroom biomes will allow obtaining a Mushroom pylon, by building two or more houses and placing chosen NPCs there; it is not necessary to wait for Hardmode and Truffle's appearance. On the surface, it is easiest to produce the biome in the Jungle due to the prevalence of mud ; this can provide a second pylon for the Jungle area.  Alternatively, mud can simply be placed as needed.  When choosing a location, consider that the Mushroom biome background will appear up to a screen's width or so away from the actual Mushroom grass etc. producing the biome. A Floating Island can make a good option for a Surface Mushroom biome. This keeps the Mushroom biome and its enveloping darkness out of the way of most surface activities, and will also put it out of the way of biome spread. Alternatively, the natural Mushroom biomes will mostly appear at great depths, and these can be "colonized" to provide a convenient way-station to the Underworld. Naturally, the NPCs should be fully sealed away from the dangerous local enemies; even so, the spores of Fungi Bulbs and Giant Fungi Bulbs may be troublesome in Hardmode. Note that NPCs placed in an Underground Mushroom biome will probably qualify as a "Cavern Town", and spawn Gem Critters in the vicinity. These will look quite odd (and nearly indistinguishable) by the biome's natural lighting, but supplying some brighter lighting will show their various colors.
