If mined while confined in a 2×2 area, the Bouncy Boulder projectile will stay still for a second until it breaks, unlike the regular Boulder, which breaks immediately.
The sprite for the Bouncy Boulder is slightly translucent, almost like a bubble of gum.
Since Buggy is the rarest Jungle bug critter, it is the only one with a 02* rarity, while Sluggy and Grubby have 01* rarities.

Much like how Ducks have a human voice say "quack" as a rare Easter egg, the Owl has a 1/300 (0.33%) chance to make a human "hoot" sound instead of its normal sound. [1] The voice of this sound belongs to FoodBarbarian. [2]
Seeing a flying Owl may be confusing to some players due to a Demon Eye variant that spawns with an owl costume during Halloween, making it appear similar to a flying Owl.
The Owl, Blue Macaw, Gray Cockatiel, Scarlet Macaw, Toucan, and Yellow Cockatiel are the only bird critters that cannot be cooked into food.
Despite being in the Nintendo 3DS version, there is no crafting recipe that uses Frost Minnows, making them useless outside of selling.
This potion can only be crafted in worlds with Crimson due to it requiring Crimson Tigerfish, although it can also be dropped from crates obtained from fishing.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As of version 1.4.0.1, it is possible to naturally acquire a Heartreach Potion in a Crimson world by purchasing Crimson Seeds from the Dryad in a Hardmode Graveyard biome, and using the Crimson Seeds to make an artificial Crimson biome to fish in.

The Heartreach Potion is especially useful during large-scale events such as the Pumpkin and Frost Moon, as the large amounts of Hearts dropped by mini-bosses or by specific enemies with likelier odds of dropping them can be collected much more quickly with the Heartreach buff active.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Like the Rage Potion to the Wrath Potion, the Heartreach Potion may be seen as the Crimson counterpart to the Thorns Potion, as both give defensive buffs with imagery which references their respective biomes.

Completing the Old One's Army event on any difficulty sets a hidden attribute for both the world it was completed on and the character who completed it. Any characters, including newly made ones, who visit that world may then use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world. The character who completed the event may also use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world.

The Ballista has a cooldown of 2.67 seconds after attacking. If the player is wearing the Valhalla Knight armor, this cooldown is reduced to 1.67 seconds. With the Ballista Panic! buff active, it is reduced to 1 second. If the buff is active and the player is wearing Valhalla Knight armor, the cooldown is reduced even further to 0.5 seconds. [3]

The Ballista shots applies -1 ticks of local immunity frames. local immunity frames mean that they will not interfere with other projectiles, nor with each other, and -1 ticks mean that a ballista shots cannot hit the same target repeatedly.

The Ballista is slower than the rest of the Tavernkeep's sentry summons, but its damage, range, and piercing capability make it one of the best sentries in the game, especially at higher levels. When combined with the boosts and healing power of the Valhalla Knight armor and an arena with good positioning, they can tear through bosses even up to the Moon Lord.
An effective strategy against the Old One's Army is to set up Lightning Aura sentries near the Mysterious Portals and Ballistas closer to the center.

Ballistas are often inaccurate against fast-moving targets. In addition, flying enemies during Old One's Army may cause the placed summon to aim up to attack them, usually missing due to travel time and wasting shots that could be used on incoming enemies. To counter this, place a few Ballistas behind the Mysterious Portal so Ballista Shots land within the path of incoming enemies. In addition, flying enemies during Old One's Army may cause the placed summon to aim up to attack them, usually missing due to travel time and wasting shots that could be used on incoming enemies. To counter this, place a few Ballistas behind the Mysterious Portal so Ballista Shots land within the path of incoming enemies.
Despite what the buff's tooltip may suggest, Mini Prime does not inflict damage.
Its tooltip quote is likely a reference to the opening line from The Six Million Dollar Man.

Vile Spit projectiles are similar to Burning Spheres, Chaos Balls, and Water Spheres in that they are destroyed with any weapon in a single hit. However, unlike the others, Vile Spit cannot pass through blocks, and it deals much more damage on contact.
Corruptors can be fairly powerful when just starting Hardmode, so they should not be underestimated.
When building/farming in or around the Hardmode Corruption, it can be helpful to use a summon weapon with knockback to hold them in place. The Spider Staff works well.

If the player own the Slimy Saddle or the Gelatinous Pillion dropped by the King Slime and Queen Slime respectively, they can bounce on the Vile Spit projectiles, allowing them to be functionally immune to attacks from below while mounted. It should be noted that, while more difficult to obtain than the Slimy Saddle, the Gelatinous Pillion is much better than the Slimy Saddle when combatting Corruptors as the vertical mobility from the wings vastly increases the chance of this function seeing use.
Corruptors leave behind an afterimage as they move, much like a set of Necro armor or The Twins boss.
The Vile Spit projectile was once able to spread Corruption, giving the Corruptor its name. However, this feature was removed in the 1.2 update.
Despite its name, the melee weapon Scourge of the Corruptor is not dropped by the Corruptor, nor does it deal any extra damage to the Corruptor.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, the afterimage-effect from Corruptors is left in front of them rather than behind.

The Dark Mage will continue to respawn until Wave 5 reaches 99% in Tier 1. This allows it to be farmed by players with late pre-Hardmode and higher gear. It is advised that players should keep an additional world they desire to grind Tier 1 raids, since defeating the mechanical bosses or the Golem will bring higher tier raids. It is advised that players should keep an additional world they desire to grind Tier 1 raids, since defeating the mechanical bosses or the Golem will bring higher tier raids.
Like other members of the Old One's Army, the Dark Mage is immune to Teleporters and lava and will take half damage from traps.
The Dark Mage is restricted to hovering a bit above the ground. It cannot fly upwards, though the skeletons it summons can.
Two pet eggs, the Gato Egg and Dragon Egg drop from the Dark Mage; however, the Creeper Egg light pet drops from the Ogre.
The Dark Mage has an Expert Mode -exclusive Treasure Bag in the game files, but it is currently unobtainable, as it never actually drops it.
The pet drops from the Dark Mage in Tier 1 are one of the highest drop chances for any pet items from enemies, beaten out only by the Bone Key, a guaranteed drop from the Dungeon Guardian.
The War Table, War Table Banner, Dragon Egg, and Gato Egg are not affected by luck, unlike most uncommon loot drops. Thus, they will always drop at their listed drop rates. [3]
The Dark Mage cannot heal itself, other Dark Mages, or the Moon Lord.

If a boss reaches its second phase and is then fully healed by the Dark Mage, the boss will still maintain its current phase (with the exceptions of Santa-NK1, Plantera, and Queen Slime, as this will cause them to revert into the first form after being fully healed).

With the Hive Pack equipped, all Bee projectiles have a 1/2 (50%) chance to be converted into Giant Bee projectiles, which always deal 1–3 extra damage, have a knockback of 0.5 (Extremely weak), can pierce enemies or ricochet off solid blocks 4 times in total, fly noticeably faster, and last 11 seconds. Both kinds of bee projectiles will dissipate immediately on contact with water or lava. [2]
Its spin duration, reach and movement speed are identical to the Valor.
This is the first yoyo to be added to the game since yoyos were first introduced in 1.3.0.1.
Its name is a play on words of high five.

The bee spawning effect of the Honey Comb, Stinger Necklace Sweetheart Necklace, Honey Balloon, and Bee Cloak do not stack. The same amount of bees will appear after being damaged no matter how many of these items are equipped.

This item can be used simultaneously with the Shark Tooth Necklace to ignore 10 defense, rather than 5, and even further with the Sharpening Station, increasing the total armor penetration to 22 on melee weapons. This bonus will also apply to weapons with armor penetration, such as the Blade Staff or the Crystal Vile Shard.

Being a ghost allows for the exploration of areas that would have otherwise been unreachable while the player was alive; however, because the movement speed of being a ghost is slow, traveling long distances will take a long time. Additionally, as ghosts emit no light, it will be difficult to clearly see places that are not already lit.
Ghosts are not shown on the minimaps of living players.
No matter what the player's character looked like when they were alive, they will always look the same as a ghost.
Ghosts never trigger enemy spawning. For example, entering the Dungeon before defeating Skeletron as a ghost and traveling under 0 depth will not cause Dungeon Guardians to spawn.
(Desktop version) The.plr file can be restored from the system trashcan to the Players folder thus restoring the character to the pre-death state.
Because a ghost can open doors, a ghost can actually spawn the Queen Bee by breaking a Larva by opening a door into the space that the larva occupies.

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ).

This content is transcluded from Instruments/Guitar chords. In order from closest to furthest away from the player, the chords played are as follows: G major – A minor – B minor – C major – D major – E minor. When the item is selected in the hotbar, the chord the instrument will currently play will be displayed underneath the cursor.
The name Whitney is a reference to Whitney "Cenx" Spinks, the lead developer of Terraria and wife of Redigit.
It is one of the only three items dropped by NPCs with special names, the others being the Green Cap, which is dropped by a Guide named Andrew, and Jim's Cap, which is dropped by a Painter named Jim.
The tooltip is a reference to Redigit's and Cenx's band, Dead Man's Sweater. [1]

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Restoration Potion has a confusing place among the tiers of healing potions. Compared to the Healing Potion, it gives almost as much health with a shorter cooldown. Compared to the Honeyfin ; it gives ¾ the healing with ¾ the cooldown. Either way, there is also natural healing/regeneration during the cooldown to consider. Mathematically, the Restoration Potion is the best pre-Hardmode health potion, as its health-to-cooldown ratio is tied with the Honeyfin 's, barely being better via receiving health more often. Mathematically, the Restoration Potion is the best pre-Hardmode health potion, as its health-to-cooldown ratio is tied with the Honeyfin 's, barely being better via receiving health more often.
Although there are both Greater Healing Potions and Greater Mana Potions, there is not an equivalent "Greater Restoration Potion". The same goes for Super Healing Potions and Super Mana Potions.
All Lesser Restoration Potions were replaced with Restoration Potions in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Because the Golf Ball is considered an accessory, it can be reforged at the Goblin Tinkerer.
Like all projectiles, Golf Ball projectiles can trigger Teal Pressure Pads.
There is often little reason to buy more than one Golf Ball, as it can be reused an unlimited number of times.
The player 's camera follows the Golf Ball when it is struck and if the player does not move after hitting it. This can be used to locate Floating Islands and other hidden structures.

It is possible to hit multiple Golf Balls with one swing, and thus potentially make multiple holes-in-one even into the same hole. Doing this will make the camera follow one of the Golf Balls and the rest will not be followed. Doing this will make the camera follow one of the Golf Balls and the rest will not be followed.
The player can score outside world borders using map editors to place a Golf Cup outside the world.

It is the most defensive basic wooden armor, though it is the weakest Hardmode armor set, and can only be acquired in a Hardmode world in most cases. This makes the armor set seem to serve little purpose outside of vanity or collectability as the mere presence of the Hallow in a world means that Hardmode has already been triggered, and a defense rating of 8 is woefully insufficient for the tough enemies and bosses awaiting players. An exception would be in Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, where crafting this armor is viable due to natural spawning of Hallowed grass on Floating Islands. An exception would be in Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, where crafting this armor is viable due to natural spawning of Hallowed grass on Floating Islands.
The Pearlwood Helmet appears to have a Unicorn Horn on it.
Underworld -exclusive bait caught by the Lavaproof Bug Net can also be used for fishing in water and honey, but it may be wasteful to do so.

As the Hotline Fishing Hook can only be obtained rarely after a significant amount of Angler quests in Hardmode, crafting a Lavaproof Bug Net is highly recommended as it allows fishing in lava relatively early. The Lavaproof Fishing Hook, that can be found in Obsidian and Hellstone Crates, can be used as it allows fishing in lava using any bait and any fishing pole. This will still require the player to use the Lavaproof Bug Net in order to obtain the accessory. The Lavaproof Fishing Hook, that can be found in Obsidian and Hellstone Crates, can be used as it allows fishing in lava using any bait and any fishing pole. This will still require the player to use the Lavaproof Bug Net in order to obtain the accessory.
The tooltip is a reference to the English idiom "too hot to handle."
Skull Lanterns count as a light source for NPCs.
Skull Lanterns can also be found naturally generated in the Dungeon.
The skull on the Skull Lantern uses the same sprite as the Skeleton 's head prior to 1.0.3.
A marquess is a European title for a nobleman of high hereditary rank, above the title of counts and earls, and below that of a duke.
The Pork of the Sea's name is a reference to the seafood brand, provider, and distributor Chicken of the Sea.
The Pork of the Sea also references how Duke Fishron is a part pig.
Compared to its alternate ore version, the Iron Pickaxe, it has more pickaxe power, deals 1 more damage, and is slightly faster in terms of mining speed.
The Lead and Iron Pickaxes only require 3 Wood to craft, unlike the rest of the early-game pickaxes which all require 4 Wood.
The Bestiary entry for the Goblin Warrior: " The backbone of the Goblin Army infantry, these heavily-armored soldiers can take tremendous damage as they march undeterred. "

Herplings can be difficult enemies due to their speed and knockback resistance. In order to counter this, the player should try to stay above them, using either wings or a higher ground that Herplings cannot reach from at least one side.
Herplings can spawn on Crimson grass, Crimstone Blocks, Red Ice Blocks, and Crimsand Blocks in all biomes. They can also spawn on Crimtane Ore blocks in the Underground Crimson.
The Herpling is often considered to be a counterpart to the Derpling, as both have names based on the phrase herp derp and have the same AI.
The Herpling does not have a Corruption counterpart.
The Peace Candle buff will stack with the Happy! buff from Sunflowers and the Calm buff from Calming Potions, reducing the enemy spawn rate by approximately 67%.
The Peace Candle can be used underwater.
The Peace Candle is unable to fully counteract the effects of a Water Candle in Space, as this biome massively increases the effects of the Water Candle debuff.
As Peace Candles reduce critter spawns as much as enemy spawn, if the player would like to collect bait, it is wise to not have any nearby.

This item is commonly used to facilitate the mining of Hellstone, which excretes half a tile of lava when mined. Since Hellstone is also found under lava lakes, the potion enables players to dive for it as well.

While the Fireblossom can easily be collected in the Underworld, the Waterleaf will have to first be collected from the Desert biome. Alternatively, the player may use a personal plant garden to grow the required plants.
The Obsidian Skin buff was the first buff ever added to the game.
The crate resembles the sprite of Bladetongue.
The pineapple is a tropical fruit native to South America. Pineapple plants in real life do not grow as trees, but instead as small shrubs.
Its tooltip is a reference to Hawaiian pizza, which is traditionally topped with pineapple.

The Cyborg is biomechanical and not a robot (true to the name "Cyborg"), as skin can be seen on his hands and face. This is easier to notice in his old sprite. Interestingly, despite seeming to have most of his body coated and/or replaced with metal, he has the regular NPC hit sound effect instead of a mechanical hit sound effect. Interestingly, despite seeming to have most of his body coated and/or replaced with metal, he has the regular NPC hit sound effect instead of a mechanical hit sound effect.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Along with the Traveling Merchant, the Zoologist, and the Princess, the Cyborg is one of the only NPCs that sells a post- Moon Lord item (the Portal Gun Station ). However, unlike the other examples, this can be circumvented by bringing a Portal Gun or Portal Gun Station from another world to the one with the Cyborg.
Almost all of the Cyborg's names are letters in the Greek alphabet. Naming robots and cyborgs with Greek letters is common in science fiction.
The names Syn-x and A.N.D.Y. are likely references to Re-Logic lead developers Whitney " Cenx " Spinks and Andrew " Redigit " Spinks.
The name T-3E0 is most likely a reference to C-3PO, a humanoid robot character from the American epic space opera media franchise Star Wars.
The name Niner-7 may be a reference to the character Seven of Nine from the American science fiction television series Star Trek: Voyager.
The Cyborg is twice as likely to be named Phi as any other name. [2]

His quote " My expedition efficiency was critically reduced when a projectile impacted my locomotive actuator. " is a reference to the popular "Arrow in the Knee" quote from the action role-playing video game The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, where a guard tells the player: "I used to be an adventurer like you, then I took an arrow in the knee." The Zoologist shares a similar quote to the reference above: " I collected critters like you once, then I took a cursed fox bite to the knee! " The Zoologist shares a similar quote to the reference above: " I collected critters like you once, then I took a cursed fox bite to the knee! "
The quote " This sentence is false, or is it? " references a common logical paradox often associated with robots.
His quote " <Name of Tavernkeep> said I reminded him of a certain "EV2". Perhaps I should meet her. " is a reference to the character EV2 in Dungeon Defenders 2.
On the Old-gen console version, he is summoned by the Queen Statue even though he is not female.
In the source files of the game, it is found that the Cyborg's light on his head is off when his party hat is on:

His quote " So that 'punk' lookin' chick is an inventor, eh? I think I could show her a thing or two! " might suggest that he has some interest in the Steampunker. Because this quote suggests he does not know the Steampunker already, it conflicts with a piece of lore, since the Cyborg's Bestiary entry states that he was created by the Mechanic and the Steampunker. However, the Cyborg does not directly say that he knows the Mechanic either, meaning that there may be no memories of the event for him. Because this quote suggests he does not know the Steampunker already, it conflicts with a piece of lore, since the Cyborg's Bestiary entry states that he was created by the Mechanic and the Steampunker. However, the Cyborg does not directly say that he knows the Mechanic either, meaning that there may be no memories of the event for him.

Despite the high damage and the debuff of Venom Arrows, there are other arrows that can technically deal more DPS, such as the echoing ability of Luminite Arrows, Holy Arrows ' stars or the defense-reducing ability of Ichor Arrows.
Venom Arrows' high base damage makes them the best choice for bows that convert all arrows into special types.
It is possible to find Lime Kelp in any body of water in the Dungeon and (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) also in Honey.
Lime Kelp is remarkably inconspicuous, being easy to miss even in brightly lit water. However, the Spelunker Potion or Magic Lantern will highlight them as "valuable".

Perhaps the most efficient way to "farm" Lime Kelp is to exploit the world map: After exploring in a map's underground snow biome, occasionally examine the area in the world map, zooming in to look for isolated dark green pixels in the water. (Mousing over these pixels will show "Lime Kelp" as a tooltip.) Since the world map updates with a live feed of each explored area, newly-spawned plants can be spotted by going over the map again later. This works on every biome, however kelp is more common in the Ice Biome. They are also easier to spot on the map due to the white / blue background.
Although Lime Kelp is available in placed form on the Nintendo 3DS version, breaking one never yields an item.
Due to its respectable defense and stat bonuses, this is a viable alternative to Hardmode ore sets, especially for those who do not wish to grind for resources. However, mixed sets have more damage.
It works well with the Nimbus Rod, Clinger Staff, and Queen Spider Staff since it boosts their damage output without sacrificing bonuses to melee or ranged weapons.
In Classic Mode, Crystal Assassin armor's dash is the only dash effect that is accessible before defeating Plantera.
In Expert Mode, the dash may be used as a replacement for the Shield of Cthulhu, freeing up an accessory slot.

The dash provided by Crystal Assassin armor is often better than the Shield of Cthulhu's dash, since it covers a greater distance and will not be interrupted by contact with an enemy if a Cobalt Shield is equipped. There are many situations where accidentally bumping into an enemy can be extremely undesirable, notably when fighting Plantera or Skeletron Prime. However, it should be noted that this also makes dashes potentially riskier in other situations, as dashing into an enemy will no longer provide the player with invincibility frames.

The curved horns featured on the helmet resemble the horns of some types of kabuto, commonly known as samurai helmets. This validates its existence as a Hardmode upgrade to the Ninja armor, which is dropped by the pre-Hardmode version of Queen Slime, King Slime. This validates its existence as a Hardmode upgrade to the Ninja armor, which is dropped by the pre-Hardmode version of Queen Slime, King Slime.

This is the last set of armor that is dropped directly by a certain boss or by enemies. This trait is shared with the Ninja armor, Gladiator Armor, Ancient Cobalt armor and Ancient Shadow armor. It is also the only Hardmode armor with this trait. Frost armor was once made available through the Ice Golem, before Frost Cores were introduced. It is also the only Hardmode armor with this trait. Frost armor was once made available through the Ice Golem, before Frost Cores were introduced.

Since the time limit for effects rounds down, if there are 0.9 seconds or less remaining of Potion Sickness, it will display as 0 seconds. In total, this makes it appear as though it lasts 61 seconds instead. This applies to all effects with a time limit.
The debuff uses the Lesser Healing Potion 's pre- 1.3.0.1 sprite.
It is usually the first debuff players encounter.
Potion Sickness is a play on motion sickness.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Restoration Potion, the Mushroom, and the Strange Brew are the only three consumables which can inflict the Potion Sickness debuff for less than 60 seconds.
Although a world might have Tin Ore instead of Copper Ore, new players will always start with a Copper Shortsword, Copper Pickaxe and a Copper Axe.

Similar to Tin Ore, new players may want to consider skipping mining Copper Ore early on, so they can focus on collecting Iron or better ores instead. This is because Copper armor and tools offer only a small improvement over Wood / Cactus armors which are accessible at the start. Additionally, the collection may not be worth the time invested as copper equipment is often quickly replaced by equipment from stronger metals. This is because Copper armor and tools offer only a small improvement over Wood / Cactus armors which are accessible at the start. Additionally, the collection may not be worth the time invested as copper equipment is often quickly replaced by equipment from stronger metals.
However, Copper Ore is used in some decorative recipes and may become more desirable to the player as mining becomes easier and quicker.
Certain rarity colors appear very similar to each other in-game and are easily confused, e.g. Green/Lime, Orange/Light Red.

Quest items that have a modifier which increases their rarity will have a rarity of -1* instead. This can be seen in-game via the Announcement Box (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), for instance.
Items with a rarity of -1* will not be destroyed when dropped in lava, even though their rarity is lower than 00*. [4]

Even though all the Team Blocks come with matching platforms, Team Platforms cannot be crafted with Team Blocks and consequently cannot be used to craft Team Blocks either, due to the purpose of platform-to-block recipes generally being for convenient decrafting.

There is an unused line of text in the code: " You can't change teams inside your team's blocks! " [1] It suggests that the player would be unable to change their team when inside a house of team blocks identical to their team color.
Repeaters strongly resemble repeating crossbows.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It is one of the six components of the Ankh Shield that can be obtained in pre-Hardmode, the others being the Obsidian Skull, Cobalt Shield, Nazar, Bezoar, and Adhesive Bandage.
Although Sky Blue Flowers are available in placed form on the Nintendo 3DS version, breaking one never yields an item.
Sky Blue Flowers are displayed on the minimap as a light blue square.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, crafting two Sky Blue Dyes and selling them is twice as profitable as selling a Sky Blue Flower directly.
This pet is a reference to Spiffo, the mascot of the open-world isometric survival horror video game Project Zomboid. The buff tooltip is a reference to the Project Zomboid world start screen.

In don't dig up and get fixed boi seeds, the Ash Wood Hammer receives the following changes: Damage decreased from 9 to 4. Hammer power decreased from 45% to 35%. Damage decreased from 9 to 4. Hammer power decreased from 45% to 35%.
Sharks can only spawn within 250 tiles of the map's edge, or from a Shark Statue.
Sharks do not flop around on land like most other fish, making them less dangerous to approach when beached.
Along with other water enemies, Sharks will ignore players who are not submerged in at least one tile of water.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sharks spawned from a Shark Statue will not drop any items when killed with lava, traps, or NPCs ' attacks.
Sharks charge the player and can move quicker than most players. They are highly resistant to knockback, but strong weapons will usually at least halt their advance.

Rapid-fire weapons, flails, and multi-attack weapons (such as the Swordfish or the Boomstick ) tend to be effective against Sharks. Autoswing weapons are also effective against Sharks as long as they have decent knockback. Because of their extremely fast attack rate and their autoswing feature, the Bladed Glove, Terragrim (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Arkhalis (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are quite useful when dealing with Sharks.

Using a Water Walking Potion or Water Walking Boots to stand on the surface and dive slightly down periodically, the player can attract Sharks to within striking distance while staying safe. The Flipper accessory or Flipper Potion will keep the player from sinking to the bottom.

To safely and easily hunt Sharks, construct a spot to stand on, but remain half-inside water. Add a shield of blocks in front of the player to one tile above the water's surface. Use an arcing ranged or Flamelash -type weapon to fire around the shield, or a Vilethorn to fire through the shield.

A similar method is to stay on the Ocean floor, dig a small pit in the Sand, and build a shield above the player but not connected to the ground, leaving a one-tile gap. Sharks will try to attack but will not fit. The player can then attack with impunity. If the player is lacking proper swim gear or a Neptune's Shell, a stack of Gills Potions may come in handy for this approach.

An easy way to farm Sharks is to place Shark Statues over one bucket of lava stretched over a 12-tile space, and activating the statue with a 1 Second Timer. This kills the Sharks without risk to the player and keeps the items from being destroyed. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Since statue-spawned Sharks do not drop items when killed with lava damage only, some form of player damage is required. This can be easily done with minions. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Since statue-spawned Sharks do not drop items when killed with lava damage only, some form of player damage is required. This can be easily done with minions.
Real-life shark attacks are incredibly rare, as sharks rarely attack humans deliberately, instead mistaking swimmers for injured seals, which are their prey.

Bone Torches, Demon Torches and Aether Torches will be swapped in when Torches are placed in the Dungeon, The Underworld and The Aether respectively, despite not affecting Torch Luck in those areas. Therefore, it is better to transfer Bone Torches to the Underworld, where they do impart Torch luck. Demon Torches do not affect luck at all. Therefore, it is better to transfer Bone Torches to the Underworld, where they do impart Torch luck. Demon Torches do not affect luck at all.

Ice Torches take precedence over Jungle Torches and Mushroom Torches even though the Jungle and Glowing Mushroom biomes both take precedence over the Snow biome for most other purposes like fishing and enemy spawning.
Coral Torches will not be swapped in while in the Ocean, despite being a biome-specific Torch.

Players who have already used a Torch God's Favor, or have one in their inventory, will not be able to initiate The Torch God event. The inventory's trash slot is not considered part of the inventory for The Torch God event, so having a Torch God's Favor there will not prevent the event from initiating. The inventory's trash slot is not considered part of the inventory for The Torch God event, so having a Torch God's Favor there will not prevent the event from initiating.
Consuming the Torch God's Favor unlocks the Bestiary entry of the Torch God.

A profit of 10 CC per Torch bought from the Merchant (at base happiness) can be made by converting regular Torches to Demon Torches in the Underworld, then picking up and selling them. However, a player who has progressed to the point that they are comfortable enough in the Underworld to spend time on this has much more profitable options; see Guide:Making money.
The Bones used in a Piano's crafting recipe likely refer to a piano's ivory keys ; however, ivory consists of teeth or tusks, not bones.

Most of Terraria 's Pianos belong to the upright (or vertical) type, with a few exceptions: The Frozen, Granite, and Marble Pianos are grand pianos. The Meteorite, Steampunk, Martian, Lesion, and the four Lunar Pianos vaguely resemble organs. The Frozen, Granite, and Marble Pianos are grand pianos. The Meteorite, Steampunk, Martian, Lesion, and the four Lunar Pianos vaguely resemble organs.
Unlike the other instruments in game, the pianos cannot be played.
The Squid, along with the Fungo Fish, are the only enemies with the Jellyfish AI that do not have an electrified state in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Naturally spawned and player placed droplets both display on the minimap :
The Thorn Chakram can pass through one-block thick openings if thrown horizontally or if bounced off the ceiling.
Like all boomerangs, the Thorn Chakram deals damage extremely quickly when used at close range.
A chakram is a weapon historically used in India. It is a flat metal ring with a sharp outer edge that was thrown at the enemy, but it would not return or bounce.
The Thorn Chakram was the loading icon for saving in the Mobile version of Terraria in the versions before 1.2.12715's release. It was replaced with a Demon Eye, which lasted until 1.3.0.7.
Like other accessories crafted with the Putrid Scent, it does not inherit the Putrid Scent's bonus to damage and critical strike chance.

The Arcane Flower is one of four items (the others being the Lucky Horseshoe, the Lucky Coin and the Deadly Sphere Staff ) that can attain a modifier which duplicates the first word (resulting in an Arcane Arcane Flower).
The Arcane Flower's appearance is similar to a blue flower ambient object that grows in Jungle.
Phở is a Vietnamese noodle soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs and meat, and is considered Vietnam's national dish.
Pho is pronounced US : /fʌ, foʊ/, UK : /fɜː/, Canada: /fɑː/ ; Vietnamese: [fəː˧˩˧] ( listen ).
The sprite shows the surface of the soup, with the usual greens and other garnishes heaped in the middle; not shown is the deep bowl it would normally be contained in.
Pho's tooltip is a pun on the simple phrase "for sure" [1].
Corals are not limited to only spawning within the generated Ocean's water. As long as the other limits are respected, Corals can grow in water basins on platforms even in the Space layer.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version : When Corals spawn, they make an audible "thump" sound. Spawn rates are increased during rainy and windy weather, with a maximum bonus when both are at their strongest. Spawn rates are increased for every empty tile above a Sand Block, up to 14 tiles. This means two platforms of sand within 14 tiles would have the same spawn rate if not for the extra layer of solid block needed under the sand. Empty tiles can include walls and inactive tiles. Spawn rates are decreased if 1 or more Seashell or Coral are within 11 tiles, and Corals can no longer spawn if more than 5 Seashells or Corals are within 7 tiles. When Corals spawn, they make an audible "thump" sound. Spawn rates are increased during rainy and windy weather, with a maximum bonus when both are at their strongest. Spawn rates are increased for every empty tile above a Sand Block, up to 14 tiles. This means two platforms of sand within 14 tiles would have the same spawn rate if not for the extra layer of solid block needed under the sand. Empty tiles can include walls and inactive tiles. Spawn rates are decreased if 1 or more Seashell or Coral are within 11 tiles, and Corals can no longer spawn if more than 5 Seashells or Corals are within 7 tiles.
Corals are animals.

On earlier versions, while each piece of Coral only needed one block under it, it essentially took up an extra half-space on each side, preventing walls or objects from being placed directly to either side. For example, to place 5 Corals between walls, one would have needed the walls to be at least 11 tiles apart. To fit the same 5 Corals on an open platform, it only needed to be 9 blocks wide.
The Balla Hat resembles bowler hats stereotypically worn by the Mafia in the early 20th century.
The Snow Ballas that spawn during the Frost Legion event wear an identical hat.
Since it only produces visual effects, using wire to trigger it instead of using Confetti can help save money.
Its shot is effectively identical to that of the Confetti Gun, just with more velocity.
Other than the name, Sauteed Frog Legs are completely unrelated to the Frog Leg accessory.

Frog legs are famous for being a French national delicacy, but they are also consumed as food in many other regions of the world, including Spain, Portugal, East and Southeast Asia, and the southern United States.

The tooltip, ' The other, other white meat.', is a reference to the 1999 American spy comedy film Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me. In the film, the character Fat Bastard boasts about the time he ate an infant, calling it "the other, other white meat".

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) In the get fixed boi secret world seed, the Mechanical Skull is not consumable and is instead a crafting material for the Ocram's Razor, an item used to summon Mechdusa.
Like other mechanical boss summoning items, the Mechanical Skull can be brought to pre-Hardmode worlds and will successfully summon Skeletron Prime there.
As with several items, the Mechanical Skull has multiple crafting recipes (two in total) due to some items in the recipe allowing substitutes.
Like the Mechanical Worm, it looks like a wind-up toy.
The Skull Lantern and Mechanical Skull are very similar in appearance to the skull in the original sprite for Skeletons :

This potion's buff grants the user the same speed of mana regeneration as a player who is standing completely still, and also greatly reduces the user's mana regeneration delay. This allows the user to be more mobile, and lowers any downtime for mana-consuming items.
If the player is inside a tunnel, the drone will stop pursuing and hover on the player's head as long as the player stays in the tunnel. The same strategy applies to dealing with Corites.
This enemy mostly resembles the General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper, a drone used primarily by the United States Air Force.

Desktop, Console, and Mobile players have the highest amount of pickaxe power of 230% using the Laser Drill. Old-gen console and 3DS players may carry a Picksaw which holds a pickaxe power of 210%. Both are capable of mining Lihzahrd Bricks.
The player can mine blocks like Grass and Moss in 1 hit instead of 2, assuming their pickaxe power is high enough.
The Gravedigger's Shovel is able to mine blocks despite lacking pickaxe power. All blocks it can mine, it mines in 2 hits.
Granite Elementals can notice the player as a Ghost if there is one present when they die.
Only one Granite Elemental can be present in the world at all times.

When out of sight, the Granite Elemental will move intelligently to reach the player's position. For example, if the player moves upward out of a chasm, the Granite Elemental will follow this action moving according to the player's position.

Elementals are magical entities who embody or personify a force of nature. Historically, elementals personify one of the four classical elements : earth, water, air, or fire (sometimes plants, and later included aether). In the fantasy role-playing game Dungeon & Dragons, elementals which are fusions and other unconventional elementals have been introduced.
Until 1.3.5, enemies had an unused internal name. The Granite Elemental's name was Grelimental [1], a portmanteau of granite and elemental, in similar style to the Granite Golem 's Grolem.
During the official 1.3 trailer, multiple Granite Elementals can be seen simultaneously, suggesting that their spawn limit was not yet added at the time.

There are two independent chances, 1/2 (50%) and 1/12 (8.33%), of receiving one Star, [1] meaning that there is a 13/24 (54.17%) chance of obtaining at least one Star. There is a 12/24 (50%) chance of receiving exactly one Star, a 1/24 (4.17%) chance of receiving two Stars, and an 11/24 (45.83%) chance of receiving no Stars.

Soul Cakes are likely a reference to the real-life soul cakes, small round cakes which are traditionally made for All Hallows' Eve, All Saints' Day and All Souls' Day to commemorate the dead in the Christian tradition. They are often simply referred to as souls, and were given out to children and the poor (known as soulers), who would go from door to door during the days of Allhallowtide singing and saying prayers "for the souls of the givers and their friends". Each cake eaten would represent a soul being freed from purgatory. The custom was popular in England and Wales and has counterparts in other parts of the world that are practiced to this day. It is often seen as the origin for modern trick-or-treating.

Although Stars are instantly consumed on pickup, it is possible to hack in Stars into the player's inventory through the use of editors. The hacked-in Stars still act like normal Stars, and will still be consumed on pickup, after dropping them in front of the player.
Mana Stars existed before Mana even existed. In the beta version of Terraria, Mana Stars would attempt to restore mana, but they did not do anything. [2]

In Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, all Stars have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be replaced by Soul Cakes and a 1/3 (33.33%) chance to be replaced by Sugar Plums, regardless of season.
Parrots, alongside Pirate Captains, are the only Pirate Invasion enemies that cannot be spawned by the Flying Dutchman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Killing Parrots does not count towards the completion of the Pirate Invasion event (similar to Martian Drones (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) during Martian Madness (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ).

As its appearance looks very much like the pet version, a player can easily mistake a hostile Parrot for their own passive version if it is summoned during a Pirate Invasion. As of 1.3.5.2 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Parrot has been resprited, which makes it slightly larger in size than the pet. As of 1.3.5.2 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Parrot has been resprited, which makes it slightly larger in size than the pet.
The Bestiary entry for the Parrot: " A pirate's best friend, the parrot, will tear the eyes out of any greasy landlubber with its sharp, pointy talons. "
The best way for hunting this set is killing Frozen Zombies during a pre-Hardmode Blood Moon, with both a Battle Potion and a Water Candle in effect.

This armor set may be a reference to Popo, one of the protagonists of the vertical platform video game Ice Climber which was developed and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1985. Popo wears an outfit almost identical to the Snow armor.

Prior to 1.4, this armor set was (and on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version still is) called Eskimo armor instead of Snow armor. Eskimo was the term used to refer to the indigenous peoples who have traditionally inhabited the northern circumpolar region. In Canada and Greenland, the term Eskimo is predominately seen as pejorative and has been widely replaced by the term Inuit. Previously, only the Mobile version of Terraria used the "Snow" set names. Eskimo was the term used to refer to the indigenous peoples who have traditionally inhabited the northern circumpolar region. In Canada and Greenland, the term Eskimo is predominately seen as pejorative and has been widely replaced by the term Inuit. Previously, only the Mobile version of Terraria used the "Snow" set names.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Snow armor is one of 3 armor sets that do not provide a set bonus, the others being Angler armor and Pink Snow armor.
One of the best ways to obtain Ash Wood is by using the Don't dig up or Get fixed boi secret world seeds where Ash trees are abundant at the spawn location.
Ash Wood is the first wood type to be added since 1.2.4.

The Leaf Crystal is capable of firing two separate simultaneous volleys of projectiles. It is possible for both volleys to target the same enemy. One volley targets the nearest enemy within 43.75 tiles [3] on its own. It requires a clear line-of-sight, but can still travel through blocks if it misses or if the player hides behind cover right before the volley is shot. This volley has a cooldown of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 0.67 seconds [4] / (Old-gen console version) 0.83 seconds [5] / (3DS version) 1 second [6]. A second volley activates when an enemy ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) only within 135 tiles [7] ) takes damage from other sources first (e.g. from a player attack, or from lava, a minion, a trap, etc). This volley will target enemies through blocks, and the projectile will travel through blocks to reach the target. This volley has a cooldown of (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) 0.83 seconds [8] / (3DS version) 1 second [9]. The Leaf Crystal has the following properties: When firing, it launches a projectile moving in a straight line and does not home in or track targets. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) As the projectile travels only at a moderate velocity, it will often miss targets that move around a lot, such as Wandering Eyes. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Leaf Crystal will instantly fire its first volley when it is summoned. The player can quickly switch one of the armor pieces with other armor to fire the projectile at a high rate. In PvP, only the second volley will target players (i.e., they need to take damage from another source first for the Leaf Crystal to target them). The Leaf Crystal emits a small amount of green light. It does not benefit from damage-increasing bonuses (e.g. accessories ) and cannot deal critical hits. It does not target critters directly but can still damage them if they happen to be in its path. The Leaf Crystal is not affected by Critter Shampoo (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), despite behaving similarly to other set bonus summons such as the Stardust Guardian (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
