The icons for the "Sick Throw" and "Throwing Lines" achievements have the same appearance, but with different colors.
The Psycho is a reference to Michael Myers from the 1978 slasher horror film Halloween, [1] though the sprite more closely resembles Jason Voorhees from the Friday The 13th series.
For some reason, despite following the Fighter AI, the Psycho cannot open doors, nor does it interact with them.
Only the Sickle purchased from the Merchant can be used to harvest Hay. The Ice Sickle and Death Sickle do not work.
Since it is so fast and easy to obtain, it makes for an excellent building block for large-scale projects, e.g. a skybridge. It is also immune to biome spread (i.e., Hallow / Corruption / Crimson ).
Using the Flower Boots, the player can repeatedly swing a Sickle for very large amounts of Hay.

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ). In addition, equipping the Guide Voodoo Doll allows the player to damage the Guide with any weapon. In addition, equipping the Guide Voodoo Doll allows the player to damage the Guide with any weapon.
The name Andrew is a reference to the creator and lead developer of Terraria, Andrew "Redigit" Spinks.
It has a similar appearance to the cap worn by Luigi, a character from the Mario franchise.

It is one of the only three items dropped by NPCs with special names, the others being Jim's Cap (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which is dropped by a Painter named Jim, and Ivy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which is dropped by a Steampunker named Whitney.
Similarly to Black and Mother Slimes, the Baby Slime blends slightly with the background of the Cavern layer, making it difficult to detect. As such, it can often catch players off-guard.

When Baby Slimes are spawned upon the death of their mother, they can find themselves in a slightly different position from where the parent was. This can make them spawn on the other side of a one block thick ground, potentially passing through the roof of a house.
When killed with Tally Counter equipped, it will always say " Kill count unavailable ".
(Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions) While Baby Slimes are capable of containing bonus drops, Mother Slimes are not.
The Baby Slime, Spiked Slime, Slimeling, Crystal Slime, Heavenly Slime, Golden Slime, and Bouncy Slime are the only slimes without their own banner.
Equipping the Yoyo Glove and the Yoyo Bag does not cause the duplication effect to stack.
When used with the Terrarian the second yoyo will also shoot out homing projectiles.
These effects can also be triggered by hitting a Target Dummy.
The magic damage reduction is calculated by the following formula, with the remaining debuff duration measured in ticks. [3] [4]
The Flask of Fire is a cheap way of providing light when exploring underground in early Hardmode. While the Hellstone cost may be high, the buff lasts for quite a long time and persists after death.
It is the only non-renewable flask in the game, since Hellstone is generated in a finite amount per world and cannot be fished from crates.
Right-clicking a social slot swaps its content with the corresponding armor/accessory slot.

If the two accessories visually appear on different parts of the body, social accessories will not override active accessories. Instead, both will be visible. For example, Climbing Claws (hands) and Hermes Boots (feet) do not conflict.
Toggling off the visibility of accessories does not make the corresponding social accessory disappear but may still be useful if both would be visible otherwise.
Putting armor in the social slot will not add additional defense to the player.
The player can also dye any vanity items and armor if they dislike the color of the originals.

Putting the same item in the social slot and armor slot has no effect on the appearance except for the Empty Bucket, Badger's Hat (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Rabbit Perch (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which stack the item on the player's head twice.
As long as all conditions are met, beds can also be placed and activated underground or underwater.
The player is still able to control weapon projectiles that follow the cursor (e.g. Flying Knife, Magic Missile, Dirt Rod. etc.) even while sleeping.

It is advisable to place and activate a bed in the same house the Nurse is living in, so immediate healing is available after recalling or respawning. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Be careful not to reset the spawn point by accidentally hitting the bed upon pressing the Nurse's "heal" button, in case she is standing in front of the bed.

There are many naturally-generated structures which can serve as suitable locations for a bed, such as Underground Cabins or the houses on Floating Islands. Some might require minor modifications, e.g. to fill background wall holes.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Upon obtaining the Shellphone, the player can teleport selectively to the bed spawn point or the world spawn point at any time. One may thus find it useful to move their home spawn point away from the world spawn, so that they can have two home bases.
The Pink Dungeon Bed was previously called the Red Dungeon Bed. It still is on the Old-gen console version.
During multiplayer, up to 2 players may sleep in a bed at once.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Sleeping Icon is actually an unobtainable, completely unusable item the only purpose of which is to create this icon. Its item ID is 5013.

The star projectile has a cooldown of 0.67 seconds with no modifier. A small particle effect and the sound for restoring mana https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:MaxMana.wav will notify the player of a recharged star. A small particle effect and the sound for restoring mana https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:MaxMana.wav will notify the player of a recharged star.

The star projectile spawns 37.5 tiles above the player and (horizontally) up to 12.5 tiles away from the cursor's location, in the opposite direction the player is facing. [1] Therefore, positioning the cursor at the very bottom of the screen will cause the star to fall in a nearly straight line, while positioning at the top of the screen will cause the angle of its trajectory to vary wildly. Therefore, positioning the cursor at the very bottom of the screen will cause the star to fall in a nearly straight line, while positioning at the top of the screen will cause the angle of its trajectory to vary wildly.
The velocity of the falling star is affected by melee speed. Higher melee speed results in higher velocity.

As the star projectiles will travel to the lowest cave at or above the cursor, they will travel the farthest if the player's cursor is at the bottom of the screen, lighting up everything above as it falls.

The Starfury can be used to reveal caves, as its stars produce light as they fall, can reach any cave visible on-screen, and produce light particles that continue traveling 10 to 35 tiles downward after colliding with blocks.

The Magma Stone, Flask of Fire, Flask of Cursed Flames, and the set bonus of Frost armor affect the star projectiles, causing them to emit even more light even inside blocks, which can help map solid areas.
As early as the Starfury can be obtained, it is extremely useful throughout all of pre-Hardmode, and can stay useful later into the game as an exploration tool.
The stars can hit enemies within blocks as long as there is an on-screen cave below those blocks to target.
For 1920×1080 resolution, the stars spawn at the top of the screen. Thus, they cannot be used to hit anything above the screen, such as Floating Islands or bosses.
With correct aim, the Starfury can be used to hit an enemy with the blade and another enemy with the star, or the same enemy twice in one swing.
Beware when using the Starfury in the Underground Jungle, as it can easily break the Larva in an undiscovered Bee Hive, summoning the Queen Bee.
If the player plans on crafting the Zenith (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), they should not throw away or sell the Starfury, as it is needed as a crafting ingredient.

The Star Wrath (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be considered the Hardmode upgrade to this weapon; unlike the Starfury, however, the Star Wrath's stars cannot pass through solid blocks below a certain height.

Earlier versions of the Starfury classified it as a magic weapon, which summoned a torrent of stars similar to the Star Wrath. This made it an effective weapon up to and into early Hardmode. This ability was removed and the weapon class changed in the 1.2 update.

During early testing, Redigit recounts placing the Starfury in an area surrounded by "several screens of spikes ", telling the testers that whoever reaches it first could keep it. Whenever a tester would get close, he would teleport them to the Ocean. [2]
The Starfury appears in the video games Pixel Piracy, Dungeon Defenders 2, and Dead Cells as part of crossovers.
The Starfury does more damage than the Light's Bane and the Blood Butcherer despite being obtainable earlier in the game.
It can be considered the Corruption equivalent to the Rage Potion.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) This potion can only be crafted in worlds with the Corruption due to it requiring the Ebonkoi, although it is possible to make an artificial Corruption biome in a Crimson world by importing either Corruption blocks, Purple Solution, or Corrupt Seeds.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As of version 1.4.0.1, it is possible to naturally acquire a Wrath Potion in a Crimson world by purchasing Corrupt Seeds from the Dryad in a Hardmode Graveyard biome, and using the Corrupt Seeds to make an artificial Corruption biome to fish in.

Pumpkin armor can be obtained very easily during Halloween, as Pumpkins grow naturally on grass in sufficient quantities. This makes the armor set obtainable before fighting any bosses. Outside of Halloween, it can be obtained by transmuting (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Cactus into Pumpkins, or by purchasing Pumpkin Seeds from the Dryad (although this does require defeating a boss). Outside of Halloween, it can be obtained by transmuting (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Cactus into Pumpkins, or by purchasing Pumpkin Seeds from the Dryad (although this does require defeating a boss).

Pumpkin armor is an excellent early-game set. It grants more defense than similar sets, like Wood or Cactus armor. It is particularly useful for players using summon weapons, as there are few other armor pieces that boost summon damage and are available this early in the game. It is particularly useful for players using summon weapons, as there are few other armor pieces that boost summon damage and are available this early in the game.

When paired with Lightning Aura and using Morning Star or Kaleidoscope, the critical strike chance granted by the set bonus and the summon tag critical chance granted by the whip are not simply added up; instead, they will be treated as two independent events. The final critical strike chance would be about 34% (Morning Star) / 32.5% (Kaleidoscope). [1]

The Shinobi Infiltrator's Torso can be swapped out for the Valhalla Knight's Breastplate to greatly increase one's defensive capabilities in trade for a lower melee speed. Alternatively, the Monk's Shirt provides an extra 20% damage at the loss of 4 defense. However, the Shinobi Infiltrator's Torso does higher damage than the Monk's Shirt if using a weapon that benefits from melee speed, such as the Terra Blade. It is also worth noting that if one was to wear the full Shinobi Infiltrator armor, they can place the enhanced Lightning Aura sentries, and then swap to better armor pieces. It requires a little more micro-management but allows one to keep the radius increase, while still benefiting from better armor. It is also worth noting that if one was to wear the full Shinobi Infiltrator armor, they can place the enhanced Lightning Aura sentries, and then swap to better armor pieces. It requires a little more micro-management but allows one to keep the radius increase, while still benefiting from better armor.
This set also increases whip speed, making it still a considerable set for summoners (especially when combined with the Feral Claws or any of its upgrades).

A ninja (忍者) or shinobi (忍び) was a covert agent or mercenary in feudal Japan. The functions of the ninja included espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, and open combat in certain situations.

Green Slimes are more likely to spawn in place of other slimes when the player is within 200 blocks horizontally of the world's spawn point. This does not occur in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
During the Slime Rain event, Green Slimes can fall from the sky regardless of the biome or time of day.

Green Slimes are abnormally strong in an Expert Hardmode world despite otherwise being the weakest slime. They deal more damage and have more health than any other pre-Hardmode slime (excluding King Slime ) and even some Hardmode slimes.
The Bestiary entry for the Green Slime: " A simple, gelatinous creature that swallows anything and everything whole! It takes a long time to digest anything. "
Jungle Bats and Jungle Slimes are among the few Jungle enemies that do not require Jungle grass blocks to spawn. They only require the player to be within the Jungle biome. [1]

Groups of Jungle Bats can easily overwhelm an unprepared player, so caution should be exercised when entering the Jungle. The numerous pools of water in the Jungle serve as good hiding spots, as the bats cannot enter water. A Breathing Reed helps to prevent drowning.

Jungle Bats, as well as Cave Bats, Hellbats, and Spore Bats, have an unused frame in the animation that seems to depict a Jungle Bat hanging upside down. This may mean that bats were originally planned to be able to hang on ceilings but that this was later decided against.
The name Valor comes from one of the many different yoyos sold by One Drop YoYos. Their logo is the symbol listed at the bottom of the item's tooltip.
Unlike On Fire! or Hellfire, entering water or honey will not cancel the debuff.
Unicorns will only spawn on Hallowed grass, Pearlstone Blocks, Pearlsand Blocks, and Pink Ice Blocks. Unicorns will not spawn in the Underground Hallow.

Players who recently entered Hardmode should avoid using short-ranged melee attacks against Unicorns, as they deal a high amount of damage and are highly resistant to knockback, and should attempt to locate to a spot out of the Unicorns attack range. For these reasons, longer ranged melee weapons such as boomerangs, spears, or yoyos are recommended. For these reasons, longer ranged melee weapons such as boomerangs, spears, or yoyos are recommended.

If the player jumps straight up with the Slime Mount and lands on a Unicorn, it can be killed without moving, as well as any other Unicorns or Pixies that come along. This is not recommended at nighttime, as Gastropods can hit the player from afar.
Fighting them in water slows their movement enough for normal knockback from swords to be effective.
Digging a two tile-wide hole just big enough to stand in will allow the player to attack the Unicorn without being attacked, since the Unicorn is too big to fit through.
Ranged -oriented players may need to use hooks or wings to avoid damage from Unicorns.
The Dao of Pow is effective, as it often Confuses Unicorns into running away, which mitigates their frequent charges.
A chainsaw or very fast sword's knockback can also hold back the Unicorn's charges.
The Flamarang is very effective, as its strong knockback will keep the Unicorn from charging. In some cases, the Unicorn will not be able to move at all when under these attacks.
The Golden Shower can immobilize the Unicorn, provided it was properly reforged.
The Piranha Gun can prevent multiple Unicorns from moving, as it will stunlock them, and home in on any of them that are remaining.
The Megashark is very effective against Unicorns as the insanely fast speed of this gun will cause the Unicorn to stop moving and prevent it from charging.
The Clinger Staff is a excellent weapon to use as it has very high knockback ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and inflicts Cursed Inferno ).
Any weapon with a knockback value of 8 or higher can potentially knock Unicorns away from the player.
Unicorns can be spawned in pre-Hardmode using Unicorn Statues, but will not drop any items.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) A winged Unicorn can sometimes be seen flying in the Hallow background as ambience.

The Trash Can requires four times as much Iron / Lead as a regular Chest would. Therefore, unless the Trash Can is used for a different aesthetic effect, Chests, Barrels, or Dressers are more efficient storage units. This may be ironic in the early game, given how useful Iron or Lead can be in early stages. This may be ironic in the early game, given how useful Iron or Lead can be in early stages.
The Trash Can can be used to differentiate relatively "useless" stored items from those of value, hence the name.
If one is low on wood, for a chest, and there are no nearby trees, a Trash Can might be a preferable alternative for the time being.
Despite it being called "Trash Can", it does not actually delete items like the Trash Slot in your Inventory. As stated before, it works exactly like a chest.
The Metal Detector (or connected information accessories) read Trash Cans as a chest for the purposes of sensed objects.
The gouts of blood from the debuff will be replaced by clouds if the Blood and Gore option is turned off.
Because the "Blood Butchered" debuff cannot be inflicted on players, it uses the icon of Distorted as a placeholder.

If a chainsaw is used for a minute without stopping, it will stop working and need to be restarted by pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button again. This is because they are actually long-lasting channel projectiles when used, like the Magic Missile.
The Sawtooth Shark is the only chainsaw available before Hardmode and the only one obtained via fishing. On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Drax is also available pre-Hardmode.
Drax is the only chainsaw that also has pickaxe power. Prior to 1.2, it also had the abilities of a hammer, which again no chainsaw has.
Butcher's Chainsaw is the only chainsaw that drops from an enemy. It is also the chainsaw with the highest overall stats.
Activating the Station with a Player Above Sensor in multiplayer will shoot portals, but will instead shoot green portals that do not disappear when a player gets too far away.
Portal Gun Stations can be useful for adventure maps, as they can create portals for players.
It remains functional while the player is under the Creative Shock debuff, making it can be used in the Old One's Army event.
Painting a Portal Gun Station will not affect the colors of the portal it shoots.

The Portal Gun Station is a direct reference to the 2007 puzzle-platforming game Portal, and the way the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device is first obtained. The device is in a stand that periodically rotates and shoots a portal. Other items in Terraria also reference Portal, such as the Companion Cube.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Eye Patch has a small dark-colored inventory icon that is difficult to see within an inventory screen. One should be wary of not losing it by error: It is easy to select it unknowingly when placing something else in the seemingly empty slot, then dropping it.
Regardless of direction, the character always wears an eye-patch. This suggests they are wearing two eye-patches, over both eyes.
Its tooltip might be a reference to a scene in the animated film Despicable Me, where Agnes says the line after receiving a unicorn stuffed animal.
The Flinx Fur itself and the Flinx enemy are both white in color, but the Flinx Fur Coat and the Flinx Staff have a purple tint to their color.
Heart Shrines in worlds created during the event will also contain the Valentine items alongside their normal items.
Changing your 3DS date to February will also trigger the event. Same goes to all seasonal events.
Like most other projectiles, liquids slow their travel speed.
Due to their infinite ricochet ability, Light Discs ricocheting at acute angles in small enclosures can cause excessive ricochets and particles, which might cause lag.
Firing a Light Disc directly against a wall grants it the ability to penetrate a 1-block wide wall directly behind the player.
Light Discs can be very effective when fighting monsters in small areas or rooms.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Crafting and selling Light Discs can be a good source of coins. Two of the three materials needed for crafting drop from The Destroyer, with said materials worth 5 GC 60 SC if sold separately ( 4 GC for 5 Souls of Might + 1 GC 60 SC for 4 Hallowed Bars). Three Souls of Light add 6 SC to the total sell price ( 5 GC 66 SC ). The 10 GC sell price of the Light Discs nets about 77% more profit.
The Light Discs are quite effective against the Twins since they usually mirror the player's movement or chase them directly, setting up for easy hits.
Light Discs resemble identity discs from the 1982 American science fiction action-adventure movie Tron. Their tooltip, 'Greetings, programs!', is a quote from the movie.
The Light Disc's sprite is used as a loading icon of the map on the Old-gen console version and pre-1.3 Mobile version of Terraria.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Light Discs can be assigned modifiers through use of an inventory editor. The best modifier that will stick is Godly, like other boomerangs.
Prior to Mobile 1.2.6508 (the 1.2 equivalent), one could throw an infinite amount (though they will return to the player) of Light Discs regardless of the stack amount.

Cultists only spawn under the following circumstances: [2] The world is in Hardmode, and Skeletron and Golem have been defeated. No bosses are alive and no events are happening. No Mysterious Tablet is existent. The player is not within an rectangular area of 144-tile-wide×81-tile-high [3] around the Dungeon point (the spawn point of the Old Man, i.e. the left of the two blocks on which he stands during the night ). The tile exactly 7 tiles above the Dungeon point (which is approximately where the center of the Mysterious Tablet will be) is not a solid block, this includes platforms and shelves. The world is in Hardmode, and Skeletron and Golem have been defeated. No bosses are alive and no events are happening. No Mysterious Tablet is existent. The player is not within an rectangular area of 144-tile-wide×81-tile-high [3] around the Dungeon point (the spawn point of the Old Man, i.e. the left of the two blocks on which he stands during the night ). The tile exactly 7 tiles above the Dungeon point (which is approximately where the center of the Mysterious Tablet will be) is not a solid block, this includes platforms and shelves.

Passive Cultists can be activated inadvertently in the following ways: Although minions will not attempt to attack passive Cultists, minions that deal contact damage may incidentally damage Cultists. However, Sharknados might accidentally hit passive Cultists with a ranged attack if they are in line with another enemy, or damage them by contact. The lasers from minecarts with the Minecart Upgrade Kit will sometimes target passive Cultists. If the Mechanical Cart is used as a way to reach the Dungeon quickly, it should be considered placing the end of the track further away from the Dungeon's entrance. Although minions will not attempt to attack passive Cultists, minions that deal contact damage may incidentally damage Cultists. However, Sharknados might accidentally hit passive Cultists with a ranged attack if they are in line with another enemy, or damage them by contact. The lasers from minecarts with the Minecart Upgrade Kit will sometimes target passive Cultists. If the Mechanical Cart is used as a way to reach the Dungeon quickly, it should be considered placing the end of the track further away from the Dungeon's entrance.

Attacking any of the Cultists will cause the Devotees' animation to speed up and the music will change to the Boss 4 theme. This is a relatively easy way to get the Music Box for the boss music, since it does not actually require fighting a boss.
The Cultist Archers will not despawn, so they may follow the player large distances if there is a clear path.
As they do not move on their own and are insensitive to knockback, the only way to move a Devotee is by destroying the blocks under their feet, teleporting them or using a hoik.

If the Lunatic Devotees are killed and Cultist Archers are lured away and killed far away, the Lunatic Cultist will not spawn. The Cultists will not respawn, either. This can be fixed by reloading the world.
Minions cannot be manually targeted to attack the Cultists by the player.
The Cultists can not be harmed by lava or drowned in water.
If one of the Cultists is hit by a Fallen Star, they will still start to attack the player, as if they were attacked.

A White Cultist Archer character appears in the game files, but never actually spawns. The source code also contains statistics for the following characters, although no graphics are included for them, and they similarly never spawn: Blue Cultist Fighter, White Cultist Caster, and White Cultist Fighter. Banners (along with banner graphics) are included for these, but are currently unobtainable. Out of these, only the White Cultist Archer can be spawned, and only with hacks or mods. Aside from appearance, the White Cultist Archer is completely identical to the Blue Cultist Archer.

Despite the Archers using what appears to be a Wooden Bow with Wooden Arrows, which will deal 9 base damage when used by a player, their ranged attack will deal 80 damage in normal mode, 160 in Expert and 240 in Master.
If a Cultist is teleported away and killed far away from the Dungeon, the Lunatic Cultist's spawn animation will still play, but it will not spawn.

– According to the Terraria lore pages, the Lunatic Cultist and its cult worship Cthulhu and wish to recreate/restore their master, forcing the Mechanic to create the mechanical bosses to replace the organs Cthulhu had ripped from his body.
Like all creatures than can pass through blocks, the Giant Fungi Bulb is immune to lava.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The bulb will not fire if it does not have an unobstructed, direct line of sight to the player.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Destroying the block a Giant Fungi Bulb is attached to will kill it instantly without dropping any loot.
If the bulb is covered by solid blocks, it will not fire any spores. This is good to keep in mind when the enemy is trying to attack from far away.
Although being small, spores deal more damage than the bulb, so players should be wary of them.
The Bestiary entry for the Giant Fungi Bulb: " When the glowing fungus is ready to spread, these bulbs will sprout to spread its spores to other locations and hosts. "
An easy way for early Hardmode players to defeat Illuminant Slimes is to lure them into lava, e.g. by grappling to a block above a pool of lava.
The Bestiary entry for the Illuminant Slime: " Slimes exposed to the light of the Hallow's crystals begin to emit that very same light, glowing brightly in the darkness. "
The full set strongly resembles a Dark Lamia.

The female version of the set has the chest covered with wraps, while the Lamia enemy does not wear any wraps. This change was likely made as the Lamia enemy is covered by its hair, while the player can wear the chest piece without equipping the mask.
Like the tail of the Mermaid set, the Lamia Tail does not appear correctly on Mannequins and Womannequins.
Since a male character equipped with Lamia Wraps is bare-chested, the item is completely invisible on Mannequins (but can still be obtained after placing).
The Lamia Mask, the Hero's Hat and the Robot Hat are the only vanity items that appear to change the character's hairstyle.
Blood Crawlers spawn six times more often on tiles that are in front of background walls, [1] hence they are more likely to be encountered in the chasms of the Crimson than on the surface.
Like all spiders, Blood Crawlers cannot travel through a vertical 2-tile wide shaft.

Blood Crawlers differ significantly from real-life spiders: They are able to drop Vertebrae, despite real spiders being invertebrates. They seem to have two eyes, but real spiders have eight eyes. On the Official Terraria Forums artwork seen below, however, they appear to have two large eyes (seen on the in-game sprite) and six small ones, which complete the eight eyes. They are able to drop Vertebrae, despite real spiders being invertebrates. They seem to have two eyes, but real spiders have eight eyes. On the Official Terraria Forums artwork seen below, however, they appear to have two large eyes (seen on the in-game sprite) and six small ones, which complete the eight eyes. On the Official Terraria Forums artwork seen below, however, they appear to have two large eyes (seen on the in-game sprite) and six small ones, which complete the eight eyes.

Blood Crawlers resemble ticks, tiny parasitic arachnids who live off of the blood of other larger animals, including humans. Adult ticks have an elliptical lower body, called an idiosoma, which bloats in size when they feed on blood, similar to Blood Crawlers.
Like the Face Monster, it lacks a direct Corruption variant.

"Princess Dress" is one of only three names that are shared by two items in-game. See Princess set (Clothier) for the other Princess Dress, Seaweed and Seaweed (junk) for the 2nd pair of items, & the corrupt & crimson Deathweed Planter Boxes for the last pair of items.
The shape of the Palladium Sword looks similar to that of the Meowmere (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The name and tooltip of the Waffle's Iron are a reference to YouTuber WaffleTime. According to WaffleTime, Redigit approached him about adding his own item to the game. As thanks, he let Redigit and Cenx dictate a playthrough each. Redigit requested he play the Get fixed boi seed in Master Mode on Mediumcore. [1] The reason of the item being dropped by Mechdusa may be because WaffleTime had previously made tutorials on how to defeat the mechanical bosses which make up Mechdusa. According to WaffleTime, Redigit approached him about adding his own item to the game. As thanks, he let Redigit and Cenx dictate a playthrough each. Redigit requested he play the Get fixed boi seed in Master Mode on Mediumcore. [1] The reason of the item being dropped by Mechdusa may be because WaffleTime had previously made tutorials on how to defeat the mechanical bosses which make up Mechdusa.
Defeating Skeletron will also unlock the complete entry for the Dungeon Guardian.
Defeating the Lunatic Cultist will also unlock the complete entries for the Phantasm Dragon and Ancient Vision.

For detecting the player's proximity to critters : [6] An invisible rectangle is drawn around the player which extends 300 pixels from the right and left edges of their bounding box, and 200 pixels from the top and bottom of their bounding box, which translates to 18.75 tiles in either horizontal direction or 12.5 tiles in either vertical direction. If a critter enters this rectangle, it will count towards its bestiary entry. The player has a default width of 20 pixels and a height of 42 pixels (though these values can change under certain situations such as when riding mounts ). In total, the critter detection rectangle has a full default width of 620 pixels (38.75 tiles) and a full default height of 442 pixels (27.625 tiles). The Bestiary is linked to the world. If a fully unlocked character is brought to a new world, the Bestiary will be empty for them in that world. An exception is The Torch God, which will be unlocked immediately if the Torch God's Favor has been used by the character. An exception is The Torch God, which will be unlocked immediately if the Torch God's Favor has been used by the character.

The Bestiary uses a separate kill counter from the one used by the Tally Counter ; this is evident due to the fact that worlds created before 1.4 require killing each creature all over again in order to fill out the entries.

Three enemies are somewhat exclusive: Crawdad, Giant Shelly, and Salamander. In a given world, there can be only two of them, chosen randomly; the third will not appear. This is taken into account by the Bestiary progression logic, and the missing enemy will register as unlocked when the other two exclusive creatures are unlocked.
Old One's Army enemies always show sprites and stats of their Tier 3 variant.
Encountering any golden critter will automatically unlock every other golden critter's entries, meaning that it is only necessary to come into proximity with one type of golden critter.
Killing enemies spawned from statues does increase their respective progression levels, and is the same for encountering statue-spawned critters.

A Bestiary entry's portrait background can include a biome background, a semi-transparent color layer, and/or a map background overlay image. The biome backgrounds are the same as the fullscreen minimap biome backgrounds ; the overlay images are shown below.

Enemy-spawning statues can be used to fill out information on rarer enemies, such as Goblin Scouts, Medusas, and Mimics. If the Pigron Statue is obtained, then there is no need to create a Corrupt/Crimson/Hallowed Ice biome, since the statue can spawn all three Pigron variations, and it is the only unique enemy found in those respective sub-biomes. If the Pigron Statue is obtained, then there is no need to create a Corrupt/Crimson/Hallowed Ice biome, since the statue can spawn all three Pigron variations, and it is the only unique enemy found in those respective sub-biomes.
The entries for the Dungeon Guardian and Tortured Soul can be obtained by talking to the Clothier and Tax Collector, respectively.

In order to reach 100% Bestiary completion, a player-made Corruption or Crimson biome must be made, depending on which one the world already has. This includes a variant of the Surface, Underground, Desert, Underground Desert, and Ice biomes to collect all Crimson/Corruption variants of enemies and critters. The Dryad, when spoken to in a Graveyard during Hardmode, sells seeds of the opposite evil biome. Drunk worlds include both evil biomes. The Dryad, when spoken to in a Graveyard during Hardmode, sells seeds of the opposite evil biome. Drunk worlds include both evil biomes.

It seems fitting, that the Guide is at the very start of the Bestiary, and the Moon Lord is at the very end, as one's journey through the world of Terraria begins with the Guide and ends with the Moon Lord.
The Gnome is the first enemy listed in the Bestiary.

The maximum Bestiary completion percentage that can be obtained in a pre-Hardmode world (including bringing items over from a Hardmode world) is 65.37%, or 353 entries. This includes enemies summoned through Hardmode event and boss summoning items, statue spawns, and town NPCs who spawn in secret world seeds. Without bringing items over from a Hardmode world, the maximum completion percentage is 54.26%, or 293 entries. This includes enemies summoned through Hardmode event and boss summoning items, statue spawns, and town NPCs who spawn in secret world seeds. Without bringing items over from a Hardmode world, the maximum completion percentage is 54.26%, or 293 entries.
Icons exist inside Terraria's game files for an additional 5 filters, which go unused: Oasis Blizzard Slime Rain Hardmode "Item Spawn" Oasis Blizzard Slime Rain Hardmode "Item Spawn"
Unused descriptions for every biome and event filter, including the unused ones, can be found in the localization files.

The Apricot, Cherry, Grapefruit, Plum, Pomegranate, and Spicy Pepper are the only fruits that do not have unique recipes of their own. They can only be used to make Fruit Juice, Fruit Salad, and Ambrosia – recipes that allow any fruit to be used.
Like almost all other items that restore health, it has a 60-second Potion Sickness cooldown.
Like almost all other items that restore mana, it also inflicts the Mana Sickness (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) debuff.
This item cannot be used as a direct replacement for the Lesser Mana Potion as it can only be used every 60 seconds, unlike other Mana Potions.

Projectiles that are reflected upon touching the Shimmer will only be reflected when they reach the Shimmer pool's upper surface. Shooting them at the sides or the bottom of the Shimmer pool (by using Bubbles ) will instantly destroy the projectile.
Statue-spawned creatures will not be transformed in shimmer, despawning instead.
Enemies made invisible by the Shimmer can be seen with a Hunter Potion.
Despite both being designed for use with water, the Super Absorbant Sponge can also soak up Shimmer, as well the Liquid Sensor (Water) being able to detect Shimmer.

When decrafting items whose crafting recipe produces a stack (e.g. Crystal Bullets ), the same amount of said item need to be thrown into Shimmer for decrafting. Any excess items will remain untransmuted.

Fallen Stars produced from decrafting will not disappear at daytime. However, if they failed to be picked up by the player (e.g. if they are attracted towards the player, but are not picked up by the player eventually), they will still disappear.

While the Chromatic Cloak is equipped to prevent Shimmering, being submerged in Shimmer is comparable to being submerged in water : the player's horizontal and vertical movement speed are slowed by the same amount, the Shimmer can be swam in using accessories such as Flippers, and the player will transform into Merfolk if wearing the Neptune's Shell or its upgrades. However, the player cannot drown in the Shimmer; the breath meter does not appear.
In Expert Mode, touching Shimmer while in the Snow or Ice biome will inflict the player with the Chilled debuff.

The decrafting properties of Shimmer can be utilized in several ways: It is possible to farm good modifiers on crafted gear by repeatedly crafting and decrafting the gear. Extra or outclassed gear can be decrafted to get the materials back. Items found throughout the world can be looted, then decrafted. Some examples include Underground Cabin furniture and Magic Mirrors. In multiplayer, excess Recall Potions can be decrafted to potentially get Specular Fish. The Specular Fish can then be crafted into Wormhole Potions. Similarly, in singleplayer, any Wormhole Potions that may be obtained can be decrafted to potentially get Specular Fish. Items can be bought from NPCs, then decrafted to get resources. An Iron Anvil can be bought from the Merchant for 50 SC and then decrafted into five Iron Bars. A Furnace can be bought from the Merchant when spoken to in a Jungle for 3 SC and then decrafted into 20 Stone, four Wood, and three Torches. Ale can be bought from the Tavernkeep for 1 SC each, which can then be repeatedly decrafted into a Mug, then one Glass, and ultimately into two Sand Blocks.
