Since pumps can move Shimmer, it is possible to move Shimmer from the Aether biome as soon as Skeletron is defeated. However, since Teleporters are sold by the Mechanic, it may be more convenient to set up Teleporters at the Aether biome instead of relocating Shimmer. However, since Teleporters are sold by the Mechanic, it may be more convenient to set up Teleporters at the Aether biome instead of relocating Shimmer.

If a lot of certain ore is needed, a kind of higher tier ore can be transmuted down into what is needed. This can be helpful for getting Iron / Lead Ore which is used in a lot of recipes, or obtaining the materials for the Drill Containment Unit.

Shimmer makes it far easier to obtain some items with the most complex crafting recipes by swapping their components, which means that one only needs to obtain a sufficient number of any of them instead of one of each. Fish Finder Angler Tackle Bag Ankh Shield components: Reflective Shades Armor Bracing Medicated Bandage Countercurse Mantra The Plan Greedy Ring Fish Finder Angler Tackle Bag Ankh Shield components: Reflective Shades Armor Bracing Medicated Bandage Countercurse Mantra The Plan Reflective Shades Armor Bracing Medicated Bandage Countercurse Mantra The Plan Greedy Ring
Similarly, Shimmer makes it easier to complete a set of Mining armor, or to get a certain emblem dropped by the Wall of Flesh.

Shimmer may be a reference to several substances or locations in media that have similar properties: In the 2018 science fiction horror film Annihilation, an amorphous phenomenon called "the Shimmer" has the power to transform and mutate living things. In the 1991 action-adventure game The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, areas called Mysterious Ponds allow the player to throw in items and recieve a stronger item in return. In the science fiction television series Doctor Who, a cloaking device called a "shimmer" allows its owner to change their appearance as well as that of others. In the 2018 science fiction horror film Annihilation, an amorphous phenomenon called "the Shimmer" has the power to transform and mutate living things. In the 1991 action-adventure game The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, areas called Mysterious Ponds allow the player to throw in items and recieve a stronger item in return. In the science fiction television series Doctor Who, a cloaking device called a "shimmer" allows its owner to change their appearance as well as that of others.

It appears that Corrupt Grass Walls can adopt the small flowers featured on Flower Walls and Jungle Walls, given those types have been used to create the Corrupt Grass Wall. This feature will even persist if the wall is cleansed with Green Solution in the Clentaminator, or Purification Powder which will always yield a flowerless Grass Wall (even if the original wall was a Flower Wall or Jungle Wall), and re-corrupted again.

As the Clentaminator affects a rather large area, creating areas of localized Corrupt Grass Walls without converting blocks and other wall parts may be difficult, making throwing Unholy Water more viable.
Unlike the Water Gun, the Slime Gun can autofire. However, the Water Gun has a longer range than the Slime Gun.
Just like the Water Gun, the Slime Gun cannot be placed on a Weapon Rack but instead on an Item Frame.
As it is a debuff, the Slime debuff cannot be manually removed.
The Slime debuff is effective for locating worms while they are traveling through blocks.
It can also be used to locate invisible players using the Invisibility Potion or Psycho Knife, or invisible players wearing Shroomite or Vortex armor.
Gem trees do not require any level of light in order to grow.
Tree tiles cannot be actuated with an Actuator.
Lava will instantly destroy trees, except for Gem and Ash trees.
If planted on painted tiles, the tree's tiles will also be painted.

Even if Gem trees are planted on Ebonstone, Crimstone or Pearlstone, or if the Stone Blocks that they are planted are converted to Ebonstone, Crimstone or Pearlstone, they will retain their standard appearance and will not gain a Corrupt, Crimson or Hallowed shape. The same goes for vanity trees, as they keep their appearance even if the grass below it gets Corrupted/Crimson/Hallowed. However, vanity trees are destroyed after some time in the case of Corrupted or Crimson grass. The same goes for vanity trees, as they keep their appearance even if the grass below it gets Corrupted/Crimson/Hallowed. However, vanity trees are destroyed after some time in the case of Corrupted or Crimson grass.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, a cloud in the shape of a tree can occasionally be seen in the background.
The normal Forest tree is also a part of the Terraria logo.
The effects of Thrown Water can be reversed with Thrown Powder.

For creating large areas of Hallow, Corruption or Crimson, a Clentaminator (or its upgrade, the Terraformer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) may be a better choice. It fires a stream of solution with a range of about 60 tiles.
The Holy Water, including its sprite and the way it is thrown, is possibly a reference to the item of the same name in the action-adventure video game series Castlevania.
This item is a direct reference to the "Flickerwick" pet/NPC in Dungeon Defenders 2.

Out of all the spears, it is tied with the Obsidian Swordfish and Tonbogiri (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) for dealing the third most knockback (beaten by the Ghastly Glaive (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and North Pole ).
While stationary, it can hit a Zombie twice, and while walking towards it, three times – at 10–15 damage per stab, compared to just 4 damage with a Wooden Sword.
It can hold back multiple Eaters of Souls or Crimeras at once, and can be useful when traveling through the Corruption or the Crimson.

It is useful in early-game for the first enemies that are encountered like Demon Eyes, since it can hold them back with knockback. Opening a door or standing by an entrance while using it can hold back Zombies and Demon Eyes, and can be useful surviving the first few nights before getting better weapons.
It cannot be obtained from Wooden Crates, despite the fact that many other similarly rare items found in Wooden Chests can.

Creating an artificial Underground Desert requires Treacherous Hardened Sand Walls or Treacherous Sandstone Walls, which are obtained through Shimmer transmutation and place the unsafe version of their respective wall. The regular Hardened Sand Walls and Sandstone Walls are considered safe when placed and will prevent enemy spawns. Alternatively, the Clentaminator and Terraformer facilitate converting a variety of safe walls into unsafe Sandstone/Hardened Sand Walls. For instance, spraying Blue Solution onto safe Sandstone Walls will convert them into unsafe Pearlsandstone Walls. There are numerous other possibilities, like using Yellow Solution on safe Stone Walls or Green Solution on safe Hardened Ebonsand Walls. See Solutions § Conversions for the complete list. Alternatively, the Clentaminator and Terraformer facilitate converting a variety of safe walls into unsafe Sandstone/Hardened Sand Walls. For instance, spraying Blue Solution onto safe Sandstone Walls will convert them into unsafe Pearlsandstone Walls. There are numerous other possibilities, like using Yellow Solution on safe Stone Walls or Green Solution on safe Hardened Ebonsand Walls. See Solutions § Conversions for the complete list.
The border between the Underground Desert and the Cavern layer often features pools of lava much closer to the surface than where lava would normally generate.

The Underground Desert enemies are very dangerous early on, so it is advised to have ample Grenades on hand as well as some form of movement-enhancing accessory to make it less difficult to deal with them. Gold / Platinum armor is recommended due to the high damage dealt by the Antlion Swarmers and Chargers.

Minions give several advantages in the Underground Desert that most other weapons do not. The Underground Desert's main dangers are fast-moving, knockback -resistant enemies and Rolling Cacti. Minions counteract these by being summonable on the other side of walls, reacting to quick-moving enemies without requiring player interactions, contributing knockback independently of the player's actions, and triggering Rolling Cacti remotely (which may require summoning them directly on the cacti multiple times or waiting to summon them until an enemy passes by).

In the real world, larval antlions creates funnel-like pits in the ground and fling sand at prey that pass by. The funnel and burrow entrance types to the Underground Desert are presumably inspired by this.
Prior to 1.4.0.1, the Desert above the Underground Desert would always contain a large pit-style entrance. This made it easier to find and access the Underground Desert.

Chlorophyte Arrows are quite useful in conjunction with wildly inaccurate multi-shot bows, such as the Daedalus Stormbow, which allow them to deal much more single-target damage than usual and allow them to hit smaller targets much more accurately, due to their homing abilities.

They work best against grounded enemies (or crowds of them) and slow flying enemies. They are not particularly effective against fast flying enemies, because the homing-upon-ricochet can commonly miss.

The Illegal Gun Parts resemble a pistol grip and muzzle device; in regions where "assault weapons" are prohibited, the definition of "assault weapon" often includes a rifle fitted with a pistol grip and/or muzzle device.
As is stated on the Sandgun page, the Sandgun has a graphic that resembles the Illegal Gun Parts put together.
The Illegal Gun Parts are likely only sold at night because of the illegality referenced in their name, as well as their implied shadiness.

Plantera's Bulbs can spawn on any block of Jungle grass (including player-placed ones) below the surface ; it does not have to be in an Underground Jungle biome. However, they will never spawn within 302×302-tiles rectangles (centered on the Plantera's Bulbs) of each other, [1] i.e. they are spaced 150 tiles apart at maximum concentration.

Plantera's Bulbs will break if the block beneath them is turned into a sloped block using a hammer, is changed using the Block Swap, turns into a Chlorophyte Ore block, comes in contact with lava, becomes inactive by use of actuators, or is converted by biome spread or the Clentaminator. Plantera will only be spawned if there is any player within a rhombus whose diagonals are 50 tiles long, centered on the broken Plantera's Bulb. [2] If a Plantera's Bulb is broken while Plantera is still alive, a second Plantera will not spawn. Plantera will only be spawned if there is any player within a rhombus whose diagonals are 50 tiles long, centered on the broken Plantera's Bulb. [2] If a Plantera's Bulb is broken while Plantera is still alive, a second Plantera will not spawn.

Plantera's Bulbs are very easy to spot, as they emit a faint pink light. On the map screen, they appear as small pink squares. They will also be labeled as " Plantera's Bulb " if the cursor is hovered over them on the map screen.
Painting Plantera's Bulb will not change the color of the summoned Plantera.

If planning to farm Plantera, a viable method is by digging long tunnels of mud near an arena so any Plantera's Bulbs can be easily found and reached. This can be easily done with the Gravedigger's Shovel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). This can be easily done with the Gravedigger's Shovel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Plantera's Bulbs can be farmed with rows of Mud Blocks with Jungle grass on them.
Sleeping (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is a good way to get Plantera's Bulbs to spawn.
In Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the time speed can be set to 24× to increase the rate at which Plantera's Bulbs grow.
The Plantera's Bulbs are very similar in appearance to Plantera's first form.

The Plantera's Bulbs are similar to the Larva in that they are both ambient objects in the Underground Jungle which summon a boss when destroyed. Additionally, both vaguely take on the appearance of their respective bosses. Additionally, both vaguely take on the appearance of their respective bosses.
Plantera's Bulb can spawn on blocks that are at 0' depth, giving the appearance of spawning in the surface layer.
The Lihzahrd Altar can spawn on top of Wooden Spikes.
Wooden Spikes turn bright red when the Dangersense buff is active.
Wooden Spikes will deal damage to a player if any part of the player is in contact with them.
Just like Spikes, Wooden Spikes only damage players. They do not damage NPCs, critters, or enemies, and as such are unsuitable for base defense outside of PvP.

Wooden Spikes deal the same base amount of damage in all modes. Since defense is more efficient in Expert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the player will almost always receive less damage from Wooden Spikes than in Classic Mode.
Wooden Spikes are valid frame tiles for NPC housing.
Wooden Spikes cannot be destroyed by Explosives in For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds. [1]
Unlike Presents, which can be opened, the Party Present is purely decorative. It cannot be opened or used, despite its tooltip.
The colors of the Party Present correspond with the colors of the Party Hats Town NPCs wear during a Party.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, Penguins will still become Corrupt Penguins during a blood moon on a Crimson world.
Although they spawn during the Blood Moon event, they cannot drop Bloody Tears.
Unlike the other sprites for corrupted critters, the Corrupt Penguin is bloody instead of purple.
The third Hallow surface background features a large animated lake on its third layer, which cannot easily be seen in-game.

The backgrounds of the Underground Corruption, Crimson, or Hallow biomes revert to the default caverns background just before the underworld, and they do not appear until the underground layer is no longer visible on the screen.
The Bestiary page for the Town Cat depicts the Siamese cat breed by default.
Town Cats are the only type of town pet that can sit in chairs. [1]

As Terraria item names are now stored in separate language files, the "name" statistic for items are now merely internal placeholders. The three different Jellyfish share the same statistical listing, with their internal name being "Jellyfish(es)," humorously referencing the odd grammar rule that the word "fish" can already be used as its plural form, without having to add the "es" suffix.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Golden Crates are one of few methods of obtaining Greater Healing/Mana Potions during pre-Hardmode.
Golden Crates do not provide the lower-tiered metals: They do not offer Copper, Tin, Iron, nor Lead.
The Hardy Saddle can only be obtained by opening Golden and Titanium Crates.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Life Crystals can be obtained by opening Golden and Titanium Crates, making them renewable.
Golden Crates can be obtained in worlds with Platinum Ore.

(Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) Meteor Heads have a very small chance of dropping one Meteorite in pre-Hardmode, making Meteorite a renewable resource. However, after two or three landings players should be able to craft everything they can out of it. If one requires a large quantity of Meteorite, continually (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) fighting the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) breaking Shadow Orbs or Crimson Hearts, and then mining all the Meteorite after it lands, and repeating, one could theoretically generate an infinite amount of Meteorite as long as there are enough blocks for one to spawn on. However, since the number of Shadow Orbs and Crimson Hearts in a world is limited, Meteorite is not renewable on 3DS. If one requires a large quantity of Meteorite, continually (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) fighting the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) breaking Shadow Orbs or Crimson Hearts, and then mining all the Meteorite after it lands, and repeating, one could theoretically generate an infinite amount of Meteorite as long as there are enough blocks for one to spawn on. However, since the number of Shadow Orbs and Crimson Hearts in a world is limited, Meteorite is not renewable on 3DS.

One way of defeating Meteor Heads is to defend oneself by using a pickaxe. While mining, the player can hit the Meteor Heads as they are flying towards them, as long as they are approaching from one direction. Suggested items are a Cobalt Shield to negate knockback and an Obsidian Skull to prevent damage from the Meteorite itself. With the Tinkerer's Workshop, a player can combine the two into an Obsidian Shield, providing both benefits and using only one accessory slot. Alternatively, any sort of Grappling Hook can be used to hold the player in place.
Because Meteor Heads move at a slow speed, the player can alternate between mining the Meteorite and killing all Meteor Heads on the screen, giving them time for another round of mining.

Weapons that are capable of hitting through blocks are highly recommended for fighting Meteor Heads. The Vilethorn is an exceptionally effective choice, dealing damage multiple times per use, but spears like the Dark Lance work well, too. High-damage weapons like the Night's Edge and the Musket can destroy Meteor Heads in a single hit. Minions or the Crimson Rod can often deal with Meteor Heads on their own.
In multiplayer, the tasks of mining and fending off the Meteor Heads can be split between the players.

Because of the conditions of an area to be considered a Meteorite biome, a player can place (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 75 / (Old-gen console version) 50 / 23 or more Meteorite wherever they like to disable the normal spawns of that area and spawn Meteor Heads instead.
They are one of the only enemies, along with the small Bee and Servant of Cthulhu, to deal more base damage than their own maximum health.
The sprite of the Meteor Head resembles the old sprite of Meteorite.
The Snow Flinx will repeatedly hit a closed door in its path, but it is unable to open it.
Despite spawning in Ice biome, Snow Flinxes spawn significantly more often on blocks that are not Ice, Snow or Thin Ice blocks. [1]
The Snow Flinx bears a striking resemblance to the Topi, an enemy from the 1984 video game Ice Climber, specifically the American and European censored sprite of the Topi.

The Snow Flinx has the fourth least knockback resistance, the third being the Slimer without its wings, and the first being a tie between Pinky and the Golden Slime (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Because of this, weapons like the Slap Hand and Golem Fist can knock it back enormous distances. Because of this, weapons like the Slap Hand and Golem Fist can knock it back enormous distances.
In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Golden Shower can only deal 75% base damage to the Destroyer and its Probes. [2]

Probes are fairly small, fast, flying enemies who can deal consistent damage in a moderate amount of time. As such, most ranged weapons are superior to melee weapons in general. Any fast-firing weapon such as the Crystal Storm will prove effective as well.
It helps to use a Gravitation Potion or Rocket Boots or one of its upgrades. These allow easy movement to dodge the Probes as they come towards the player and to dodge the lasers.
Despite their appearances, the lasers that the Probes fire begin from slightly above their centerpoint.
Despite having the name referring to the Headless Horseman, The Horseman's Blade is not a drop from the Horseman, but the Pumpking.
Due to the Headless Horseman's size, he cannot fit through 4 tile gaps or lower and can be taken out easily with ranged attacks.

Due to the Headless Horseman's immunity to knockback, attacking him with close-range weapons is ill-advised since he can easily overwhelm the player. Hitting it with rapid-fire weapons or weapons that do continuous damage (e.g. Vampire Knives or Inferno Fork ) can still slow it down, however.

Similar to most of the Pumpkin Moon enemies, making an arena where the player has plenty of space to fly around in can make him easier to take down. It is also possible to place some Wood Platforms high above the ground to fire down on him without fear of him reaching the player, but a sufficiently long platform may allow more to spawn on it instead.
As the Headless Horseman uses the same AI as the Unicorn enemy, it can be useful to practice avoiding the attacks of multiple Unicorns beforehand.

The Headless Horseman originated from European folklore during the Middle Ages but gained popularity in America with The Legend of Sleepy Hollow, a short story written in 1820 by American author Washington Irving, in which the Headless Horseman was prominently featured.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The wavelike flight patterns of the Headless Horseman's pumpkin head projectiles greatly resemble the flight patterns of Medusa Heads from the 1986 video game Castlevania.
Vortex Fragment Blocks emit a faint glow when placed.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It may be a good idea to craft the Cactus armor instead, since it has similar stats and only requires entering the Desert ; characters that could make use of Shadewood armor are likely not ready to enter the Crimson.

Shadewood is initially obtainable in Crimson worlds only. An artificial Crimson biome can created using materials from another world or by buying Crimson Seeds from the Dryad while in a Hardmode Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Crystal Ball can be activated limitlessly with no cooldown period. It is never consumed, and all players may use it to give themselves the buff. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Activating the Crystal Ball while the Clairvoyance buff is already active resets the 10-minute buff duration. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Activating the Crystal Ball while the Clairvoyance buff is already active resets the 10-minute buff duration.
Although generally considered to be part of the Tuxedo set, the Top Hat suits well with this set, too.

Instead of the Terrarium ; Butterflies, Dragonflies, Fireflies, Lavaflies, Lightning Bugs and Faelings must be combined with a Bottle to create bottled variants. Bottled Water can be combined with Goldfish or Pupfish to make Fish Bowls, or with fished Jellyfish to make Jellyfish Jars. Light-providing insects in bottles can be used as valid light sources for housing.
Gold critters inside Terrariums sell for the same price as without one, so it may be desirable to sell the animal without a Terrarium.
Some critters that have a sell price have no value when placed in a Terrarium.
Gold Critters have a unique sprite with golden lids and bottoms. So do Gem Critters, with silver lids and bottoms.
On the map, when hovered over with the mouse, the Red Squirrel Cage erroneously  displays the text "Orange Squirrel Cage".

The Penguin's sprite in the Penguin Cage resembles the Penguin pet, rather than the Penguin used to craft it. This may be due to resolution constraints, which would make it difficult to draw a proper penguin inside the cage's borders.
The Truffle Worm Cage's tooltip is 'Won't be running away now...', alluding to the fact that the Truffle Worm can bury away from the player.
It increases melee damage only, despite being crafted from the Avenger Emblem, which increases all damage.
The Mechanical Glove increases speed for whips but not knockback and base damage. This is possibly because whips are used like melee weapons but deal summon damage.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Even though it is used in the Fire Gauntlet 's crafting recipe, the Mechanical Glove is still regarded as better than the Fire Gauntlet, as it has better stats and is only missing the ability to inflict On Fire!. However, that perk is not worth it compared to the lost stats, making the Mechanical Glove widely considered to be a stronger accessory. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Fire Gauntlet gives the same stat boost as the Mechanical Glove, and can be considered a direct upgrade. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Fire Gauntlet gives the same stat boost as the Mechanical Glove, and can be considered a direct upgrade.
Killing the White Cultist Archer will not spawn the Lunatic Cultist.
Despite the fact that the White Cultist Archer never spawns, it has its own banner.
Its attire is similar to that of the Solar Cultist Clothes sold by the Clothier.

Despite having the hurt sound of a Zombie or any type of Slime, it has the kill sound of a Ghost or Wraith. Another two enemies that follow this pattern, with a different hurt sound to the kill sound, are the Possessed Armor and Mimics. Another two enemies that follow this pattern, with a different hurt sound to the kill sound, are the Possessed Armor and Mimics.

The meteor ambient entity will only be displayed if the condition for the Meteorite biome to spawn was fulfilled between dusk (7:30 PM) and 11:40 PM, which includes the random chance each night. It will always start falling in the background at 11:40 PM. [1] Even if circumstances would prevent meteorite landings (i.e., no new meteorite biome would actually be generated), the meteor ambient entity will still appear when the conditions are fulfilled. Even if circumstances would prevent meteorite landings (i.e., no new meteorite biome would actually be generated), the meteor ambient entity will still appear when the conditions are fulfilled.
The bats more accurately represent the bats from the Bat Scepter rather than the bat enemy.
Necromancers can only teleport onto solid blocks. If there is no valid place to teleport to, they will remain in the same location.
They are only able to teleport while resting on a solid block.
A Necromancer's attack is always directly aimed at the player, regardless of obstacles.

Weapons that stick to enemies are exceptionally useful, as they remain on the Necromancer after the teleport. The Piranha Gun, Daybreak (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Bone Javelins (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are viable options.
Weapons that deal high damage in single hits are effective against Necromancers. Weapons that fire multiple projectiles simultaneously may be able to land multiple hits before they teleport as well.

Weapons with homing capacities or minions can continue to track Necromancers after they teleport. The Sanguine Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is particularly effective at this, often causing the Necromancer to rapidly teleport as it takes damage and quickly dies.
Despite inflicting the Slow debuff, they do not drop Fast Clocks.
Necromancers are magicians that engage in communication with the dead, although in Terraria they do not have this ability.
If obtained early in Hardmode, it can be fairly effective until better weapons are obtained. With its fast speed, average and fair knockback, it can deal with crowds of enemies.
The Frost Staff functions somewhat similarly to a gem staff.
It is shaped very similarly to the Imp Staff.
In the official changelog of 1.4.0.1, this weapon is incorrectly referred to as the "Staff of Frost".
Crimtane Bricks (unlike Crimstone ) will not spread Crimson.
Crimtane Bricks are an infinitely renewable resource, since they are created when the Wall of Flesh is killed.

There is a maximum limit of 8000 storage items (Excluding portable and showcase storage items) in each world. Attempts to place additional storage items will result in the item immediately dropping to the ground as an item rather than being placed.
Two of the four items for portable storage can be purchased from the Merchant, the Piggy Bank ( 1 GC ) and the Safe ( 20 GC ).

Grates can make gathering Hellstone without lava immunity a bit easier, as the lava produced from mined Hellstone will flow through the Grates but the ore will land on them where it can be safely collected.

The tooltip for the item, 'They'rrrre great!', is a reference to the catchphrase of Tony the Tiger, the advertising cartoon mascot for Kellogg's Frosted Flakes breakfast cereal. It is furthermore a play on grate and great being homonyms. It is furthermore a play on grate and great being homonyms.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The jump speed and safe falling distance bonuses stack with the Frog Leg's upgrades.
It is completely unrelated to the Frog critter or the Sauteed Frog Legs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), despite the similarities in name.
The Star Princess Set and its companion item, the Celestial Wand, are a reference to Rosalina and the Lumas from the 2007 platform action-adventure video game Super Mario Galaxy.
The Rod of Harmony is identical to its predecessor while in Godmode.

Since the Rod of Harmony does not apply Chaos State when used, it cannot be used for quick self-damage like the Rod of Discord. This means there are cases where it would be preferable not to upgrade if the player was using the self-damage aspect on purpose.
Prior to 1.2.1.2, the Rod of Discord did not inflict the Chaos State debuff, and thus functioned identically to the Rod of Harmony. The latter may be a nod to the former predecessor.

Fittingly, "harmony" is an antonym of "discord". Harmony has meanings of "peace" and "agreement", while discord has meanings of "conflict" and "disagreement", as well as "dissonance" with regards to music.
Lifeforce Potions can sometimes be found in Shadow Chests and Lihzahrd Chests, making it possible to obtain them in Pre-Hardmode.

If the player has used a total of 15 Life Crystals and 20 Life Fruits to upgrade their health capacity to the 500 point maximum, the Lifeforce Potion will temporarily boost the player's health capacity by +100, to a total of 600, the highest amount of health one can legitimately reach.

The Lifeforce Potion does not always increase the player's maximum health by exactly 20%. Instead, it grants +20 HP for every 100 HP of the player's maximum health. [1] For example, a player with 425 maximum health will be granted 505 maximum health rather than 510.

The Prismite can only be acquired by fishing in the Hallow. Though it can be caught at any depth, the player will have a greater chance to catch the Prismite if they fish on the surface, because only two special fish can be caught within the surface Hallow (the Prismite and the Princess Fish ).

Using the Lifeforce Potion can greatly increase a player's chances of winning any major boss battle, especially in Expert Mode and Master Mode, since the player needs all the buffs and health they can get.
Like all spiders, Black Recluses cannot travel through a vertical 2-tile wide shaft.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The cooldown between web spit attacks lasts 3 seconds. It is paused if the Black Recluse loses focus on the player or has no direct line of fire, and it is increased by between 0.33 and 1 second when the Black Recluse takes damage. [1]

In For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Black Recluse's web spit projectiles randomly place Cobwebs within a 13×13 rectangular area when the projectile disappears. [2]

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Black Recluses completely replace Wall Creepers in the Spider Nests once Hardmode starts. On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, Wall Creepers still have a small chance to spawn in Hardmode.
With their black color, Black Recluses may be difficult to perceive in the Spider Nest. It is advisable to place an ample number of light sources or drink a Hunter Potion.

Their high damage output combined with their property of being difficult to see and a chance to inflict the Acid Venom debuff for an additional 40 total damage makes them extremely deadly and can easily kill players in early Hardmode.

Because of their low health and high defense, using weapons that deal a lot of damage with a single strike is the best way of defeating them. High- knockback weapons can also hold them off for long enough to get them killed. A good weapon to use on a Black Recluse is a yoyo (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as it can deal damage to it from a safe distance. A good weapon to use on a Black Recluse is a yoyo (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as it can deal damage to it from a safe distance.

Once the player has better weapons, Black Recluses are an excellent money-farming target, offering over half a Gold Coin per kill. They drop 5 SC up front, the chance of a Poison Staff averages about 11 SC 50 CC per kill, and the fangs can be crafted into Queen Spider Staffs averaging 23 SC 96 CC per kill.

The name Black Recluse is a combination of the spider names black widow and brown recluse. Both spiders are commonly known for their venomous capabilities. This is reflected in the enemy's appearance, drops, and Acid Venom debuff infliction.

The cooldown of the web spit attack is programmed in a way that it could technically last up to 15 seconds: [1] Every tick [3], the game checks whether the last attack occurred longer than x ticks ago, x being a number between 180 and 899 randomly picked upon every check. If that is the case, the cooldown is reset and the Black Recluse fires again. Therefore, the cooldown will always last at least 181 ticks (which is equal to 3 seconds):
Despite being the counterpart to The Groom and equally relevant to marriage, she does not grant the "Til Death..." achievement when killed.

Following a Discord message where Redigit jokingly answered a Discord user's question of "who are the angler 's parents" with "they ded", a Reddit user declared "officially starting" a theory of the Groom and the Bride being the Angler's parents, to which Redigit, likewise jokingly, replied "This is now canon." [1]

In Greek mythology, Lamia was a queen of Libya who was turned into a child-devouring monster by Hera, the goddess of women and marriage. Lamias, portrayed as vicious snake women, have since become a staple of fantasy media.
The Lamia Banner appears to portray the darker version of the Lamia found in Corruption or Crimson Underground Deserts.
Defeating Skeletron will also fully unlock the Bestiary entry for the Dungeon Guardian.
The Old Man can be killed. However, this does not count as defeating Skeletron, and he will respawn.
The Old Man will respawn at the following dawn if the player fails to defeat Skeletron.
Killing Skeletron after the night ends will still count as defeating it, and will allow entering the Dungeon safely.
Skeletron's defense and damage will revert to their normal figures if the player dies during the day.

Defeating Skeletron is not necessary for game progression until Golem has been defeated. The Cultists, required for initiating the Lunar Events, will only spawn once both Golem and Skeletron have been defeated. However, skipping Skeletron in pre-Hardmode results in a lack of valuable Dungeon loot, keeps Shadow Chests from being opened (due to the inaccessible Shadow Key ), blocks access to the Mechanic, as well as renders the Safe and Void Vault (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) unobtainable.

Try to avoid staying above or far to one side of Skeletron for a long time. It will accelerate to move back above the player during this time, and it can be hard to avoid both the head and hands as they rebound into position.
The Slime Mount can help the player escape Skeletron's head spin attack.
Using a grappling hook can also help evade Skeletron's attacks and is an especially useful tool to escape its head spin attack.
With multiple players, it is a good idea to set the spawn point near the Dungeon, so that players can simply rejoin the fight if they die.
While Skeletron is immune to many debuffs on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it is not immune to Frostburn on any version.

Attacking the hands first is advised as destroying them both will make it very easy to dodge Skeletron for the rest of the battle. This is pretty much mandatory in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as Skeletron gains 25 defense for each hand it has alive. Moving quickly enough on a minecart can cause the hands to despawn. This is pretty much mandatory in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as Skeletron gains 25 defense for each hand it has alive. Moving quickly enough on a minecart can cause the hands to despawn.

In Expert Mode, if the player keeps moving in different directions, most of the homing skulls will miss. The player can also jump in a circle around Skeletron's head, aided by a Shield of Cthulhu or Featherfall Potion. Skulls are blocked by solid blocks, so a barrier between the player and Skeletron can let the player attack Skeletron using a yoyo with impunity. The player can also jump in a circle around Skeletron's head, aided by a Shield of Cthulhu or Featherfall Potion. Skulls are blocked by solid blocks, so a barrier between the player and Skeletron can let the player attack Skeletron using a yoyo with impunity.
Shimmering a Bezoar lets the player use a Bandage for the fight, blocking the Bleeding debuff for more value out of health regeneration buffs.

Assuming that the player is at 5′ 9″ (1.75 m) in terms of height, Skeletron's head would be about 12′ 2½″ (3.72 m) tall and 9′ 7″ (2.92 m) wide. The hands would be 6′ 2½″ (1.9 m) tall and 6′ 2½″ (1.9 m) across.

At one point during game development, Skeletron Heads protected the Dungeon, but when one was killed, it would count as killing Skeletron, so the Dungeon Guardians were introduced to protect the Dungeon instead.
Skeletron's pre-1.3.5 head looks identical to the Dungeon Guardian.
Counting the health from both its hands, Skeletron has even more health than the Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Wall of Flesh.

Skeletron is the only boss not to have any guaranteed drops (with the exception of healing potions, a Treasure Bag (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) if in Expert Mode and a relic (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) if in Master Mode ).
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Old Man has a health bar, but on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, he does not.
In the Terraria and Edge of Space crossover teaser, Skeletron turns into a boss called Omegatron.
The name Skeletron is similar to the name Skeletor, the main antagonist of the Masters of the Universe franchise.

Blood emits from the joints between Skeletron's arms and head, possibly implying that they are severed. This aligns with the lore pages. If the Blood and Gore setting in the menu is turned off, the blood emitted from Skeletron's joints is replaced by puffs of smoke. If the Blood and Gore setting in the menu is turned off, the blood emitted from Skeletron's joints is replaced by puffs of smoke.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, a cloud in the shape of Skeletron can occasionally be seen in the background.
In the first release of Terraria, prior to the introduction of the Wall of Flesh, Skeletron was the final boss of the game.
It is one of the two bosses that needs a town NPC to be alive in order to be summoned. The other is the Wall of Flesh.
The sprite file for Skeletron's arms is named Arm_Bone. Similarly, the sprite file for Skeletron Prime 's arms is named Arm_Bone_2.
In older versions of the game, all parts of Skeletron took increased damage from ranged weapons. Verify
– According to the Terraria lore pages, the Dryads ripped out part of Cthulhu 's skeleton, and a curse caused all the inhabitants of the Dungeon to become undead.
The Silenced debuff will still prevent the player from using the Space Gun with a full set of Meteor armor, despite it costing no mana.
The Silenced debuff only prevents item usage via ⚒ Use / Attack. Items used via other methods can still be used (e.g. the Forbidden armor 's set bonus).
It is recommended that mages should bring a Megaphone or make a Ankh Shield as this debuff is extremely deadly when there are many enemies on screen.
The effect of Silenced is related to how in popular fiction, casting magic sometimes requires saying certain words out loud. Therefore, being silenced would prevent casting any magic.
The lava immunity feature does not extend to blocks that inflict the Burning debuff, such as Hellstone, and the player will still take damage from them without an Obsidian Skull or its upgrades.
The Lava Shark Mount will not protect the player from the Chilled debuff. It will, however, ignore its effects, so long as the player stays mounted.
While riding the mount, all fall damage is reduced to 1.
The mount emits a faint light.

The Lava Shark Mount is very useful for mining Hellstone as it grants unlimited immunity to lava. If the player has large supplies of Obsidian, selling the Hellstone in form of Hellstone Bars is a good way to make money, even in Hardmode.
When paired with either the Bottomless Lava Bucket or the Bottomless Water Bucket, this mount can grant infinite flight. This may take some time to get the hang of, and the results can be messy.
The Lava Shark Mount could be used during the fight against the Wall of Flesh, without the need of a bridge or Lava Waders or their upgrades, although this might require some practice beforehand.
When not in liquid, the Lava Shark has saddened eyes.
The item's tooltip, 'Bloody hell!', is an informal interjection commonly used in British English as an expression of dismay, disgust, anger, or surprise.
The mount moves at the same speed in all liquids.
It can be seen as an upgrade to the Turtle Mount, as they are both mounts with increased speed in liquids that are obtained by fishing.
Using a flying mount allows the player to easily outmaneuver the Bouncy Gel launched by the Bouncy Slime.
The Bouncy Slime, Spiked Slime, Baby Slime, Slimeling, Crystal Slime, Heavenly Slime, and Golden Slime are the only slimes without their own banner.
Despite being pink, and the fact that Pink Gel is used to make bouncy items, the Bouncy Slime cannot drop Pink Gel.
When any Gem Robe is equipped in an armor slot without a Wizard Hat, Tim 's spawn rate will be increased to 5 times.
This item is the armor analog to the Topaz Staff.
The tooltip Falling sand you can safely watch is a joke about how falling sand is a hazard throughout the entire game.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Ginger Beard does not display if anything other than a Familiar Wig is worn in the head slot.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Ginger Beard cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
This item is part of a set of crossover content with Pixel Piracy, another game published by Re-Logic. It is accompanied by the Pirate Staff, Falcon Blade, and the painting Pillagin Me Pixels.
Contrary to one of his quotes [1], the Skeleton Merchant does not sell Maggots.
Despite inflicting Darkness, neither Black Slimes nor Demons can drop a Blindfold.
It will not protect the player from Blackout or Obstructed (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), nor will it cancel out the positive effects of the Shine or Night Owl buffs.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Blindfold is the only accessory used in the Ankh Charm crafting recipe that is not itself involved in or crafted by any other recipe.
The Blindfold is the only Ankh Charm material that is visible when equipped.

A real-life blindfold usually disables the wearer's sight instead of preventing sight-deteriorating effects. However, it is known for fictional characters to wear blindfolds to reduce their dependency on vision, and thereby heighten their other senses. In Terraria, the character may be using the blindfold to "see without using one's eyes," which would negate any visual impairment. However, it is known for fictional characters to wear blindfolds to reduce their dependency on vision, and thereby heighten their other senses. In Terraria, the character may be using the blindfold to "see without using one's eyes," which would negate any visual impairment.
The yellow raincoat makes them easier to see than most zombies.
The Bestiary entry for the Raincoat Zombie: " Some zombies never leave home without their trusty raincoat. Comfy and dry, they pursue human flesh no matter the weather. "
Javelins are useful during events such as Slime Rain and Blood Moon, where their piercing properties, decent damage, and fast throw speed allow them to efficiently destroy crowds.
Javelins can be quickly farmed in massive quantities from a Hoplite Statue.
Javelins move at a speed of 59 mph.
It must be equipped to work in the Old-gen console version. It will not display the time if it is in the inventory.
Despite its name, Ancient Cobalt armor is not functionally related to the current Cobalt armor set, nor with Cobalt Ore.
Unlike other critters, the Guide to Critter Companionship (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) does not render it immune to damage inflicted by the player.

In the For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) secret seed, any Bunny (but not the Gold or Gem variants) spawned naturally, released by the player, or spawned by the Bunny Statue has a 2/3 (66.67%) chance of being replaced by an Explosive Bunny. [1] However, Explosive Bunnies spawned via the Bunny Statue do not inflict damage when killed.
The Explosive Bunny's explosion can damage NPCs.

When fired from the Bunny Cannon, the Explosive Bunny has the highest base damage of any weapon on the Desktop version, Console version, Old-gen console version, and Mobile version. It is beaten only by the 3DS -exclusive Holy Hand Grenade, which deals 600 damage.

The Huntress armor is fairly strong when it is obtained, with stats similar to the ranged versions of Titanium armor or Adamantite armor. Its enhanced summon damage and extra sentry slots give it an extra source of damage. However, the Explosive Trap sentry summons have a limited range, making them less effective against highly mobile bosses. They are, however, quite good against the The Destroyer and Golem, the least mobile of Hardmode bosses. However, the Explosive Trap sentry summons have a limited range, making them less effective against highly mobile bosses. They are, however, quite good against the The Destroyer and Golem, the least mobile of Hardmode bosses.
The Bestiary entry for the Undead Viking: " Long before there were pirates, stories tell of powerful vikings who raged the seas. Their remains roam the icy caverns below. "

The best way to monetize granite is to craft Granite Candelabras: 5 + 3 ( @ ). Candelabras sell for 3 SC, for a profit of 1 SC 50 CC if torches are purchased, or 2 SC 70 CC if crafted (this takes into account the value of the torches if sold directly).
The Granite furniture is themed after a retro-futuristic look, as opposed to Marble's Ancient Greek-style theme.
The gem Topaz in real life can be found in many different colors, such as green, blue, pink and white, rather than just yellow.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Lihzahrd Brick Walls can only be broken after Golem is defeated.
Before Plantera is beaten, naturally generated instances of these walls will stop Teleporters or the Rod of Discord from teleporting.

Standing directly in front of a natural Lihzahrd Brick Wall activates the Jungle Temple biome, changing the game music to "Lihzahrd" and allowing Lihzahrds and Flying Snakes to spawn on any exposed Lihzahrd Brick blocks in the zone just off-screen. Since Lihzahrds are still able to spawn before Hardmode, it can be very dangerous to linger in the temple entrance.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, Lihzahrd Bricks can be obtained prior to defeating Golem by "uncrafting" Lihzahrd Brick Walls.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Forbidden Lihzahrd Brick Wall allows creating an artificial Jungle Temple biome, as it places unsafe Lihzahrd Brick Walls.

Randomly, the Shadowflame tentacle will appear to bounce off a solid surface. This appears to happen most often when the tentacle was already going to be bending in a direction away from or parallel to the surface to start with. (The tentacles can technically bounce, but only when traveling mostly parallel to the surface [1] )
Like many projectiles, the tentacles are slowed by liquids. They will not travel as far if used in a liquid.
Because of the random deviation of the tentacles as they travel further away, the Shadowflame Hex Doll is less effective at its maximum range against smaller targets.
The Shadowflame Hex Doll can prove to be very useful if acquired in early Hardmode, especially in tight caverns.
The tentacles' piercing and area-of-effect damage is effective against worms, e.g. The Destroyer, and crowds of enemies, e.g. Plantera's Tentacles.
The local invincibility frames make this weapon perform extremely well in close range, dealing more damage per second than most weapons at this stage of the game.
Despite the tooltip implying that the accessory boosts knockback of minions only, it also affects sentries and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

The Hercules beetle is a real-life insect native to rainforests in Mexico, Central America, South America, and the Lesser Antilles. It is the largest species of rhinoceros beetle and one of the overall largest beetles in the world.
As the item grants 15% increased summon damage and increased summon knockback, it can be considered an upgrade to the Summoner Emblem.

The target location must be at least 3 tiles high and 2 tiles wide. Pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button will always place the player's feet at the cursor position. Thus, in order to teleport into a 3-tile-high opening, the player must aim at the floor. Unsuccessful teleports play the same sound, but do not inflict the debuff. While riding a mount, the target location must usually be higher, depending on the mount's height. For instance, while riding the Unicorn Mount, the location must be 5 tiles high. While riding a mount, the target location must usually be higher, depending on the mount's height. For instance, while riding the Unicorn Mount, the location must be 5 tiles high.

The Rod of Discord will not teleport the player before Plantera is defeated if the background wall at cursor location is an unsafe Lihzahrd Brick Wall, and the cursor location is lower than surface. In Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, this effect is always applied, regardless of depth. [1] This effectively prevents the player from entering the Jungle Temple pre-Plantera.
While teleporting cancels fall damage, it does not reset the wing flight timer.
Despite causing no damage to enemies, the Rod of Discord can be placed on a Weapon Rack.
Using the Rod of Discord when moving maintains the player's movement speed.
Using it does not cancel the Shroomite armor 's stealth.

If the player simply taps the ⚒ Use / Attack button with the Rod of Discord on the Mobile version, they will be teleported slightly right of the spot where they were standing (and above if blocks are in the way or furniture is to the right). Using the thumbpad can see mixed results if the aim mode is set to "Aim & Use" rather than "Aim Only".

The damage incurred by Chaos State cannot be dodged with a Black Belt / Master Ninja Gear, Holy Protection, or Brain of Confusion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It bypasses and does not trigger invincibility frames. It is always negated in Godmode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), like all other damage. It bypasses and does not trigger invincibility frames. It is always negated in Godmode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), like all other damage.

In Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the drop rate of the Rod of Discord is increased to 1/100 (1%) regardless of difficulty.

If the Rod of Discord is used correctly, it has the potential to become one of the best items for maneuvering the map. For instance, it is very useful for capturing Truffle Worms because they can be caught almost immediately upon materializing. It is also useful for maintaining high movement speed, e.g. on fast mounts, by surpassing obstacles that would otherwise require slowing down.

The Rod of Discord is valuable for dodging high-damage attacks or ones that would be difficult to avoid, such as the Moon Lord's (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Phantasmal Deathray, contact damage from the Dungeon Guardian, or the Empress of Light's (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Ethereal Lance, Everlasting Rainbow, and Prismatic Bolts during her daytime "enraged" state.
While it is one of the rarest items in the game, it can be obtained immediately after the start of Hardmode without requiring defeating any additional bosses.

Since this item is one of the few ways to deal self-damage on command, it can be used with the Shrimpy Truffle or the Panic Necklace to activate the speed boost. Furthermore, it allows easily getting the Frequent Flyer achievement.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Using other items to increase the player's view, then quickly switching to the Rod of Discord and using it, allows teleporting larger distances. This can be done by using items like the Binoculars, Rifle Scope, or any of its upgrades.

Dying from teleporting during the Chaos State will display unique death messages : " <Player name> didn't materialize " " <Player name>'s legs appeared where their head should be. " On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, this is the only death message that changes based on the character's gender. The game uses the pronouns "his" and "her". On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there are still separate death messages but they are exactly the same. " <Player name> didn't materialize " " <Player name>'s legs appeared where their head should be. " On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, this is the only death message that changes based on the character's gender. The game uses the pronouns "his" and "her". On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there are still separate death messages but they are exactly the same. On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, this is the only death message that changes based on the character's gender. The game uses the pronouns "his" and "her". On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, there are still separate death messages but they are exactly the same.

The Chaos State debuff was introduced to combat the problem of being able to use the Rod of Discord repeatedly, which would grant the user an arguably overpowered method of transportation or evasion. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, however, this can be remedied post- Moon Lord by using the Rod of Harmony. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, however, this can be remedied post- Moon Lord by using the Rod of Harmony.
The abbreviation of the Rod of Discord, RoD, is the same as the first word, rod.
This is one of the only ways in the game the player can have negative health. Verify
In earlier mobile versions, using the Rod of Discord would instantly kill its user, and the death message would read "Structures".
Despite the tooltip implying that the accessory boosts knockback of minions only, it also affects sentries and whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Papyrus Scarab stacks with both its ingredients.

If the player has the accessory slots to spare, it may be more effective (compared to other common options) to equip both the Papyrus Scarab and its predecessor, the Necromantic Scroll. The summoner damage lost by choosing the Necromantic Scroll over other damage accessories is easily made back up by the extra minion slot.
The Papyrus Scarab's name is based on two things commonly referred to in Ancient Egyptian lore: the scarab beetle, and the papyrus being the leaf that Egyptian scribes used to write upon.

Due to the Papyrus Scarab only giving 15% extra summon damage, it is technically more effective to equip the Hercules Beetle and Necromantic Scroll separately without accounting for accessory slot cost.
The Bestiary entry for the Antlion Larva: " Freshly hatched from their eggs, larval antlions should not be underestimated. Though young, they are still very aggressive. "
The dodging chance does not stack with that of the Master Ninja Gear.
Any dye applied to the accessory will also affect most of the smoke particles from a dodge.
The black belt is used to denote a martial arts trainee with the highest obtainable rank attained during training.
Boot Statues are purely decorative items that can be found depicting Hermes Boots.
Boreal Wood armor, Palm Wood armor, and Rich Mahogany armor all have the same stats.
The Boreal Wood Helmet has horns similar to the Viking Helmet.
The Bestiary entry for the Ice Slime: " Slimes that spent too long in arctic temperatures may begin to partially freeze, developing a shifting layer of ice on their surface. "
"Gato" means "cat" in Spanish and Portuguese.
This item is a direct reference to the "Propeller Cat" pet/NPC in Dungeon Defenders 2.
Standing on Aetherium Bricks causes an occasional particle of iridescent star dust to appear. Walking or running on them causes a trail of particles to follow behind the player.
Pinky has a 1/180 (0.56%) chance of spawning in place of any slime of the following types: [1]
The best time to attempt to find Pinky is during the Slime Rain (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) event, as the spawn rate for slimes is greatly increased.
The large amount of coins it drops makes it a very valuable enemy in the early game, especially for fulfilling the move-in conditions for the Merchant.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Pink Gel that Pinky drops can be used to craft Pink Torches, which can be crafted into a Peace Candle. This item might prove useful early-game, as it decreases enemy spawn rates.
Since Pinky is the smallest slime, using a Hunter Potion can be very useful in dark areas like the Underground for finding or detecting it.

Pinky's knockback resistance is tied with the Golden Slime's (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for the lowest in the game, beating even the Slimer without wings at double the vulnerability. Pinky and the Golden Slime are the only enemies in the game to have negative knockback resistance in Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Pinky and the Golden Slime are the only enemies in the game to have negative knockback resistance in Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Unlike regular Bombs, Bomb Fish do not slow down in water.
As an explosive, obtaining a Bomb Fish fulfills one of the Demolitionist 's spawning criteria.

The game uses player's Fishing Power to determine the minimum and maximum amount of Bomb Fish fished in a single pull. Then, the maximum amount has four independent chances to be increased by 1, also based on Fishing Power. [1] The minimum amount and maximum amount is determined by following formulas. Decimals are always rounded down after each division. Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 20 + 3 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 10 + 6 ) ÷2 Then, roll four integers from these intervals: [0, 49], [0, 99], [0, 149], [0, 199]. The maximum amount is increased by 1 for each integer that is less than player's Fishing Power (e.g. if the four integers are 49, 56, 90, 36 while Fishing Power is 90, the maximum amount will be increased by 3). Finally, roll a random integer from this interval: [Min, Max]. This integer would be the amount of Bomb Fish fished up. The minimum amount and maximum amount is determined by following formulas. Decimals are always rounded down after each division. Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 20 + 3 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 10 + 6 ) ÷2 Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 20 + 3 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 10 + 6 ) ÷2 Then, roll four integers from these intervals: [0, 49], [0, 99], [0, 149], [0, 199]. The maximum amount is increased by 1 for each integer that is less than player's Fishing Power (e.g. if the four integers are 49, 56, 90, 36 while Fishing Power is 90, the maximum amount will be increased by 3). Finally, roll a random integer from this interval: [Min, Max]. This integer would be the amount of Bomb Fish fished up.
Similar to Sticky Bombs, Bomb Fish are useful when a safe and precise detonation is required, such as when destroying Shadow Orbs or Crimson Hearts.
While Bomb Fish sell for 2 SC, Sticky Bombs only sell for 1 SC (50% less). Therefore, it may be preferable to sell Bomb Fish and craft and use Sticky Bombs instead.
Although the rest of its characteristics are identical to the Sticky Bomb, the Bomb Fish does not generate a faint glow when thrown, due to not having a fuse.
The Bomb Fish is one of three fished consumables, the other two being the Honeyfin and the Frost Daggerfish.
The Bomb Fish may be a reference to the Water Bombs and Bombfish from the 2006 action-adventure game Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess.
Chests locked by the Chest Lock are eligible for obtaining achievements such as Dungeon Heist and Big Booty when unlocked again.
Biome Chests can only be locked post- Plantera, if they are somehow unlocked before that (e.g. throwing Biome Keys in shimmer, bringing them from another world or using inventory editors ).
The player should avoid placing important items inside unlocked Biome Chests, especially in multiplayer, to avoid the Chest being locked by themselves or other players.

It is recommended to make this enemy a priority when dealing with an invasion. The Goblin Archer can attack from range and its attacks cannot be shot or struck down, making it a nuisance to players with low defense.

Unlike the Goblin Sorcerer, however, its arrows will not pass through blocks, allowing players to simply take cover when it shoots. It is also very useful to dig a three-block tall tunnel and stay cornered at the end so that its arrows cannot hit the player.
Its arrows are unaffected by banners, making them one of the more dangerous enemies that spawn in a Goblin Invasion.

Goblin Archers seem to shoot arrows on a timer. This is especially apparent when playing with multiple players, as more will spawn, and sometimes a huge flood of arrows will fly from the horde of Archers. Grenades are recommended for this situation.
The Confused debuff causes Goblin Archers to become very unstable, sometimes running faster than the Goblin Thief, and flipping between left and right in place.
Even with Blood and Gore turned off, its bow will still drop when it dies, just like a body part.
Goblin Archer and the Goblin Scout are the only goblin enemies with blue skin, with the former being the only event one to be blue.
Its tooltip refers to a joke of stand-up comedian Dave Chappelle, in which he lists the ingredients of grape juice as "sugar, water, and of course, purple".
The Companion Cube (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), an expensive pet sometimes sold by the Traveling Merchant, occasionally emits the same noise as the Whoopie Cushion.

Sticky Bombs can be very useful for clearing an area, as they are more precise than their non-sticky counterpart and much safer. However, they have a shorter overall reach. Thus, they are particularly useful when trying to destroy Crimson Hearts or Shadow Orbs as the player will not need to create barriers to keep them from rolling away. Thus, they are particularly useful when trying to destroy Crimson Hearts or Shadow Orbs as the player will not need to create barriers to keep them from rolling away.
While the Sticky Bomb sells for 1 SC, its ingredients only sell for 61 CC, hence it is more profitable to craft Bombs into Sticky Bombs and sell them than selling the ingredients.

The only way to get the Obsidifish and Flarefin Koi is by fishing in lava. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, any fishing pole can fish in lava using Lava Critters caught in the underworld or by having a Lavaproof Fishing Hook equipped. The Hotline Fishing Hook can still be used to fish in lava with any bait on all versions, however.
The Chum Caster will increase the chance of hooking an enemy during a Blood Moon from a 1/6 (16.67%) chance to 1/3 (33.33%) chance.
The color of the line can be changed by equipping a string in vanity slots.
The appearance of a fishing pole's bobber can be changed by equipping a Fishing Bobber accessory.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Since the Golden Fishing Rod cannot be used to fish in lava, the best possible fishing setup in lava is slightly less efficient than the best fishing setup in water/honey.

The pet is the male counterpart of the Slime Princess, spawned with the Regal Delicacy. The buff tooltip, "He answers to a higher authority", is connected to the Slime Princess buff's tooltip, "She is the higher authority". The buff tooltip, "He answers to a higher authority", is connected to the Slime Princess buff's tooltip, "She is the higher authority".

When the player is far enough away from Slime Prince, or is away far enough away from the ground, the Slime Prince will drop his crown, morph into a ball, and fly towards the player with his flying magic ability. While flying, slime will continue to drip down the pet. King Slime also leaves his crown behind when teleporting. King Slime also leaves his crown behind when teleporting.

Following community suggestions, developers toyed with the idea that the Royal Delight and Regal Delicacy could be crafted together into one pet-summoning item. However, this was not implemented until 1.4.4. [1]

Gnomes spawn in front of unsafe Dirt Walls, unsafe Grass Walls, and unsafe Underground Dirt Walls around the surface line (0 feet) and in front of naturally generated Living Wood Walls at any height. If the player is in front of a natural Living Wood Wall, Gnomes also rarely spawn in front of any wall or, at night, anywhere. Spawn rates are significantly higher when spawning in front of natural Living Wood Walls. [1]

Spawn chances are reduced by 25% for each Gnome currently alive in the world, with spawns becoming impossible with four Gnomes alive. This reduction does not apply to spawns in front of Living Wood Walls. [1]

Gnomes emit white, glittering particles when the conditions are met for them to transform into a Garden Gnome, but only when there is an unobstructed block for them to do so. Gnomes will break grass and ambient objects upon transforming into Garden Gnomes, but are unable to break placed furniture items.
Gnomes will not spawn during a Blood Moon or a Solar Eclipse except in front of Living Wood Walls. [1] However, they will still turn into Garden Gnomes as normal during a Solar Eclipse.
Gnomes turning into Garden Gnomes counts as the player killing them and will grant banners and the Bestiary entry.
In Expert Mode, any coins that Gnomes pick up will be permanently lost when they transform into Garden Gnomes.

Multiple Gnomes are prone to merging into a single apparent figure, e.g. if they happen to gather against a wall. Once they are standing in the same place, the Gnomes will move together without separating, but as soon as they get into sunlight they will transform separately, usually producing multiple Garden Gnomes placed in a row.
In Don't dig up and Get fixed boi worlds, the Gnome will transform if it is brought into the Underworld layer during the day.
Since Gnomes drop neither coins nor other items, killing them usually has no benefits. Instead, luring them to the surface during the day to turn them into Garden Gnomes is much more useful.

Gnomes can be commonly found within the root networks of Living Trees. It can be difficult to lure them out from these networks though, especially during the early game as their strong knockback can prevent the player from climbing out of the Living Tree's roots to escape into the sunlight. A Cobalt Shield or upgrade will help with that. Rows of platforms (Gnomes can jump 6 tiles high) or staircases also facilitate a quick escape.

When farming for Gnomes, Battle Potions and Water Candles can be used to maximize the spawn rate, as with all rarer creatures. A Lifeform Analyzer (or one of its upgrades) paired with a Hunter Potion or the Binoculars helps locating Gnomes. Lava or traps can be used to kill other creatures in nearby areas to reduce spawn competition. Of course, the traps need to be well away from where they might kill the Gnomes. Any nearby Sunflowers should be removed, as these reduce enemy spawns. Increasing the player's luck, e.g. via Ladybugs or already obtained Garden Gnomes, will increase the Gnomes' spawn rates. Since Gnomes mainly spawn in front of naturally generated walls, Living Wood Walls in particular, the player can expand their spawn area by removing blocks from Living Trees. Minions should be dismissed, as these can quickly kill any Gnome within range. Thorns -like effects and items that activate when taking damage (e.g. the Honey Comb ), can also inadvertently kill a Gnome. Gnomes do not move (or run away) if the player is too far away, so it is crucial to stay close enough to bait them into sunlight. A Lifeform Analyzer (or one of its upgrades) paired with a Hunter Potion or the Binoculars helps locating Gnomes.
