Gnomes do not move (or run away) if the player is too far away, so it is crucial to stay close enough to bait them into sunlight.
The Bestiary entry for the Gnome: " A tiny long-bearded sneak who resides in oversized trees. Becomes a lawn ornament when exposed to sunlight. "
The flame effect also appears when riding a Minecart across a Minecart Track laid right on top of a flat surface.
Like Meteor armor, Molten armor or Rocket Boots, dyes will also change the flame effect's color.

If the player is walking on water (e.g. using the Water Walking Potion, the Water Walking Boots, or any of its upgrades) with the Flame Waker Boots equipped, the flame effect will not appear unless the water is 1 tile or less tall.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Flame Waker Boots cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
The phrase to get cold feet is an idiom for when someone is just about to do something and suddenly gets too afraid to do it.

A waker is one who wakens or rouses someone or something; this refers to this item's ability to rouse up flames behind the player, akin to a ship's wake. The word waker also appears visually similar to walker, which was possibly intended as a pun.
This item is the only vanity accessory that is also a crafting material.
The item looks similar in appearance to the Sailfish Boots.
The Slime Mount does not benefit from the critical strike chance bonus of banners.
The Slime Mount's damage is not variable (i.e., unaffected by the usual ±15% randomization), hence it is very useful for enemy defense tests in-game.
Items that allow double jumps work while riding the Slime Mount.

Damaging an enemy with the Slime Mount will reset the player's invincibility to 6 ticks [1] (1/10 second), meaning that they cannot take damage immediately after jumping on an enemy. However,  note that the damaged enemy will get 10 ticks of invincibility. [2]
Players move at double the normal vertical speed while riding the Slime Mount. Note that the Stopwatch (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and its upgrades will still show the regular speed.
The Lucky Horseshoe, its upgrades, and wings will prevent fall damage while riding the mount.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Since the Slime Mount bounces off of Target Dummies, it is possible to create an elevator with them and the mount.

A player can easily move from the bottom of a large body of water to the surface by mounting the Slimy Saddle, as the Slime Mount will float to the top. The Slime Mount may also float on lava, but the player will need an Obsidian Skin Potion or Lava Charm to avoid lava damage.
The doubled vertical speed can be extremely useful, e.g. for traveling down hellevators with great speed, or by using it to dodge attacks.

By grappling to a wall and activating the mount mid-way, the bright particle effects will go about 16 blocks through, thus revealing caverns and valuables. Combined with the zoomed-in overlay map, this is a good way to explore the underground early on. Note that to activate the mount while grappling, there needs to be enough space at the point of activation for the mount to appear. This same practice can be applied in a vertical manner allowing the player to reveal an Enchanted Sword Shrine from the surface.
The Slimy Saddle, along with all other pre-Hardmode mounts, is one of the few pre-Hardmode items with a rarity of 08*.

The Flare Gun itself does not belong to any damage type, and its damage will not be affected by any factors, including those for all types of damage (like the Avenger Emblem or the Wrath buff ). The Flares that the gun fires deal ranged damage and benefit from ranged damage buffs, but final damage dealt is considered classless.

The Flare Gun will equip when the player holds Quick Select with the Flare Gun and at least one Flare in their inventory, while also having their cursor out of Torch placement range, or when the player has no Torches or Glowsticks in their inventory.
The Flare Gun will not fulfill the spawn criteria for the Arms Dealer.

If playing in multiplayer, a player can use the Flare Gun much like a real-world flare gun, to signal other players for help. Due to its high range, it can shoot relatively far and can fairly easily reach the area of another player (barring obstacles).

The Flare Gun's shots will pierce targets. Since they inflict the On Fire! / Cursed Inferno debuff, the weapon can prove very useful for fighting off groups of enemies, such as during the Blood Moon, as well as keeping track of bosses and enemies in dark environments.

The Flare Gun can be especially useful against worm-like enemies (and bosses like the Eater of Worlds ), or even the Brain of Cthulhu 's Creeper minions. Surprisingly, the Flare Gun is also useful against Wyverns, being able to kill one with a single, well landed shot and a few seconds.
While mining downward, firing a Flare where the player is mining will allow it to fall with the player as they mine.

Due to the Flares' 10-minute duration, the Flare Gun can also be used to reach the 1,001 projectile spawn limit, making it an extremely useful setup tool before boss encounters by firing a thousand flares beforehand, subsequently preventing the boss from firing any projectiles while still allowing the player to fire projectiles themselves.
A mantra is a religious hymn believed to have psychological or spiritual powers.

With even a slow rocket launcher, this item can mine blocks faster than even the Shroomite Digging Claw or Drill Containment Unit. With the Celebration Mk2, this item can mine more than 1000 blocks every 5 seconds.
This item is a reference to the post-apocalyptic role-playing video game series Fallout, in which Mini Nukes are American Football-sized warheads intended for use in handheld weaponry.
The Royal set is nearly identical to the Princess ' clothes.

The word candelabra originated from Latin, where candēlābrum is the singular form and candēlābra is the plural. Over time, English usage changed so that candelabra as the singular and candelabras as the plural is now the more common usage.

Crafting and selling Candelabras is an excellent avenue of monetizing surplus blocks by combining them with torches, and remains profitable even if the torches required are bought from the Merchant. For more information, see Guide:Making Money.
The Bamboo and Granite Candelabras look more like desk lamps with lampshades rather than actual candelabras.
The Large Dynasty Candle appears to be two separate objects when placed; wiring one of them would affect the other, however.
The Lesion Candelabra appears to be a Clinger, and even closes its eye when switched off.
Increasing melee speed by reforging the weapon also increases its range, as with most boomerangs.
While the hammer is clearly visible in darkness, it emits no light.
(Old-gen console version) It cannot autoswing, unlike most late-game weapons.

Despite it not being the final obtainable boomerang, the Paladin's Hammer is generally considered to be the strongest boomerang-type weapon in the game since it easily out-damages all the other boomerangs. It also generally has more uses than all the other boomerangs because of its infinite piercing capabilities.

The infinite piercing of the Paladin's Hammer makes it very effective against multi-segmented enemies, which it can strike multiple times in one pass. It is similarly effective against enemies that fire destructible projectiles, because the hammer can destroy the projectile and damage the caster in one swing.
It has similar damage as the Possessed Hatchet. The main differences are that the Paladin's Hammer can pierce, is somewhat faster, does not home in on enemies, and has much more knockback.
With autoswing enabled by accessories and melee-boosting gear, this weapon can become highly powerful, possibly dealing a higher DPS than the Terra Blade.
Due to its high speed, the Paladin's Hammer is effective for clearing the Cobwebs out of a Spider Nest while simultaneously killing or severely damaging any enemies in the vicinity.
The hammer is a common choice of weapon for paladins in many fantasy games, though they are not often thrown.
The hammer's throwing function is similar to Mjölnir, the magical hammer wielded by the Norse god Thor, which would return to his hand after being thrown.
This is the only hammer in the game that has no function as a tool, but still activates the "Stop! Hammer Time!" achievement.
Unlike the projectile thrown by the Paladin, this weapon cannot pass through blocks.
The Cactus Sword can be very useful until one finds Silver or Tungsten to craft a more effective sword.
Selling a Cactus Sword is 18× as profitable as selling its ingredients.
With the Star Wrath being an autoswing weapon, waves of falling stars can very easily be accumulated, rendering this weapon highly effective for clearing large groups of enemies or bosses.

Like the Starfury, the Star Wrath's stars can pass through blocks on the way down. However, the unique properties of the stars solidifying while the player is nearby means that multiple open spaces will not hinder the stars, but a low ceiling will block them even if there are open spaces above.
Also, like the Starfury, the speed of the falling stars increases with the wielder's melee speed.
Once this weapon is obtained, the Moon Lord can be killed on a sky bridge quite easily. The same goes for the sword Meowmere.

It is extremely important to hit enemies with the projectiles, not just with the sword. Each of the projectiles does as much damage as the sword does. Since the projectiles use local immunity, the DPS can roll very high as the number of hits adds up. Each of the projectiles does as much damage as the sword does. Since the projectiles use local immunity, the DPS can roll very high as the number of hits adds up.
The Star Wrath can be used for exploring the map easily, since the stars it sends down produce light at the maximum light level.
The projectiles summoned by the use of the Star Wrath can inflict effects from flasks such as Ichor.

Compared to the Star Wrath, the Meowmere has much higher base damage, but the Star Wrath's projectiles have a higher DPS than the Meowmere's, and they can pass through ceilings. This makes the Star Wrath better for a hybrid ranged play style, where the projectiles are the main damage dealer with the sword itself serving as more of a contingency weapon, and the opposite is true for the Meowmere.

The projectiles from Star Wrath are capable of traveling at a near-horizontal angle if the cursor is placed in one of the upper corners of the screen. With some height, it is possible to cause star showers far across the map, which has little practical use but is visually fun.
It bears a similar appearance and function to the Starfury, particularly before its changes in the 1.2 update.
When the shirt and pants are dyed using Silver Dye, the outfit closely resembles that of Alex DeLarge, the protagonist of the 1971 dystopian crime film A Clockwork Orange.

The Spinal Tap's damage penalty per hit in a single swing is very low (10%), which makes it an excellent weapon for crowd control and effective against The Hungry during the fight against the Wall of Flesh. Along with this, it is one of the best weapons for farming the Brain of Cthulhu in pre-Hardmode, as well as the Eater of Worlds to a lesser extent.
Due to the nature of Dungeon generation of drunk worlds, it is possible to encounter Dungeon enemies pre-Skeletron, allowing summoners to craft this whip very early.

The tooltip is a reference to a line from the 1984 American mockumentary movie This Is Spinal Tap, in which the guitarist for the band Spinal Tap, Nigel Tufnel, shows an amplifier to the crew and notes that the dials go " up to eleven ".
A spinal tap is another name for a lumbar puncture, which is a medical procedure that involves inserting a needle into the spinal canal.

Compared to the Unicorn Mount, the Basilisk is much slower, but has much more acceleration and lower height, making it more suitable for underground exploration. It can also be better for battle depending on the player's gear, as it trades the Unicorn's invulnerability for a lower charge delay and higher damage.
When used with the Neptune's Shell, the Basilisk Mount is capable of extreme mobility underwater, competing with that of the Turtle Mount and even Cute Fishron (in the air).

Using an Umbrella or Djinn's Curse with this mount will cause the player to glide through the air at significant speeds, allowing the player to move long distances quickly when jumping from a high ledge.

The Basilisk is capable of charging through the segments of the Eater of Worlds and The Destroyer with minimal damage to the player. When running along the Destroyer's body, the Basilisk can achieve very high DPS due to summon damage bypassing the Destroyer's high defense.

The Basilisk Mount is resistant to the Sandstorm 's Mighty Wind debuff while in motion (but not when standing still), meaning that the player's speed and charge time are unaffected regardless of wind direction. This also applies to jumping against the wind. This is very useful when traversing the Desert during this event.

Both the Basilisk and Unicorn Mount's charge abilities operate the same way sprinting accessories do in terms of momentum. This means that mounting while sprinting, dashing with the Shield of Cthulhu or Tabi, or moving quickly through the use of a canceled grapple will immediately cause the Basilisk to begin charging, even if the distance covered would normally not be enough to trigger it.

When used with arrows that deal piercing damage ( Unholy Arrows, Jester's Arrows, Hellfire Arrows, (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Chlorophyte Arrows ), only one arrow will deal damage to each enemy per shot, making the shotbow far less effective.
The average number of arrows fired per shot is (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 2.33 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 2.7.

Due to variance in the number of arrows fired per shot, the effective base damage of the Shotbow ranges between 68 and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 102 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 136 damage. It is also more strongly affected by the base damage of arrows than single-shot bows or repeaters.
The Shotbow's lower base damage can be compensated for by using Ichor Arrows, which decrease defense.

While the Shotbow has less base damage per arrow than the Hallowed Repeater, the spread is tight enough that targets will usually be hit with more than one arrow per shot, resulting in higher damage output overall. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) However, the Hallowed Repeater remains superior to the shotbow when using piercing arrows (with the possible exception of Hellfire Arrows against dense crowds), due to the latter's anti-synergy with piercing arrows. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) However, the Hallowed Repeater remains superior to the shotbow when using piercing arrows (with the possible exception of Hellfire Arrows against dense crowds), due to the latter's anti-synergy with piercing arrows.
Shotbow is a portmanteau of the words shotgun and crossbow.
All existing Vulcan Repeaters in 1.3.0.1 -equivalent worlds were replaced by Chlorophyte Shotbows upon updating.
The fact that the Sand Poacher may drop Fried Eggs upon death could be a play on words, as one way to cook eggs is to " poach " them.
Despite the name, it cannot fire Land Mines, which are an unrelated item. The Proximity Mine Launcher can only use rockets as ammo.

If multiple mines are stacked on top of each other, then a single enemy will trigger them consecutively. This is because the mines are projectiles which inflict invincibility frames on the enemy. Once the invincibility frame is over (after 0.17 seconds by default), the enemy can take damage again and trigger the next mine.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Copper Shortsword can be thrown at a slime to unlock the Squire Slime (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

In a world that generated with Tin Ore, it is advisable not to discard the Copper Shortsword if planning to craft the Zenith (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Copper can still be obtained via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Chlorophyte Extractinator (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), crates, and bonus drops from slimes. This is less of an issue in a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as it always contains both Copper and Tin Ore. Copper can still be obtained via Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Chlorophyte Extractinator (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), crates, and bonus drops from slimes. This is less of an issue in a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as it always contains both Copper and Tin Ore.
The Copper Shortsword is the weakest shortsword.

The uselessness of the Copper Shortsword, even at the beginning of the game which it is supposedly suited for, has earned it "memetic" status within the Terraria community. On videos of people successfully completing challenges in Terraria such as unusual boss fights or speedruns, for example, comments saying "Now do it with a copper shortsword!" are not a rare sight, to make the seemingly impossible challenge even more ridiculous. However, there have been videos where bosses have been defeated with a Copper Shortsword.
The Copper Shortsword on the Zenith (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 's recipe represents the beginning of the player's journey.
A Tiny Copper Shortsword is the smallest possible sword in the game.

It is possible to spawn with a Broken Copper Shortsword. This reduces its damage to 3, which makes the early game even harder. Furthermore, a Broken Copper Shortsword is the weapon with the second-lowest damage in the game, as the weapon with the lowest damage is the Broken Wooden Hammer, which deals 1 damage. However, a player in this condition can simply make a new sword, which is generally accepted as the best course of action for a new character anyways.
Because the Copper Shortsword autoswings on the Nintendo 3DS version, its use is slightly increased. However, 3DS players start with a Wooden Sword, a mostly better weapon.
Placed Rock Golem Heads have a similar function to Clay Pots and Planter Boxes. However, unlike those two items, herb seeds cannot be planted in Rock Golem Heads.
Unlike most placed items, the eyes of the head will always be directed at the player when it is placed, regardless of the direction the head is facing.
Neither its worn nor default placed sprite feature the flower atop the enemy's head.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Dark Lance not only has slightly better stats, but also is somewhat easily obtainable Pre-Hardmode, making it a good alternative. However, the Naginata has a slightly higher range.
A Naginata is a traditional Japanese pole weapon, used by samurai. In reality, a naginata is intended to be swung rather than thrusted.

Clay Pots have a similar function to Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and placed Rock Golem Heads (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). However, herb seeds cannot be planted in Rock Golem Heads.
When using a Staff of Regrowth or Axe of Regrowth on a herb in a Clay Pot, the herb cannot be harvested unless it is blooming. It can still be harvested at any time by using a pickaxe or drill.
Clay Pots can be placed in lava, allowing Fireblossom to bloom on the Old-gen console and 3DS versions.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) While each Clay Pot sells for 20 CC and thus seems to be the most lucrative item made of Clay Blocks, Pink Vases have a better ratio of coins per Clay Block ( 3.5 CC compared to 3.33 CC for a Clay Pot). On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the lower number of required Clay Blocks makes the Clay Pot more profitable than the Pink Vase. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the lower number of required Clay Blocks makes the Clay Pot more profitable than the Pink Vase.
Lava is, as most would probably guess, fairly dangerous to swim in. Some items, such as Obsidian Skin Potions and the Lava Charm, give temporary protection against it.
Sometimes, while swimming in draining/falling water, the player will receive air even without being close to the surface.
The Water Walking Boots will allow the player to walk on water. Its upgrade, the Lava Waders will allow the player to walk on all liquids.
When walking on a liquid, pressing ▼ Down will cause the player to sink.
Desert Spirits are references to jinns (anglicized as "genies"), mythical invisible spiritual creatures commonly associated with ancient and modern Arab Islamic mythology.

The Desert Spirit's association with the Desert Spirit Lamp is a reference to the original tale of Aladdin from the Middle Eastern folktale collection One Thousand and One Nights, where the titular protagonist summons a wish-granting genie by rubbing an oil lamp, who is bound to do the bidding of whoever is in possession of it.
A full stack of 9999 Wooden Arrows can be upgraded to Flaming Arrows using about 1000 Torches.
Even if they transform into normal arrows when going under water, they keep their higher base damage, making them still superior to normal arrows in a such case.

They are useful to players who have not yet acquired the materials to make large amounts of Unholy Arrows or Jester's Arrows, though players with access to the Snow biome will likely prefer Frostburn Arrows, which deal more damage than Flaming Arrows while requiring only Ice Blocks as additional material for crafting.
Even though it appears to be 4 tiles tall, it can fit through 3-tile spaces.

New players should be cautious around it, as while it appears to be similar to the common Zombie, it is considerably more resistant to knockback, being able to do damage to a player even while being repeatedly attacked with most starting weapons. Unlike Zombies, however, Face Monsters will not despawn during daytime.
There is no Corruption counterpart for this enemy, unlike the Crimera, which has the Eater of Souls as its counterpart.

– According to the Terraria lore pages, the Face Monster once was a worshipper and/or sacrifice to the Crimson, raising it to the level of deity and giving it human sacrifices, which it accepted, turning them into mindless, loyal servants of the hivemind.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Face Monster's idle sound effect can be heard randomly in-game at any time, even when there are no Face Monsters present. This is uncommon, however.
Snowballs are affected by gravity, so they are ineffective against enemies at farther ranges.
Although it has a low knockback value and damage, the Snowball can be a useful starter weapon, as the materials required to make it are abundant.
In real life, salamanders are small, semi-aquatic, or fully aquatic amphibians found throughout the Northern Hemisphere and are capable of regenerating lost limbs or damaged body parts.
Despite Salamanders having different colors, the Salamander Banner and Bestiary entry always depict the second green color variant.
On the Console version and Old-gen console version, Hellforges can spawn just above the Underworld.
The sprite appears to have a small flow of lava on the right side.
With a bit of luck, a Teleportation Potion may take the player to the Underworld, making the Hellforge easily obtainable early-game.
It appears to be made of Hellstone Bricks.
Even though the Hellforge looks like a Furnace and acts like one, it cannot be crafted from it.
Although it is a late pre-Hardmode version of the Furnace, it is not required to smelt Cobalt, Palladium, Mythril, and Orichalcum into bars.
The Destroyer Emblem, Avenger Emblem, Celestial Emblem, and Warrior / Ranger / Sorcerer / Summoner Emblem have a stacking damage bonus if they are equipped simultaneously.
For summoners, it is best to keep the Avenger Emblem instead of crafting the Destroyer Emblem, since minions cannot deal critical hits.
Since critical strike chance and damage bonuses have a multiplicative effect with each other, it is slightly better than an increase of 18% damage or critical strike chance would be.

The Ice Bolt projectile has a cooldown of 0.92 seconds. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) While the cooldown is active, the player can neither switch items, look in another direction, nor utilize Auto Select, but they can continue swinging the sword. A small particle effect and the sound for restoring mana https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:MaxMana.wav will notify the player of a recharged Ice Bolt. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) While the cooldown is active, the player can neither switch items, look in another direction, nor utilize Auto Select, but they can continue swinging the sword. A small particle effect and the sound for restoring mana https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:MaxMana.wav will notify the player of a recharged Ice Bolt.
The Ice Blade is capable of autoswing. It will swing in the direction of the last fired projectile.
Melee speed will affect the speed of the Ice Bolt. Its cooldown will remain unchanged, however.
On the, this weapon deals 18 damage without modifiers instead of 17. Whether this is intended or not is unknown.
This can be a good early game melee weapon, because of its autoswing, 17 damage, and projectile.
The Ice Blade makes the same noise as the Ice Elemental when its projectile is fired.
The Frostbrand can be considered its Hardmode upgrade.

The Joja Cola is a direct reference to the item of the same name from the simulation role-playing video game Stardew Valley, where it is one of the possible trash items that can be caught while fishing.

Webbed is the only debuff in the game that completely disables most of the player's inputs and cannot be prevented whatsoever. Therefore, it is commonly used in large multiplayer servers to stop a player.

The debuffs Stoned (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Frozen, and Webbed all disable the player's inputs. When more than one of them is active, the priority for the effects is as follows: Stoned → Frozen → Webbed. Note that if the Webbed effect coexists with any of the other effects, the player will not experience the effects of gravity. Note that if the Webbed effect coexists with any of the other effects, the player will not experience the effects of gravity.

The Stake Launcher is considered an arrow-type weapon by the Magic Quiver, Shroomite armor, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Archery Potion, and the Stakes it fires cannot be retrieved. However, it is considered a gun by the Rifle Scope and its upgrades, allowing it to use the zoom function.

The 1000% damage boost against Vampires is applied to the combined damage of Stake Launcher and Stake after all damage calculations (e.g. armor, accessories, buffs, randomized deviation, etc.) have been completed. However, it is applied before the damage is reduced by the enemy's defense. Note that this boost does not affect Vampire Miners (Old-gen console and 3DS versions). Note that this boost does not affect Vampire Miners (Old-gen console and 3DS versions).
Because of the absurdly high damage dealt to Vampires, the Stake Launcher is prone to setting off anti-cheat measures when used in some multiplayer servers.

The Stake Launcher is easily one of the most powerful ranged weapons obtainable, given its extremely high damage (base of 100 with the Stakes), powerful knockback, high velocity, automatic fire, cheap ammunition, and the fact that said ammunition can pierce up to nine times and is not affected by gravity. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The only downside would be the fire rate, which is relatively slow in comparison to other high-tier ranged weapons, like the Megashark. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The only downside would be the fire rate, which is relatively slow in comparison to other high-tier ranged weapons, like the Megashark.
The Stake Launcher is very effective against multi-segmented enemies like worms, as its piercing effect can damage multiple segments.
The Stake Launcher's damage bonus references vampire folklore, in which the only way to completely kill a vampire is to drive a wooden stake through its heart.
The Warmth buff does not affect the ice-themed weapons' damage in PvP.
Despite the Frost Minnow being available on the Nintendo 3DS version and having "Material" listed in its tooltip, the Warmth Potion cannot be crafted due to a lack of Shiverthorn in the game.
Its damage reduction multiplies with that of the Endurance Potion, granting a total 37% damage reduction from ice enemies.

The Warmth buff does not reduce damage from Frozen Zombies, (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Ice Mimics, and (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Ice Tortoises, despite them being cold-themed enemies.

Warmth Potions are highly advantageous during the Frost Legion and Frost Moon events, as many of their enemies are affected by the Warmth buff. Additionally, it will last the full duration of the Frost Moon.
Although some of Deerclops' (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) attacks do not use ice, their damage is still reduced by 30%. This makes the potion quite helpful during the fight.
Despite its name, this buff does not protect against the Chilled debuff. The only way to do so is with accessories such as the Hand Warmer, Ankh Shield, or Arctic Diving Gear.
The Frost Minnow and Shiverthorn, which are crafting ingredients of the Warmth Potion, are both obtained in the Snow biome, a cold-themed biome itself.
The Bone Arrow may be a reference to bone marrow, a substance in bones.
The name of this item is similar to the phrase bow and arrow.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the GPS do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The GPS may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.

Selling the GPS is more profitable than selling its separate parts ( 20 SC for the Gold Watch or 30 SC for the Platinum Watch, 25 SC for the Depth Meter, and 25 SC for the Compass ). However, since it will probably be necessary for the player to craft the watch themselves, they should consider the cost of its components instead. In the worst case, if the world has platinum and the player does not have any spare bars, they will need 40 Platinum Ore to craft the watch, which sell for 1 GC 80 SC on their own, making a measly 70 SC of profit, which can even be negated if the two other accessories have particularly good modifiers. However, since it will probably be necessary for the player to craft the watch themselves, they should consider the cost of its components instead. In the worst case, if the world has platinum and the player does not have any spare bars, they will need 40 Platinum Ore to craft the watch, which sell for 1 GC 80 SC on their own, making a measly 70 SC of profit, which can even be negated if the two other accessories have particularly good modifiers.
GPS stands for " Global Positioning System ", which in real life is used to track the user's location.

The GPS was the first combined informational accessory, existing well before any of the other accessories used to craft the PDA (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which were all introduced with the 1.3.0.1 update.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Despite having similar stats to its Corruption counterpart, the Ball O' Hurt, it is relatively less useful since it is not recommended to be used on the Brain of Cthulhu itself, unless a melee player, unlike the Ball O' Hurt which is a viable option for the Eater of Worlds.
The Meatball is one of the three craftable flails in the game, the other two being the Flaming Mace and Dao of Pow.
The Meatball's name is a reference to the real food made of meat and to how the Crimson is flesh/meat-themed.

Modifier prefixes are added in front of the "The" in its name, which can result in a grammatically incorrect name such as "Keen The Meatball". It shares this trait with all other items that can obtain modifiers and whose names begin with "The". This error is not present in the Old-gen console version.

This accessory proves exceptionally useful in multiplayer with a "tank" player and a player who focuses on DPS. If the player focusing on DPS equips the Putrid Scent or its upgrades along with Shroomite or Vortex armor while the "tank" equips Turtle armor, Beetle armor, or Solar Flare armor, enemies will be much, much more likely to target the "tank", greatly increasing the survivability of the other player. If the Flesh Knuckles and its upgrades are available, they can further concentrate fire on the tank, but this requires access to a world with the Crimson.

This accessory provides an average damage bonus comparable to the Avenger Emblem, while being available at the start of Hardmode. If the class emblem is unavailable, the player is not playing a single class, or in a multiplayer scenario where one may want to fully focus on offense, this is one of the best options at the start of Hardmode. However, the bonus is greatly reduced for summoners, since summoning weapons are not affected by the current critical strike chance of the player. However, the bonus is greatly reduced for summoners, since summoning weapons are not affected by the current critical strike chance of the player.

The Putrid Scent is the Corruption counterpart to The Crimson 's Flesh Knuckles, since it increases damage dealt and decreases aggro range, while the Flesh Knuckles decrease damage received and increase aggro range.
None of the items crafted from it retain the critical strike and damage bonus.
The Ice Bat becomes extremely rare once Hardmode is initiated.
If a Hand Warmer is equipped, the debuffs inflicted by this enemy are negated.
The Ice Bat is larger and more powerful than a Cave Bat, and may prove challenging for players without a gun or other ranged weapon.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Despite being a bat, it cannot inflict Feral Bite in Expert Mode. Only Cave Bats, Jungle Bats, Giant Bats, Spore Bats, and Giant Flying Foxes cause this debuff.

Ichor cannot be destroyed by lava, so pouring lava on Ichor Stickers is one possible way to collect Ichor. This also means areas with naturally generated lava can be used as natural traps to farm Ichor.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It is possible to obtain Ichor in a world which was generated with Corruption by creating an artificial Underground Crimson. To do so, one can buy Crimson Seeds from the Dryad during Hardmode while in a Graveyard, and use them to seed the Underground Crimson biome. Alternatively, one might simply bring the material from another world which has Crimson. Alternatively, one might simply bring the material from another world which has Crimson.
If one wishes to fish for an extended amount of time, Hematic Crates can supply a small amount of Ichor.
Ichor should be gathered as much as possible, as it is a valuable crafting material even in the endgame.
Making Ichor Arrows is a good way to make profits with Ichor, increasing the sell price from 9 SC to 12 SC per Ichor.

Ichor, in Greek mythology, is the golden ethereal fluid that flows in the blood of gods and immortals, as also said in the item's tooltip. It also means a discharge from a wound or ulcer. H.P. Lovecraft, the creator of the original Cthulhu character, often used "ichor" in his descriptions of otherworldly creatures.
Ichor is usually pronounced /ˈaɪkɔr/ EYE-kor. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] An alternative pronunciation is /ˈɪkəɹ/ IK-ər, which would make the Ichor Sticker's name a rhyme.

It might be hard to obtain a Gold Mouse, not only because the Underground biome is usually more hostile than other biomes (like the Surface, where most of the other critters spawn), especially during Hardmode, but also due to town NPCs cannot increase the spawn rate of Mice.
The Bestiary entry for the Gold Mouse: " Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! Shopkeepers will pay handsomely for these, or you can show them off in cages! "

Herbs can grow anywhere in the world, as long as their respective soil is present. Since some soil types are more prevalent in certain biomes, the respective herbs will be found more often there as well. For instance, Snow and Ice Blocks make up the majority of the Snow / Ice biomes, hence Shiverthorn is going to be found there in large quantities.
A herb will bloom on every occasion which provides its blooming conditions, not just once. For example, Moonglow will bloom each time it is night, not just once.
Due to the mechanic of random tile updates, on average, herbs on and above the surface layer will grow faster than herbs below the surface layer.

Despite there being a Planter Box (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for each herb, any Planter Box (and additionally Clay Pots ) can be used to grow any herb, regardless of its type or what biome it is placed in. Using them also avoids the problem of swinging tools breaking nearby herbs.
Herb seeds are named after their herb, e.g. Blinkroot Seeds for Blinkroot. There are also plain Seeds that are ammunition for the Blowpipe. These latter Seeds cannot be planted.
All herbs sell for 20 CC, while their seeds sell for 16 CC.

Herb seeds can be used to create herb farms. A Dart Trap can be used to quickly harvest herbs growing on soil, however herbs growing in Clay Pots or in Planter Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are harvested with a pickaxe or, for a better profit, a Staff of Regrowth.
Daybloom is the only herb that can be dropped by enemies.
The tooltip is a play on the words appreciate and apricot.

The Apricot, Cherry, Grapefruit, Plum, Pomegranate, and Spicy Pepper are the only fruits that do not have unique recipes of their own. They can only be used to make Fruit Juice, Fruit Salad, and Ambrosia – recipes that allow any fruit to be used.

The Stardrop is a direct reference to the item of the same name from the 2016 simulation role-playing video game Stardew Valley, where it is a rare item that permanently increases the player's maximum energy. Its tooltip in Terraria is almost identical to the one in Stardew Valley.
In addition, a maximum of seven Stardrops can be acquired normally in Stardew Valley, whereas in Terraria, an unlimited number of Joja Cola can be collected and purified to obtain more.
In Stardew Valley, Junimos are mysterious forest spirits that aid and reward the player for completing objectives while rebuilding the town community center.
This is one of the few food items in the game that provide the Exquisitely Stuffed buff.

If farming for Burgers, it is advisable to farm for them in a pre-Hardmode surface Corruption biome, since the surface Corruption has much less enemy variety than the Crimson, making it easier to farm Burgers.
The Burger's tooltip, '...but wait! It was 99 cents.', is a lyric from the song " Thrift Shop " by American hip-hop duo Macklemore & Ryan Lewis.
On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, Bowls are used as a part of the recipe for Bowls of Soup and cannot be reobtained.
On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, only the Clay Bowl can be used to make the Bowl of Soup. Glass/Dynasty Bowls will not work.
This item is not available on the Nintendo 3DS version due to the unavailability of pixel shaders.

Similar to The Horseman's Blade and Bee Keeper, the Bladetongue only creates projectiles when the sword strikes an enemy. This is unlike most other projectile swords, which fire projectiles regardless of whether or not an enemy is hit. Among the projectile melee weapons, these three are sometimes considered "true" melee weapons, since the player still needs to move into melee range in order to deal damage. Among the projectile melee weapons, these three are sometimes considered "true" melee weapons, since the player still needs to move into melee range in order to deal damage.
The Bladetongue fires one ichor stream each time it hits an enemy (with the sword itself), i.e., hitting three enemies in a single swing will cause the sword to fire three streams in total.
The sword itself also inflicts the Ichor debuff and can be used in conjunction with other weapon imbuements from flasks.
The Bladetongue resembles the Oculus Reaver from the action-adventure video game Starbound.

The Ruler swings in bursts of four, meaning that even if the player stops attacking, it will continue swinging until its burst is done. Likewise, trying to swing the Ruler once is impossible, and attempting to do so will result in four swings instead.
Despite having a swing rate of 12 per second, the Ruler can only hit the target 6 times per second.

The Ruler is the only autoswinging shortsword in the game. This along with its high use speed and gold -equivalent damage gives it the highest DPS of any shortsword. Despite this, the player will almost invariably secure much better weapons by the time the Goblin Tinkerer becomes available, and as such it remains obsolete.
On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, Ichor Stickers are not immune to the Ichor debuff, despite inflicting it themselves.

To easily farm Ichor, it is recommended for the player to create horizontal shafts in the Underground Crimson for the Ichor Sticker to spawn. A three-tile tall shaft will cause the Ichor Sticker to become stuck and barely able to shoot the player (as they shoot in an arc); with a four-tile tall shaft, they become mobile but will still have problems shooting the player. The player will also have more room to deal with the irritating Floaty Gross, which can fly through blocks.

Ichor Stickers appear to fly, but actually they just float over the ground instead of jumping. As a result, a hole that is at least 4 tiles deep can effectively immobilize them. While this will not prevent them from shooting if the player is in sight, they can be easily dealt with using nearly any weapon available at the start of Hardmode or just placing some lava in the hole.
Ichor is usually pronounced /ˈaɪkɔr/ EYE-kor. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] An alternative pronunciation is /ˈɪkəɹ/ IK-ər, which would make the Ichor Sticker's name a rhyme.
On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, Ichor Stickers are the only source of Ichor. On the Desktop, Console, and Mobile versions, Tainted Ghouls and Hematic Crates may also drop it.
The Ichor Sticker is the only enemy with a ranged attack in both the Crimson and Underground Crimson, and it also has the highest maximum health of all non- boss enemies in both biomes.
When a player is killed by Ichor spit, the death message will say the player was killed by the Golden Shower, which is a magic weapon the player can craft out of Ichor.
The Flying Dutchman cannot move down through platforms.
If the player moves too far from the Flying Dutchman, it will despawn.
When spawning enemies, the Flying Dutchman cannot spawn Parrots or Pirate Captains.

If fighting the Pirate Invasion in Space, there is a chance, especially near the end of the event, that a Flying Dutchman may spawn, but not be immediately seen. This is evident by random cannonball explosions that can damage the player, but with no enemy visible. Whether glitch or lack of proper space requirements (40×30 tiles), the "invisible" Dutchman will disappear after a short time, whether it eventually appears or not. If players change their altitude when this happens, the Dutchman will likely appear and can be defeated. This can also seemingly happen at random at the end of an event at a low chance, typically when not tabbed into the game.
Any weapons that can hit multiple targets at once are good for taking out the cannons.

Due to the way it moves and the way the cannonballs fire, it is very easy to find positions where it cannot hit the player, yet they can hit it. Weapons that can be used in these situations include any kind of summoning weapon, the Daedalus Stormbow, the Meteor Staff, the Nimbus Rod, and the Flying Knife. Weapons that can be used in these situations include any kind of summoning weapon, the Daedalus Stormbow, the Meteor Staff, the Nimbus Rod, and the Flying Knife.

Due to the fact that they stop upon hitting a wall, and continuously spawn pirates, the Flying Dutchmen can be stopped above a half-block deep pit of lava (or other trap) and used to farm the various items pertaining to the Pirate Invasion.

Farming for the Lucky Coin, Discount Card, or Gold Ring is most efficient from killing the Flying Dutchman, rather than from common pirates. After getting the event progress to 50%, the player can ensure ten Flying Dutchmen spawn per event by not killing any other enemies or by making them despawn. Eventually, a Flying Dutchman will spawn (usually it takes a short time). After killing it, the process is repeated until the event ends. Parrots can be killed safely since they do not contribute towards event progress.
A Minecart with a sufficiently long track is useful for dodging the Flying Dutchman's attacks, and can then be attacked with ranged or magic weapons from the Minecart.
The sail gore that the Flying Dutchman is torn into upon death behaves differently from normal gore; they appear to drift gently in the wind instead of falling directly to the ground.

The real-life Flying Dutchman is a legendary ghost ship that can never make port and is doomed to sail the oceans forever, a myth that is likely to have originated in the 17th century. In ocean lore, the sight of this phantom ship is a portent of doom.
The Sticky Dirt Bomb is useful for quickly filling in holes left by explosions or mining, as well as creating hills or filling in a large area quickly.
Unlike the Dirt Bomb, its sticking ability allows the Sticky Dirt Bomb to easily fill holes located above the player.

The Sticky Dirt Bomb is a easy way to farm dirt, as it can spawn more dirt than what was used to craft it. In order to get the most dirt from one bomb, place a block at least 10-15 blocks above the ground and throw the bomb on it. This maximizes the amount of blocks it can fill with dirt, and is useful to obtain dirt without needing to destroy the nearby terrain, as well as making most/all recipes requiring dirt renewable.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Although they can be acquired much earlier, Cursed Arrows, Chlorophyte Arrows and Venom Arrows surpass Luminite Arrows in damage.
If one equips the Skull and the Robe, the player will strongly resemble a Dark Caster.

The Skull was added as a reference to the Terraria webcomic The Legend of Maxx, where, in Comic #76 published on June 24, 2012, Maxx puts a skull on his head from remains of a Skeleton he killed in the previous issue, using the Hammush that he created in the prior issue, but finds that he cannot remove it.
Flaming Arrows shot by the Skeleton Archer are not extinguished by water.
Unlike Armored Skeletons, Skeleton Archers cannot open doors.
Arrows fired by the Skeleton Archer are not retrievable by the player.
Several simple pit traps (7 blocks deep) can be very effective against such enemies as Skeleton Archers and Armored Skeletons.
Skeleton Archers rarely shoot the first arrow accurately, slowly adjusting aim, so moving around makes it almost impossible for them to hit the player, as does standing above.

There is a small delay before the first arrow is shot, during which the Skeleton Archer is vulnerable to attack. If a player lands a hit it will interrupt its aiming, so a quick player can prevent it from firing a single shot.
Skeleton Archers appear to be wearing a green variation of the Ancient Cobalt Breastplate with spiked shoulder guards.
It appears to wield a Wooden Bow, yet it drops a Marrow instead. It also appears to have no visible quiver, yet it can drop a Magic Quiver.
The Nebula Blaze has a limited amount of aim correction, and can automatically readjust and narrow its normal cone of fire to avoid striking nearby walls.
The projectile can hit enemies through walls at certain angles, even though it dissipates upon collision.
When selected, it provides a small amount of light.
Because of the quite high mana cost and fast use time, the Nebula Blaze consumes mana very rapidly. Be sure to have items that provide mana at the ready when using this item.

Because of this weapon's inaccuracy, it is best suited to combat in open spaces. While fighting enemies in narrow passageways, those in places like the Dungeon, the projectiles have a tendency to collide with walls.
With sufficient boosts, it is possible to reach or even exceed 3000 critical damage.
This weapon is devastating in PvP at close range because of its high rate of fire and triple damage caused by the larger blue projectile, Nebula Blaze Ex.

When used for healing with Spectre armor, Nebula Blaze can restore massive amounts of health in a single hit, but will also trigger a long cooldown before healing can activate again. This makes it uniquely suited for healing as much health as possible during the few seconds when Moon Bite wears off.
The Nebula Blaze appears to be a magic glove or gauntlet.
The Nebula Blaze has the highest base damage of any magic weapon.

The blue projectile is internally named Nebula Blaze Ex. This can be seen when players are killed by the projectile, as their death message will display their cause of death being Nebula Blaze Ex instead of simply Nebula Blaze.

Its tooltip mentions Orion's Belt, part of the constellation of Orion. This may be a further reference to a quote by Dr. Otto Octavius from the 2004 American superhero film Spider-Man 2, "The power of the sun in the palm of my hand." This may be a further reference to a quote by Dr. Otto Octavius from the 2004 American superhero film Spider-Man 2, "The power of the sun in the palm of my hand."
The Tackle Box and its upgrades have no effect on the Gold Worm's chance of being consumed when fishing. [1]
The Gold Worm is best used to obtain a Gummy Worm as it is a permanent buff to the player's fishing power.

The Gold Worm is a good bait item due to its particularly low chance of being consumed. Other gold critters and other items with 50% bait power have a 1/9.333 (10.71%) (or 1/10.333 (9.68%) with the Tackle Box or its upgrades) chance of being consumed, so the Gold Worm will last more than twice as long as them on average.
The Bestiary entry for the Gold Worm: " Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! They are worth great coin to shopkeepers and fish absolutely love golden bait! "

To create the Aether biome, the area must be at between 50 tiles below surface and 430 tiles above the bottom true world edge (i.e. most part of the underground and cavern layers) besides the Shimmer tile count limit.
Since Terraria 's world is not dynamically updated, worlds generated pre- 1.4.4 will always lack an Aether biome.

Before defeating the Moon Lord, the Aether is the only source of Shimmer, meaning it is finite and cannot be replenished. However once defeated, the Bottomless Shimmer Bucket becomes available and can be used to create unlimited Shimmer. However once defeated, the Bottomless Shimmer Bucket becomes available and can be used to create unlimited Shimmer.

The Guide 's name can be used to find the Aether's horizontal location upon world creation. Note that this method may not always work, as it only calculates the position of the first generation zone (Zone A). Since the Aether cannot overlap with Ebonstone or Crimstone Blocks in regular worlds, if it fails to generate in Zone A, it will generate in another zone, rendering this method invalid. If the original Guide has died, a world with the same World Seed can be created to find the original Guide's name. First, find the number ( n ) corresponding to the Guide's name (the numbers are in the table below ). Then, substitute n into the equation in the table below to calculate the horizontal location of the Aether biome shown on the Compass (in feet, 1 tile = 2 feet). Note that the Aether is always on the same side of the world as the Jungle. Note that this method may not always work, as it only calculates the position of the first generation zone (Zone A). Since the Aether cannot overlap with Ebonstone or Crimstone Blocks in regular worlds, if it fails to generate in Zone A, it will generate in another zone, rendering this method invalid. If the original Guide has died, a world with the same World Seed can be created to find the original Guide's name. First, find the number ( n ) corresponding to the Guide's name (the numbers are in the table below ). Then, substitute n into the equation in the table below to calculate the horizontal location of the Aether biome shown on the Compass (in feet, 1 tile = 2 feet). In Greek mythology, Aether is the personification of the bright upper sky.
The Aether's name uses the archaic spelling of the word æther, with the Latin letter æ separated. In modern English, aether is normally spelled ether.

If the player has not explored a significant portion of the map already, the Teleportation Potion usually teleports them to new, unmapped areas, where helpful loot can be found. For instance, it can take them to a Floating Island, to The Underworld, or near an Underground Cabin.

It is recommended to carry a Magic/Ice Mirror, Recall Potion, or Potion of Return (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) as a means of returning to the base, since the potion can potentially take the player to very remote places. Returning to the spawn point can also be done by exiting and re-entering the world.
Pressing ⚒ Use / Attack on the Lihzahrd Altar with a Lihzahrd Power Cell in the inventory will automatically consume it. The Lihzahrd Power Cell does not need to be held.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) After Plantera has been defeated, the Lihzahrd Bricks under the Lihzahrd Altar can be actuated, allowing players to move the Lihzahrd Altar before defeating Golem or obtaining the Picksaw.

The Lihzahrd Altar may also spawn on top of Wooden Spikes, which can be mined before acquiring the Picksaw, making it possible for the Lihzahrd Altar to be moved early. Players should exercise caution to avoid accidentally activating the Lihzahrd Altar while mining, e.g. by pressing the wrong key.
Paints can only affect the Lihzahrd Altar tiles and cannot affect the floating symbol above the altar.
The symbol that floats above the Lihzahrd Altar strongly resembles the Chakana.
The Bestiary entry for the Gold Butterfly: " Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! They are worth great coin to shopkeepers and fish absolutely love golden bait! "

The seven different rocket types are distinguished by color. All rocket types are affected by gravity to varying extents, unlike the Celebration's projectiles. Although their damage, critical strike chance, and knockback is identical, they behave differently: The red rocket infinitely pierces through enemies that are not at point-blank range, and explodes when hitting a block. Red rockets intermittently emit small explosions, but they are purely visual and do not affect the rocket's hitbox. The orange rocket flies in an arc that is affected by the relative position of the cursor vertically and has an area-of-effect damaging hitbox along the ground in the form of a shockwave upon impact. The orange rocket also increases in size as it flies. The yellow rocket travels in a straight line (visually zig-zagging) until it begins to taper off due to gravity. The green rocket homes into enemies similarly to Chlorophyte Bullets. Two blue rockets are fired at once, in a helical pattern, and travel in a straight line. Three purple rockets are fired at once, in a shotgun-spread pattern. The pink rocket appears to have no special behavior. The red rocket infinitely pierces through enemies that are not at point-blank range, and explodes when hitting a block. Red rockets intermittently emit small explosions, but they are purely visual and do not affect the rocket's hitbox. The orange rocket flies in an arc that is affected by the relative position of the cursor vertically and has an area-of-effect damaging hitbox along the ground in the form of a shockwave upon impact. The orange rocket also increases in size as it flies. The yellow rocket travels in a straight line (visually zig-zagging) until it begins to taper off due to gravity. The green rocket homes into enemies similarly to Chlorophyte Bullets. Two blue rockets are fired at once, in a helical pattern, and travel in a straight line. Three purple rockets are fired at once, in a shotgun-spread pattern. The pink rocket appears to have no special behavior.

When the ⚒ Use / Attack button is pressed, the type of rocket that is fired is determined randomly. When it is held down, however, the rockets are fixed to cycle through the colors of the rainbow: Red → Orange → Yellow → Green → Blue → Purple → Pink → Red.

Technically, when the Celebration Mk2 is being used, it spawns a launcher projectile which can deal 100% of the weapon's damage (50 base damage) on contact. The launcher projectile then spawns rockets based on built-in fire rates. [2]

Because of its fast fire rate, it is also an incredible excavating weapon, capable of mining large areas out extremely quickly with Rocket II, Rocket IV, or Mini Nuke II – upwards of a thousand blocks every 5–8 seconds depending on ammo. Though it is faster at digging than traditional tools, it suffers greatly in accuracy when compared to the Shroomite Digging Claw, the Drill Containment Unit, or even a less powerful launcher such as the Snowman Cannon.
Despite being the formal successor to the Celebration, the Celebration Mk2 is generally less effective against distant enemies.

The erratic rockets in conjunction with the quick fire rate make the Celebration Mk2 excellent at clearing waves of ground enemies (such as in the Solar Eclipse, Pumpkin Moon, or Frost Moon ). It can take down mini-bosses such as the Pumpking and Ice Queen in seconds. It can take down mini-bosses such as the Pumpking and Ice Queen in seconds.
The Celebration Mk2 was first teased on March 22, 2018, in celebration of Yoraiz0r 's birthday. [3]
It can be considered a pseudo-upgrade of the Snowman Cannon and Stynger.
The Celebration used to be dropped by the Moon Lord, but was replaced by the Celebration Mk2 due to its strength not being on-par with other post-Moon Lord weapons.
The Solar, Nebula, Vortex and Stardust sets all have identical forms, and only differ in color.
This weapon is easy to acquire early, relative to its strength, and can sustain new players for a good while.
Due to its short range, it is not advisable to bring into tougher battles, e.g. against bosses.
Despite having sword in the name, this weapon is not a sword, but a spear.
Due to how big the sprite of the weapon is, it appears to go through the player's shoulder when attacking with it.

Crafting Black and Pink Pearls into Luck Potions is always more profitable than directly selling them. Counting other materials, this will boost their sell value by 1 GC 89 SC 76 CC and 9 GC 89 SC 76 CC, respectively.

Pink Pearls are quite rare. Players who obtain one should consider crafting it into a Galaxy Pearl (unless they have already consumed one) rather than a Greater Luck Potion. The Galaxy Pearl grants a permanent (albeit small) boost to luck, whereas the Greater Luck Potion only grants a temporary boost.

The Static Hook has a rarity of 10* despite being acquirable after only one of the mechanical bosses has been defeated. It is also one of two items with this rarity that can be purchased, the other being the Rubblemaker.
The Titanium Repeater is the only Titanium-themed weapon whose sprite was not updated in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The Angler Earring's fishing power increase stacks with that of the Angler Tackle Bag and Lavaproof Tackle Bag, granting a total boost of 30% if all three are equipped.
The High Test Fishing Line, Angler Earring, and Tackle Box are interchangable with Shimmer.
The Bestiary entry for  Sluggy: " Slow and covered in a slick mucus. Fish are especially attracted to these. "
It is a good alternative to other powerful bows like the Pulse Bow, Eventide, Tsunami, or Phantasm because of its unique ability.
This bow should be angled somewhat upward to maximize range and DPS. It generally will not reach enemies off the screen.
Using wings can help compensate for the bow's lack of range and sharp drop-off.

The Aerial Bane is very useful against most bosses, as they are typically airborne. It is particularly efficient during events, where there are a lot of ground enemies that can be hit by the additional projectiles.
On the Console version, both the splitting and special arrows can hit the same target, resulting in absurdly high damage. Verify For the best results, fire from an upwards position.
Like the other Old One's Army weapons, the Aerial Bane is a direct reference to the weapon of the same name in Dungeon Defenders 2, due to its implementation as part of a crossover event.
A chakram is a weapon historically used in India. It is a flat metal ring with a sharp outer edge that was thrown at the enemy, but it would not return.
Loki's set design is mainly based off of Daedric Armor from the series of role-playing fantasy video games The Elder Scrolls. [1]

Despite being the best type of wooden sword, it is also one of the weakest Hardmode-exclusive weapons. The Classy Cane (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is a weaker weapon due to its lower base damage value of 16, compared to the Pearlwood Sword's 30 base damage. The Pearlwood Sword also autoswings, unlike the Classy Cane, and has double the knockback of the Classy Cane. The Classy Cane (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is a weaker weapon due to its lower base damage value of 16, compared to the Pearlwood Sword's 30 base damage. The Pearlwood Sword also autoswings, unlike the Classy Cane, and has double the knockback of the Classy Cane.
Its sprite is very similar to the Wooden Sword; however, there are a few changes, most notably its lighter color. The quillons of this sword appear to curve upward, parallel to the blade.

The Pearlwood Sword is made obsolete by other melee weapons during early Hardmode such as the Shadowflame Knife (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and the Drippler Crippler (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

While Venom Bullets have the highest base damage of any pre- Moon Lord (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) bullet, they are largely outclassed in most situations. Crystal Bullets have a higher effective damage output, Chlorophyte Bullets are more accurate against fast-moving enemies (such as the Moon Lord itself), High Velocity Bullets can pierce enemies and are more accurate and effective against other players in PvP, and Nano Bullets have the same stats but can also smart bounce to nearby enemies.

Crafting Black and Pink Pearls into Luck Potions is always more profitable than directly selling them. Counting other materials, this will boost their sell value by 1 GC 89 SC 76 CC and 9 GC 89 SC 76 CC, respectively.

Pink Pearls are quite rare. Players who obtain one should consider crafting it into a Galaxy Pearl (unless they have already consumed one) rather than a Greater Luck Potion. The Galaxy Pearl grants a permanent (albeit small) boost to luck, whereas the Greater Luck Potion only grants a temporary boost.

The Dead Man's Sweater is a reference to the " redshirt " stock character in fiction, who dies soon after being introduced and is typically used to dramatize the potential peril the surviving characters will face. The term originates from the security staff on the sci-fi show Star Trek: The Original Series, who wear red uniforms and frequently die during episodes.
Redigit and Cenx play in a band of the same name. [1] This is also referenced in the tooltip of the Ivy.
The Gray Grunt is modeled after the archetypal Gray alien, popularized by American conspiracy theorists after the interviews of Barney and Betty Hill and the Roswell UFO incident.
Despite supposedly not carrying any weapons, as stated in their Bestiary entry, they can still drop the Charged Blaster Cannon, which implies that they are armed.

Early into Hardmode, it is usually preferable to save Adamantite for armor and weapons, as the Adamantite Pickaxe does not allow mining any new blocks that the Mythril and Orichalcum Pickaxes and Drills would not mine.

If used with the Daedalus Stormbow, the direction in which arrows come from is unchanged, but the arrows will gradually reduce speed and eventually fly upwards. If used with the Blood Rain Bow, the arrow's unique effect is not applied, but the high damage is still useful.

The Gas Trap's clouds damage all entities in a rectangular area. Over the course of 1.27 seconds after activation, this rectangle expands from 3.125×3.125 tiles to 18.75×18.75 tiles, and then it lingers for another 0.07 seconds before disappearing. [2] This means that its maximum horizontal and vertical range is 9.375 tiles.

The Gas Trap's clouds inflict the Poisoned debuff on all entities in a separate, circular area. Over the course of 0.27 seconds after activation, this circle's radius increases from 0 to 11.25 tiles, and then it lingers for another 1.07 seconds before disappearing. [2]

The Gas Trap's cloud projectiles share the exact same sprite as the toxic cloud projectile created by the Toxic Flask. It also has similar behavior to said weapon, though it inflicts damage to players, NPCs, and enemies.
The Used Gas Trap is the only non-junk/badly reforged item to have the -1* rarity.
Getting the Alchemy Table is highly suggested before creating these potions due to the high material cost (the Alchemy Table has a 33% chance to not consume potion crafting ingredients).
These potions are obtainable before breaking the fourth Celestial Pillar by crafting the fragments dropped by the remaining tower with the other three types of fragments.
The Super Healing Potion can be very valuable for extended fights, especially in Expert, where the player must seize every advantage given to them.

They are a good use for the fragments after the Moon Lord has been defeated and all of the other gear has been attained, and, if gathered quickly after the destruction of the pillars, they can come in handy during the player's first encounter with him.
The sprite of the Super Healing Potion shares a strong resemblance to the potion with the same name in the action role-playing hack-and-slash computer video game Diablo II.
The Super Healing Potion's 07* rarity is lower than the 09* rarity of four of its ingredients, the Lunar Fragments.
This potion heals for the same amount the old Healing Potion used to.
The Moon Lord is the only boss that drops Super Healing Potions. All other bosses drop weaker variants of healing potion.
Managing to position oneself above or below the enemy is recommended in warding them off effectively.
The Snowman Gangsta can be defeated easily by trapping it in a pit filled with water and using a ranged weapon or a magic weapon.
The Snowman Gangsta is the only snowman (bar the unimplemented Exploding Snowman ) not to wear a red scarf.

The Snowman Gangsta's gun resembles a Thompson submachine gun, also known as a "Tommy gun", and was a common firearm in the possession of crime syndicates during the Prohibition era due to its availability to the general public in the 1920s.
While it renders the player unable to damage critters, enemy attacks and environmental hazards such as lava are still completely able to damage and kill them.
It does protect critters against player-placed traps.
It does not prevent the player from harming Explosive Bunnies, which explode when killed, and spawn naturally in the For the worthy secret seed.
The Guide to Critter Companionship will prevent Fallen Stars from killing critters.
It is useful to carry this item while wearing the Shield of Cthulhu, as the shield's dash may be interrupted by bumping into a critter.

The Guide to Critter Companionship is useful for collecting rare or risky critters, including: Prismatic Lacewings, which summon the Empress of Light when killed. Ladybugs, which give a luck penalty when killed. Different bugs for bait. Any gold critter. Prismatic Lacewings, which summon the Empress of Light when killed. Ladybugs, which give a luck penalty when killed. Different bugs for bait. Any gold critter.
The book's cover seems to depict a Bunny.
The crystal may sporadically attack through blocks, though this does not occur often.
The light beams from the crystal will detect enemies that have not appeared on-screen yet. This is useful for detecting which direction new enemies will appear from.
Pressing ⚷ Open / Activate while aiming at an enemy will focus fire on that enemy until killed or the target has been switched.
As with all sentry summons, summoning another sentry will cause the crystal to disappear unless the player has an accessory to increase the limit.

This weapon has a massive range and can target enemies far off-screen, though it prefers to aim at closer targets. As such, it is recommended to place this sentry high in the air to provide it with the widest view; its accuracy will not improve if it is close to its target.
Unlike most other rainbow-themed weapons, the Rainbow Crystal Staff does not have secret color themes for developers or beta testers.
The quote in its tooltip, 'The colors, Duke, the colors!', is a reference to a Popsicle commercial.
The Rainbow Crystal Staff has the highest base damage of all sentry summon weapons.
When summoned through mods or 3rd-party software, its projectile's color is red.
Because it does an immense amount of damage upon contact with players in PvP and can be placed in midair, most regulated PvP servers ban the use of this weapon.
The Falcon Blade, Tartar Sauce, and Ginger Beard can only be obtained by opening Iron and Mythril Crates.
Iron Crates can be obtained in worlds with Lead Ore.
The materials for this block are identical to those of the Copper Brick, however the recipes are created at different crafting stations.
Copper has historically been a common material in roofing and architecture due to its durability and appearance.

Sky lanterns (traditional Chinese: 天燈, simplified Chinese: 天灯 ) are small hot air balloons made of paper, with a source of fire affixed at the bottom. In Asia and elsewhere around the world, sky lanterns have been traditionally made for centuries, to be launched for play or as part of long-established festivities.

The Release Lantern resembles the Lanterns in the 2010 American musical adventure movie Tangled. This is supported by the fact that the Lantern Night event was first teased as being "straight out of Tangled ". [1]

Each ricochet or hit enemy will reduce the projectile's base damage by 10%. [1] For example, if used with Wooden Arrows, it will only deal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 50 / (Old-gen console version) 40 base damage ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 62.5% / (Old-gen console version) 61.54% of the original damage) after five ricochets/enemies.

The Pulse Bow operates differently compared to other bows. Even though it consumes arrows, its projectiles appear as if they were cast by a magic weapon in that they emit a particle glow, ricochet, pierce, dissipate in midair, and are unaffected by gravity and liquids.
Its piercing and ricochet abilities make it useful in confined spaces, such as the Dungeon.

If shot at the right angle, the Pulse Bow's projectiles can ricochet through one-block walls. This appears to happen when the projectile hits a block at an entry angle of 40 to 50° and is easier to pull off when first bouncing the projectile off of another surface. This useful trick can be used in many situations to attack enemies behind cover.

Because the Pulse Bow cancels additional arrow effects, damage is the only factor that should be considered in choosing an arrow type. The highest base damage of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 99 / (Old-gen console version) 82 can be achieved with Venom Arrows.
The Endless Quiver will work as usual, allowing the Pulse Bow to fire bolts indefinitely.

This weapon is very similar to the Stake Launcher, both firing piercing projectiles unaffected by gravity and suitable for crowd control on flat arenas. On the Old-gen console version, their DPS (with Venom Arrows) is approximately equal, but the Pulse Bow is affected by the Archery Potion, pushing its damage higher, while the Stake Launcher is not. On the Old-gen console version, their DPS (with Venom Arrows) is approximately equal, but the Pulse Bow is affected by the Archery Potion, pushing its damage higher, while the Stake Launcher is not.

When the Pulse Bow is fired against a hammered slope, the bolt will hug the slope and follow it up, instead of ricocheting off, and shoot out at the end of the slope with the same incident angle. The height of the slope which the bolt can climb is limited.
The Pulse Bow's color scheme is similar to that of Shroomite equipment.
The changelog for 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) claims an increased damage reduction of 20% per hit (instead of 10%). This was not put into effect, however.
The Pulse Bow has the highest listed base damage of all bows in the game.

The angle a Scarab Bomb will detonate in is indicated by the particles coming from the front and rear of the bomb, and will always point away from the player even after being thrown. Moving perpendicular to the bomb while waiting for it to detonate can mess up the intended angle, or be used to limit the damage if a bomb is thrown by mistake. Even though the explosion aims away from the player, it can damage a player if they are less than a tile or two away from the bomb. Even though the explosion aims away from the player, it can damage a player if they are less than a tile or two away from the bomb.

The characteristic, linear shaft created by a Scarab Bomb's explosion makes the bombs useful for several different situations: Desert Fossil in the Underground Desert often forms in flattish lodes that can be cleared layer by layer with Scarab Bombs. Note that processing Desert Fossil in an Extractinator will yield an average of about one Sturdy Fossil for every 8 Desert Fossil, allowing easy replacement of the Bombs used for harvesting. In the Dungeon, they are useful for clearing the Spikes lining covered pits. In this context, the explosion-proof nature of Dungeon Bricks becomes an advantage. When fired downwards, they are useful for creating hellevator shafts quickly. Creating multiple hellevators also helps containing the evil biome in Hardmode. Any kind of layered farm can be quickly set up with the help of Scarab Bombs, e.g. for herbs, Plantera's Bulbs, etc. Desert Fossil in the Underground Desert often forms in flattish lodes that can be cleared layer by layer with Scarab Bombs. Note that processing Desert Fossil in an Extractinator will yield an average of about one Sturdy Fossil for every 8 Desert Fossil, allowing easy replacement of the Bombs used for harvesting. In the Dungeon, they are useful for clearing the Spikes lining covered pits. In this context, the explosion-proof nature of Dungeon Bricks becomes an advantage. When fired downwards, they are useful for creating hellevator shafts quickly. Creating multiple hellevators also helps containing the evil biome in Hardmode. Any kind of layered farm can be quickly set up with the help of Scarab Bombs, e.g. for herbs, Plantera's Bulbs, etc.

A spoiler posted to the Official Terraria Forums mentions the Scarab Bomb. The flavor text reads: "Unique to the Desert Biome and descended from the ancient beetles of legend, these handy helpers make digging long tunnels or shafts a breeze!" [1] [2]

The color palette, particularly the blue fire and purple shell, as well as the visual design in general, bear resemblance to the Covenant technology in the video game series Halo. The Scarab is a large mining device in the universe of Halo.

It spawns rarely and can be hard to spot due to its small size and blue color which blends well with the Ice Biome. Use of Water Candles, Battle Potions, and Hunter Potions is recommended when trying to hunt it for the Cyan Dye.
The Cyan Beetle seems to be rarer in the Old-gen console version.
The Bestiary entry for the Cyan Beetle: " Hardy to extremely cold temperatures, these beetles contain a desired bluish fluid which can be used to dye textiles. "

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ).
While holding the Combat Wrench, it will appear on a player's back, similar to how the Mechanic has a wrench on her back.
The Mechanic uses the Combat Wrench to attack enemies.
The Combat Wrench can hit one target multiple times, making it good for pre-Hardmode boss fights. However, its short range might make it undesirable to use against highly aerial, fast enemies.
If the block is made inactive via an Actuator, the snow animation will still be there.
A solid block stops the snow from falling, while a hammered block does not.
If Echo Coating is applied on a Snow Cloud, only the block itself is affected. The snowfall effect will still be visible.
Snow Clouds can be used at the bottom of hellevators to avoid dying from fall damage.
The Guide refers to the Snow biome requirement for crafting this item as " Cold Weather ".
Weapons and projectiles affected by the flask will emit glowing golden sparks.
The Flask of Gold also makes pickaxes and melee weapons provide light, making it a sidegrade to the Shine Potion, since it also improves money drops but requires constant use of weapons or tools.
The Lucky Coin and its upgrades operate independently, and can make hunting and events even more profitable.

The total cost of buying the Gold Dust is 85 SC. So, even with the Midas debuff's lowest benefit possible (10%), the player will get a return on investment after earning just 8 GC 50 SC. Killing a Mimic, the Queen Bee, or any Hardmode boss will do, but mass-killing pre-Hardmode bosses may be very profitable, and the Solar Eclipse is ideal. Note that in Expert Mode bosses drop their money inside Treasure Bags, which are not affected by Midas. Note that in Expert Mode bosses drop their money inside Treasure Bags, which are not affected by Midas.
Tesla Turrets can only be spawned within a 5×5-tile rectangle around the Martian Engineer. They require a solid tile with an open space of 3×4 tiles and no lava above it. [1]

A Martian Engineer can only create a new Tesla Turret if there are no more than four Tesla Turrets per Martian Engineer currently alive. [1] For instance, if there are currently two Martian Engineers alive, then a maximum of eight Tesla Turrets can be present at a time. The limit is not tied to the respective Martian Engineers, i.e., one could spawn seven Tesla Turrets and the other only one.
