After constructing a Tesla Turret, the Martian Engineer will wait 3 seconds before constructing a new one. This cooldown is reset to 1 second whenever the Martian Engineer takes damage. It is unable to spawn a Tesla Turret while Confused,  and the cooldown for spawning one is set to 1.5 seconds when the debuff ends. [1]

Over the course of the event, a large number of Tesla Turrets can appear if Martian Engineers are not properly dealt with. To avoid getting overwhelmed by their attacks, the player should focus on defeating Martian Engineers first before anything else.
The Bestiary entry for the Martian Engineer: " Martian soldiers who lack combat ability may instead be deployed for their mechanical aptitude, constructing turrets on the field. "

The Defender's Forge is the biggest piece of furniture that cannot be hung on a wall; large Paintings and the Treasure Map are tied as the biggest pieces of furniture overall. Compared to the other placeable portable storage items, the Defender's Forge is much larger than the Void Vault and dwarfs the Piggy Bank and Safe. Compared to the other placeable portable storage items, the Defender's Forge is much larger than the Void Vault and dwarfs the Piggy Bank and Safe.
The Golden Bug Net is the only way to catch Underworld critters without mining Hellstone.
The Golden Bug Net makes acquiring bait easier, as some bait critters have a chance to spawn from destroying tall grass and flowers, which can then be caught without the need to switch items.
It can be used for an improved chance at catching a Truffle Worm due to its faster swing speed giving the worm less time to escape.
The Suspicious Looking Tentacle cannot detect any enemy in an invulnerable period or state. This includes Jellyfish, Granite Golems, Granite Elementals, and Biome Mimics.

The Suspicious Looking Tentacle is one of the three light pets that provide the most light, the others being the Wisp in a Bottle and Fairy Princess. The Suspicious Looking Tentacle is generally considered better since it exposes nearby treasure and enemies. However, it lacks the Wisp's ability to move around the screen based on the player's direction input. Furthermore, it may have a hard time keeping up with the player at high speeds, whereas the Wisp can teleport to the player.
This light pet looks exactly like a smaller version of the True Eye of Cthulhu, an enemy summoned by the Moon Lord.

Similar to the Suspicious Looking Apple (3DS version), the Suspicious Looking Tentacle is named as if it were a boss-summoning item instead of a pet-summoning item. This is likely what the tooltip is referring to. This is likely what the tooltip is referring to.
Unlike most other pets and light pets, the light pet summoned by the Suspicious Looking Tentacle is named like the item instead of like the buff.
The Suspicious Looking Tentacle is one of three Expert Mode-exclusive items dropped by the Moon Lord, the others being the Gravity Globe and the Celestial Starboard.

The Santank Mount's detection range is a cone-shaped area of 120° in front of the player (60° above the horizontal axis and 60° below) which extends up to 53.125 tiles from the player (highlighted in red in the image on the right). [2] This is merely the mount's target detection area. It can hit enemies that are outside (the machine gun's bullets can hit enemies that are more than 53.125 tiles away and the homing rockets can hit enemies virtually anywhere), but neither weapon will fire if there are no enemies with a direct line of sight to the player in this detection area. This is merely the mount's target detection area. It can hit enemies that are outside (the machine gun's bullets can hit enemies that are more than 53.125 tiles away and the homing rockets can hit enemies virtually anywhere), but neither weapon will fire if there are no enemies with a direct line of sight to the player in this detection area.
The player can use items or other weapons while the tank attacks, making it useful as a DPS boost.
This mount reduces fall damage to 1.
The projectiles' damage and fast rate of fire makes this mount a reliable weapon.
Its tooltip, 'For the REALLY naughty ones.', is a reference to Santa Claus ' nice and naughty list. The buff tooltip, "Crossing off the naughty list...", references the same story.
The name of the Santank Mount itself is a reference to the name of the Santa-NK1 while it was in development.
If the player teleports using a Magic Mirror, Ice Mirror, or a Cell Phone while a Brain Suckler is still attached to them, the Brain Suckler will teleport with the player to the player's destination.
Unlike the Blackout and Darkness debuffs, Obstructed darkens the screen evenly, without factoring in light levels.
No matter how fast a player may move, a Brain Suckler will still catch up with them unless they teleport home at will.

Brain Sucklers pay homage to the iconic Headcrab enemy from the first-person shooter video game series Half-Life, as they attack by latching onto a player's head and disrupting their brain functions. Brain Sucklers are referred to as NebulaHeadcrab [2] sporadically in the game's code, and in their banner prior to a patch, implying their name was changed at some point during development.
Naturally-generated Sandstone Chests will never spawn low enough to generate the common drops of Shadow Chests.
Naturally-generated Sandstone Chests contain Scarab Bombs in place of Bombs, but contain regular torches instead of the biome-specific Desert Torches.
The total bonus to the max number of sentries is +2, allowing 3 to be summoned at once.
This set is an alternative to Spider armor for summoners against mechanical bosses and Plantera. It trades minions for sentries but increases regeneration and provides powerful sentries for arenas.
The first mana-restoring potion in the player's inventory will be used (from top to bottom and left to right), regardless of how much mana it restores.
The Mana Flower will consume hybrid potions that restore both health and mana, but it will not use any more as long as the Potion Sickness debuff is active.

A mana-restoring potion is automatically consumed once an item is used that requires an amount of mana higher than the currently available mana. The potion is consumed, the item is used, and then mana is consumed. [1]

The Mana Flower effectively makes continuous use of magic weapons limited only by the number of mana restoration potions in the player's inventory. As with consuming any mana potion, it causes Mana Sickness, a debuff that temporarily reduces magic damage dealt by the player by 1% per 1/5  second for 5 seconds each time a mana potion is consumed. This debuff is able to stack for up to 50% magic damage reduction at a maximum duration of 10 seconds. Because of this, Celestial Cuffs may be preferred to restore mana.
It may be preferable to rely on the Quick Mana hotkey to quickly restore mana. While this frees up an accessory slot, bear in mind the reduction of mana consumption will no longer be applied.
The Mana Flower sells for more than Nature's Gift and Mana Potion individually. Spare Nature's Gift should be crafted into Mana Flowers before being sold for maximum profit (~50s each).
Although the Mana Flower is crafted from a Mana Potion, its sprite shows a Greater Mana Potion.
If the player's inventory is full when they get a banner, it will drop beside them.
Bosses do not have banners. Instead, they have trophies. These do not however grant any buffs.
If an NPC lands the killing blow on an enemy that would have dropped a banner, the last player to hit the enemy receives the banner.

The effective range of the buffs from banners is based on the center of the player's view, not where the player is positioned. This can be proven by using Binoculars or a gun equipped with the Sniper Scope or its upgrades.
Banners can be hung off platforms. On Old-gen console and 3DS, this is only possible if the platforms are in their bottom position (after being struck with a hammer ).

Each banner may be placed in a right- or left-facing orientation, but this is decided by which tile column in the world the banner is placed. Placing it one block to the left or right will flip the orientation.
The left half of the Nymph Banner is of the Lost Girl "NPC", while the right half is the Nymph monster.

Diggers share the same Banner and kill count with their pre-Hardmode counterparts, the Giant Worms. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The same applies to Moss Hornets and Wandering Eyes, which share banners with their pre-Hardmode counterparts: Hornets and Demon Eyes.
The Tortured Soul does not have a banner.
Similarly, the Maggot Zombie does not have its own banner; however, the Zombie Banner does offer a buff against it.

The Hoplite and Medusa Banners are the only banners that do not show a picture of the monster on it. Instead, each resembles dark green banners with golden Greek patterns, with the Hoplite and Medusa Banners having a picture of a helm and snake on them respectively.

The Bunny, Bird, Goldfish, and Penguin are the only four critters that have banners of themselves. The four banners still give a buff on attack and defense against the aforementioned critters, even though they cannot actually harm the player.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) While the player has no banner, the Nurse will muse about a hypothetical player banner if spoken to while the player has died at least 25 and less than 100 times (outside of PvP ).
The tooltip is a reference to Wickerbottom 's examination quote for the Tentacle Spike in Don't Starve.

Internally, the Tentacle Spike inflicts a debuff on enemies, which inflicts the damage over time. Because it cannot be inflicted on players, it does not have a name nor tooltip and uses the icon of Distorted as a placeholder. Its buff ID is 337.
Pigronatas have a chance to drop Bacon even in pre-Hardmode.
In terms of duration and effects, Bacon is the second-best food item in the game, tied with the BBQ Ribs and only behind the Golden Delight.

If the player has enough money for it, consider buying Pigronatas in bulk and breaking them, as the Bacon that they drop will grant huge stat boosts for the duration of an entire in-game day. It is also arguably easier to get compared to BBQ Ribs or Golden Delights. However, the effective cost per piece of getting Bacon this way is considerably higher than the 10 GC foregone by using (rather than selling) a Golden Delight, which can be crafted from any gold critter and has twice the duration of Bacon. (See the Pigronata page for full analysis.) If the Party Girl is happy enough (and/or a Discount Card is used), the player can actually buy Pigronatas for less than their average coin drop, resulting in unlimited Bacon if the player has sufficient coins to get about 10 Pigronatas to start with. However, the effective cost per piece of getting Bacon this way is considerably higher than the 10 GC foregone by using (rather than selling) a Golden Delight, which can be crafted from any gold critter and has twice the duration of Bacon. (See the Pigronata page for full analysis.) If the Party Girl is happy enough (and/or a Discount Card is used), the player can actually buy Pigronatas for less than their average coin drop, resulting in unlimited Bacon if the player has sufficient coins to get about 10 Pigronatas to start with.

As Spiked Slimes are exclusively found as part of the fight with King Slime, they are similarly unaffected by the immunity granted by the Royal Gel and will continue to fire projectiles and damage the player on contact.
Defeating a Spiked Slime is not required for the Gelatin World Tour achievement.
Their spikes seem to be made out of hardened gel.
The Spiked Slime, Baby Slime, Slimeling, Crystal Slime, Heavenly Slime, Golden Slime, and Bouncy Slime are the only slimes without their own banner.

While other enemies spawned by bosses, such as the Servants of Cthulhu, have a Bestiary entry, the Spiked Slime does not. This is likely because it is an Expert Mode-exclusive enemy and if it did have a Bestiary entry, it would be impossible to complete it fully in a Classic world.
The Spiked Slime, Jungle Mimic, Golden Slime, and Pirate's Curse are the only killable enemies without Bestiary entries.
If a Spiked Slime is spawned in a Classic world (e.g. via third-party tools), it will have 50 health (instead of 100), even though it can never be encountered in Classic Mode normally.
Coins have their damage values (from a Coin Gun ) listed, and are listed as ammo.
Coin Portals (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) have a rare chance to be opened by Pots.
In addition to the coins most slimes already drop, coins have a small chance to appear as a bonus drop (Desktop, Console, Mobile and 3DS versions).

Coins can be placed to form Coin Piles (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions). Silver Coin Piles can sometimes be found naturally generated in the Underground and Caverns in a Campsite (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), often accompanied by a Campfire and a background object of skeletal remains and in a Pyramid. Silver Coin Piles can sometimes be found naturally generated in the Underground and Caverns in a Campsite (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), often accompanied by a Campfire and a background object of skeletal remains and in a Pyramid.
When thrown in Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), coins disappear and give the player coin luck.

Coins can be researched in Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Although tedious, players can duplicate 100 and work their way up the denominations until they reach 100 PC. A sure way to achieve this is to research Gold or Platinum Bars, then sell them in stacks of 9999. A sure way to achieve this is to research Gold or Platinum Bars, then sell them in stacks of 9999.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Copper, Silver, and Gold Coins are the only items that can have a max stack of 100. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This also makes them the only stackable items that cannot be stacked to the usual maximum stack size of 9999. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This also makes them the only stackable items that cannot be stacked to the usual maximum stack size of 9999.
Coin Portals (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) often spawn in the Underworld due to the large amount of pots.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Due to the transaction properties of portable storage, the maximum amount of money that a player can be considered to be able to spend at one time is exactly 1,739,826 (40 stacks in Piggy Bank (or Money Trough / Chester ) + 40 in Safe + 40 in Defender's Forge + 54 in inventory, with each stack containing 9,999 PC ). However, if you include the player's ability to pick up coins off of the ground this number could theoretically be infinite. This would have to be accomplished with a money-making contraption that allows the player to automatically pick up coins such as an extremely efficient mob farm so that as the player is buying items they gain more money than they are spending.

Depending on the version, coins may or may not have a sell value. Coins do not have a sell value. Coins have a selling price equal to the amount in their stack, but cannot be sold. Interestingly, this means that they have an internal buy value equal to 5× what they are worth (meaning buying 1 Gold Coin would cost 5 GC ). Verify Coins can be sold on the Wii U and Xbox editions. Doing so will do nothing, however. Coins do not have a sell value. Coins have a selling price equal to the amount in their stack, but cannot be sold. Interestingly, this means that they have an internal buy value equal to 5× what they are worth (meaning buying 1 Gold Coin would cost 5 GC ). Verify Coins can be sold on the Wii U and Xbox editions. Doing so will do nothing, however.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Depending on their value, some coins will appear larger than others. The Platinum Coin is the tallest and widest coin (14×16 Pixels), Gold Coins are 2 pixels less wide (12×16), Silver Coins' dimensions are 2 pixels shorter than the Gold Coin (12×14) and Copper Coins' dimensions are 2 pixels shorter than the Silver Coin (12×12), making the Copper Coin the smallest.

A Platinum Coin is worth 1,000,000 Copper Coins. Knowing how much space there is in a world, we can see how much space this many coins would take. Placing all of these Copper Coins would take up 4.9% of the area in a Large world, 8.6% of a Medium world, 19.8% of a (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) Small / Expanded world, and 63.4% of a Normal / Tiny world. Knowing how much space there is in a world, we can see how much space this many coins would take. Placing all of these Copper Coins would take up 4.9% of the area in a Large world, 8.6% of a Medium world, 19.8% of a (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) Small / Expanded world, and 63.4% of a Normal / Tiny world.

Purchasing every NPC item requires the following number of coins: (although NPC happiness (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) may increase or decrease these numbers) 27 PC 18 GC 73 SC 74 CC Verify Unknown Verify 27 PC 18 GC 73 SC 74 CC Verify Unknown Verify

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Although coins are considered as ammunition due to being fired by the Coin Gun, they cannot legitimately be placed in the ammunition slot, only in the coins slot.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) If you click "Deposit All" in the storage item, then in this storage and in the player inventory all coins that can be combined into higher denominations will be combined, even if no item will be deposited.

When paired with Lightning Aura and using Morning Star or Kaleidoscope, the critical strike chance granted by the set bonus and the summon tag critical chance granted by the whip are not simply added up; instead, they will be treated as two independent events. The final critical strike chance would be about 26.67% (Morning Star) / 25% (Kaleidoscope). [1]

The Monk armor and Squire armor both provide melee benefits. While the Squire armor has a higher melee critical strike chance increase, the Monk armor's increased melee speed means that (especially against enemies with low defense) it does more damage overall. This is especially true when accounting for whips which are affected by melee speed bonuses, but not by melee damage bonuses. The Squire armor has more defense and a higher regeneration rate to compensate.

The Monk armor is a powerful armor against the mechanical bosses (once the player has defeated one to get it) and Plantera. Its bonuses are better than Hallowed armor, and having multiple Spider Turret or Lightning Aura sentries makes the fight much easier, especially against Plantera. However, the Holy Protection provided by the Hallowed armor may be preferable. The stationary nature of Lightning Auras makes it inefficient against The Twins and Skeletron Prime. The Queen Spider may be better, however, the mobility of this weapon is limited to the ground. It may be wise to swap out the Spider Helmet for a Monk's Bushy Brow Bald Cap when using the Spider armor. This is due to the fact that it provides a melee speed bonus, which also applies to whips. This will make it perform as a Hardmode Obsidian armor of some sort. The stationary nature of Lightning Auras makes it inefficient against The Twins and Skeletron Prime. The Queen Spider may be better, however, the mobility of this weapon is limited to the ground. It may be wise to swap out the Spider Helmet for a Monk's Bushy Brow Bald Cap when using the Spider armor. This is due to the fact that it provides a melee speed bonus, which also applies to whips. This will make it perform as a Hardmode Obsidian armor of some sort.

Due to its high attack rate when direct contact is made with the spear, it proves to be quite an effective early-game weapon. It is also one of the first projectile melee weapons one can get access to, on par with the Ice Blade. Being able to attack in any direction and extending into walls makes it an effective weapon against Tomb Crawlers and Man Eaters. It is also one of the first projectile melee weapons one can get access to, on par with the Ice Blade. Being able to attack in any direction and extending into walls makes it an effective weapon against Tomb Crawlers and Man Eaters.

The Storm Spear Shot projectile gives it a greater reach than other early-game spears, making it especially useful in Master Mode where keeping a distance from enemies and early bosses like the Eye of Cthulhu and King Slime is more important due to increased contact damage. It can also light up spaces through walls.

When standing close a one-tile thick wall, the Storm Spear Shot can sometimes be shot through the wall. The more melee speed a player has, the further distance they can shoot through walls, even being able to reach up to 3-block thick walls with enough melee speed. The more melee speed a player has, the further distance they can shoot through walls, even being able to reach up to 3-block thick walls with enough melee speed.
In Don't dig up worlds, the Storm Spear can be obtained from the lower Chests that spawn below the Underground Desert walls with much less risk.

If a Sandstone Chest contains a Thunder Zapper or Bast Statue as its primary item, the player is low enough to obtain the Storm Spear. Otherwise, they need to dig lower before they have a chance of finding one.
It bears an obvious resemblance to the Thunder Zapper, a pre-Hardmode magic weapon which can also be found in Sandstone Chests in the Underground Desert.

As Marshmallows on Sticks do not stack, this food item is somewhat difficult to mass-produce. Still, one may do so by filling their inventory, leaving one slot with a Cooked Marshmallow and one Marshmallow on a Stick in the hotbar. Put the Marshmallows on Sticks on the ground, select the one on the hotbar, and stand at the fire. When the held Marshmallow is cooked, it stacks in the inventory, and a Marshmallow on a Stick on the ground is picked up. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 29 Cooked Marshmallows can be created simultaneously this way since they stack up to 30. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 29 Cooked Marshmallows can be created simultaneously this way since they stack up to 30.
It is the only food item that grants the Well Fed buff for the same duration on all platforms.

The Cooked Marshmallow's tooltip, "'How can I have some more of nothing?'", is a play on s'mores (a contraction of the phrase some more ), a confection popular in North America that is traditionally cooked over a campfire.
The tooltip is also a reference to the 1993 American sports comedy film The Sandlot, in which main protagonist Scott Smalls is offered a s'more without knowing what a s'more is.
The Bestiary entry for the Jungle Slime: " A simple, gelatinous creature that swallows anything and everything whole! It takes a long time to digest anything. "
Pad thai is a stir-fried Thai dish made of rice noodles and various ingredients, cooked without soup, and is considered Thailand's national dish.
The Ancient Chisel's mining speed boost will not stack with the Hand Of Creation. [1] It does stack with other mining speed boosts (e.g. Mining Potion ).
The tooltip is a reference to the phrase, "Modern problems require modern solutions." The phrase originates from a comedy skit by Dave Chappelle, and eventually became a meme.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) All dart-firing weapons benefit from the damage boost of the Shroomite Helmet.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Dart-firing weapons do not benefit from any of the special damage boosts of the three Shroomite headpieces. Nonetheless, they do gain the general bonuses for ranged weapons provided by the armor (e.g. the general increase to ranged damage).
The name Hoppin' Jack is a reference to Spring-heeled Jack, a creature from British folklore.
Players may wish to stock up on Eternia Crystals before defeating the mechanical bosses, in order to save coins.
Despite the fact the Illuminant Bat is slightly stronger than most early Hardmode enemies, using the Night's Edge will take it down in four to five hits.
The Illuminant Bat is a recolor of the Giant Bat.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Despite being a bat, it cannot inflict Feral Bite in Expert Mode. Only Cave Bats, Jungle Bats, Giant Bats, Spore Bats, and Giant Flying Foxes cause this debuff.

There are several other consumable weapons which cause an explosion upon impact, e.g. Grenades. However, these deal ranged damage and are thus not considered part of the explosives class. Despite not being part of the explosives class, any type of Grenade, including Beenades, fulfills one of the requirements needed for the Demolitionist to arrive. Despite not being part of the explosives class, any type of Grenade, including Beenades, fulfills one of the requirements needed for the Demolitionist to arrive.
When fired from certain launchers, rockets of types II and IV destroy blocks within their radius. However, rockets are considered as ammunition.
Explosives always drop all the tiles they destroy.

A maximum of 400 "loose", dropped items can be present in the world at any given time, regardless of whether they are stacked. If more than 400 loose items are created as a result of destruction with explosives, some of them will be lost.
While the Crimson 's Tendon Bow is stronger, the Demon Bow is faster.
The Demon Bow (or its Crimson counterpart) will almost always be craftable after one Eye of Cthulhu kill.

The Chik is a decent melee weapon for early Hardmode, although it does slightly less damage than the Night's Edge. However, the yoyo is able to hit enemies at a faster rate than the Night's Edge, so for some players it could be a better weapon. The Chik can also serve as an alternative to the Crystal Storm.

The name Chik comes from one of the many different yoyos sold by One Drop YoYos, and is the signature model of their sponsored player, Igor Korzhev. Their logo is the symbol listed at the bottom of the item's tooltip.
The Chik is the only craftable One Drop yoyo.
Unlike most shields, the Shield of Cthulhu does not grant knockback immunity.

The Shield of Cthulhu deals melee damage. However, not all melee bonuses can be applied to it. [1] It can receive the following bonuses: Melee damage and melee critical strike chance bonuses. Knockback bonuses from Titan Glove or its upgrades and Titan Potion. It cannot receive the following bonuses: Flasks. Frostbite from Frost armor. Hellfire from the Magma Stone or its upgrades. It can receive the following bonuses: Melee damage and melee critical strike chance bonuses. Knockback bonuses from Titan Glove or its upgrades and Titan Potion. Melee damage and melee critical strike chance bonuses. Knockback bonuses from Titan Glove or its upgrades and Titan Potion. It cannot receive the following bonuses: Flasks. Frostbite from Frost armor. Hellfire from the Magma Stone or its upgrades. Flasks. Frostbite from Frost armor. Hellfire from the Magma Stone or its upgrades.

The damage done by the Shield of Cthulhu is not subject to the usual ±15% randomization, meaning that barring critical hits, it will always do the same amount of damage to enemies with the same defense.
The dash damage increases drastically while in Psycho Knife 's stealth mode.

The Solar Flare armor 's set bonus will override the Shield of Cthulhu's dash ability. The Master Ninja Gear and Tabi will only override it if they are equipped in an accessory slot below the Shield of Cthulhu.
The Shield of Cthulhu's dash works when Cursed. This is because the debuff only applies to items from the inventory, not the accessories.
The player's invulnerability timer resets after they hit something with the Shield of Cthulhu, meaning an enemy can hit the player again right after they have dashed into something. Verify
Enemy kills made with the Shield of Cthulhu's dash will not be counted by the Tally Counter (or its upgrades).

Players can dash to boost themselves to the maximum sprint speed provided by their sprinting accessories. This also works with mounts, like the Unicorn Mount, if the mount is summoned immediately following the dash.

Getting the Shield of Cthulhu early and using the dash defensively will greatly increase a player's survival during boss battles. It remains a very valuable mobility accessory until it is replaced with the Tabi. However, it should be noted that the Tabi is not a direct replacement for the Shield of Cthulhu, since it does not provide any invincibility frames while dashing – one of the Shield of Cthulhu's greatest strengths. However, it should be noted that the Tabi is not a direct replacement for the Shield of Cthulhu, since it does not provide any invincibility frames while dashing – one of the Shield of Cthulhu's greatest strengths.

When dashing below a 1-tile-wide hole and using the ▲ Up key (or otherwise, a hole below and pressing the ▼ Down key), the Shield of Cthulhu allows the player to move through 1-tile-wide holes. This seems similar to a hoik effect and can be useful where there are a lot of these gaps, e.g. in the Dungeon.
The Shield of Cthulhu can be used to effectively defend oneself while fishing, as it is not a weapon that needs to be switched to in the hotbar to use.
One should use caution around terrain hazards as one wrong push of the movement key can send the player hurling straight into that hazard.
The Shield of Cthulhu can be used as a form of reducing damage. Similar to the Slime Mount, dashing and hitting an enemy will grant the player temporary invincibility.
The Shield of Cthulhu can synergize with the Brand of the Inferno to block attacks, granting the Striking Moment buff.

While dashing towards any solid wall, the player can tap the opposite direction as their character comes in contact to perform a wall bounce, conserving speed and instantly changing directions. This also works with other dash items. The directional key does not need to be pressed at the exact moment the character comes in contact with the wall, but must be held as they do.
The Shield of Cthulhu can allow players to use the Jousting Lance and its upgrades relatively safely without a mount, since they will bounce before taking damage.
The Guide to Critter Companionship is a good complement to the Shield of Cthulhu, as it will allow the player to dash through critters without bumping into them.
Dashing into a projectile NPC will safely destroy it; this is a useful tactic against the spell orbs shot by Goblin Sorcerers, Dark Casters, and Fire Imps.

Some mounts will release glowing particles when summoned. If they are summoned during Shield of Cthulhu's dash, the particles will keep their momentum, flying forward before falling downwards, which can be helpful for exploring caves.

If the player is currently moving in one direction, and double taps the opposite direction key while still holding the previous direction key, they will dash in the same direction that they are moving in.
If the Shield of Cthulhu is equipped in a hidden accessory slot, it will still be visible while dashing.
When walking with the Shield of Cthulhu in a visible accessory slot, part of its sprite is cut off during the frame where it is most forward.
The Bestiary entry for the Alien Hornet: " These flying insectoids utilize wormholes to ambush intruders near the celestial pillars. They hunt in pairs and may swiftly evolve. "
Increasing melee speed with accessories and/or armor will increase both the range and flight speed of boomerangs.
Boomerangs have infinite piercing ability when returning, and can return through blocks.
Boomerangs can only have universal modifiers because they cannot have their speed modified.
Since boomerangs are considered melee weapons, they are affected both by accessories such as the Magma Stone as well as buff items such as flasks.
After a certain period of time, if using the Rod of Discord to escape, a boomerang will disappear as it tries to return to the player.

Though it has infinite ammo, the Endless Quiver only counts as one in the ammo count on a weapon (as seen in the lower-right corner of its icon in the closed inventory's hotbar). Consequently, if the player's only ammo (in arrows) left is the Endless Quiver, the ammo count will only read one, instead of infinity.

The Endless Quiver follows the same ammunition priority rules as other ammo types. If held in the inventory, arrows in the dedicated ammo slots will be fired first, followed by those further up and to the left in the player's inventory. While in the ammo slots, those above it will be fired. Players can use this to quickly alternate between infinite and special ammo.

160 wood and stone will yield enough arrows to craft the Endless Quiver. While this is one of the more profitable things that can be done with just wood and stone, the crafting is rather cumbersome for the potential profit.
If using a regular bow or repeater, putting the Endless Quiver in the last ammo slot will provide backup ammo if a player uses all their special arrows (e.g. Ichor, Frostburn, Jester's ).
In contrast, with special bows that transform wooden arrows (e.g. The Bee's Knees or the Marrow ), this item does well in the first slot, providing an endless supply of arrows to transform.

Players using an Endless Quiver exclusively gain no benefit from effects that decrease ammo consumption, and are free to dedicate equipment and accessories to other effects. Additionally, there is minimal penalty to using bows or repeaters that always destroy arrows like the Daedalus Stormbow.
This item can be paired with the Molten Quiver to supply infinite flaming arrows.
Players cannot make endless quivers with different types of Arrows.
Despite needing to be crafted during Hardmode, its rarity is 02*.
Prior to 1.4.4, the crafting recipe used to require 4 stacks of Wooden Arrows, as they could only stack to 999.

Even during pre-Hardmode, Lihzahrds and Flying Snakes can spawn outside the Jungle Temple, if the player is standing directly in front of a Lihzahrd Brick Wall (in the Temple's entrance, for example). They pose a very high threat to players with early-game equipment.

Before defeating Plantera, the Lihzahrd Brick Walls will prevent the teleport of following items. The player will not be teleported if the destination is in front of a Lihzahrd Brick Wall. Teleporters, the Rod of Discord, and the Rod of Harmony (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will simply not teleport the player. Pylons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will show the status message " Ancient forces prevent you from accessing this location... " when used, and the player will not be teleported. Teleporters, the Rod of Discord, and the Rod of Harmony (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will simply not teleport the player. Pylons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will show the status message " Ancient forces prevent you from accessing this location... " when used, and the player will not be teleported.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The player cannot remove any traps other than the Wooden Spikes without a Picksaw or a better pickaxe. It is also impossible to see, cut, or place wires in front of Lihzahrd Brick Walls before defeating the Golem. However, Lihzahrd Pressure Plates are still mineable.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) While the explosion-proof Lihzahrd Bricks and the Lihzahrd Altar can only be mined with a Picksaw, most other objects in the Temple, including traps, can be removed with low-tier tools.

In extremely rare cases, it is possible for the Jungle Temple to generate almost entirely outside of the Underground Jungle, with only a small portion of the edge still touching it. This can happen in worlds even without secret seed world generation modifications to the Jungle Temple. If the player is having trouble looking for the Jungle Temple inside the Jungle, it may be best to check the edges of neighboring biomes.

In a For the worthy (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) world, the Jungle Temple is 3× bigger than in a normal world. This often means that finding the temple is trivial as it more often than not extends down into the Underworld. Great caution needs to be made, however, as despite being considered in the temple, the Altar in its natural position causes Golem to enter its enraged state due to being in the Underworld. This can also happen in a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
In a Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) world, the Jungle Temple will generate on the surface.
The Jungle Temple is densely wired. Collecting all wires in the Temple (using the Wire Cutter or The Grand Design ) can net a player over 1000 wires.

The Dangersense Potion is useful for avoiding traps, as the buff also highlights Wooden Spikes in addition to traps and pressure plates. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) An effective way of avoiding the traps in the Temple is to hold a wire-related item ( Wrench, Wire Cutter, or their upgrades, or devices or triggers ) to make placed wires visible. If the player is overwhelmed by Lihzahrds, a way to disable the traps is to shoot at them with some Rocket IV / Mini Nuke II, removing the Pressure Plates and the Wooden Spikes. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) An effective way of avoiding the traps in the Temple is to hold a wire-related item ( Wrench, Wire Cutter, or their upgrades, or devices or triggers ) to make placed wires visible. If the player is overwhelmed by Lihzahrds, a way to disable the traps is to shoot at them with some Rocket IV / Mini Nuke II, removing the Pressure Plates and the Wooden Spikes.

The traps can be disarmed by directly removing the wires connecting them to Pressure Plates. The Grand Design can be helpful for doing this. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This can only be done after defeating the Golem. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This can only be done after defeating the Golem.
The Lihzahrd Furnace can be sold for 2 GC and since every chest inside the temple contains one, selling excess ones is an effective way of making money.
If the player is having trouble locating the temple, consider using the Clentaminator 's spray to light up the surrounding environment to highlight the Jungle Temple on the map.
The colors of Wires in the Jungle Temple appear to be based on the horizontal position of the pressure plate they originate from.
Life Crystals can generate in the Jungle Temple, although it is extremely rare.

When in use, the Step Stool increases the player's jump reach to 9.335 tiles (assuming no other jump boosts are in effect), which is an increase of 48.88% compared to the default jump reach of 6.27 tiles. This boost is comprised of a lift by 1.625 tiles [1] and a jump duration increase by 5 [2].
The Step Stool is part of the player's hitbox. This means that enemy projectiles that hit the Step Stool do deal damage to the player.

By binding the ↷ Jump button and ▲ Up button to the same key, the Step Stool allows all jumps to reach this height by default, greatly increasing its usefulness. This only works if the player is not moving.
Pairing a Cloud in a Bottle and its variants with the Step Stool can give the player an even higher jump boost.
A Martian Probe will not spawn if the Lunar Events are active, or if a Martian Madness event is already started, or if another Martian Probe exists.
After exiting a world during a Martian Madness event, the screen in the main menu will still have UFOs flying around in the background.
Playing in Expert Mode does not increase the drop rate of Martian Madness items, but it does increase the spawn rate of the Martian Probe.
Exiting the world just before the Martian Probe despawns will prevent the event from occurring.
Martian Saucers can only spawn after 30% of the event has been completed and are much more common after 50% of the event has been completed.

The Martian Madness have location requirements. The player must be no deeper than 67.5 tiles below the surface, and the player must be within 187.5 tiles horizontally of the location of the invasion. If the invasion has reached the center of the world, then the horizontal check can also be satisfied by the player being within 187.5 tiles horizontally of any town NPC, although at a reduced spawn rate. The town NPC's vertical position is not checked and so they can be housed far above or below the arena.

Martian Madness is one of the more difficult events to have occur, due to the fact that its summoning requires a random spawn of a Martian Probe. However, with a proper spawn platform or via the use of a Floating Island towards the outer thirds of the map, it can be "summoned" more easily.

While most minions will not deliberately target the Martian Probe, minions that deal damage on contact can still accidentally kill it before it has the chance to detect players and escape, preventing the event from triggering. Minions should be dismissed if the player is trying to cause an invasion to occur.
Unlike most other enemies in Terraria, Martians have purple blood when killed rather than red.
Martian Madness is one of only two invasion-style events that cannot be manually started by the player, the other being Slime Rain.
On February 25, 2015, Re-Logic released the music for Martian Madness on YouTube, 124 days before the release of the 1.3.0.1 update.
The mana cost is for the initial casting only. Maintaining and directing the missile does not cost additional mana, and the player will regenerate mana while controlling it.
The Magic Missile can fire through water (unlike the Flamelash, a similar guidable weapon).
The Magic Missile's projectiles can be controlled through one-tile-wide gaps.
The missile emits light and can be remotely directed wherever there is continuous empty space, making it a good cave-scouting tool.
The Magic Missile can prove very useful when combined with the Binoculars, increasing the range in which the missile can be guided.
The Magic Missile has a high amount of knockback while being as accurate as the player can move their mouse, allowing them to precisely knock enemies away.

The Flamelash, which is found in Shadow Chests and Obsidian Lock Boxes (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), can be considered an Underworld -tier upgrade to the Magic Missile, having identical functionality but inflicting the On Fire! debuff. The Rainbow Rod, crafted in early Hardmode, also has identical functionality and deals even further damage.

A magic missile spell first appeared in the fantasy tabletop role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons in 1974, and has appeared in countless publications since. In Dungeons & Dragons, the magic missile spell always hits its target, represented in Terraria by the weapon's homing ability. In Dungeons & Dragons, the magic missile spell always hits its target, represented in Terraria by the weapon's homing ability.
Previously, on the Mobile version, the missile could be fired multiple times, stacking into a projectile that could instantly kill most enemies.
The Decay Chamber vaguely resembles a one-eyed monster. It is unknown whether or not this was done on purpose.
In the United States, a SWAT ( special weapons and tactics ) team is a law enforcement unit which uses specialized or military equipment and tactics.
Even though SWAT Helmets are designed to be very resilient in the real world, they do not grant any defense in Terraria.
Due to the nature of Snapthorn's Jungle's Fury buff, switching to another whip while the buff is active will increase its speed for a brief duration.

Between the Leather Whip and Snapthorn, it is usually easier to obtain the Snapthorn first as it is made from craftable materials, while the Leather Whip requires the Zoologist to be present and costs 10 GC. Depending on the player's preference, it may be worthwhile for summoners to venture into the Underground Jungle to collect materials to craft the Snapthorn in the early game, despite the dangers of the biome.
Because tag damage adds a fixed amount of damage per hit, the Snapthorn works well with rapidly-attacking minions like Flinxes and Vampire Frogs, but works poorly with slow minions like Imps.

If the player can switch weapons fast enough, they can get all the melee speed buffs from the Snapthorn, the Durendal, and the Dark Harvest at the same time. Strike an enemy with one, then select the next, and finally select the last whip and receive its bonus. However, this strategy is very impractical without other bonuses, because by the time the player selects the last whip, the first buff might have already run out. The strategy could be complemented by equipping the Obsidian armor, or by only using two of the whips at a time.
Compared to its alternate ore version, the Lead Pickaxe, it has less pickaxe power, deals 1 less damage, and is slightly slower in terms of mining speed.
The Iron and Lead Pickaxes only require 3 Wood to craft, unlike the rest of the early-game pickaxes which all require 4 Wood.
The Iron Pickaxe has an item ID of 1, implying that it is the first item added to the game.

Although the Bat Scepter is superior to the Wasp Gun in terms of base damage and has higher DPS against a single target, the Wasp Gun may be preferred in enclosed places, (such as the Dungeon ), or against large hordes of enemies (such as during events ).

Bats will not start homing in on an enemy immediately; they must travel a certain distance first. Since they are fired in a random cone pattern and disappear rather than ricochet on contact with blocks, this restricts the number of bats that can hit an enemy in confined spaces, especially underground.
Bat projectiles cannot enter water or lava, but can enter honey.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The bats will move faster after they start tracking a target.
It can be considered the " Halloween version" of the Bee Gun and Wasp Gun.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Bat Scepter makes the same sound as wings when fired. On the Old-gen console version, it makes no sound when fired, but sounds like wings when impacting. On the Nintendo 3DS version, it makes a subtle sound similar to that of wings when fired. On the Old-gen console version, it makes no sound when fired, but sounds like wings when impacting. On the Nintendo 3DS version, it makes a subtle sound similar to that of wings when fired.

If the world generated with Silver Ore instead of Tungsten Ore, then the only way to craft the Emerald Staff is to: Gather Tungsten Ore with the Extractinator. Mine Tungsten Ore from another World where it is naturally generated. Collect Tungsten Ore from slimes. Get Tungsten Ore and Tungsten Bars through fishing up crates. Transmute Gold Ore into Tungsten Ore via Shimmer Transmutation. Turn Silver Ore or Bars into Tungsten Ore or Bars via a Chlorophyte Extractinator. Gather Tungsten Ore with the Extractinator. Mine Tungsten Ore from another World where it is naturally generated. Collect Tungsten Ore from slimes. Get Tungsten Ore and Tungsten Bars through fishing up crates. Transmute Gold Ore into Tungsten Ore via Shimmer Transmutation. Turn Silver Ore or Bars into Tungsten Ore or Bars via a Chlorophyte Extractinator.
Due to its somewhat slow projectile speed, this weapon suffers when facing moving aerial targets, such as the Demon Eye.
It will occasionally hit a target twice because of its slow projectiles and ability to pierce one enemy.
It is very useful for fighting hordes of enemies due to its piercing ability.
The bolt will travel at 41 mph until it hits an obstruction or enemy, or until it goes off the map.
On Desktop, Console, and Mobile, Reapers only appear after defeating all three mechanical bosses, while on Old-gen console and 3DS, they appear after only one mechanical boss has been defeated.
Melee speed bonuses extend the sickle projectile's range.
The Death Sickle's projectile can apply melee debuffs, like flasks or the Frost armor 's set bonus of applying Frostbite.
The Death Sickle projectile has a cooldown of 0.42 seconds.

The Death Sickle can be considered a direct upgrade to the Ice Sickle, a weapon obtainable earlier in Hardmode with inferior range, lack of autoswing, and projectiles that do not travel through blocks.

It has somewhat low damage compared to other mid-Hardmode or late-Hardmode weapons, but its projectiles are large and linger in the air for multiple hits that can result in more total damage than other Hardmode weapons.
The fact it can hit large numbers of enemies makes the Death Sickle excellent against crowds of enemies and segmented bosses like The Destroyer.
The Death Sickle is especially useful against Plantera, as it can easily hit her large hitbox as well as take out her spores and tentacles during her second phase with relative ease.
On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, it is a lot harder to obtain this weapon, due to Reapers being uncommon enemies and having significantly lower drop rates.

The Death Sickle can be used for locating caves due to its projectiles traveling through blocks and emitting dim light. Equipping an accessory that causes melee weapons to inflict On Fire!, like the Magma Stone or Fire Gauntlet, makes this lighting strategy much more efficient, due to the additional bright sparks they cause the sickles to produce. Equipping an accessory that causes melee weapons to inflict On Fire!, like the Magma Stone or Fire Gauntlet, makes this lighting strategy much more efficient, due to the additional bright sparks they cause the sickles to produce.
It is useful in the Hardmode Dungeon due to its decent knockback and projectiles moving through blocks. It is notably effective against Diabolists, Necromancers, Bone Lees, and even Paladins.
As with all more uncommon enemies, using a Water Candle or Battle Potion increases the chance for Reapers to spawn, resulting in less time (on average) needed to obtain the Death Sickle.
The Death Sickle's projectile is one of the few player-fired projectiles that consistently travels through blocks.
The weapon's design originates from classic depictions of the Grim Reaper, generally shown wielding a scythe.
Despite its name, the Death Sickle more closely resembles a real-life scythe than a sickle. Moreover, the weapon cannot cut grass.
Slightly surpassed by its alternate ore counterpart, the Adamantite Sword is the second best ore -crafted sword before the player is able to mine Chlorophyte.

The only way to fish the Obsidian Crate in pre-Hardmode without the Hotline Fishing Hook, or either a Lavaproof Fishing Hook or Lavaproof Tackle Bag is to use lava bait ; the Hell Butterfly, Lavafly or Magma Snail.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Hive Pack increases the armor penetration of wasps from 10 to 15, as well as the base damage of the Wasp Gun from 31 to 36. This buff is not listed in-game.
Like the bees of the Bee Gun and many other similar weapons, the wasps will dissipate upon contact with water and lava, but not honey.

Modifiers that increase the Wasp Gun's speed have little positive impact because it deals piercing damage, which limits how often it can hit the same enemy no matter how quickly its projectiles are fired.

It may not be very effective against Hardmode enemies due to the low per-wasp damage and high enemy defense, even though the gun is dropped by Plantera. Because of that (and the fact that the wasps pierce, triggering enemy invincibility), it is more useful not to spawn too many of them and switch to a different weapon after casting some. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The weapon's armor penetration somewhat mitigates this problem. Because of that (and the fact that the wasps pierce, triggering enemy invincibility), it is more useful not to spawn too many of them and switch to a different weapon after casting some. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The weapon's armor penetration somewhat mitigates this problem.
The Wasp Gun is highly effective for farming money with the Lucky Coin during events. The low per-hit damage results in a larger number of hits, netting more money overall.

The Wasp Gun works incredibly well with the set bonus of the Spectre armor (with Mask), due to how every time a wasp hits an enemy it creates multiple projectiles, allowing for more potential DPS, which makes it quite well at dealing with bosses with multiple parts (e.g. Golem ).
Worm-type creatures have a variable number of body segments. For example, a Devourer has 8-12 body segments, and a Giant Worm has 4-6 body segments.

Worm-type creatures always produce a specific sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Roar_1.wav when digging near the player's location (besides Leeches which make no noise when released from the Wall of Flesh), so in most cases it is not only possible to tell when, but even where will it emerge next – and to aim and/or dodge accordingly. The speed of the sound gets faster as the creature gets closer, which can also help.
Weapons that appear to go through blocks, like spears, hurt worms when going through blocks. This does not happen with most other enemies.
Worms can dig through liquids as though they were solids.

If using Autopause at the exact moment a worm is killed, it is possible to see negative numbers when the cursor is hovered over it. This is because, since all segments share the same health, damaging all of them at the same time can lead to the game not realizing that the worm's health is below 0 until after resuming.

All worms save for the Leech, Wyvern, Milkyway Weaver, Phantasm Dragon, and Crawltipede will occasionally cause particles to spawn from the blocks they dig through (1/100 chance each tick [1] ). Note that all worms excluded, except the Leech, typically move through the air. [2]
Weapons that are capable of piercing enemies, like Flying Dragon, Rainbow Gun, or Death Sickle, are exceptionally effective against all types of worms.
It is the only AI that is used by both non- boss enemies and a boss ( Eater of Worlds ).
Due to the Copper Broadsword's stats, it is arguably the weakest of the early game metal broadswords, being generally more useless than the other early game metal broadswords.
There are also other swords that are easier to acquire early game and that deal more damage than the Copper Broadsword, such as the Ebonwood Sword or Shadewood Sword.

While a Kobold Glider is pursuing a target, it will exponentially gain speed over time, making it increasingly more difficult to outrun the longer it is left alive. Gradually, its speed will outmatch any means of player movement and make it impossible to avoid.
Due to them also exploding upon contact with blocks, making a ceiling above the Eternia Crystal can be a useful strategy.
The Kobold Glider can be considered a combination of the Etherian Wyvern and the Kobold.
In combination with Beetle armor, it is a great way to help out players on the team with low maximum health or defense.

It might be better for tanky melee builds and whip -using summoners looking to maximize the effectiveness of their accessories to use Flesh Knuckles to craft a Berserker's Glove instead, which grants auto-swing, increased knockback, and faster attack speed, and use the Paladin's Shield for the Frozen Shield, which reduces damage taken when your life is low.
Naturally, the Hero Shield offers few benefits to a single-player character.
The Hero's Shield grants the most amount of defense out of any accessory.
Normally, it gushes a stream of blood, but if Blood and Gore is off, it instead shoots particles that look like the Cloud in a Bottle as if it were deflating.
Unlike floating light pets, the Crimson Heart will activate Teal Pressure Pads.
Unlike its Corruption counterpart, the Shadow Orb, it cannot be controlled with the arrow keys.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As the Magic Quiver does not boost the damage of ammunition and its damage bonus is additive, its actual damage increase is less than 10%.
Equipping the Magic Quiver will boost the velocity of existing fired arrows, regardless of whether the arrows were fired before the accessory was equipped.
The 10% arrow damage boost of the Magic Quiver can stack with the Molten Quiver and the Stalker's Quiver ; however, arrow velocity and ammo conservation chance do not stack.

Extra arrow velocity works by setting the arrow's extraUpdates value to 1. This does not affect Jester's Arrows, Ichor Arrows, Venom Arrows, or Stakes, as they already have an extraUpdates value of 1 (or greater).

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The arrow damage boost multiplies with other ranged damage boost and adds with the Shroomite Headgear 's. Due to this, it could sometimes do more ranged damage than having the Ranger Emblem equipped.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Magic Quiver increases the knockback of arrows and Stakes by 10% and then rounds down that increased value. [1] Therefore, the effect on the knockback depends on each weapon's base knockback. For most weapons, it has no effect at all due to their base knockback being a low natural number. For all other arrow- and Stake-firing weapons, the effect is listed in the table below. Knockback-affecting modifiers and other knockback boosts are not considered; they cause different results.
Unlike its pre-Hardmode variants, the Snatcher and the Man Eater, the Angry Trapper is affected by knockback.
The Angry Trapper can reach out to about 55 blocks.

Since it often resides inside of blocks, weapons that are capable of attacking through blocks, such as the Crystal Vile Shard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or the Nettle Burst, prove effective.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Like with the Snatcher and Man Eater, destroying the block an Angry Trapper is attached to will kill it instantly without dropping any loot. Because of this, it is not suggested to destroy the block it is attached to, especially when aiming to obtain the Uzi. Because of this, it is not suggested to destroy the block it is attached to, especially when aiming to obtain the Uzi.
The name is a pun on a " trapper ", which is slang for someone who deals illegal drugs. The Uzi dropped by the Angry Trapper is also a pun because "trappers" commonly carry guns such as Uzis.
Despite their name, Hellfire Arrows do not inflict the debuff.

Blood Thorn projectiles spawn from random solid blocks or platforms in a circular area around the cursor. If a solid block obstructs line of sight between the player and the cursor, then projectiles are instead summoned from a circle around the obstruction point, facing the cursor. If no solid, valid tiles are detected within a circular area around the cursor (i.e. the player is both in midair and targeting a point in midair, or when there are no valid tiles for summoning Blood Thorns around the cursor), then they are summoned from the player's hitbox instead. Blood Thorn projectiles cannot be summoned from background blocks (such as Smoke Blocks or Bubbles ) or actuated blocks. They can, however, be summoned into or from liquids. If a solid block obstructs line of sight between the player and the cursor, then projectiles are instead summoned from a circle around the obstruction point, facing the cursor. If no solid, valid tiles are detected within a circular area around the cursor (i.e. the player is both in midair and targeting a point in midair, or when there are no valid tiles for summoning Blood Thorns around the cursor), then they are summoned from the player's hitbox instead. Blood Thorn projectiles cannot be summoned from background blocks (such as Smoke Blocks or Bubbles ) or actuated blocks. They can, however, be summoned into or from liquids.
Blood Thorn projectiles can pierce up to four enemies and linger for approximately 1.5 seconds before dissipating.
The Ice Blocks summoned by the Ice Rod can serve as roots for the Blood Thorns.

In the event that one of each decoration is placed on the tree, the number of possible combinations is 2,904 ( (Old-gen console version) 4,356). Including the possibility of leaving one or more types of decorations blank, the total possible combinations reach 5,039 ( (Old-gen console version) 7,055). Including the possibility of leaving one or more types of decorations blank, the total possible combinations reach 5,039 ( (Old-gen console version) 7,055).

Selling the Beetle Wings instead of the individual components will be more profitable. The wings sell for 8 GC, whereas the components sell for a collective 4 GC 40 SC. It is not profitable to sell any piece of Beetle armor, the ingredients are worth more.
Although Green Mushrooms are available in placed form on the Nintendo 3DS version, breaking one never yields an item.
Players might have more success finding the Green Mushroom in the underground layer than in the caverns, as there is more dirt.
Players can use a Spelunker Potion to highlight the Green Mushroom, making it easier to locate.
The Green Mushroom and Teal Mushroom are the only mushrooms to require mining to uproot.
Green Mushrooms seems to be based on a real mushroom species called Gliophorus psittacinus, a green-colored toadstool with a gray stipe.
Most dyes do not affect the color of this armor much, with a few exceptions like Intense Rainbow Dye.
If the player teleports while the Titanium Barrier buff is active, the shards will quickly move to the player's position instead of teleporting.

A Lightning Aura sentry can be used to continuously refresh the Titanium Barrier set bonus, though Target Dummies and statue-spawned enemies cannot be exploited for this purpose. Traps will not trigger the set bonus at all.
Attempting to catch a Magma Snail with a standard Bug Net will deal 1 damage to the player and inflict On Fire! for 5 seconds / 10 seconds / 13 seconds. [1]

Magma Snails sell for 50 SC, so capturing all Magma Snails that are encountered in the Underworld can be an efficient way to make money. Using Magma Snails as bait for lava fishing can net even higher amounts of money, if the fished items are sold. Using Magma Snails as bait for lava fishing can net even higher amounts of money, if the fished items are sold.
The Magma Snail is not included in the group of Any Snail.

The Magma Snail's shell appears to closely resemble the Demon Conch. Considering Magma Snails are only found in the Underworld, and that the Demon Conch can only be acquired from lava, the Demon Conch may simply be a Magma Snail shell.

The Tendon Bow (or its counterpart, the Demon Bow ) will almost always be craftable after one Eye of Cthulhu kill, because it drops at least 30 Crimtane or Demonite Ore, which can be turned into 10 respective bars.
A tendon is the fibrous connective tissue that connects muscle to bone, which ties into the "flesh" theme of the Crimson. Animal tendons are often used as bow strings and are also called sinew.

Toggles for Actuators and Wires have three states: Bright : actuators/wires of this color will be always displayed at maximum brightness. Classic : actuators/wires of this color will be displayed as normal, with their brightness affected by nearby light sources. Faded : brightness is determined the same way as the Classic state, but actuators/wires of this color will also be semi-transparent. Bright : actuators/wires of this color will be always displayed at maximum brightness. Classic : actuators/wires of this color will be displayed as normal, with their brightness affected by nearby light sources. Faded : brightness is determined the same way as the Classic state, but actuators/wires of this color will also be semi-transparent.

The Mechanical Display toggle have two states: Forced : all Actuators and Wires will be displayed regardless of item held, while their display method is determined by the respective toggle. Normal : all Actuators and Wires will be displayed only if a mechanism -related item is held. Forced : all Actuators and Wires will be displayed regardless of item held, while their display method is determined by the respective toggle. Normal : all Actuators and Wires will be displayed only if a mechanism -related item is held.

Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the Mechanical Lens do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The Mechanical Lens may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.

Having a Mechanical Lens while exploring the Dungeon, Jungle Temple, or deep underground caverns will reveal wires and show where dangerous traps are located. Carrying a Wire Cutter will allow for the disabling of these traps. The Grand Design combines these features.
The Binoculars operate similarly to the Sniper Rifle, the Rifle Scope, and its upgrades, but without the need to press ⚷ Open / Activate with a gun being held.

Viewing an adjacent biome can cause the music and background view to change to those of the adjacent biome. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The same effect occurs for area-of-effect buffs like Campfires or Heart Lanterns, which will take effect if the player shifts the screen view close enough to them, as well as the Metal Detector. Shifting the view will also shift and update the minimap.

Holding the Binoculars will affect NPC spawning, increasing spawn range and the safe range. In other words, enemies will spawn further away from the player while holding the Binoculars. This effect does not occur when the item is in the inventory without being held and hovering over inventory slots while holding it will cancel this effect, much like Magic Missile -type weapons.
If the player stops holding the Binoculars, they can sometimes see enemies despawn while the camera moves back to the player.

On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Binoculars, as well as the Rifle Scope, are obtainable, but they are not functional. This means that the only items that can change the camera's position are the Sniper Rifle and Sniper Scope. Note that the same used to apply for the Mobile version as well, but it is now functional since the 1.3 update. However, the C-stick can be used to change the camera's position, making these items obsolete on the New Nintendo 3DS systems. This means that the only items that can change the camera's position are the Sniper Rifle and Sniper Scope. Note that the same used to apply for the Mobile version as well, but it is now functional since the 1.3 update. However, the C-stick can be used to change the camera's position, making these items obsolete on the New Nintendo 3DS systems.

If the player uses a Magic Missile, Flamelash or Rainbow Rod and then quickly switches to the binoculars while still holding down ⚒ Use / Attack, the player will still be able to control the projectile but will also be able to move the camera around, greatly increasing the range of the projectile.
Binoculars can be used while the game is paused.
Binoculars are very helpful in locating rare enemies detected by the Lifeform Analyzer or its upgrades.

Binoculars are one of the five items that change the camera's position, the other four being the Recon Scope, the Sniper Scope, the Rifle Scope, and Sniper Rifle. Out of these, it is the only one not associated with guns, and it is also the only one that can be obtained pre-Hardmode.
In reality, lead would not be a feasible metal for making anvils. It would not keep its structure very long, due to the low Mohs hardness (1.5) and melting point (600 K) of pure lead.
The anvil is used to craft many items that an actual anvil would not be used for, such as the Amazon yoyo.

The Charm of Myths decreases the duration of Potion Sickness while it is equipped. Equipping it while Potion Sickness is already in effect will proportionally decrease the remaining duration, and unequipping it while Potion Sickness is in effect will proportionally increase the remaining duration. [1] For example, if the player lets half of the normal 60 seconds of Potion Sickness run out and then equips the Charm of Myths, the item will decrease the remaining 30 seconds by 25% to 22.5 seconds. If the player consumes a recovery potion while the Charm of Myths is equipped, lets 25 of the 45 seconds of Potion Sickness run out, and then unequips it, the remaining 20 seconds will be increased by 33.33% [a] to 26.67 seconds. If the player consumes a recovery potion while the Charm of Myths is equipped and then immediately unequips it, the 45 seconds of Potion Sickness will be increased by 33.33% to 60 seconds, i.e. the normal duration. For example, if the player lets half of the normal 60 seconds of Potion Sickness run out and then equips the Charm of Myths, the item will decrease the remaining 30 seconds by 25% to 22.5 seconds. If the player consumes a recovery potion while the Charm of Myths is equipped, lets 25 of the 45 seconds of Potion Sickness run out, and then unequips it, the remaining 20 seconds will be increased by 33.33% [a] to 26.67 seconds. If the player consumes a recovery potion while the Charm of Myths is equipped and then immediately unequips it, the 45 seconds of Potion Sickness will be increased by 33.33% to 60 seconds, i.e. the normal duration.

The reduction effect also works if the regular cooldown is not 60 seconds, such as after consuming a Mushroom (30 seconds, decreased to 22.5 seconds), a Restoration Potion (45 seconds, decreased to 33.75 seconds), or a Strange Brew (up to 70 seconds, decreased to up to 52.5 seconds).
The Charm of Myths' duration reduction effect does not stack with the Philosopher's Stone 's.
Rainbow Slimes can also spawn on Hallowed blocks that are submerged in water.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) One way to encounter Rainbow Slimes in the Hallowed forest biome is to set up a Water Candle inside the edge of the Hallow and wait at this location until it rains, allowing enemies to spawn off screen on non-Hallowed blocks. Alternatively, Hallowed blocks can be covered with snow or bricks of some kind to allow Rainbow Slimes to spawn, though this will prevent other Hallow enemies from spawning. Another way is to place about 200 blocks of Pearlstone, Pearlsand, or Pink Ice above the surface and wait for the rain with the Water Candle and Battle Potion ready. To avoid Forest transformation to Hallow, proper spacing is required. Rainbow Slimes are also able to spawn on platforms. Setting up a large number of platforms may thus increase the likelihood of discovering one. The platforms must be somewhere off-screen, as enemies normally cannot spawn on the same screen as the player. Another way is to place about 200 blocks of Pearlstone, Pearlsand, or Pink Ice above the surface and wait for the rain with the Water Candle and Battle Potion ready. To avoid Forest transformation to Hallow, proper spacing is required. Rainbow Slimes are also able to spawn on platforms. Setting up a large number of platforms may thus increase the likelihood of discovering one. The platforms must be somewhere off-screen, as enemies normally cannot spawn on the same screen as the player.
The Rainbow Slime is the largest non-boss slime and deals the most damage out of all slimes, surpassing King Slime and Queen Slime (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
If the player shoots a Rainbow Slime with a Heart Arrow (3DS version), it will fade to a gray color, but will return after the effect is over.
Unlike water, honey can exist in The Underworld.
Honey greatly reduces visibility compared to water, even when lit with multiple Torches.
Rain will not turn honey to Honey Blocks.
Honey is subject to all the infinite replication methods.

Since honey does not evaporate in The Underworld, a player could use an infinite replication method to flood The Underworld and provide safe (albeit slow without water-walking or something like Fishron Wings ) passage without having to worry about falling into lava or spending extra time and effort building bridges over lava pools. This also makes a pool of honey a viable solution for a permanent safe landing zone at the bottom of a Hellevator.

Honey can be valuable while fighting any boss as the regeneration boost can protect weaker players. In conjunction with Heart Lanterns and campfires, the resulting regeneration boost can negate the need for the Band of Regeneration, freeing up an accessory slot.
Using the Lava Shark Mount (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) makes it possible to continually receive the regeneration boost while retaining or even improving mobility.
By creating a circle of Bubbles and putting a bucket of honey in, the player can quickly run through to get the health regeneration boost without much loss in speed.
By using Flipper Potions, the player can reduce the effect of moving through honey even further.
Traps such as Boulders can be slowed down to allow for more damage output that would otherwise have been lost to invincibility frames.

The Lunatic Cultist Mask is arguably the most tedious to obtain, not because of the difficulty of the Lunatic Cultist's boss fight, but because it is impossible to farm it without spawning in and completing the Lunar Events likely multiple times.

After updating to a Desktop 1.3 -equivalent, the Ocram Mask became unobtainable on Console. Any Ocram Mask already existing in character inventories or worlds was converted into a Lunatic Cultist Mask in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It is impossible to obtain on the Nintendo Switch version, as Ocram was never available on this version. Any Ocram Mask already existing in character inventories or worlds was converted into a Lunatic Cultist Mask in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It is impossible to obtain on the Nintendo Switch version, as Ocram was never available on this version.

Three of the masks have animations: The King Slime, Queen Slime (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Moon Lord (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Masks will move around when the player moves left or right.

The only event bosses that drop masks are those from the Old One's Army (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) event; the Dark Mage, the Ogre, and Betsy. However, most event bosses do drop trophies. However, most event bosses do drop trophies.
The Ogre Mask has a duplicate which is unobtainable.
This item is unrelated to the Beams type of background item, such as the Wooden Beam or Boreal Beam.
If the Item IDs associated with each item are assumed to indicate when they were implemented, Adamantite Beams were likely the very first 1.2 item to be implemented.
The texture of a 4×4 square of Adamantite Beams loosely resembles the top surface of a crafting table in the 3D sandbox game Minecraft, but in different colors.
General color of ears corresponds to character 's skin color.
Though it provides considerable defense, Turtle armor's bonuses to melee damage and critical strike chance are barely higher than those of Cobalt armor and Molten armor.
If one intends to craft both chest pieces of the Beetle armor, a total of 78 Chlorophyte Bars (390 Chlorophyte Ore) and 4 Turtle Shells are required to craft the whole Beetle armor set.

The set's Thorns effect cannot be improved by the Thorns Potion buff nor the Dryad's Blessing (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) buff. It deals twice as much damage as a Thorns Potion but is otherwise identical.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The reflected damage is decreased by banners (25% / 50% ), rerolled inversely by luck (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (having negative luck will give a chance to increase incoming damage, and thorns as a result) and capped at 1000 damage.

The passive Thorns effect usually allows players to ignore weak enemies that rely on contact damage, especially when combined with a shield for knockback immunity. However, the Thorns effect deals negligible damage compared to most Hardmode weapons, causing it to be relatively worthless for boss fights. The effect also does not activate when players are hit by lasers or other projectiles that bosses tend to use. However, the Thorns effect deals negligible damage compared to most Hardmode weapons, causing it to be relatively worthless for boss fights. The effect also does not activate when players are hit by lasers or other projectiles that bosses tend to use.

Turtle armor works well as a support set for multiplayer since it draws aggro from enemies and bosses. It pairs well with the Paladin's Shield and both of its upgraded versions, increasing the survivability of the player's teammates as well as their own.

Unlike the Helmet and Leggings, the Turtle Scale Mail has relatively decent offensive stats. It can be combined with a Chlorophyte Mask or Hallowed Mask and Squire's Greaves (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) for a much stronger offensive melee set, though it lacks the 15% damage reduction and Thorns effect of full Turtle armor.
On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Turtle armor can be seen as the Hardmode counterpart of the Cactus armor.
Any Chest type can spawn this item and it will generate alongside any loot already generated in that Chest.

This item is an excellent starting armor option which provides equivalent defense to a full set of Wood armor, increases base jump reach from 6.27 to 10.02 tiles, and has 5 times the speed boost of an Aglet.

The Moon Lord Legs can safely substitute the leg parts of some early armor sets, providing a mobility boost as well as a defense bonus in some cases: Armors crafted from any type of wood (excluding Ash Wood armor ) only have +1 defense as a set bonus, with the greaves having either 1 defense as well or, in the case of regular Wood Greaves, no defense at all. As a result, replacing them with Moon Lord Legs gives a net defense bonus of +1 or +2 respectively. Replacing the leg parts of Copper armor or Tin armor (both have 2 defense set bonus, while the corresponding greaves only have 1 defense) gives no net bonus to defense, but still may be useful because of improved mobility. Doing the same with Iron armor will result in 1 less defense, because the Iron Greaves and the set bonus give a total of 4 defense, but this can be compensated with a Shackle, potentially allowing to save enough Iron Bars for both a Pickaxe and a Broadsword. For the Lead armor, the total loss is 2 defense, and for the higher-tier metal armors it only gets bigger. However, the Moon Lord Legs are made less useful this far into the game by such mobility accessories as Cloud in a Bottle and Hermes Boots, as well as Hooks. The Moon Lord Legs provide an excellent synergy for early game mages using the Wizard Set, as those sets' bonuses are not inhibited by equipping leg slot armor. Some experimentation may be required to find an ideal combination, but the right Wizard Set variant coupled with the Moon Lord Legs could potentially be preferable over Meteor or even Jungle armor. The Moon Lord Legs can also pair well with Rain armor due to it also lacking leg armor. If one wishes to keep the original set’s visuals while wearing the Moon Lord Legs, they can equip the corresponding armor’s leg piece in a social slot.
