The Moon Lord's legs are a recurring in-joke in the Terraria community. This item was introduced by Redigit as a joke answer to a petition to add the Moon Lord's legs to the game as a boss.
The tooltip "'These might be Steve's'" is a reference to the fact that Arkhayla jokingly claimed the Moon Lord to be named Steve and to be Cthulhu 's brother. [1]
The Creeper Pants and the Moon Lord Legs are the only pieces of clothing to have more than two visible legs.
Approximately slightly above lava level, a larger and more powerful version of Armored Skeletons can spawn. It is called "Heavy Skeleton" internally.
Armored Skeletons are one of two sources of Armor Polish before having defeated Plantera, the other is Shimmer transmutation with Vitamins.
Armored Skeletons appear to be wearing a bluer variation of the Ancient Cobalt Breastplate with spiked shoulder guards.

The Heavy Skeleton variant is one of the few enemies whose health does not increase in Expert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Because of this, their health is actually considerably lower than the regular armored skeleton in the latter, and comparable in the former.

Due to the high damage output and infinite piercing of the charged laser, the Charged Blaster Cannon is extremely useful for horizontal crowd control or against segmented bosses such as The Destroyer.

The fully charged laser is comparable to the Last Prism 's fully converged beam, but it deals 87.5% less damage: The Last Prism's beam deals 300 base damage 12 times per second (3600 base damage each second), whereas the Charged Blaster Cannon's beam deals 150 base damage 3 times per second (450 base damage each second).

Due to how the Charged Blaster Cannon only consumes mana on the first shot of each of the orb bursts but consumes mana on each damage tick of channeling the laser, the player may wish to only charge the weapon up to the point of it firing the third large orb and stop charging the weapon before it fires the laser if they wish to use mana as resourcefully as possible. This allows them to fire 6 of the small orbs and 3 of the large ones at the cost of only twice the weapon's mana cost (28 base mana). Channeling the laser will, however, in most cases reward higher DPS compared to only shooting the orbs and then restarting the attack cycle repeatedly. This allows them to fire 6 of the small orbs and 3 of the large ones at the cost of only twice the weapon's mana cost (28 base mana). Channeling the laser will, however, in most cases reward higher DPS compared to only shooting the orbs and then restarting the attack cycle repeatedly.

The Charged Blaster Cannon is a reference to the video game character Mega Man, who uses a similarly shaped cannon called the Mega Buster. The Mega Buster can be similarly charged before firing, a feature of the Mega Buster since Mega Man 4, and the Charged Blaster Cannon's appearance as part of the player's arm when selected mimics the fact that Mega Man's robotic body has the gun built into his arm, along with the weapon's circular appearance.
The Charged Blaster Cannon has the smallest sprite of any weapon in the game.

In don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) seeds, the Ice Bow receives the following changes: Switched place with Snowball Cannon. As a result, it is found in Frozen Chests, or dropped by Ice Mimics during pre-Hardmode, instead of dropped by Ice Mimics during Hardmode. Damage decreased from 39 to 8. Use time increased from 14 to 17. Value decreased from 25 GC to 10 GC. Switched place with Snowball Cannon. As a result, it is found in Frozen Chests, or dropped by Ice Mimics during pre-Hardmode, instead of dropped by Ice Mimics during Hardmode. Damage decreased from 39 to 8. Use time increased from 14 to 17. Value decreased from 25 GC to 10 GC.
Like other bows that fire special arrows, the Ice Bow is especially effective to use with the Endless Quiver.

The Ice Bow is very similar in function to the Marrow, as they are both early Hardmode weapons obtainable underground, both shoot a unique high-velocity projectile, and before 1.4.0.1, had a very similar stat distribution.
This item cannot be obtained in a world where Skeletron has already been defeated, as Dungeon Guardians will no longer spawn.

Similar to the Zephyr Fish, the head that follows the player will not teleport to them when they end up a long distance away from it but instead keep moving towards the player. One can instantly teleport it back to themselves by toggling the visibility of it off, then back on again in their pet slot. Alternatively, if being used as a summon from the player's inventory, they can simply re-summon it. Alternatively, if being used as a summon from the player's inventory, they can simply re-summon it.
The Bone Key is most likely designed and named after a 19th century bit key, known erroneously and commonly as a skeleton key.
Despite being extremely difficult to acquire, it only sells for 5 GC.
Even though the base damage can be amplified with armor, accessories, and buffs, the continuous damage of one Bone Javelin will still be 3 damage per second.

Bone Javelins appear to have a strange effect on Granite Golems. When the Granite Golem turns invincible by crossing its arms, all Bone Javelins will immediately disappear, but 1 damage will be dealt multiple times to the Granite Golem when the invincibility wears off. This is probably due to the damage over time being inflicted by having negative health regeneration, while the Granite Golem does not reset its regeneration stat immediately when turning invincible.

The Bone Javelin is a great supporting weapon in pre-Hardmode boss fights, even after obtaining better weapons. Since 6 stacks are the maximum for the Penetrated debuff, landing 6 shots and changing to the main weapon with higher DPS will maximize the damage output.
The Penetrated debuff can never be applied to players, so it lacks a unique debuff icon. It uses the Distorted debuff's icon as placeholder.
Bone Javelins act similar to a Daybreak which both stick to an enemy and inflict a stacking damage debuff.

The summoned Pygmies do not deal damage themselves. Instead, they attack by throwing spears twice per second, which have varying properties depending on the version: (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Spears do not pierce enemies, and vanish on the first target hit. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The first spear thrown per volley will pierce through enemies. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Spears do not pierce enemies, and vanish on the first target hit. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The first spear thrown per volley will pierce through enemies.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The aim of the summoned Pygmies is somewhat inaccurate, so they might miss even relatively close and static targets, let alone moving ones.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Having the Pygmy Staff in the inventory unlocks extra items in the Witch Doctor 's shop, namely the Pygmy Necklace, Hercules Beetle, and Tiki armor.
Each time a Pygmy is summoned, it randomly has one of four possible sprites. However, they are all functionally identical.
The Pygmy catches up to fast-moving players by flying through the air while standing, sitting, or hanging onto its spear.

The Pygmy Staff is one of only four weapons in the game that can inflict Acid Venom without any external buffs or bonuses, the others being the Spider Staff, the Venom Staff, and the Queen Spider Staff.

In real life, the anthropological term for pygmy peoples refers to ethnic groups whose average height is relatively short. It is primarily associated with the African Pygmies, hunter-gatherer tribes originating from the Congo Basin.
The flight time is cumulative, which means that it can be broken up into split-second bursts.
The flight time cannot be stacked with its upgrades.
Spectre Boots have a maximum ascent speed of 38 mph.
When paired with wings, the flight of Spectre Boots will be disabled. Instead, it directly adds 0.7 seconds to the wings' flight time.
Regardless of which boots are used to craft them, Spectre Boots will always use the Hermes Boots' dust particles for its running animation.
Dyes can be used to color the boots and their particles.
Despite having "Spectre" in its name, the Spectre Boots are not made from either Ectoplasm or Spectre Bars.
Mounting in mid-air while flying will, for a split-second, blow out Rocket Boots particles. This also happens if the player un-equips a mount while flying, though it lasts a bit longer.
Although its rarity is 04*, it can be easily obtained pre-Hardmode.
Explosions created by this weapon will not damage the player who fired it.
On the Old-gen console version, rockets fired by the Snowman Cannon cannot destroy tiles.

The Snowman Cannon is the strongest launcher that keeps the effects of special rockets ( Liquid Rockets, Cluster Rockets, etc.), and the only one to do so without dealing self-damage. This makes it not only a versatile weapon but also the fastest way to create and remove liquids directly.
When used against large hordes of enemies, especially The Destroyer and other worms, the Snowman Cannon will deal massive amounts of damage, sometimes more than the Coin Gun with Platinum Coins.

If a rocket fails to hit an enemy, it will usually turn back and continue the chase, though the wide turning radius often prevents this from happening outside open spaces. This may lead to accidents that will destroy blocks.
If a rocket loses its current target, it will track the next closest enemy, otherwise, it will continue on its flight path.

In PvP, it can do immense amounts of damage if used with accessories boosting ranged damage and the Shroomite armor (with Helmet), dealing around 250 damage per shot only using Rocket III. However, rockets do not home on players, meaning that careful aim is required.
Despite its name and appearance, it is not an upgrade to the Snowball Cannon ; therefore, it cannot use Snowballs as ammunition.
The Snowman Cannon fires snowman-themed missiles, hence its name.
When thrown in the Corrupt, Crimson, and Hallowed Deserts, the World Globe will only affect the normal Desert biome.
When thrown in underground variants of biomes such as the Underground Jungle, the surface variant will be affected by the World Globe.
When thrown in the Underworld, the World Globe will change the dynamic background of the Underworld, unlike the other underground biome backgrounds.

The World Globe projectile is considered a ranged projectile internally, therefore it benefits from ammo conservation. However, this is limited to ammo conservation bonuses provided by armor items – the Magic Quiver, Ammo Box, and Ammo Reservation Potion have no effect on the World Globe. [1]

Completing the Old One's Army event on any difficulty sets a hidden attribute for both the world it was completed on and the character who completed it. Any characters, including newly made ones, who visit that world may then use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world. The character who completed the event may also use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world.
The Explosive Trap has a cooldown of 1.5 seconds after attacking. With the Huntress armor, this cooldown is reduced to 1 second, and with the Red Riding armor, it is reduced to 0.5 seconds.
The sentry detects and damages enemies within a 9×9-tile rectangle centered 3 tiles above it. [2] This means that its range is 7.5 tiles above, 1.5 tiles below, and 4.5 tiles to either side.
The Explosive Trap has a faint glow, and can be used to see into nearby surrounding caves.

The Explosive Trap fires slowly and has a fairly insignificant range. When combined with Huntress armor or Red Riding armor, it fires much faster and benefits from the summon damage boosts of those sets. A cluster of 3 or 4 traps at each portal in the Old One's Army event can kill everything but Ogres before they leave the damage area.
Despite the Princess Fish being available on the Nintendo 3DS version and having "Material" listed in its tooltip, the Love Potion cannot be crafted due to a lack of Shiverthorn in the game.

It can be created and used in pre-Hardmode worlds if an artificial Hallowed sea or lake is created for fishing – or if either Princess Fish or the Love Potion itself is transferred to the world by a Hardmode player.
Since the Princess Fish ( 25 SC ) sells for more than the Love Potion ( 40 CC ), it is more profitable to sell the fish than it is to sell the potions.

Lovestruck is considered a debuff because it cannot be terminated manually and the Nurse charges money for removing it, similar to other debuffs. Despite this, the debuff icon has a blue background, which usually indicates a buff. This might be because the Love Potion is used to " make someone fall in love", which could imply that the target is unable to remove the effect. This might be because the Love Potion is used to " make someone fall in love", which could imply that the target is unable to remove the effect.
Below the quote used to be a GUI with a help button, similar to the Guide 's, but pressing this help button sometimes crashed the game.
Mc MoneyPants had only one line. This line is shared by the Merchant.
Although practically guaranteed in normal gameplay, the shaft can only generate with a height of up to 1000 tiles.
The shrine will only rarely spawn below the surface layer and will only ever reach a maximum of 100 tiles in the underground layer.
While Enchanted Sword Shrines only generate on the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Enchanted Swords can still appear scattered throughout the world in all versions.

Enchanted Sword Shrines may generate in uncommon ways at times: The shaft can go all the way to the surface, making it very easy to notice. It can even go to the top of a Living Tree. The shrine itself can occasionally spawn on the surface, without a shaft. In rare cases, the top of the shaft spawns more than 10 tiles under the ground. The shrine itself can generate partially or completely Corrupted / Crimson. However, at least part of the shaft will always be dirt and uncorrupted grass. If generated under an overhang on the surface, the shaft will cut through midair. The shaft can go all the way to the surface, making it very easy to notice. It can even go to the top of a Living Tree. The shrine itself can occasionally spawn on the surface, without a shaft. In rare cases, the top of the shaft spawns more than 10 tiles under the ground. The shrine itself can generate partially or completely Corrupted / Crimson. However, at least part of the shaft will always be dirt and uncorrupted grass. If generated under an overhang on the surface, the shaft will cut through midair.

The shaft can be revealed by light particles that fall downwards through blocks. There are many weapons which spawn projectiles of this kind, for instance, the Dark Lance, Starfury, Jester's Arrow, Meteor Staff, Solar Eruption, Zenith, Flying Dragon, Flamelash, or numerous explosives. Some enemy projectiles can also reveal the shaft, e.g. those fired from the Goblin Sorcerer. Additionally, some mount provides a short burst of light particles when summoned, and if timed correctly, activating/deactivating a mount just before landing can send the light particles downwards 5–7 tiles. Some light pets that move when the player presses a direction (such as the Wisp pet, shown in the gallery below ) can be used to find the shafts by holding ▼ Down. The Clentaminator can also be used to provide light, though players should be careful not to spread biomes in locations they did not want. The background object will generate an item upon its destruction. Therefore, the player can force-close the game to reload a previous save and continue doing this until the desired item is obtained.

World Seeds with Enchanted Sword Shrines found before the current version of Terraria will not be guaranteed to contain a shrine in the same location despite the rest of the world being the same. If looking online for a seed that contains a shrine make sure that the seed was not discovered in a past update.

On the Desktop version 1.4.4.9, an Enchanted Sword Shrine can always be found in a world with the seed 1.1.1.235012488 ( small, any difficulty, Corruption ). It is visible from the surface simply by going left to 186′ West and falling into the hole there.

The tooltip, " 'You want the moon? Just grapple it and pull it down!' ", is a reference to the quote "You want the moon? Just say the word and I'll throw a lasso around it and pull it down!" by George Bailey, protagonist of the 1946 American Christmas fantasy drama movie It's a Wonderful Life.

When using the Lunar Hook, the color fired always follows this order: First orange (Solar), second green (Vortex), third pink (Nebula), and finally blue (Stardust). Because the Lunar Hook always follows this pattern, it is possible to cycle through the different hooks (i.e., shooting them out without latching onto an object) and latch onto objects with whichever desired color. Therefore, it is also possible to have four of the same type of hook out (four Solar, Nebula, Vortex, or Stardust hooks) at a time. Because the Lunar Hook always follows this pattern, it is possible to cycle through the different hooks (i.e., shooting them out without latching onto an object) and latch onto objects with whichever desired color. Therefore, it is also possible to have four of the same type of hook out (four Solar, Nebula, Vortex, or Stardust hooks) at a time.
Meteorite, Obsidian and Luminite are not considered ores by the game. They do not have "ore" in their names and mining them does not unlock the Ooo! Shiny! and Extra Shiny! achievements.
Chlorophyte Ore is not counted as a Hardmode ore for the Extra Shiny! achievement.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Using Shimmer Transmutation, almost all ores are obtainable by Shimmering down the ore that's considered one tier above. The ore "Shimmer chain" is as follows: Luminite → Chlorophyte Ore → Titanium Ore → Adamantite Ore → Orichalcum Ore → Mythril Ore → Palladium Ore → Cobalt Ore → Platinum Ore → Gold Ore → Tungsten Ore → Silver Ore → Lead Ore → Iron Ore → Tin Ore → Copper Ore Notably, Demonite Ore, Crimtane Ore, and Hellstone are excluded from the chain, as are the already-dubious Obsidian and Meteorite. Luminite → Chlorophyte Ore → Titanium Ore → Adamantite Ore → Orichalcum Ore → Mythril Ore → Palladium Ore → Cobalt Ore → Platinum Ore → Gold Ore → Tungsten Ore → Silver Ore → Lead Ore → Iron Ore → Tin Ore → Copper Ore

Each Hardmode ore is chosen at the moment the first three altars in the world are broken. Ores can be "chosen" by quitting the world without saving (by ending the task or killing the process) after smashing the first altars. It is more easily done with a server, using the exit-nosave command. Autosave should be disabled for this. Otherwise, the game might be saved just after smashing the altar and before quitting the world. Autosave should be disabled for this. Otherwise, the game might be saved just after smashing the altar and before quitting the world.

All ores except Hellstone and Obsidian are highlighted by the Spelunker buff, making it easy to find veins of ore. Hellstone is not lit up by the buff, but it is by a Dangersense Potion. Obsidian easily appears around lava.
Using a Crate Potion will improve the chances of obtaining crates and as such the ore-bearing Wooden Crates.

Filling in caves with spare natural blocks such as dirt before destroying altars can cause Hardmode ores to spawn in them. They can then also be seen on the minimap, presenting an easy way to convert extra blocks into ores with knowing their exact location.
In the Nintendo 3DS version, the Palladium Pickaxe and Drill can mine Adamantite and Titanium.

Most ores sell for the same as or more than the bars made from them, exceptions being the late pre-Hardmode ores ( Meteorite, Hellstone, and (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Demonite / Crimtane ) and Chlorophyte, all of which are far more profitable as bars. (Hellstone and Obsidian are unsaleable as ores, and there is no Obsidian Bar).

Two ways to quickly find Hardmode ores is to use previously discovered Abandoned Minecart Tracks (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or search along the ceiling of The Underworld. Both of these methods feature large cave systems along a significant horizontal distance, the Minecart Tracks allow the player to outrun dangerous enemies, and pre- mechanical boss Hardmode enemies in the Underworld spawn rarely and are easy to avoid.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Hellstone's item sprite is a recolor of that of Silver Ore.

Hellstone is the only ore that cannot be infinitely generated within a single world. Others can be obtained from sources such as crates, an Extractinator, bosses, duplicable liquids, Meteorite crashes, and Mud. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Chlorophyte is limited by the amount of Mud (and Dirt) in the world, due to the absence of Dirt Bombs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Chlorophyte is limited by the amount of Mud (and Dirt) in the world, due to the absence of Dirt Bombs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Iron and Lead are the only ore types without a respective brick type.
Luminite sells for the most of any ore, 30 SC per piece.
Palladium, Cobalt, and Titanium are the only Hardmode ores named after real metals.
Luminite is the only ore that does not use either a Furnace or Hardmode Forge to craft bars, instead requiring the Ancient Manipulator.
Its texture can sometimes be confused with actuators, but it can be distinguished by looking for the yellow in the middle to avoid confusion.
Pigrons are purple in the Underground Corruption, pink in the Underground Hallow, and red in the Underground Crimson.

Pigrons can only spawn on Snow Blocks, Thin Ice, Ice Blocks, and Pink Ice Blocks [1] [2]. The type of ice is irrelevant when the game is deciding what type of Pigron to spawn (i.e. a Corrupt Pigron can spawn on Pink Ice Blocks as long as the player is considered in the Corruption ). The type of ice is irrelevant when the game is deciding what type of Pigron to spawn (i.e. a Corrupt Pigron can spawn on Pink Ice Blocks as long as the player is considered in the Corruption ).
When the Pigron growls, it sounds like an oddly distorted boss noise when summoned or attacking.

In rare cases, Underground Cabins will have a functional trap consisting of a pressure plate and a Pigron Statue. This allows them to be spawned pre-Hardmode, however, they will not have any drops. The variant is randomized when they are spawned this way.

For a Pigron to turn transparent and phase through blocks, its direct line of sight to the player must have been obstructed by blocks for an extended period of time. Therefore, it is possible to trap Pigrons by allowing them a hole for them to observe the player at all times but making it not large enough for them to pass.
Utilizing the Hunter Potion makes finding and dispatching a Pigron much easier, as it is highlighted in red when it would normally be nearly invisible.
It is recommended to pay attention to growls while in the Ice biome, since Pigrons will usually be heard sooner than they are seen, and the sounds they make are unique.

The Pigron Statue can be used to easily unlock all three variants in the Bestiary (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), saving the player the trouble of having to create all of the respective biomes.
Pigron is a portmanteau of the words pig and dragon. This was confirmed by Cenx in the IRC.
Despite Pigrons coming in three different color variants, the banner, minecart, and the Scaly Truffle 's Pigron Mount are always pink.
There is a discontinued Pigron plush sold in real life by Toynk Toys, based on its purple appearance in the Underground Corruption. [3]

Early options for food include regular Mushrooms, shaking trees, converting Vertebrae or Rotten Chunks into Monster Lasagna, and getting the Merchant to move in to buy a Bug Net (or to buy Marshmallows if he is in a Snow biome ).
The Mining Helmet, Jellyfish Necklace and Magiluminescence can help keep the darkness away before light pets are found.
To avoid damage from cacti while retaining Desert enemy spawns, place platforms 2 tiles above the Sand. This will prevent cacti from growing, but still allow enemies to spawn.
"The Constant" directly references the world with the same name in Don't Starve.

Several world generation changes in the Constant seed recreates specific Set Pieces or items in Don't Starve : The Marble patches recreate the Marble Sculptures set piece. The Spider Caves on the surface recreate Spider Dens. The Marble patches recreate the Marble Sculptures set piece. The Spider Caves on the surface recreate Spider Dens.

Several game mechanics in The Constant seed are based on mechanics in Don't Starve, these include: The shader is based on the shader effect in Don't Starve. A world can only have Iron and Gold Ores is due to the fact that only Iron Ore and Gold Nuggets exist in Don't Starve. The hunger mechanic is directly based on Don't Starve 's Hunger mechanic. In Don't Starve, the player is also able to see things normally during Full Moon nights. However, the player cannot see things during New Moons in Don't Starve, which is not the case in Terraria. The mechanic of players getting damaged in completely dark areas is based on a similar mechanic of survivors being attacked by Charlie in complete darkness. The player getting damaged by Cacti is based on Don't Starve 's Cactus, which damages the player by 6 health when harvesting it. Exposed Torches and Campfires extinguish when Rain starts, as in Don't Starve, Rain will make Torches and Campfires burn out faster. The shader is based on the shader effect in Don't Starve. Because the weapon is retracted as soon as damage is taken, it is not very effective at fighting enemies that can survive more than a single hit. However, it is adept at clearing weak crowds. This makes jousting matches between players feasible, as the losing player will not be able to deal damage to the winning one. This can be mitigated somewhat with Feral Claws or its upgrades, as autoswing makes the player automatically ready their next attack after taking damage. Additionally, the knockback bonus from Titan Glove accessories will make the player less likely to take damage in the first place. This makes jousting matches between players feasible, as the losing player will not be able to deal damage to the winning one. This can be mitigated somewhat with Feral Claws or its upgrades, as autoswing makes the player automatically ready their next attack after taking damage. Additionally, the knockback bonus from Titan Glove accessories will make the player less likely to take damage in the first place.

The damage that Jousting Lances get from momentum does not have a limit. They can be paired with the Mollusk Whistle or the Inner Tube and a very deep pool of water to gain extraordinary amounts of momentum, and, in turn, damage, by surfacing from the bottom to the top of the pool of water. With the right setup, this damage is even able to defeat the Dungeon Guardian in one hit. [3]
Holding the lance straight up or down gives it a much taller hitbox, which can make hitting flying or less predictable enemies easier when charging.

Holding the lance straight down when falling down a hellevator will prevent Cobwebs, such as those created in a Spider Nest, from slowing the player's descent. The high fall speed can also help deal with enemies.

Holding the lance in the opposite direction of travel will cause mounts to " moonwalk " at full speed, e.g. a Unicorn Mount can gallop backwards. Similarly, holding the lance in a Minecart can result in the player visually holding it behind themselves.
Assuming the player never kills a Pirate Captain or Flying Dutchman, the odds of getting at least one Cutlass over the course of a Pirate Invasion are about 45%.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It has a dark outline and transparent pixels in its blade, so it looks deformed against dark backgrounds.

It resembles a scimitar rather than a cutlass. Terraria does have a scimitar in the game dropped by the Dye Trader, the Exotic Scimitar, which resembles the Cutlass. Terraria does have a scimitar in the game dropped by the Dye Trader, the Exotic Scimitar, which resembles the Cutlass.
It can almost be considered a Hardmode upgrade of the Falcon Blade, sharing many of the same features, pros and cons, as well as similar designs.

The Mining buff only increases the mining speed of pickaxes, and will not increase the drilling speed of drills or the Drill Containment Unit (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). It will affect the axe speed of hybrid pickaxes and axes like the Pickaxe Axe, but not the axe or hammer speed of normal axes or hammers.

Mining speed bonuses stack subtractively, meaning that each successive bonus is larger than the last. Due to its subtractive nature and rounding effects, a Mining Potion will cause pickaxes to mine at least 1.33× as fast and often even faster.

The Mining buff will stack together with the bonuses from the Ancient Chisel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Slice of Cake (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Celestial Stone, Celestial Shell, Sun Stone or Moon Stone, and Mining armor. Each successive mining speed boost becomes more powerful as more are added, up to a total of 70%. Max mining speed more than triples mining speed for any pickaxe, and for the Titanium Pickaxe and stronger, max mining speed buffs allow mining a block every single tick [1]. Each successive mining speed boost becomes more powerful as more are added, up to a total of 70%. Max mining speed more than triples mining speed for any pickaxe, and for the Titanium Pickaxe and stronger, max mining speed buffs allow mining a block every single tick [1].
A Flipper Potion will help when creating a hellevator to avoid being slowed down by water.
The sprite slightly resembles a pickaxe when turned upside-down:
The Water Strider design appears less like real-world water striders, and more like the Pokémon character Surskit which seems to be based on real-world water striders.

As the Icy Merman stops in place when firing at the player, it is easily dispatched with a long-ranged weapon that fires more rapidly than its Icewater Spit attack, such as the Phoenix Blaster. This will easily lock it in place. Alternatively, if the player can use cover to get close to it without being hit by its projectile attack, it is vulnerable to melee weapons. However, if the player is caught by its projectile and gets Chilled, it will be far more difficult to get into close range without being hit by more of their attacks.
A Nimbus Rod can be used to kill them effectively while they stand still.
Despite being a Merman, it cannot swim and does not gain increased mobility in water.

The Icy Merman's pre- 1.3.5 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) sprite is a re-color of the Merfolk sprite granted by the Neptune's Shell and its upgrades. The Zombie Merman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 's sprite is similar to the Icy Merman's new sprite. The Zombie Merman (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 's sprite is similar to the Icy Merman's new sprite.
This item is not available in the Nintendo 3DS version due to the unavailability of pixel shaders.
Similar to Wraiths, they are incapable of ascending more than a few tiles above solid blocks.

Staying relatively high above the ground provides for safe means of combatting Reapers due to them needing tiles below them to hover. Note that this still leaves the player open to attack from flying Vampires, Deadly Spheres, Mothrons, and an Eyezor 's lasers.
They follow the same AI as Wraiths.
Similar to Eyezor, the Reaper does not allude to a specific horror movie, instead being a reference to the Grim Reaper. [1]
The weapon the Reaper is holding strikingly resembles the Death Sickle it drops.
The Glommer is one of three pets that can make noises, the others being the Pet Worm (3DS version) and the Companion Cube.
The Glommer’s Flower appears to resemble the real-life flower Rafflesia arnoldii, commonly referred to as the stinking corpse lily or the giant padma.
The tooltip of the item is a reference to Wilson 's examination quote for the Glommer's Flower in Don't Starve Together.
The tooltip of the buff is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for Glommer in Don't Starve Together.
The Bestiary entry for the Alien Larva: " The larval stage of the alien hornets. They may seem weak and harmless, but if ignored they will evolve into powerful beings. "
The Vilethorn also inflicts minuscule knockback for each hit, which can stun-lock enemies.
The Vilethorn is the earliest weapon available to players that consistently travels through blocks.
It is rather mana -efficient for its damage potential.
With appropriate modifiers and accessories, it is possible to recover full mana between shots if the player stands still, allowing for sustained fire.

Because it needs to hit multiple times in order to reach its full damage potential, the Vilethorn is susceptible to enemies with high defense, as the damage reduction is applied to each hit rather than the total amount. This weapon scales very poorly in Hardmode as a result. It shares this trait with other low-damage but high-firing rate weapons, such as the Minishark. For the same reason, accessories, modifiers and buffs that increase damage or lower enemies' defenses can be especially useful for the Vilethorn. For the same reason, accessories, modifiers and buffs that increase damage or lower enemies' defenses can be especially useful for the Vilethorn.

The most useful trait of the Vilethorn is its ability to fire through solid blocks and pierce all enemies caught in it. Exploiting this, whenever a threat is encountered, the player can quickly set up a sealed bunker made of solid blocks and attack enemies with impunity from within. This makes it effective against Blood Moons, the Goblin Army, and any situation with swarming enemies. Note that the Chaos Balls fired by the Goblin Army's Goblin Sorcerers pass through solid blocks. This trait also makes the Vilethorn useful against worm -type enemies. Bosses with multiple parts, such as the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu 's first stage, are also vulnerable. This makes it effective against Blood Moons, the Goblin Army, and any situation with swarming enemies. Note that the Chaos Balls fired by the Goblin Army's Goblin Sorcerers pass through solid blocks. This trait also makes the Vilethorn useful against worm -type enemies. Bosses with multiple parts, such as the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu 's first stage, are also vulnerable.

Because enemies that are vulnerable to knockback are essentially stopped in their tracks, and the Vilethorn has a duration just barely long enough for a player to recover all their mana and fire again before the effect ends, a player can essentially just lay down a constant thorn that paralyzes any enemy that passes nearby.

Caster -type enemies such as the Fire Imp, Dark Caster, and Tim cease attacking once they take any damage, and will not resume attacking for a while after. The Vilethorn can be useful for reaching these enemies so as to stop their assault.
The Vilethorn is the counterpart to the Crimson 's Crimson Rod, as the Crimson Rod is the magic weapon drop from Crimson Hearts and also pierces through enemies.

Until the release of 1.2, the Vilethorn was unique in its ability to attack through blocks. Since then, however, other similar weapons have been introduced – the Nettle Burst, Crystal Vile Shard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Blood Thorn (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) – which can be considered the Vilethorn's Hardmode upgrades. Many other weapons have also been introduced that allow attacking through blocks while hiding from enemies, such as the Chlorophyte Partisan, Death Sickle, and Mushroom Spear.
This item increases the player's base speed from 15 mph to 34 mph.
If the player runs into a wall with a 1- to 2-block opening in the floor next to the wall, the player will sometimes fall through.
This item will stack with wings, granting a small flight time bonus to them.
They were incorrectly called "Sparkfrost Boots" in the Terraria 1.2.1.2 changelog. Their name still appears as such in some places within the game's source code.
This accessory is one of the few pre-Hardmode accessories to have a base rarity of 07*.
The color of the running particle uses a different dye slot than that of the flying particle. This is easily seen when using Intense Flame Dye.

Despite being presumably higher-tech, Chainsaws are generally inferior to Axes made out of the same material: they have the same or worse tool speed and they cannot be reforged to increase that speed. They do have the advantage that clicking "resets" the digging process, so the player can theoretically make up the difference (and then some) by clicking rapidly. However, faster tools require faster clicking to keep up, and realistically, doing this with even Cobalt tools is very demanding, most likely requiring two hands on the mouse for any player not thoroughly seasoned in rapid clicking from other games. As of 1.4, all drills are faster than pickaxes, though they still do not benefit from speed boosts.
Using the Drill Containment Unit is probably a better, albeit more expensive alternative. But it does not benefit from any upgrades that are given.
Smaller slimes may clip through walls and one block-wide holes. Verify

The Royal Gel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) accessory (dropped by King Slime in Expert Mode ) turns all slimes passive (i.e., behaving neutral and not dealing damage), with the exception of King Slime, Queen Slime, and their exclusive minions.

It may not always be worth fighting slimes in the early-game when under-equipped, particularly on Expert and Master Mode. In these situations, combat can be avoided by standing close to a slime and waiting for them to jump over or simply tanking a hit without dealing damage; as most surface slimes are passive during the day, they can usually be ignored afterwards.
Farming slimes with a Slime Statue can produce an infinite amount of Gel. This can be helpful when using the Flamethrower, which requires Gel as ammunition.
A Slime Statue can also be used to farm for a Slime Staff.

Because of their low stature, slimes can be difficult to hit with guns, bows, or magic weapons, as they require calibration to effectively hit in early game stages. Broadswords, or other melee weapons with an arc, are more preferable. Exceptions to this exist, such as controllable magic weapons like the Flamelash or Magic Missile.
Rainbow Slimes deal the most damage out of all non-boss slime variants.
Slimes are hinted to be made of a digestive substance by the Nurse in her dialogue: "You look half digested. Have you been chasing slimes again?"
The fact that Slimes are usually a player's first enemy encounter is referenced in the painting First Encounter.

The Crystal Slime makes a reference to the slime of the same name in the game Slime Rancher. Although they are different, because in Slime Rancher, they spawn in the Indigo Quarry, in Slime Rancher 2 they spawn in Ember Valley and Powderfall Bluffs ; but in Terraria, Queen Slime spawns them.

According to the Collector's Edition trading card of the Blue Slime, there is a single source where all the slimes originate, and destroying that source will make the slimes vanish from the world. However, no such source currently exists in the game.
Grasshoppers use the same AI as slimes, which causes them to hop away from the player during daytime, and towards the player at night.
Sangria is a type of punch and alcoholic beverage originating from Spain and Portugal, made from red wine and assorted fruit.

Like Zombies, Demon Eyes sometimes spawn as either larger or smaller than normal; larger Demon Eyes have more health, damage, defense, and knockback resistance, while smaller Demon Eyes are faster and harder to hit.
Demon Eyes appear more often during a new moon.
Although the Dilated Eye variant appears to have a large, black pupil, its drop rate for Black Lenses are not guaranteed nor raised.
Demon Eyes attempt to fly straight towards the player, and when they hit a wall, they bounce up. This allows for a relatively easy escape by hiding behind a wall with an upside-down L shape.
Due to the fact they cannot enter water, they cannot reach the player if they are completely submerged. However, the player can still hit them with their broadsword or any ranged weapon.
New players may find that spear -type weapons are quite effective against these enemies.

It is also recommended to use ranged weapons, such as the Wooden Bow, when dealing with Demon Eyes, as they spend much of their time out of reach. The best time to attack it is when the Demon Eye is turning, as a successful hit will knock it back and interrupt its flight pattern, allowing the player to get in more shots before it reaches them. One can avoid damage from Demon Eyes entirely by using said bow while within a box with a 1 wide hole. This is enough space to allow projectiles through, but not Demon Eyes. One can avoid damage from Demon Eyes entirely by using said bow while within a box with a 1 wide hole. This is enough space to allow projectiles through, but not Demon Eyes.

If the player swings in a different direction each time with their sword, they can effectively trap a Demon Eye with knockback in their sword's range, as the sword will knock it in the way the player is facing.
The Eye of Cthulhu, Servant of Cthulhu, and Wandering Eye are modeled after this enemy.
The Dilated Eye refers to dilation response, or the widening of an eye's pupil caused by external stimuli such as decreased light exposure.
The Cataract Eye references the real-life eye condition known as cataracts both in sprite and name, hence the cloudy lens.
The Sleepy Eye resembles the Monoeyes from the video game series Kid Icarus.
There used to be a sprite based on the Demon Eye which served as the loading icon of the Mobile version after Mobile 1.2.12715 's release and before Mobile 1.3.0.7 's release.
Demon Eyes appear in the video game Dungeon Defenders 2 as enemies.

According to the Bestiary (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Demon Eyes can become erratic during a Blood Moon and twist together into a cluster of blood and eyeballs, creating a Drippler (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
The internal names for the Dilated Eyes are misspelled as DialatedEye and DialatedEye2.
Fritz is a reference to the 1931 American science fiction horror film Frankenstein, where Frankenstein's hunchbacked assistant is named Fritz. [1]

If the player has any boots that increase movement speed, such as the Frostspark Boots, it will take much longer to accelerate, but the player can still move at the maximum speed allowed by the boots.
If the player has nothing equipped that affects movement speed, they will move at the same speed even when the debuff is active.

If the player is afflicted by the debuff and uses the sandstorm jump via Sandstorm in a Bottle, Sandstorm in a Balloon, or the Bundle of Balloons, they will spin much faster than normal during the ascent.

This item is non-renewable. Selling or trashing it when it becomes obsolete may result in being unable to create Master Ninja Gear or Frog Gear later. In the Don't dig up and Get fixed boi worlds, Shoe Spikes can be dropped from Mimics before Hardmode. In the Don't dig up and Get fixed boi worlds, Shoe Spikes can be dropped from Mimics before Hardmode.
Pearlsand is actually more white than pink, though it is possible that the Shifting Pearlsands Dye is pink to represent the theme of The Hallow in general.
The Spider Nest seems to have an increased enemy spawn rate. Standing still and not killing any enemies may allow as many as 25 enemies to spawn, even with no spawn rate buffs. Verify

The spider- and Cobweb-spawning properties of the biome are a result of the special wall tile present. Removing all the wall tiles with a hammer will effectively remove the biome. Another unique property of the background wall type is the reduced chance of dropping Cobwebs. Instead of every Cobweb destroyed dropping one Cobweb item, only 1/4 (25%) of Cobwebs in front of this background wall will drop a Cobweb item. Another unique property of the background wall type is the reduced chance of dropping Cobwebs. Instead of every Cobweb destroyed dropping one Cobweb item, only 1/4 (25%) of Cobwebs in front of this background wall will drop a Cobweb item.
The size of a Spider Nest is always between 500 tiles and 3499 tiles, inclusive. Most of the time they are in the Cavern layer and not in a Glowing Mushroom biome, but there are rare exceptions.
Mining out all tiles near the Spider Nest, aside from the walls, may allow for a money farm to be made.
The Dangersense Potion can be useful in locating Spider Nests, because the Cobwebs inside sparkle in a unique pattern.

Creating three-block-high diagonal tunnels into a Spider Nest using a hammer to slope the floor and ceiling will prohibit spiders from exiting (or entering, if they spawn outside), but not the player. This can be a good tactic to trap and easily kill spiders. Similarly, spiders cannot fit into two-block-wide vertical tunnels and can be used the same way.

If one finds themselves crossing through a Spider Nest while creating a hellevator, in order to prevent Cobwebs from generating and slowing the player down during freefall, it can be advised to place ropes or torches on the background walls, thus occupying the space where Cobwebs are unable to grow. Alternatively, one may also use a hammer to remove the walls.
The biome features unique background objects, such as a human corpse covered in webs.
A player's initial creation of Silk to make their first Bed represents an early "gate" for their advancement, since it will require a bit of underground exploration.
Silk's use in the Ancient set offers some profit over selling the ingredients, but that is more about monetizing the Ancient Cloth (which has no other use).
The sale of Silk allows a modest profit of 2 GC 86 SC /1000 Cobwebs. However, once Bones are available, combining the Cobwebs and Bones directly into Necro Helmets will yield far greater profits.

Grass Wall, Flower Wall, and Jungle Wall can be used to make Corrupt Grass Wall, Crimson Grass Wall, and Hallowed Grass Wall by spraying Purple, Red, and Blue Solution, respectively. This cannot be undone; spraying Green Solution always yields Grass Walls instead.
The red panda is a small mammal native to the Himalayas and China. Despite the similarities in name and diet, it is not closely related to the giant panda.
The Mermaid Tail conceals the player's feet, and when moving, the player appears to slither rather than walk.
Enemies that die while afflicted with the debuff inflict it onto nearby enemies.
Prior to 1.4.3, the tooltip misspelled "Incinerated" as "Incenerated".
Despite the debuff being known as "Daybroken", it is inflicted by both the Solar Eruption and the Daybreak.
The Daybroken debuff does not have a unique debuff icon as it can never be applied to players. It instead uses a copy of the Stardust Dragon buff's icon as a placeholder.
It is still possible to fall through lava whenever there is a change in its fluid level (e.g. when standing on lava and mining Hellstone ).
Lava Waders are beneficial for mining Hellstone, and during the Wall of Flesh fight(s), if a walkway has not been built.
Equipping the Flipper in addition makes it possible to swim in lava, while being immune to its effects for 7 seconds.
Lava Waders let the player walk in thin layers of Lava, such as those used in traps and farms without destroying drops, without using up the 7 second lava immunity.

The Lava Charm, Molten Charm (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Magma Skull (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Molten Skull Rose (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Terraspark Boots (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) all stack with the Lava Waders to increase lava immunity by 7 seconds each. The Demonic Hellcart (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) also gives an additional 7 seconds. This leads to a maximum total of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 49 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 14 seconds. Of these, only the Demonic Hellcart is not itself a Lava Charm upgrade.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Combining Obsidian Water Walking Boots with either the Molten Charm or the Molten Skull Rose is not recommended as this will result in a waste of an Obsidian Skull. Note that one of the Molten Skull Rose's recipes allows wasting an Obsidian Skull as well.
The Lava Waders are one of the few pre-Hardmode accessories to have the 07* rarity.
Although technically not a seashell, Starfish share the same function, spawn conditions, tile ID, and internal name as all Seashells. They are now collectively referred to in the code as Beach Piles.

For the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version : When Seashells and Starfish spawn, they make an audible "thump" sound. Verify Spawn rates are increased during Rain and Wind weather, with a maximum bonus when both are at their strongest. Spawn rates are multiplied by the number of empty tiles above the Sand Block, up to 14 tiles. This means two vertical platforms of sand within 14 tiles would have the same spawn rate if not for the extra layer solid block needed under the sand. Empty tiles can include water, walls and inactive tiles. Spawn rates are decreased if 1 or more Seashells or Corals are within 11 tiles and can no longer spawn if more than 3 are within 8 tiles. When Seashells and Starfish spawn, they make an audible "thump" sound. Verify Spawn rates are increased during Rain and Wind weather, with a maximum bonus when both are at their strongest. Spawn rates are multiplied by the number of empty tiles above the Sand Block, up to 14 tiles. This means two vertical platforms of sand within 14 tiles would have the same spawn rate if not for the extra layer solid block needed under the sand. Empty tiles can include water, walls and inactive tiles. Spawn rates are decreased if 1 or more Seashells or Corals are within 11 tiles and can no longer spawn if more than 3 are within 8 tiles.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) While they share spawns with the more common Seashells, Junonia Shells sell for considerably more and can be a good source of money early game.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) A simple Seashell farm can be built by placing Sand Blocks atop vertical platforms 14 tiles apart. Seashells will appear as long as above the surface in Ocean biomes, even in the Space layer. Walls will prevent Sea Oats from spawning without hindering Seashell spawns.
The Seashells, along with Corals, are the only decorative background objects whose inventory sprite does not match at least one of the placed variants.
Until 1.3.5 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), items had an unused internal name. The Seashells' name was Beach Stuff. [1]
The Spore Zombie can be seen as a sort of counterpart to the Spore Skeleton, as they are both mushroom biome versions of normal undead enemies.
The Bestiary entry for the Spore Zombie: " The fungus controlling the minds of these zombies wants only one thing: brains! This is very convenient for the zombie. "

The Ice Skates stop Thin Ice from being broken, but also allow the usual fall damage from landing on it. If the player is more prepared for the water underneath (and the Chilled debuff it inflicts in Expert Mode ), it can be advised to take the Ice Skates off before falling on thin ice.

While the Ice Skates provide additional speed on ice while worn by themselves, the player cannot move any faster than the usual sprinting speed while wearing any combination of Ice Skates and sprinting boots. They can, however, reach sprinting speed much faster than on normal land.
The Ice Skates do not provide extra mobility when the player is on Frozen furniture items.
The Ice Skates and its upgrades prevent Thin Ice from being highlighted by the Dangersense Potion.
When worn on a female character, ice skates appear far wider than most other footwear accessories, as if to fit a male character.
Heart Shrines were removed in the Mobile 1.3.0.7 update, no longer generating in newly created worlds. However, they still exist in worlds created prior to that update.
Heart Shrines were the only pre-Hardmode means of obtaining an Ice Chest.
The chest would always contain a total of 69 Copper Coins. Due to the overall love theme of the shrine, this is most likely a reference to 69, a well-known sex position.

The Avenger Emblem is slightly weaker than the emblems used to craft it, giving 12% damage while they give 15% damage. It is better to use the warrior/summoner/ranger/sorcerer emblem first before using both.

The Avenger Emblem is generally less useful for players who are playing pure Summoner. Though the Avenger Emblem can be worn by itself for the plain damage buff, there are many better choices of accessory at and after this point in the game for Summoners, such as the Moon Stone and Hercules Beetle as well as their upgrades. As for the Avenger Emblem's upgrades, melee damage bonuses provided by the Mechanical Glove and everything beyond it do not apply to whips ; the Destroyer Emblem 's critical boost is irrelevant to Summoners as neither whips nor minions can crit; and since Summoners rarely struggle for mana, the Celestial Emblem is of little value.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version the Avenger Emblem can be acquired very early into Hardmode and with minimal difficulty, requiring only that the player remain in an Underworld area largely untouched by Hardmode and defeat the Wall of Flesh several times. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, however, it requires the three mechanical boss souls and so can only be acquired just before fighting Plantera ; this does reduce the amount of random chance in its acquisition, since all three varieties of souls are guaranteed to appear, and the Avenger Emblem can be made even with an emblem that did not match the player's chosen play style.
While multiples of the Avenger Emblem cannot be worn at once, multiple emblems of different types (and the Mechanical Glove or Fire Gauntlet ) will stack.
Rain armor is one of two armor sets in the game that comes in two pieces, the other one being the Wizard set.
Despite the similar method of obtaining them and the fact they both drop from weather-exclusive enemies, the Snow armor is rarer than the Rain armor and has three pieces.

Instead of the Terrarium; Butterflies, Dragonflies, Fireflies, Lavaflies, Lightning Bugs and Faelings must be combined with a Bottle to create bottled variants. Bottled Water can be combined with Goldfish or Pupfish to make Fish Bowls, or with fished Jellyfish to make Jellyfish Jars.
Caged Bunnies, Penguins, and Goldfish (see Fish Bowl ) do not become corrupt or vicious during Blood Moons.
To cage every critter in a Terrarium requires 63 Terrariums, which takes 1008 pieces of Glass (or 2016 sand ).
"Terraria" is one of the plurals of "Terrarium" (the other being "Terrariums").
The Living Loom is unrelated. It is used to craft Living Tree -themed furniture, and cannot craft any Loom items.
Despite being referred to as a loom, which is used to weave thread into fabric, its sprite more closely resembles a spinning wheel, which is used to spin fiber into thread.
Equipping Acid Dye, Red Acid Dye, or Blue Acid Dye on the Shadow Orb can make parts of it or the whole orb invisible.
The color for the mask on the pickup text is rgb(50, 8, 102). [1]

An opened Void Bag will act effectively as the player's secondary inventory, which inherits the following functions: Consuming food and potions in it with Quick Heal, Quick Mana, and Quick Buff. Crafting with its contents. Quick Stack to Nearby Chests. When looting all items from a storage item with a full main inventory, the items will be sent to the Void Vault. Favoriting items (to prevent quick stacking). Items that have a function in the player's inventory will work as normal, including informational accessories, Guide to Critter Companionship, Guide to Environmental Preservation, etc. However, placing the Encumbering Stone inside the Void Vault will not prevent the player or an opened Void Bag from picking up items. Consuming food and potions in it with Quick Heal, Quick Mana, and Quick Buff. Crafting with its contents. Quick Stack to Nearby Chests. When looting all items from a storage item with a full main inventory, the items will be sent to the Void Vault. Favoriting items (to prevent quick stacking). Items that have a function in the player's inventory will work as normal, including informational accessories, Guide to Critter Companionship, Guide to Environmental Preservation, etc. However, placing the Encumbering Stone inside the Void Vault will not prevent the player or an opened Void Bag from picking up items. However, placing the Encumbering Stone inside the Void Vault will not prevent the player or an opened Void Bag from picking up items.

The Void Bag is only obtainable after defeating Skeletron, as its crafting recipe requires Bones, which drop from enemies in the Dungeon. However, defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu is not necessary: While summoning them at least once is required, Shadow Scales or Tissue Samples can be obtained by merely destroying a few segments of the Eater of Worlds or a few Creepers, respectively; the bosses do not have to be defeated. In a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it is obtainable before defeating Skeletron, as Dungeon enemies can spawn prior to defeating the boss. However, defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu is not necessary: While summoning them at least once is required, Shadow Scales or Tissue Samples can be obtained by merely destroying a few segments of the Eater of Worlds or a few Creepers, respectively; the bosses do not have to be defeated. In a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it is obtainable before defeating Skeletron, as Dungeon enemies can spawn prior to defeating the boss.

The Void Bag will not pick up quest fish if the player's inventory is full or contains another quest fish of the same type. However, the fish can still be placed inside the Void Vault manually, and any quest fish already within the Void Vault will not prevent the player from picking up another in their inventory.
The Void Bag will not let the player use its bait with a fishing pole. The bait must be in the player's main inventory for them to fish with it.
The Void Bag will not pick up Etherian Mana, but it can be placed into the Void Vault manually or via Quick Stack.
Earlier versions of the Void Bag during development had a dark purple portal, more resembling the portals from the Potion of Return in the current game.
The Void Bag's portal is known internally as " VoidLens ".
Because the Antlion creates Sand Blocks as it attacks, sand is a renewable resource, although one renewed slowly.
If faced with an incline facing directly upward, Antlions will climb very slowly toward the player. This happens on all versions and prevents them from burying themselves.
The Antlion's head is the only part that takes or deals damage. Thus, projectiles aimed at its body will fly through. Likewise, a player that touches the Antlion's body will not take damage.

The Antlion is based on real-life antlion larvae, which dig sand pits as traps for other insects. The antlion larva will throw sand at escaping prey, causing its victims to tumble down into the center of the pit where the hungry antlion larva is waiting. When the larvae grow up, they resemble the Antlion Swarmer. Due to the large presence of Antlion enemies in the Underground Desert and its funnel-like entry point, it could be assumed that the Underground Desert is in fact a large Antlion nest. Due to the large presence of Antlion enemies in the Underground Desert and its funnel-like entry point, it could be assumed that the Underground Desert is in fact a large Antlion nest.
The NPC ID image contains only the head. The body is stored not as a numerical ID, but by its name, AntlionBody.xnb.
While the Sand Ball projectiles the Antlion shoots cannot damage other enemies, falling sand created by the projectiles can.
Antlion is commonly mispronounced as antillion, when, since it is based on the insect, it can be assumed that one would pronounce it the same as the insect – ant-lion.
This is one of only two or three creatures besides the player that can place blocks in the world, the others being the Snow Balla and, debatably, the Wall of Flesh.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Albino Antlion is the only exclusive variant of an enemy that has the exact same stats and drops as the original enemy (apart from the Banner ).

When destroyed, Hive blocks will either turn into honey ( 1/3 (33.33%) chance) or drop like a regular item ( 2/3 (66.67%) chance). If the block drops as an item, there is an additional 1/2 (50%) chance that 1–2 Bees spawn ( 2/3 (66.67%) chance for 1 Bee, 1/3 (33.33%) chance for 2 Bees), i.e. an overall 1/3 (33.33%) chance upon mining a Hive block. [1]
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Since Hive blocks count as Jungle biome blocks, they can be used to create small Jungles that the Corruption or Crimson cannot spread to.

This accessory is probably the single most useful money-making item in the game. In particular, it is possible to wait in shelter while minions defeat enemies, and the coins dropped go directly into the inventory. Using a swarm of particularly weak minions (like a Broken Slime Staff ) against an event with no casters (e.g. Frost Legion ) can rake in multiple platinum coins. It is also possible to farm during a Solar Eclipse. Since Mothron and Reaper can travel through solid blocks to reach the player, it is recommended to farm before defeating Plantera. It is also possible to farm during a Solar Eclipse. Since Mothron and Reaper can travel through solid blocks to reach the player, it is recommended to farm before defeating Plantera.

A good way to keep the enemies at bay near the Mysterious Portal is by firing the Clinger Staff or Rainbow Gun 's projectile or by placing an Explosive Trap near the portal's entrance. This way the enemies will instantly take damage when they come out.

Sandstone Blocks do not affect whether an area qualifies as an Underground Desert biome. The only qualification for such a biome's enemies to spawn is an unsafe Sandstone Wall. Ebonsandstone, Crimsandstone, and Pearlsandstone will create and spread their respective biome ( Corruption / Crimson / Hallow ), however. Ebonsandstone, Crimsandstone, and Pearlsandstone will create and spread their respective biome ( Corruption / Crimson / Hallow ), however.
Only normal Sandstone Blocks can be turned into Smooth Sandstone. Corrupt, Crimson, and Hallowed counterparts can only be made into walls.
Antlion Eggs will slowly regrow on normal Sandstone Blocks located below the surface layer, even if they are not within the Underground Desert.
A player equipped with Dunerider Boots will be able to run faster while standing on any type of Sandstone Block.
Oddly enough, the Sandstone Block cannot be used to make Sandstone Brick and Sandstone Slab, despite the similarity in names.
The chest-worn garment will overwrite any leg armor or vanity leg clothes.
The Potato Chips' tooltip ' Betcha can't eat just one!' was the slogan used in U.S. television commercials for Lay's Potato Chips at the start of the 1960s.

Unlike many health regeneration items, which directly increase health gained per second, the Vital Crystal speeds up the health regeneration ramping by 20%. [1] For example, 5 seconds after taking damage, the player will receive the same amount of health regeneration that would normally take 6 seconds to reach. For example, 5 seconds after taking damage, the player will receive the same amount of health regeneration that would normally take 6 seconds to reach.

When fishing, contents exclusive to these biomes are only obtainable when there are no other overlapping biomes, otherwise the contents will be overridden by the overlapping biome's. [1] For example, the Jewelfish can only be obtained by fishing in Underground and below. If there are enough tiles nearby to form a, e.g. Corruption / Underground Corruption biome, then it is impossible to obtain the fish. For example, the Jewelfish can only be obtained by fishing in Underground and below. If there are enough tiles nearby to form a, e.g. Corruption / Underground Corruption biome, then it is impossible to obtain the fish.
It must be equipped to work in the Old-gen console version. It will not display the time if it is in the inventory.

The Steampunker's move-in requirements do not expressly require a world to be in Hardmode. Summoning and defeating a mechanical boss in a pre-Hardmode world will allow the Steampunker to move in, though this can only be legitimately achieved by carrying over resources from an existing Hardmode world. If summoned into a pre-Hardmode world this way, the Steampunker will not sell Cogs, the Steampunk Minecart (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or the Static Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) until the given world enters Hardmode. If summoned into a pre-Hardmode world this way, the Steampunker will not sell Cogs, the Steampunk Minecart (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or the Static Hook (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) until the given world enters Hardmode.

The Steampunker is one of the starting NPC in Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds. This means that it is possible to get most of her items legitimately in a pre-Hardmode world without transferring them from a Hardmode world (e.g. Asphalt Blocks for arenas).
Re-defeating the Eye of Cthulhu and Eater of Worlds/Brain of Cthulhu may be necessary to buy the Steampunk Boiler after the Steampunker arrives.
The Steampunker does not sell Dark Blue Solution if moved to the Glowing Mushroom biome. It is sold by the Truffle instead.

Steampunk is a sci-fi/fantasy term used to describe a subculture that incorporates technology and aesthetic designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery. The Steampunker occasionally talks about becoming an air pirate. Air pirates are a staple of the steampunk genre. The Steampunker occasionally talks about becoming an air pirate. Air pirates are a staple of the steampunk genre.
The Steampunker can be seen working on the Cyborg in the credits. The Steampunker getting electrocuted, as seen during the credits.
The Steampunker was sprited by former artist Sarah "Waffles" Data.

One of the Steampunker's possible names, Whitney, is also the name of Cenx, one of the lead developers of Terraria and Redigit's wife. If the Steampunker is killed, she will drop the Ivy if her name was Whitney. The Steampunker’s Shimmered form has green hair, another nod to Cenx. [1] If the Steampunker is killed, she will drop the Ivy if her name was Whitney. The Steampunker’s Shimmered form has green hair, another nod to Cenx. [1]
The name Minerva is a reference to the Roman goddess of handicrafts and wisdom.
The name Zelda may be a reference to the Nintendo game series The Legend of Zelda.
The name Ada is a reference to the 19th-century English mathematician and writer Ada Lovelace, who pioneered work on Charles Babbage 's "computer."
One of the Steampunker's quotes regarding the Pirate comments states that he seems to be "pretty well over the bay," which is a 19th-century Celtic phrase meaning drunk. [2]
The Steampunker is the only Hardmode NPC that can also be obtained in a regular pre-Hardmode world that is not a secret world seed.
The quote " I prefer the wide open spaces here in the Desert, great for jetpack joyrides! " is a reference to the mobile game Jetpack Joyride.

She most likely has a Cockney accent, judging by the way she speaks. The accent is typically associated with steampunk themes. However, when talking about NPCs she dislikes, she uses the word dinnae, which is a Scottish word meaning did not or do not.

Her quote, " I'm mighty curious about that <name of Cyborg> fellow. By what manner of consumption does he maintain such locomotion? " implies that she does not know the Cyborg very well, despite the Bestiary entry for the Cyborg stating that he was built with the combined efforts of the Mechanic and the Steampunker.

Even though all the Team Platforms go with matching Team Blocks, Team Platforms cannot be crafted with Team Blocks, & consequently cannot be used to craft Team Blocks either, due to the purpose of platform-to-block recipes generally being for convenient decrafting.
Despite the similarities in name, it cannot be used to make the Shrimp Po' Boy.

Later in the game, the player can swap in the Obsidian Skull or Cobalt Shield as a replacement, which grants a defense bonus but also Burning or knockback immunity respectively. The Obsidian Shield (when both are combined) provides 2 defense and grants immunity to both Burning and knockback. The Obsidian Shield (when both are combined) provides 2 defense and grants immunity to both Burning and knockback.
Due to Zombies spawning in large quantities during a Blood Moon, Shackles are relatively easy to acquire during the event.

Due to its low reforging cost, this item is useful for getting better modifiers like Arcane, Violent, Lucky, and Warding. With the "Warding" modifier, 4 defense is added for a total of 5, which is nearly equivalent to Copper armor (6 defense with set bonus). With the "Warding" modifier, 4 defense is added for a total of 5, which is nearly equivalent to Copper armor (6 defense with set bonus).
In real life, a Shackle is either a metal link used for linking devices together or chains used to restrain prisoners.
The Zombie Arm appears to have a shackle on its wrist.

The bee spawning effect of the Honey Comb, Sweetheart Necklace, Honey Balloon, Bee Cloak, and Stinger Necklace (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) do not stack. Only 1–3 / 1–4 bees will appear after being damaged regardless of how many of these items are equipped.
Any source of damage will trigger the effects, except for damage-over-time debuffs (e.g. Burning ).
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) This is the only combination using a Honey Comb that can be sold for more than the parts could be individually.

The Sweetheart Necklace's name is a pun on how, due to it being a heart necklace and honey combined, the necklace charm could literally be called a sweet heart. It is also a reference to a sweetheart neckline.

Despite the description, players are also able to walk on lava without taking damage and without the need for the Obsidian Skin Potion. This makes it a viable alternative to Obsidian Skin Potions when traversing the Underworld, as the ingredients required are generally safer to obtain (though more time-consuming to gather in bulk). Players should still take care when dropping long distances onto lava, as they may find themselves partially submerged and take damage from the lava.
This potion can be used to make the Ocean into a makeshift arena, for fights against the Dreadnautilus (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Duke Fishron, for instance.

While Lava Waders (and their upgrade, the Terraspark Boots (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) partially combine the functionalities of this potion and the Obsidian Skin Potion, they require an additional accessory slot.
Falling onto water will still prevent fall damage.
The buff icon appears to depict the Guide.
The player could lure one at a time into an enclosed space and kill them one by one.

The Starfury can be useful for dealing with them, since its stars can deal damage while the player is out of the Harpies' reach. Minions, sentries, and homing weapons can also be quite helpful. Minions, sentries, and homing weapons can also be quite helpful.
If mining Clouds or while creating or fishing in a sky lake, it may be best for the player to box themselves in, and ignore the Harpies.
Using a fast weapon such as a Minishark, Megashark, or any ranged weapon with High Velocity Bullets can easily take care of them, without having to chase them.

The Harpies' feathers are somewhat slow but can be difficult to dodge because of their numbers. Timing one's attacks to avoid them, or using a ranged weapon that does not require precision, can greatly increase the player's chances.

Harpies may not seem dangerous, especially if the player is equipped with later-stage pre-Hardmode armor and weapons; however, at night or in large swarms, especially in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the swarm of projectiles and the Harpies' contact damage can make it difficult to move around the screen. A Cobalt Shield or its upgrades can mitigate this and allow for escape.

The Harpies' feathers have a limited range and will self-destruct after traveling a certain distance. The feathers can traverse water, albeit at a much slower speed, somewhat granting protection from Harpies, who themselves cannot travel in liquids.

A harpy is a being from Greek and Roman mythology with the face of a human, typically that of a woman, and the body of a large bird. They are said to be wind spirits and personifications of their destructive nature.

Rarely, if a Harpy Statue happens to spawn in a path of wire from a trap or another statue in the cavern or underground layer and that mechanism is activated, a Harpy can "naturally" spawn outside its natural environment.

When fighting bosses, it is advantageous to keep some of this ammo in the ammo slots, as it allows the player to switch between using Ichor Bullets to inflict Ichor and using other bullets to deal more damage. It is not recommended to use this ammo by itself, since other types (most notably Crystal Bullets ) can inflict significantly more damage with the Ichor debuff applied.

The Destroyer, the Lunatic Cultist (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and all Celestial Pillars (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are immune to the Ichor debuff, making this ammunition mostly useless against them.
Ichor Bullets reflected by enemies do not inflict the Ichor debuff on the player.

In a PvP scenario, the damage increase from Ichor actually changes depending on the difficulty: on Journey/Classic it will increase the effective damage by 7-8, 11-12 on Expert, and 15 on Master mode. This is due to how the effectiveness of defense changes with the difficulty, getting stronger as it gets harder.
When idle, the Baby Imp appears to yawn.
The Slice of Hell Cake's sprite seems to be a recolored version of the Slice of Cake.

The Baby Imp is based on the Fire Imp enemy. The Slice of Hell Cake's tooltip, ' He hasn't learned how to teleport yet!', is a reference to the enemy's teleportation abilities. However, while the Fire Imp is red, the Baby Imp is a shade of indigo similar to that of Shadow Chests. However, while the Fire Imp is red, the Baby Imp is a shade of indigo similar to that of Shadow Chests.

In the Baby Imp's buff tooltip, "Just wait till his terrible twos!", " terrible twos " refers to a period in a toddler 's early development characterized by mood swings and unruly behavior, typically around two years of age.
The Stake Launcher deals 10× damage against Vampires in both forms. [1]

Due to low lighting during a Solar Eclipse and the small size of the Vampire in its bat form, it may be difficult to see before it strikes the player. Therefore, using a Hunter Potion and artificial lighting (including light pets like the Wisp in a Bottle or the buff of the Shine Potion ) is recommended.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, a Vampire can keep up with or outrun a player with Hermes Boots, even when it is not in its bat form.
The theme of almost all of the Solar Eclipse enemies is classic horror film icons. Vampires are a reference to the 1931 American vampire-horror film Dracula.
The Stake Launcher's damage bonus references real-life vampire folklore, in which the only way to completely kill a vampire is to drive a wooden stake through its heart.

Vampires in modern fiction are often said to be vulnerable to sunlight. While Vampires in Terraria do attempt to flee during the day when the Solar Eclipse is over, like all other enemies, they do not actually take damage from the sun.
Sand Sharks use the Vampire's idle audio as their jump attack sound.
Demonite Ore does not spread the Corruption in any way.
Unlike its Crimson counterpart, Demonite Ore can be found in increased amounts within Corruption cave systems.

Demonite Ore and its counterpart Crimtane Ore can be mined extremely early game with Bombs, with this being highly effective with the vein increases of 1.4, easily netting one a powerful sword, bow, axe, yoyo, and fishing rod early game.
Very rarely, Demonite Ore can spawn extremely close to the surface.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) As of 1.4, Demonite Ores have increased value and Demonite Bars have decreased value, such that one makes the same amount of money selling via the ores or the bars. Hence, it is faster and just as efficient to sell the ores.
The placed block texture of Demonite Ore seems to represent scales.

The Master Gamer's set is a reference to the 1989 animated cartoon series Captain N: The Game Master, and it is also the outfit worn by the show's main protagonist, Kevin Keene. The tooltip is a line said in the show's opening by Kevin's mother.
The Starlight grants 4 global invincibility frames on hit, [1] meaning that it can hit targets 15 times per second.
The beams are not able to deal damage to enemies through blocks unless the enemy itself is able to pass through blocks.

Despite being able to receive modifiers which boost speed, the Starlight is completely unaffected by those and other melee speed bonuses. However, the Titan Glove and modifiers which boost size do affect the weapon's range. However, the Titan Glove and modifiers which boost size do affect the weapon's range.
The quick attack speed and infinite piercing of the weapon allow it to quickly defeat hordes of enemies on the ground.

The Starlight is an efficient weapon for farming large, slow-moving enemies and bosses like Plantera, Golem, and Ogres, killing them in seconds, however, it is not reliable as a main weapon against most enemies in general because of its short range. It should be used alongside other weapons with a longer range.
With the Legendary modifier and when used against a single target, it is able to reach a DPS of around 1,100 with no additional equipment.

Due to its rapid attack rate and critical strike chance, it is an effective weapon for killing the Dungeon Guardian. Although, given the short range of the Starlight, and the extreme contact damage dealt by the Guardians, it may be unwise to attempt.
It is roughly as powerful as the Solar Eruption within its effective range, though its range is much shorter.

Although the Starlight visually resembles a sword and has a similar attack motion to shortswords, the sword itself does not actually deal damage. For this reason, it is instead classified as a projectile-only melee weapon.
