Because the weapon is retracted as soon as damage is taken, it is not very effective at fighting enemies that can survive more than a single hit. However, it is adept at clearing weak crowds. This makes jousting matches between players feasible, as the losing player will not be able to deal damage to the winning one. This can be mitigated somewhat with Feral Claws or its upgrades, as autoswing makes the player automatically ready their next attack after taking damage. Additionally, the knockback bonus from Titan Glove accessories will make the player less likely to take damage in the first place. This makes jousting matches between players feasible, as the losing player will not be able to deal damage to the winning one. This can be mitigated somewhat with Feral Claws or its upgrades, as autoswing makes the player automatically ready their next attack after taking damage. Additionally, the knockback bonus from Titan Glove accessories will make the player less likely to take damage in the first place.

The damage that Jousting Lances get from momentum does not have a limit. They can be paired with the Mollusk Whistle or the Inner Tube and a very deep pool of water to gain extraordinary amounts of momentum, and, in turn, damage, by surfacing from the bottom to the top of the pool of water. With the right setup, this damage is even able to defeat the Dungeon Guardian in one hit. [2]
Holding the lance straight up or down gives it a much taller hitbox, which can make hitting flying or less predictable enemies easier when charging.

Holding the lance straight down when falling down a hellevator will prevent Cobwebs, such as those created in a Spider Nest, from slowing the player's descent. The high fall speed can also help deal with enemies.

Holding the lance in the opposite direction of travel will cause mounts to " moonwalk " at full speed, e.g. a Unicorn Mount can gallop backwards. Similarly, holding the lance in a Minecart can result in the player visually holding it behind themselves.

With the Hive Pack (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) equipped, there is a 1/3 (33.33%) chance for one extra Bee to spawn, and all Bee projectiles have a 1/2 (50%) chance to be converted into Giant Bee projectiles, which always deal 1–3 extra damage, have a knockback of 0.5 (Extremely weak), can pierce enemies or ricochet off solid blocks 4 times in total, fly noticeably faster, and last 11 seconds. Both kinds of bee projectiles will dissipate immediately on contact with water or lava. [2]
Armor penetration effects (from both the Shark Tooth Necklace and the Sharpening Station ) also affect the damage done by the summoned bees, granting bonus damage to all hits from them too.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Bee Keeper is capable of autoswinging.
Using the Bee Keeper on worm enemies will release many bees if they move right through the sword's swinging area.
The Bee Keeper can be useful even in Hardmode because of its ability to inflict Confused and deal decent damage at the same time, especially with the bees.
The friendly bees are very helpful for crowd control, as they can not only finish off enemies damaged by the sword but severely hurt or kill any other enemies in the vicinity.

The Bee Keeper is the only pre-Hardmode weapon that is capable of inflicting the Confused debuff. While the Brain of Confusion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can also inflict the debuff, it is an accessory.
The Bee Keeper's name is a play on the real-life profession of the beekeeper.
Despite the item tooltip stating the sword has a small chance of causing confusion, it has a 9/10 (90%) chance to do so, which is comparably large.
The Bee Keeper's Confused debuff strangely works on other players, despite most weapon-inflicted debuffs normally being disabled in PvP.
Despite the Falcon Blade having a higher rarity, the Bee Keeper is superior to the Falcon Blade in all ways, including sell price.
The top running speed of the Tree Mount is 82 mph, reached after 0.533 seconds. [1] Its maximum diagonal speed is 96 mph, achieved by jumping off a ledge at full speed.

The Tree Mount's acceleration is extraordinarily high. It achieves high speed very quickly without a dash (e.g. Tabi or Shield of Cthulhu ) and can allow one to make sharp turns midair if it is summoned while falling, making it rather useful for boss fights. The Tree Mount's incredibly high speed makes it especially useful for outrunning the Moon Lord and his True Eyes of Cthulhu, especially from their Phantasmal Deathrays. The Tree Mount's incredibly high speed makes it especially useful for outrunning the Moon Lord and his True Eyes of Cthulhu, especially from their Phantasmal Deathrays.
The buff's tooltip "Run, forest, run!" is a pun based on a famous line from the 1994 American comedy-drama movie Forrest Gump.

The Tree Mount is the fastest ground-based mount in the game. It is as fast as the fastest flying mount, the Shrimpy Truffle while it is in water, despite the fact that in real life trees rarely move at all.
The Bestiary entry for the Gold Bird: " Rarely, critters are found coated entirely in gold! Shopkeepers will pay handsomely for these, or you can show them off in cages! "
The Bestiary entry for  Grubby: " Slimy, yet satisfying! Fish are somewhat attracted to these. "
This set was added as a replacement for the Hero's set due to copyright concerns over the latter costume. As such, the crafting recipes for both sets are very similar. [2]
Although the Nintendo 3DS version utilizes the green version of the Hero's set from 1.3.0.1, the clothing is crafted using Purple Thread like in the Old-gen console version.
The Purple Thread's sprite is the Green Thread's sprite, but inverted in color.
The Bestiary entry for the Armored Viking: " The most elite vikings were worthy of the strongest armor. It seems that it wasn't terribly effective, given their state now. "
In a regular world with 20 town NPCs, the Tax Collector will collect 10 SC every minute, collecting 2 GC 40 SC per in-game day.

The Tax Collector is the starting NPC in Don't dig up worlds, and one of the starting NPCs in Get fixed boi worlds. When spawning as a starting NPC in Get fixed boi worlds, the Tax Collector is named Andrew, a name originally for the Guide. The Tax Collector's defense will also be set to 200 if he is named Andrew. When spawning as a starting NPC in Get fixed boi worlds, the Tax Collector is named Andrew, a name originally for the Guide. The Tax Collector's defense will also be set to 200 if he is named Andrew.
Funds can be collected at any time, and do not require a minimum amount stored.
When the Tax Collector's maximum storage is reached, he will not collect any further coins until the player collects from him.
Time passed using the Enchanted Sundial or the Enchanted Moondial counts towards his total.
Time passed using the Journey Mode time menu counts towards his total.
In multiplayer, each player's earned taxes are separately maintained, and collecting has no impact on another player's payout.
The Tax Collector can be teleported using the King Statue.
He will not participate in Parties, or even wear a party hat. However, it is still possible for him to throw a party.
The Tax Collector will keep the debuffs inflicted on him as well as (in Expert Mode ) any dropped coins he picked up when changed from a Tortured Soul into himself.

When searching for a Tortured Soul, make sure all minions are dismissed so they will not inadvertently kill it. Note that a Tortured Soul can respawn like any other enemy if it is accidentally killed, as long as it has not been transformed into a Tax Collector already.

Bringing some Purification Powder when going to kill the Wall of Flesh for the first time will let the player recruit the Tax Collector almost immediately after starting Hardmode, even before returning to the surface or breaking altars.

For most of the game progression, the only way to maximize his happiness is to put him in the Snow biome with the Merchant and Party Girl. Unfortunately, that will make both of them unhappy. The Party Girl can be replaced by the Princess later after Plantera has been defeated and the Cyborg moves in, as the Princess only spawns when all other NPCs are present.

The Tax Collector is a reference to Ebenezer Scrooge from the 1843 novella A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens. Scrooge is a greedy, grumpy old man with a cane and top hat, mutton chops, and a hunched back. Many of his quotes are references to the story. Additionally, this is why he prefers the Snow biome, dislikes Christmas, and hates Santa Claus.

All of the Tax Collector's possible names are names of well-known U.S. politicians, most of whom were at one point president or vice-president. Agnew – Spiro Agnew Blanton – Blanton Winship Carroll – Charles Carroll Chester – Chester A. Arthur Cleveland and Grover – Grover Cleveland Dwyer – R. Budd Dwyer Fillmore and Millard – Millard Fillmore Harrison – William Henry Harrison Herbert – Herbert Hoover Lyndon – Lyndon B. Johnson McKinly – William McKinley Ronald – Ronald Reagan Rutherford – Rutherford B. Hayes Theodore – Theodore Roosevelt Tweed – William M. Tweed Warren – Warren G. Harding Woodrow – Woodrow Wilson Agnew – Spiro Agnew Blanton – Blanton Winship Carroll – Charles Carroll Chester – Chester A. Arthur Cleveland and Grover – Grover Cleveland Dwyer – R. Budd Dwyer Fillmore and Millard – Millard Fillmore Harrison – William Henry Harrison Herbert – Herbert Hoover Lyndon – Lyndon B. Johnson McKinly – William McKinley Ronald – Ronald Reagan Rutherford – Rutherford B. Hayes Theodore – Theodore Roosevelt Tweed – William M. Tweed Warren – Warren G. Harding Woodrow – Woodrow Wilson
The Tax Collector not participating in the Party event is almost certainly intentional and possibly another reference to Ebenezer Scrooge, as they both do not celebrate.
Despite being a squid, water will still slow down its movement.
The Blood Squid's anatomy resembles that of a vampire squid, small deep-sea cephalopods native to temperate and tropical oceans at extreme, lightless depths.
The Blood Squid has its own banner, unlike most other summoned enemies like Shadowflame Apparitions, Baby Slimes, Slimelings, and Chattering Teeth Bombs.
The Ice Queen begins spawning during the Frost Moon event at wave 11.
During the final waves of the Frost Moon there may be several Ice Queens on the screen at once.
The Ice Queen has a higher chance of dropping loot in later waves. See Frost Moon § Loot for more details.
The Ice Queen's projectiles inflict the following debuffs : [5]

Both of the Ice Queen's attacks will inflict the Chilled debuff, which slows the player's movement speed, and Frost Waves will sometimes inflict the Frozen debuff which completely immobilizes the player. Equipping a Hand Warmer (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) or Ankh Shield in the Desktop, Console, and Mobile versions will negate these effects and potentially make the fight much less frustrating.

Drinking a Warmth Potion (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) is recommended as it will significantly lower the damage the Ice Queen can inflict on the player, and it will last for the entire duration of the event.
The Frozen debuff causes players to exit their mounts. This may kill a player without immunity to fall damage if inflicted at a high enough point in the sky.
The Ice Queen is most vulnerable while executing her twirl attack, when she spins in place rapidly and shoots Frost Shards in all directions. This is the only time she stays in one spot.

The distribution of the Ice Queen's Frost Shards during her twirl attack is weighted such that the projectiles have a significantly higher chance of shooting near-diagonally than near-vertically or near-horizontally. Thus, players standing roughly along one cardinal direction from the Ice Queen (up, down, left, or right from her) have a lesser chance of being hit than players standing diagonally from her. [6]

To mitigate her damage, using wings and possibly movement-enhancing accessories for chasing and dodging, in addition to equipping a Cross Necklace / Star Veil combined with lifesteal ( Spectre armor or Vampire Knives ), proves very effective.

On the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the Ice Queen is considered the third strongest enemy in the game, the strongest being the Dungeon Guardian and the second strongest being Duke Fishron.

Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the R.E.K. 3000 do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The R.E.K. 3000 may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.
In a drunk world, it is possible to get the R.E.K. 3000 before defeating Skeletron.
Selling the R.E.K. 3000 is more profitable than selling its separate parts ( 1 GC for the Tally Counter, 1 GC for the Lifeform Analyzer, and 50 SC for the Radar ).

It is possible that the R.E.K. 3000 is a reference to the Garden of Eden Creation Kit, commonly abbreviated as "G.E.C.K.", and the Pip-Boy 3000 from the post-apocalyptic role-playing video games series Fallout. The acronym R.E.K. may stand for Rares, Enemies, and Kills, the three displayed functions of this item. The acronym R.E.K. may stand for Rares, Enemies, and Kills, the three displayed functions of this item.

Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the Sextant do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The Sextant may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.
The Fisherman's Pocket Guide, Weather Radio, and Sextant are interchangeable with Shimmer.
The icon of the Sextant turns into a red moon during a Blood Moon or a Solar Eclipse.

A real-life sextant is a navigational instrument used to determine the angle between an astrological object and the horizon, often by sailors to determine latitude, and has nothing to do with measuring or evaluating moon phases.
It resembles the Regal Gel projectiles of Queen Slime.
It can be considered a Hardmode counterpart to the Slime Gun.
The tooltip is a reference to the "Gamer Girl Bathwater" product sold by Belle Delphine in 2019.
The Hook of Dissonance has an unusually fast retract time; most hooks in the game retract at the same speed they launch. The Hook of Dissonance retracts in less than half that time.
The Hook of Dissonance can be used with Shroomite armor in order to move while in stealth mode before obtaining Vortex armor.
If the player attempts to teleport through a gap that is smaller than their height, they will instead be teleported to the closest position through which they can fit.
The Hook of Dissonance can be used to get out of a situation where the player is cornered by enemies, since they will not take any damage while passing through the enemies.
Since the hook teleports the player to a block, the player will lose all momentum as a result.
Unlike regular hooks, the player will not take damage from falling blocks, such as sand or silt, while traveling using the Hook of Dissonance.
This hook can also serve as an alternative to the Rod of Discord if used properly.

The Hook of Dissonance can be used to move vertically very quickly in traditional platform row arenas while skipping past airborne enemies, which can be used to quickly escape from tight situations in boss fights and invasion events.
This hook's projectile appears to be a kunai, complementing the theme of the Crystal Assassin Armor.
Even at top firing speed, notes are still relatively slow in comparison to other projectiles.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Notes from the Magical Harp receive the Frost armor 's set bonus.

The size of the game window appears to change how far the mouse/click needs to be for certain projectile speeds. Smaller screens do not have to move the cursor as far to shoot a faster/higher-pitched note.
Low, slow notes can hit large enemies multiple times, while fast, high notes are more likely to hit moving targets.
The Magical Harp's infinite piercing projectiles are exceptionally effective for killing worm -type enemies, especially The Destroyer.
Due to the slow speed and bouncing capabilities of the projectiles, the Magical Harp is useful for fights in small spaces, e.g. against Golem.
The Magical Harp's sprite is always shown while held, unlike most weapons that only show while firing.

The Magical Harp can be considered a direct upgrade from the Water Bolt ; its projectiles have more damage and can bounce and pierce more. However the projectiles will only last 4 seconds and (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) do not have any knockback / (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) barely have knockback, removing the Water Bolt's useful ability of keeping enemies away.
Despite playing musical tones when fired, lowering the "Music" option from the audio will not make the Magical Harp go quiet.

The Magical Harp's notes fired appear to be quarter notes, eighth notes, and paired eighth notes, though these notes only differ visually and do not have different stats. These notes also appear backward when fired, only being turned around to the correct orientation after bouncing off a surface.
Water slows down the notes' speed even though in the real world, sound travels faster in water.
Internally, the Water Sphere is considered an enemy, not a projectile. Therefore, it has an NPC ID and statistics like health and defense, unlike actual projectiles.
This weapon is a reference to a special attack from the anime franchise Soul Eater, specifically Maka Albarn's variation of the Kishin Hunter, which may have also been the reason for its removal.
This weapon's item ID was given to Red Potion upon its removal.
The runes themselves do not spell anything and cannot be altered to control their "spelling".
The change of runes is synchronized across all placed Arcane Rune Walls in a world.

When placed in large patches, some tiles may not display a rune. This also applies to single pieces of Arcane Rune Walls within patches of other wall types. This also applies to single pieces of Arcane Rune Walls within patches of other wall types.
The Hemogoblin Shark is immune to lava and is unimpeded by liquids. It is not, however, immune to the On Fire! debuff from non-lava sources.
It can run at just enough speed to outrun even players with Terraspark Boots on ground.
The Sonar Potion will detect if a Blood Moon enemy is about to be hooked (it will display enemies in red text).
Using the Chum Caster will greatly increase the chances of hooking Blood Moon enemies.
The Hemogoblin Shark will not fire Blood Shots while submerged in liquids.
Building a platform high above the player's fishing spot allows them to dodge the Hemogoblin Shark's lunging attacks, though it can still hit the player with its Blood Shot attack.
Keeping the Hemogoblin Shark underwater will prevent it from firing Blood Shots.
The Flying Knife is an effective weapon if the Hemogoblin Shark gets stuck in a crevice.
The Hemogoblin Shark cannot enter doors, being 4 tiles tall. However it will still keep trying to enter, getting stuck at the doorway, allowing for an easy kill.

Trapping either the Hemogoblin Shark or player themselves inside a house or otherwise enclosed area and using weapons that can attack through walls (e.g., the Crystal Vile Shard ) allows for a flawless, albeit slow kill.
Opening a small hole, or using a platform Hoik in an enclosed space can allow the player to use normal weapons and projectiles to easily kill the Hemogoblin Shark.

The name Hemogoblin Shark is a portmanteau of hemoglobin, an oxygen-carrying protein found in vertebrates which is responsible for giving blood its red color, and goblin shark, a rare and ancient species of shark native to the deep waters of the Eastern Atlantic, from which this enemy likely takes its appearance. Hemogoblin is also an anagram of hemoglobin. Hemogoblin is also an anagram of hemoglobin.

It is the only non- Old One's Army event enemy to follow the Attacker AI.  It also shares all of its sounds with the Drakin, possibly hinting that it was based on the Drakin. Unlike other enemies with this AI, it will not prioritize the Eternia Crystal over the player if both are present. Unlike other enemies with this AI, it will not prioritize the Eternia Crystal over the player if both are present.
Despite dropping Cursed Flames, it neither inflicts nor is immune to the Cursed Inferno debuff.

As with all worms, debuffs and piercing or area-of-effect damage are very effective, as the enemy consists of numerous vulnerable targets. A Dark Lance or a better spear is powerful, having a good range and being able to hit multiple segments at a time. The Ice Sickle is a strong melee weapon that will deal massive damage to the World Feeder's segments. Magic weapons such as the Magical Harp or the Magic Dagger are useful. The Cursed Inferno debuff, inflicted by Cursed Bullets, Cursed Arrows, or Cursed Flames, can take the World Feeder down fairly quickly. The Cursed Flames it drops will be even more useful for making those types of ammunition. A Dark Lance or a better spear is powerful, having a good range and being able to hit multiple segments at a time. The Ice Sickle is a strong melee weapon that will deal massive damage to the World Feeder's segments. Magic weapons such as the Magical Harp or the Magic Dagger are useful. The Cursed Inferno debuff, inflicted by Cursed Bullets, Cursed Arrows, or Cursed Flames, can take the World Feeder down fairly quickly. The Cursed Flames it drops will be even more useful for making those types of ammunition.
The World Feeder resembles the Eater of Worlds, similar to how the Wandering Eye resembles the Eye of Cthulhu.
The internal name of the World Feeder is Seeker.
The ascent speed on a Rope is 41 mph, the descent speed is 51 mph, and the horizontal speed is about 5 mph (although it is listed as 0 mph in the game, it is about 7.55 feet per second).
All varieties of Rope include a "+3 range" attribute that allows the item to be used from further away. This does not affect the usage of placed Ropes.
No types of Rope can be turned off with Actuators.

A glitch in the Nintendo 3DS version causes the Rope to multiply downwards at no extra Rope cost if an eighth piece of Rope is added to a vertical string of seven pieces of Rope. The multiplication is finite, however, and it will eventually stop.

Rope works very well for building hellevators because players descend at the same speed as free-fall, and ascend fairly quickly as well. It is very easy to obtain and can be placed at the top of the hellevator over and over again to bring the Rope all the way down. Note that placed items like Torches might interrupt the placement.

The player can also place Rope even if the top is not anchored to anything, and even extend it skyward. This can be used to easily access Floating Islands : Build a Rope column upwards while climbing skyward. Similarly, Rope can be used to quickly ascend to the surface when exploring the depths of the Ocean.
Flying into a Rope and continuing to move on the Rope will maintain the velocity of flight.

Making Silk Rope instead of Web Rope is more resource-efficient: While 30 Web Ropes require 10 Cobwebs, 30 Silk Ropes only require 7 Cobwebs (crafted into Silk). However, Silk and Silk Rope both require a Loom to craft, whereas Web Rope can be crafted without any crafting station. However, Silk and Silk Rope both require a Loom to craft, whereas Web Rope can be crafted without any crafting station.
Converting all Ropes into coils when possible will allow carrying ten times as much Rope, and they can be crafted back into normal Rope if necessary.
The mechanical tool that the player automatically uses to move along Rope is called PlayerPulley internally.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Chlorophyte Ore is capable of turning nearby Dirt Blocks into Mud.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) In Hardmode, the evil biomes are capable of converting nearby Mud Blocks to Dirt Blocks. Thrown Water and the Clentaminator similarly convert Mud Blocks covered with Jungle/Mushroom grass. Bare Mud Blocks will not be converted by these items, unless there is a grass block of the target biome (e.g. a Crimson grass block when using Blood Water/Red Solution) directly adjacent to it. [1] Thrown Water and the Clentaminator similarly convert Mud Blocks covered with Jungle/Mushroom grass. Bare Mud Blocks will not be converted by these items, unless there is a grass block of the target biome (e.g. a Crimson grass block when using Blood Water/Red Solution) directly adjacent to it. [1]
The tooltip of the item is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for Bernie in Don't Starve Together.
The tooltip of the buff is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for Bernie in The Forge event of Don't Starve Together.

Paladins are exceptionally tough enemies. Their hammer attack is unusually versatile for a non- boss enemy and inflicts extreme damage. Paladins also have more health than Skeletron, knockback immunity, and have as much defense as the Moon Lord (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Duke Fishron (in its first form), making it difficult to kill and dangerous to try to slip past or ignore.
Although Paladins have a visual height of 4 tiles, they can pass through 3 tile-tall corridors.
Paladins cannot throw hammers while moving or while being hit.
Paladins are much less likely to attack players outside their line-of-sight.

Because a Paladin's attack will be interrupted if it takes damage, quickly firing weapons can stop it from attacking entirely. Most melee weapons are capable of hitting fast enough, although the Paladin's immunity to knockback, as well as other, surrounding enemies, may make this tough to pull off. Fast-firing ranged weapons can also be used, however, other enemies may get in the way, allowing the Paladin to attack. Consider using piercing or exploding shots. A Piranha Gun is exceptionally effective. Magic weapons with piercing capabilities can be used to great effect. Notable examples include the Heat Ray ( (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) ), Nettle Burst, Wasp Gun or Magical Harp. Once obtained, a Shadowbeam Staff or Rainbow Gun can also be used. Summon weapons are extremely useful for taking out Paladins. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) If the Paladin is targeted, the minions will almost always hit it fast enough to halt its attacks. The player can then focus on taking out other enemies and staying a safe distance away from them. The Desert Tiger Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Terraprisma (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Tempest Staff, and Raven Staff are the best minion weapons available at this point of progression. Most melee weapons are capable of hitting fast enough, although the Paladin's immunity to knockback, as well as other, surrounding enemies, may make this tough to pull off. Fast-firing ranged weapons can also be used, however, other enemies may get in the way, allowing the Paladin to attack. Consider using piercing or exploding shots. The player can then focus on taking out other enemies and staying a safe distance away from them. The Desert Tiger Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Terraprisma (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Tempest Staff, and Raven Staff are the best minion weapons available at this point of progression.

As Paladins usually cease to attack as soon as their line of sight is blocked, closed doors and walls (which may include openings with a width of one block) are a safe barrier. Weapons that are capable of attacking through blocks (e.g. Death Sickle ) or those that fit through small holes (e.g. Scourge of the Corruptor or Nimbus Rod ) can be used to defeat Paladins with little risk.

Fighting it in smaller hallways is not recommended, as this leaves no room for dodging, and often leads to a quick death. It may be possible to defeat a Paladin in a longer, two-way corridor by continuously attacking while backing away, but additional enemies potentially getting in the way still pose a threat.

Getting hit by a Paladin's body deals less damage than getting hit by one of its hammers, unless in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
In Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Paladins will despawn even if they pick up coins.
Out of all Dungeon enemies, the Paladin drops the most coins upon death.
It visibly holds the items that it drops: the Paladin's Hammer and Paladin's Shield.
The Paladin drops the third most coins of any non- boss enemy, tied with the Pirate Captain.

In real life, a paladin is usually a heroic champion (especially a knightly one) or a defender or advocate of a noble cause. The twelve foremost knights of Emperor Charlemagne 's court are also called paladins.

The Demon Conch requires a flat surface at least 2 tiles high and 3 tiles wide at the center of the Underworld, or it will not teleport the player. At the minimum, 3 solid blocks placed in a "V"-formation fulfills this requirement. The chosen area must be within 100 tiles east or west of the world's center, and be 25 or more tiles below the start of the Underworld layer. The chosen area must be safe. It cannot contain Spikes, blocks that can inflict Burning, or lava. Other liquids are acceptable. The point chosen (specifically 3 tiles above the ground, on the left side of the three-block area) cannot have a wall behind it. Other walls in the space are fine but this means it is not possible to spawn inside an enclosed space without breaking a hole in the wall. At the minimum, 3 solid blocks placed in a "V"-formation fulfills this requirement. The chosen area must be within 100 tiles east or west of the world's center, and be 25 or more tiles below the start of the Underworld layer. The chosen area must be safe. It cannot contain Spikes, blocks that can inflict Burning, or lava. Other liquids are acceptable. The point chosen (specifically 3 tiles above the ground, on the left side of the three-block area) cannot have a wall behind it. Other walls in the space are fine but this means it is not possible to spawn inside an enclosed space without breaking a hole in the wall.

Upon using the Demon Conch in a drunk world seed, it is highly possible that no area within the Underworld's center will fulfill this requirement, requiring the player to build a foundation of solid blocks in order to have the Demon Conch function properly.

A failed Demon Conch teleport will reset the player's momentum, and reset any extra jumps from accessories. Furthermore, holding ↷ Jump until the teleport fails will only reset the flight time provided by Rocket Boots and its upgrades, while releasing ↷ Jump before the teleport will reset the flight time provided by both Rocket Boots and wings, making it possible to gain "infinite" flight.

The Demon Conch's tooltip, " If you listen closely, you can hear screams", is a reference to the belief that one can hear the ocean when holding a conch shell to a person's ear, except that instead of ocean sounds, sounds of screaming are heard instead, as this is an Underworld-related item.
It has one of the slowest use times in the game, tied with the Magic Conch, Magic Mirrors, Cell Phone, Shellphone, and Snake Charmer's Flute.
The Demon Conch resembles the shell of a Magma Snail.

On Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, due to requiring Worm Teeth, which only drop from Devourers and have no Crimson equivalent, Unholy Arrows are not possible to craft in worlds that generate with Crimson without transferring materials (ideally Worm Teeth) from a world with Corruption. However, it is possible to purchase them from the Arms Dealer even on Crimson worlds. However, it is possible to purchase them from the Arms Dealer even on Crimson worlds.

Unholy Arrows have high damage, only being beaten by Hellfire Arrows in pre-Hardmode. Compared to Hellfire Arrows, Unholy Arrows are better at dealing with spread out enemies or enemies in a line, such as in the Old One's Army, while Hellfire Arrows are better against compact crowds of enemies such as in the Dungeon or against worms such as The Destroyer. Unholy Arrows can be bought in pre-Hardmode, however, making them easier to get. Compared to Hellfire Arrows, Unholy Arrows are better at dealing with spread out enemies or enemies in a line, such as in the Old One's Army, while Hellfire Arrows are better against compact crowds of enemies such as in the Dungeon or against worms such as The Destroyer. Unholy Arrows can be bought in pre-Hardmode, however, making them easier to get.

Jester's Arrows can pierce more enemies than Unholy Arrows, but have lower damage and a greater damage drop-off per hit (10% as opposed to 5%), and are harder to farm once Unholy Arrows can be bought. Jester's Arrows are stronger against the Eater of Worlds and Brain of Cthulhu due to the sheer number of targets to pierce through, and Fallen Stars are easier to obtain than Worm Teeth or Vertebrae. Unlike the Jester's Arrow, Unholy Arrows do not automatically break after a certain amount of air time. Unlike the Jester's Arrow, Unholy Arrows do not automatically break after a certain amount of air time.
In the 1.3 release date trailer, a Vortex Drill can be seen in the third slot of the player's hotbar.
This item is a reference to Stan Marsh 's hat from the American animated sitcom South Park.
The Bestiary entry for the Twinkle Popper: " This beastly celestial arachnid rapidly spawns swift and relentless offspring to distract its prey as it prepares to devour them. "

The Pirate Map can only drop if the following conditions are met: [2] The world is in Hardmode. The enemy can drop at least 1 CC (i.e. statue -spawned enemies, Meteor Heads, etc. cannot drop Pirate Map). The enemy is within 380 tiles of either side of the world. The enemy is located above 10 tiles below the border between surface and underground. The world is in Hardmode. The enemy can drop at least 1 CC (i.e. statue -spawned enemies, Meteor Heads, etc. cannot drop Pirate Map). The enemy is within 380 tiles of either side of the world. The enemy is located above 10 tiles below the border between surface and underground.
Although Pirate Maps can only be obtained in Hardmode, they can be used to summon Pirate invasions even in pre-Hardmode worlds.

Perhaps the easiest way to farm Pirate Maps is to stay just above the Ocean water ( Water Walking Boots or a small platform will work). Use a Water Candle and/or Battle Potion to increase the spawn rate and farm enemies, and they eventually will drop a Pirate Map. Minions can be helpful during the farming process.
During a Blood Moon, enemies will spawn at an even higher rate, which can be stacked with Water Candle and Battle Potion buffs. This practically ensures the drop of several Pirate Maps.
Creating a Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) mini-biome near the Ocean will raise enemy spawn rates even during the day, allowing quick farming.
The King Slime can be used as a good source for farming Pirate Maps.

With Neptune's Shell and minions, along with any minion boost gear available (such as Spider armor ), stand on the Ocean floor while the minions kill incoming enemies. In Crimson worlds, place a contained area of Crimson to one side of the Ocean so Blood Jellies spawn, which will be more frequent than ordinary Ocean spawns. If the Jungle is close enough to overlap the Ocean, Arapaimas will spawn frequently. A Jungle can be created artificially near the Ocean. In Corrupt worlds, it is helpful to corrupt the Ocean using Unholy Water or a Clentaminator and grind the Eater of Worlds for maps. Since there are about 50 parts per boss, around every 2 bosses will probably drop at least one map. Harpies and Wyverns can also drop Pirate Maps. In Crimson worlds, place a contained area of Crimson to one side of the Ocean so Blood Jellies spawn, which will be more frequent than ordinary Ocean spawns. If the Jungle is close enough to overlap the Ocean, Arapaimas will spawn frequently. A Jungle can be created artificially near the Ocean. In Corrupt worlds, it is helpful to corrupt the Ocean using Unholy Water or a Clentaminator and grind the Eater of Worlds for maps. Since there are about 50 parts per boss, around every 2 bosses will probably drop at least one map. Harpies and Wyverns can also drop Pirate Maps.
Pirates themselves can drop Pirate Maps if fought within the Ocean biome, which can make farming easier. This also applies to all other invasion enemies, such as the Goblin Army and Frost Legion.
The Pirate Map plays the same sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Roar_0.wav as the boss-summoning items ( Suspicious Looking Eye, Mechanical Skull, etc.) when used.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Guide mentions the Pirate Map in a tip: " I think I saw a treasure map floating around in the ocean once, but a shark ate it. Maybe you should go try and find one? " However, Pirate Maps can drop from any Ocean enemy, not only from Sharks. However, Pirate Maps can drop from any Ocean enemy, not only from Sharks.
Chlorophyte will only spread in a Hardmode world.
Chlorophyte Ore can spread to hammered, actuated, and painted blocks. This will cause the ore to be hammered, actuated, or painted too.

Chlorophyte Ore's spread mechanics grant the Underground Jungle some resistance against The Corruption and The Crimson 's destructive effects, especially on Desktop, Console, and Mobile (where it can revert Dirt to Mud and evil grass to Jungle grass ). However, these biomes will still spread through Stone Blocks, and more importantly, on Old-gen console and 3DS, Chlorophyte Ore will not regrow or convert other Jungle features such as grass or trees.
Despite being mud-based, Chlorophyte Ore cannot convert Mushroom grass blocks.
Despite its tooltip and achievement, it does not need light to grow. However, it does slightly glow green when exposed to light.
Chlorophyte Ore and Chlorophyte Bricks restrict the spread of the evil biomes around them. [1] See biome spread for further information.
A Spelunker Potion can be used to find Chlorophyte faster.

When mining for Chlorophyte, it is advisable to avoid smaller clusters of the ore. Leaving them to grow will result in a steady, renewable supply of Chlorophyte in the long term. When mining big veins, it is advised to keep 1–2 Chlorophyte not mined so it can regrow to more Chlorophyte.
Selling the bar rather than the ore yields (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 SC / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 87 SC more than the components per bar.

The name Chlorophyte is derived from chlorophyll, the color pigment responsible for photosynthesis, plus the common rock suffix -ite. The prefix chloro- means green, while the suffix -phyte means plant; so "chlorophyte" translates to "green plant". The prefix chloro- means green, while the suffix -phyte means plant; so "chlorophyte" translates to "green plant".

Chlorophyte Ore is completely renewable on Desktop, Console, and Mobile due to the fact that Dirt Bombs allow the duplication of Dirt Blocks, and that Stone and Wood Blocks can be Shimmered into dirt (and, therefore, Mud Blocks).
Chlorophyta is a division of green algae, informally called chlorophytes.
Its appearance when placed seems to resemble some plant cells.
Land Mine explosions do not damage placed blocks or walls.
NPCs can trigger Land Mines.
Land Mines can be painted.

Land Mines can be useful in PvP situations where it is necessary to ward players away from a certain patch of land. Land Mines can even kill players who have PvP disabled or their users. A Pressure Plate wired to Explosives may be more effective during PvP, since it is not as visible. However, it will destroy blocks, and other players may hide in the pit. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) However, like any other trap, Echo Coating can be used to conceal the Land Mine, hiding it completely from unsuspecting players. Land Mines can even kill players who have PvP disabled or their users. A Pressure Plate wired to Explosives may be more effective during PvP, since it is not as visible. However, it will destroy blocks, and other players may hide in the pit. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) However, like any other trap, Echo Coating can be used to conceal the Land Mine, hiding it completely from unsuspecting players. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) However, like any other trap, Echo Coating can be used to conceal the Land Mine, hiding it completely from unsuspecting players.
Land Mines can be used as a convenient way to kill and collect drops from friendly NPCs, especially considering that they do not dislodge placed blocks.
Like explosives and Explosive Bullets, Land Mine damage counts as a PvP death, so softcore characters do not drop money when killed.
The Land Mine's texture is a reference to the Land Mine weapon in the artillery tactical video games series Worms.
Besides crafting, there is a chance to obtain a Flask of Party from breaking a Pigronata (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), which can be bought during a Party from the Party Girl.
In Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Flask of Party can be purchased from the Princess for 15 SC.

Since flasks apply to all weapons that deal melee damage, it is possible to create large amounts of confetti using this flask with weapons such as Vampire Knives, Light Discs, the Bladed Glove, or the Scourge of the Corruptor.
The Flask of Party produces significantly less confetti on the Mobile version.
Using a drill while under the buff will make the player appear to "shoot" confetti.

Common loadouts may include: Building and/or mining, e.g. the Hand Of Creation (or its components) and Mining armor Fishing, e.g. the Lavaproof Tackle Bag (or its components), a Fishing Bobber, and Angler armor In Expert Mode, the above may benefit from incorporating the passively attacking accessories ( Bone Helm, Volatile Gelatin, and Spore Sac ) and/or Royal Gel as mining and angler armor provide minimal combat benefits, and these activities do not take up many accessory slots (especially once the combined accessories mentioned above have been created). Otherwise, summoning accessories can also be used for passive defense, although additional minions will have to be summoned separately if the player switches from a loadout that did not support as many. Combat One can have loadouts for different combat classes, e.g. a ranged loadout to dispose of enemies at a distance and a melee one for when they approach. Another combat class loadout can be used as a backup for magic/ranged when out of mana/ammo (although, for a magic user, appropriate items usually enhance mana regeneration in various ways). Loadouts can be used to rapidly equip armor/accessories that are only needed for a short amount of time. One can switch to a loadout with high-defense armor and accessories (e.g. Worm Scarf or accessories with the modifier Warding ) right before getting hit for an immediate damage reduction, before switching back to offensive items. One can switch to a loadout with the Philosopher's Stone or Charm of Myths for the decreased duration of Potion Sickness. Keep in mind that the player needs to equip them for the whole duration to gain the full reduction on time. Switching to a loadout with debuff immunity items (e.g. Ankh Shield ) can be used to quickly cancel those debuffs. This does not work well with Summoning armor, since additional minions not supported by the target loadout will disappear. This also does not work as well with Magic armor, since mana above the maximum for the target loadout will disappear and need to be regenerated when switching back, although this usually does not take very long. Switching loadouts does not reset items with activated abilities. Switching to a loadout with wings in midair will only allow the player to glide, and similarly extra jump items cannot be used either until the player lands. Cooldowns such as the Master Ninja Gear 's dash are not reset upon switching loadouts. Switching to a loadout with wings in midair will only allow the player to glide, and similarly extra jump items cannot be used either until the player lands. Cooldowns such as the Master Ninja Gear 's dash are not reset upon switching loadouts.
If the player wishes to have multiple loadouts with the same item (e.g. items that boost all kinds of damage like the Destroyer Emblem ), they will need multiple copies of that item.

Since vanity/social slot items can be switched into the functional slots relatively quickly, by storing armor/accessories in them, one can effectively double the number of loadouts to 6, although at any time 3 of them will be easier access than the others. Loadouts are essentially an extension of the previously existing ability to swap vanity and functional slots. Existing tips on other pages that mention this can often be applied with loadouts instead, including many of the above. In some cases it may be preferable to continue swapping individual armor pieces/accessories this way, which takes longer but offers finer control than changing all of one's armor and accessories at once, avoiding some of the downsides mentioned above. Existing tips on other pages that mention this can often be applied with loadouts instead, including many of the above. In some cases it may be preferable to continue swapping individual armor pieces/accessories this way, which takes longer but offers finer control than changing all of one's armor and accessories at once, avoiding some of the downsides mentioned above.
The addition of loadouts indirectly increased the player's inventory capacity for dyes, armor, and accessories.
Loadouts cannot be switched while using an item.
Since switching loadouts does not change the items in the player's main inventory, the player must still have the appropriate weapons/tools for each loadout on-hand in order to make full use of them.
Armor, accessories, and dyes equipped by players that were created before loadouts were introduced automatically go into the first loadout.
With the Inner Tube equipped, the player gains +5 Fishing Power while floating in liquid.

The Inner Tube is more useful than the Flipper and Water Walking Boots at the beginning of the game, since it provides a function similar to having both accessories equipped. However, unlike those accessories, the Inner Tube has no upgrades, so it will be outclassed once the player has purchased the Tinkerer's Workshop.

As long as the player is underwater, this accessory will accelerate the player upward with no speed cap. This can be exploited by using a deep water column to reach incredibly high speeds. This can be further exploited using Lances to cause extraordinarily high damage, with the potential to inflict 1 million damage in a single hit. Once the player reaches speeds of around 150 mph, they will start to phase through blocks and ignore the Portal Gun 's portals, but not Teleporters. This can be further exploited using Lances to cause extraordinarily high damage, with the potential to inflict 1 million damage in a single hit. Once the player reaches speeds of around 150 mph, they will start to phase through blocks and ignore the Portal Gun 's portals, but not Teleporters.
Combined with a Featherfall Potion, sinking to the bottom of the Ocean and floating up will cause the character to shoot up high into the sky, possibly even reaching Floating Island height.

When combined with the stealth effect provided by Psycho Knife, Shroomite armor, or Vortex armor, the Inner Tube will still be visible, so wearing it in vanity slot is a good way to locate the player. However, Invisibility Potions will make it invisible as normal.

The term inner tube refers to the inflatable ring that forms the interior of some pneumatic tires. It is also sometimes used as a synonym of swim ring, an inflatable water toy derived from the original inner tube. The Terraria item closely resembles a swim ring.
While nearly identical in function to a Recall Potion, the Magic Mirror has a noticeable startup delay.
Fall height will be reset when the Magic Mirror is used, allowing it to be used as a means to avoid lethal falls.
On the Old-gen console version, opening a storage item such as a Chest or a Piggy Bank while the Magic Mirror animation plays will crash the game upon arrival.
Using Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to decraft excess mirrors produces a far higher sell value for the constituted parts than selling them directly.

Due to their reflective properties, mirrors play a powerful role in cultural literature and are often depicted as magical in nature. In video games, it is common for them to be used as a magical means of transportation between distant locations, into secret spaces, or even into other dimensions.
They have one of the slowest use times in the game, tied with the Magic Conch, Demon Conch, Cell Phone, Shellphone, and Snake Charmer's Flute.
On earlier versions of Old-gen console, it was possible to use the Magic Mirror to gain permanent invincibility by using it before invincibility ran out. This has since been patched out.

Unlike several other NPCs, who sell their own clothes on Halloween, the Nurse set is not sold by the Nurse. On a technical level, this may be because the Nurse does not have a shop interface through which to sell her own clothes. The Arms Dealer in particular (and not any other NPC) was probably chosen to sell the set because his quote " Make it quick! I've got a date with <name of Nurse> in an hour. " suggests he is in a relationship with her. The Arms Dealer in particular (and not any other NPC) was probably chosen to sell the set because his quote " Make it quick! I've got a date with <name of Nurse> in an hour. " suggests he is in a relationship with her.
The Nurse Pants seem to have the actual legs associated with the skirt and shoes.
Both Luminite Arrows and their bolts reduce their damage by 1/25 (4%) each time they damage an enemy. [1]
Secondary bolts will originate at the same position where the arrows were initially fired, regardless of player position or movement.
A secondary bolt will be spawned for each arrow that was initially fired. For instance, using a Tsunami, which fires five arrows at once, will cause five bolts to be released after the initial shot.
Unlike many other arrows, both Luminite Arrows and their bolts have a limited range. They will evaporate in the air if they exceed this maximum range.
It can be difficult to hit a moving enemy with the secondary bolts. Enemies can be damaged by both the arrows and their bolts if they are on a long, flat surface (e.g. a skybridge ).

Luminite Arrows synergize exceptionally with the Phantasm bow: The Phantasm releases four arrows (and thus four secondary lasers) while consuming only one arrow from the inventory. It has a 66% chance not to consume arrows, which is very desirable considering the value of Luminite as well as its ineligibility for recovery. A successful hit with Phantasm can allow for a triple hit on an enemy: first the initial shots, then the Phantasm's secondary arrow projectiles, and lastly the bolts from Luminite Arrows. The Phantasm releases four arrows (and thus four secondary lasers) while consuming only one arrow from the inventory. It has a 66% chance not to consume arrows, which is very desirable considering the value of Luminite as well as its ineligibility for recovery. A successful hit with Phantasm can allow for a triple hit on an enemy: first the initial shots, then the Phantasm's secondary arrow projectiles, and lastly the bolts from Luminite Arrows.

The quote " 'Shooting them down at the speed of sound!' " may be a reference to the line "Rolling around at the speed of sound" in the song " Escape from the City " from the 2001 platform game Sonic Adventure 2.
While very expensive, the Cluster Rocket I is slightly better than other rockets for large events like the Lunar Events.
Stynger Bolts have a very similar function while costing a fraction of the price of Cluster Rockets. This option trades cost for versatility, as Stynger Bolts can only be fired by the Stynger.
Hanging Braziers can work well for lighting in builds that use Hanging Herbs, as they are both made from the same Hanging Pot and thus have similar textures.
Although the Hanging Brazier appears to hang from a single point like Chandeliers, they actually require two blocks of space to hang from.
This accessory is helpful when fighting the Dungeon Guardian, as critical strikes deal more damage to the Dungeon Guardian.
Unlike all other tables, the Dynasty Table is only 1 tile high. However, its counterpart, the Dynasty Chair, is still 2 tiles high.
The Picnic Table and the Fancy Picnic Table count as both a table and a chair for the purpose of NPC housing, but only as a Table for the purpose of crafting. [1]
The Frozen Table is not affected by Ice Skates when stood on.
When any Gem Robe is equipped in an armor slot without a Wizard Hat, Tim 's spawn rate will be increased to 5 times.
This item is the armor analog to the Sapphire Staff.
Although it appears to only take up a 3×2 space, it actually requires a 4×3-tile empty space; this is because the Cannon needs the extra space in order to properly rotate.

If used quickly, the sound that the Cannonballs make exploding on the ground causes the sound of the Cannon launching the Cannonballs to stop before it is completed, making shorter bursts of incomplete noise.
The Cannon is powerful but immobile, functioning as a fixed gun emplacement, and so is best suited for tasks such as home defense.
Despite being weaker than the Bunny Cannon, the Cannon could be seen as a better choice of home defense, due to the fact Cannonballs are easier to obtain than Explosive Bunnies.

When fired on a flat surface: At 0° the Cannonball impacts the ground 21 tiles away. At 22.5° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 8 tiles and impacts the ground 43 tiles away. At 45° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 23 tiles and impacts the ground 45 tiles away. At 67.5° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 32 tiles and impacts the ground 29 tiles away. At 0° the Cannonball impacts the ground 21 tiles away. At 22.5° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 8 tiles and impacts the ground 43 tiles away. At 45° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 23 tiles and impacts the ground 45 tiles away. At 67.5° the Cannonball reaches a maximum height of 32 tiles and impacts the ground 29 tiles away.
The Bunny Cannon can be considered a more powerful version of the Cannon.

Wooden Arrows lose utility early on as better arrows become available, but they remain a considerably cheaper and more accessible alternative for bows that convert shots into special arrows, such as the Marrow, Ice Bow, and Sharanga (Old-gen console and 3DS versions), as these gain no benefit from the special properties of more expensive ammo types. In Hardmode, the Endless Quiver (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) may be a better alternative.
Upgrading Wooden Arrows to Flaming Arrows or Frostburn Arrows does not require a lot of resources, yet greatly increases their usefulness.
The darts fired from a Dart Trap bear a strong resemblance to Wooden Arrows.
In the beta version of Terraria, Wooden Arrows could not be crafted. Instead, they could only be found in Pots and Chests, or purchased from the Merchant for 10 CC each. [1] [2]
The Mana Booster, unlike natural or other sources of mana regeneration, will restore mana while using weapons that use mana.
There is a probability of 1/3 (33.33%) to yield a booster each time a player hurts an enemy, with a cooldown of 0.5 seconds.
The following enemies cannot yield boosters: Bubble Shield, Tesla Turret, Martian Drone, and Ancient Doom.
In addition to increasing its respective stack, picking up a booster will also refresh its duration.
Like all armors made from Luminite, equipping Nebula armor makes the player give off light, in this case purple. The more pieces equipped, the brighter the light is.

Due to its increased defense, positive damage bonuses, and extremely high-potential health regeneration, this armor set outclasses both Spectre armor variants offensively while providing survivability close to that of the Spectre Hood. Additionally, the Moon Lord's Moon Bite debuff will not stop the Life Booster from working as it increases passive health regeneration, unlike the Spectre armor with Hood, which gives instant health restoration. Additionally, the Moon Lord's Moon Bite debuff will not stop the Life Booster from working as it increases passive health regeneration, unlike the Spectre armor with Hood, which gives instant health restoration.
The Celestial Magnet does not increase the pickup range of the boosters, unlike the Treasure Magnet (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), since the game treats the boosters as items, not as Stars.
The sprites of the boosters before they are picked up strongly resemble the Nebula Fragments that are needed to make the armor.
In real life, a nebula is a diffuse interstellar cloud of ionized gases. They are often hotspots of star formation.

The Void Vault is only obtainable after defeating Skeletron, as its crafting recipe requires Bones, which drop from enemies in the Dungeon. However, defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu is not necessary: While summoning them at least once is required, Shadow Scales or Tissue Samples can be obtained by merely destroying a few segments of the Eater of Worlds or a few Creepers, respectively; the bosses do not have to be defeated. In a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it is obtainable before defeating Skeletron, as Dungeon enemies can spawn prior to defeating the boss. However, defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu is not necessary: While summoning them at least once is required, Shadow Scales or Tissue Samples can be obtained by merely destroying a few segments of the Eater of Worlds or a few Creepers, respectively; the bosses do not have to be defeated. In a drunk world (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it is obtainable before defeating Skeletron, as Dungeon enemies can spawn prior to defeating the boss.
Similarly to all other portable storage, the Void Vault is exclusive to each individual player. Its contents cannot be shared between players.

While the Void Vault requires only half of the materials of the Void Bag, it cannot be used freely and instead requires a flat surface of three tiles to place. For personal use, it is easier to craft the Void Bag only, as it is able to work individually and can be used any where to gain access to the Void Vault. However, Void Vaults do have their uses in making extra money, as they are considerably more valuable than their ingredients. For personal use, it is easier to craft the Void Bag only, as it is able to work individually and can be used any where to gain access to the Void Vault. However, Void Vaults do have their uses in making extra money, as they are considerably more valuable than their ingredients.
Earlier versions of the Void Vault had a dark purple portal, more resembling the portals from the Potion of Return in the current game.

After inflicted with Shimmering, an non-player entity's opacity will decrease by 1% per tick [1], resulting in it being completely invisible after 1.67 seconds. For entities with special transmutations, it will transform when it has 10% opacity, or after 1.5 seconds. After it leaves Shimmer, its opacity will increase by 0.1% per tick, and become fully opaque after 16.67 seconds. Hurting the entity will increase its opacity by 10%, or subtract 1.67 seconds from the total gradual change time. [2]

If the player is in the Shimmering state for more than 20 seconds, they will be teleported to an open space when any of the movement keys ( ▲ Up, ◀ Left, ▼ Down, ▶ Right ) is pressed. If no movement key is pressed and the player remains in the Shimmering state for more than 60 seconds in total, they will be forcefully teleported to open space. [3]

The following enemies' attacks can still deal damage to the player during Shimmering state: [4] The Torch God (projectiles), King Slime, Spiked Slime, Eye of Cthulhu, Servant of Cthulhu, Eater of Worlds, Vile Spit, Creeper, Dark Mage (projectiles only), Old One's Skeleton, Queen Bee (projectiles only), Bee, Skeletron and its arms, Deerclops (projectiles only), Wall of Flesh, The Hungry, Leech, Queen Slime and all her minions, The Destroyer, Probe, The Twins (projectiles only), Skeletron Prime and its arms, Ogre (projectiles only), Plantera, Plantera's Tentacle, Plantera's Hook, Empress of Light (projectiles only), Golem, Duke Fishron, Sharkron, Betsy (projectiles only), Lunatic Cultist, Phantasm Dragon, Ancient Vision, Moon Lord, True Eye of Cthulhu.
The player cannot enter the Shimmering state in reversed gravity. Gravity will be reset to normal as soon as the player touches Shimmer.
The descent speed in the Shimmering state can be sped up by holding the Portal Gun.
Shimmering can be used to gain early access into the Jungle Temple.

Boss classification is determined as follows: Bosses: boss = true in Terraria 's source code; Mini-bosses: the other trophy-dropping characters. Bosses: boss = true in Terraria 's source code; Mini-bosses: the other trophy-dropping characters.

The status messages that appear when the bosses are about to spawn are as follows: Eye of Cthulhu : " You feel an evil presence watching you... " Eater of Worlds and Brain of Cthulhu : " A horrible chill goes down your spine... " after the first and " Screams echo around you... " after the second Shadow Orb / Crimson Heart is broken. The third only produces a standard summon message. The Destroyer : " You feel vibrations from deep below... " The Twins : " This is going to be a terrible night... " Skeletron Prime : " The air is getting colder around you... " Mechdusa : " What a horrible night to have a curse. " Moon Lord : " Impending doom approaches... As of 1.2.3, worlds generated in earlier versions, in which a player defeated all mechanical bosses before upgrading, will not have those bosses register as defeated; for instance, Plantera's Bulbs will not spawn, and the Steampunker will not arrive.
There are currently 36 different/unique bosses ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 33 / (Old-gen console version) 19 / (3DS version) 21) in the game.
Some enemies are particularly difficult to defeat, yet are not classified as bosses.
Even though there are food items in the game that could reasonably be made into a Banana Split, such as Bananas and Ice Cream, the Banana Split cannot be crafted.
Its male and female variants look identical.
Although a Daybloom is needed, the flower inside the helmet appears red.
The Ancient Gold Helmet has the same sprite that the Gold Helmet had before 1.0.3, thus the term "Ancient".
The Ancient Gold Helmet is available even if a world generated with Platinum Ore. However, obtaining a Gold armor set to complete its set bonus is much harder in this case.
Due to its high ore requirement, it is advisable to skip Gold armor. The next tier of armor is usually available before the player can get enough Gold to craft the armor set.

Prior to 1.3, if the Frost Breastplate and Leggings were paired with a Gold Helmet, and all pieces were dyed with Blue Flame and Black Dye, it would cause an afterimage and pulsing aura, akin to Hallowed armor. This was the armor Red used to wear before his specific set was added.

It is likely that the ability to craft a single type of fragment (Solar, for example) from the other three fragment types (Nebula, Vortex, and Stardust, in this case) was implemented due to the arduous process required to collect each fragment. For example, being a single Solar Fragment away from crafting the full set of armor would otherwise mean that the player had to again fight the Lunatic Cultist and the Solar Pillar. Furthermore, it allows players to craft items that require all four types of fragments, such as the Super Healing Potion, prior to taking on the Moon Lord.
The fragments each correspond to a weapon class. Solar Fragments are used for melee weapon users, Nebula Fragments for magic users, Vortex Fragments for rangers, and Stardust Fragments for summoners.
Lunar Fragments are not affected by gravity, similar to souls.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Fake Unicorn Horn cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
The Fake Unicorn Horn is a reference to the professional wrestling team The New Day. The tooltip references their catchphrase.

The Flying Carpet and the Sandstorm in a Bottle are the other two items that can appear in the Chest in a Pyramid. The Pharaoh's set is usually the least desirable out of the three possibilities due to its vanity nature, especially when speedrunning, for instance. However, the opposite is the case on Desktop, Console, and Mobile : The Pharaoh's set can be used to obtain both a Flying Carpet and a Sandstorm in a Bottle via Shimmer. This is still suboptimal for speedrunning, though. However, the opposite is the case on Desktop, Console, and Mobile : The Pharaoh's set can be used to obtain both a Flying Carpet and a Sandstorm in a Bottle via Shimmer. This is still suboptimal for speedrunning, though.
Due to the relatively high drop chance compared to other food items that provide the Exquisitely Stuffed buff, the BBQ Ribs may be a viable farming option for late-game players.

The BBQ Ribs may be a reference to Meat from the action-adventure video game series Castlevania, as both are meat-themed items that provide beneficial effects. However, in the Castlevania games, Meat is a powerful healing item that is usually hidden within breakable blocks but can be obtained in a variety of different ways across the series, such as by hitting candles, purchasing it from vendors, or defeating specific enemies. The Killer Fish BBQ item from Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia has a similar description: "Killer Fish, lightly seasoned and grilled to perfection." The Killer Fish BBQ item from Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia has a similar description: "Killer Fish, lightly seasoned and grilled to perfection."
The BBQ Ribs dropping from specific kinds of skeletons (Skeleton Commandos, Skeleton Snipers, and Tactical Skeletons) likely alludes to their ribs being visibly exposed.
The Crimson flail counterpart of the Ball O' Hurt is the Meatball. However, it is crafted rather than looted. Its Crimson Heart melee weapon counterpart is The Rotted Fork.
Despite appearing to be a weapon made of Demonite Bars and Shadow Scales, it is uncraftable.
A rather humorous modifier for this weapon is Hurtful, making it the "Hurtful Ball O' Hurt".

The Steak is one of the best Exquisitely Stuffed food items obtainable in pre-Hardmode, second only to the Golden Delight. However, it is much more reasonable and relatively easier to obtain than the Golden Delight, making it more accessible to the player. However, it is much more reasonable and relatively easier to obtain than the Golden Delight, making it more accessible to the player.
While it has less base damage than its sword counterpart, it gains effectiveness because of its ability to attack through multiple enemies, at a very long range, and while moving in any direction.

The Crawltipede determines if the player is airborne by checking a rectangle area consisting of 2 tiles from the center of the player to the left and right, and 15 tiles below (a 4×15 or 5×15 rectangle, depending on the position of the center of the player). If there are no "solid tiles" in the area, then the player is considered airborne. [1] "Solid tiles" include the following tiles: Solid blocks that are not hammered. All platforms, except platforms hammered to "bottom" position. Planter Boxes. Solid blocks that are not hammered. All platforms, except platforms hammered to "bottom" position. Planter Boxes.
Standing on the surface of a liquid (e.g. with Water Walking Boots ) is not considered to be standing on the ground.

The Crawltipede will approach flying players quickly and can deal massive damage. It moves swiftly and is able to make quick sharp turns; its mobility is far beyond any other worm-like enemies. It is very hard to dodge even with high-tier wings. Therefore, players should avoid this enemy as much as possible. However, wings combined with the Frog Leg and/or the Soaring Insignia are able to outrun the Crawltipede. However, wings combined with the Frog Leg and/or the Soaring Insignia are able to outrun the Crawltipede.
Short jumps into the air are usually possible, but it is important to land again quickly.

Homing and fast hitting weapons such as the Razorblade Typhoon, Possessed Hatchet, or Chlorophyte Bullets will make fighting a Crawltipede much easier. Likewise, minions make short work of this enemy as they will target the tail without the need for the player to aim.

Vampire Knives are very effective against Crawltipedes, due to the overall increased damage against them. This in turn rewards increased lifesteal, and thus players can very swiftly restore up to 40 HP with just one or two successful attacks.

If using a powerful magic weapon and wearing Spectre armor with the Spectre Hood, hitting the tail can heal for 600+ HP, the highest self-heal per hit in the game. However, due to how lifesteal works, this will result in no healing for the next few seconds. However, due to how lifesteal works, this will result in no healing for the next few seconds.
If the Solar Pillar has been defeated before, the Solar Eruption is somewhat effective against the Crawltipede. Its swinging motion and long length can easily hit Crawltipedes' tails.
Since Crawltipedes will not target players standing on platforms, placing a lot of layers of platforms in the area may help fighting Crawltipedes.

An unusual and perhaps somewhat dangerous method of dealing with the Crawltipede is waiting for it to curl up, then using the Cosmic Car Key to hover on the inside of its curl. The Crawltipede cannot turn sharply enough to reach the player, instead forming a circle around them. It can then be attacked from within its own "trap". The only issue is that there is not much room to move without touching the Crawltipede's body, which makes the player susceptible to Corites until the Crawltipede has been killed.
It is the only destructible enemy without a visible health bar.

The Crawltipede may be a reference to Moldorm from the fantasy action-adventure video game franchise The Legend of Zelda – more specifically, Link's Awakening, A Link to the Past, or A Link Between Worlds – where Moldorm appears as a giant black or yellow centipede that can only be damaged by striking its tail. It has a habit of attempting to knock Link into the pit surrounding the arena, similar to the Crawltipede's habit of flying directly into an airborne player.
Its name is a portmanteau of crawl and centipede.
It is the only Lunar Events enemy with its own kite.
Like boomerangs, Shurikens can be thrown through single-block-thick walls, at certain angles.
As Shurikens both pierce and are affected by gravity, they can be thrown upwards to damage an enemy multiple times.

Since Shurikens are easy to obtain, they are an effective early-game weapon. They are a good alternative to arrows, if the player does not have a bow. Even after getting a bow, they can remain relevant due to their ability to pierce multiple targets. (Good for the Eye of Cthulhu, though Jester's Arrow are far better) Even after getting a bow, they can remain relevant due to their ability to pierce multiple targets. (Good for the Eye of Cthulhu, though Jester's Arrow are far better)

In the official Japanese Terraria wiki, the Shuriken is referred to in two different writing systems, them being: The Katakana writing system which is also used in the official Japanese port. The Kanji writing system. The Katakana writing system which is also used in the official Japanese port. The Kanji writing system.

Particularly useful crafting recipes include the Tall Gate, which can allow mounts to pass through due to its increased height, and the Stone Slab, a way to economically process Stone Blocks into an incorruptible building material.

Both of the metal plating recipes are identical to their metal brick counterparts at the Furnace. Their colors are similar, but the sprites of platings tend to have larger and more irregular pieces compared to their equivalent bricks.
Despite having "Work Bench" in its name, the Heavy Work Bench cannot be used as a crafting station for the regular Work Bench recipes.
Despite being comparably easy to obtain, the Zoologist has a 5 star rarity in the Bestiary.

The quote, " I collected critters like you once, then I took a cursed fox bite to the knee! " is a reference to The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim with the often-repeated line "I used to be an adventurer like you, then I took an arrow in the knee".

The quote, " Oh, THESE ears? Haha, totes better to hear you with, my dear! " is a reference to the fairy tale of " Little Red Riding Hood ", wherein the Big Bad Wolf responds in a similar manner to questions about his unusual proportions when disguised as Little Red Riding Hood's grandmother.
The quote " This one time, at critter camp, I woke up one morning and everything was torn apart! Like, wow, how did I sleep through THAT?! " could be a reference to the 1999 comedy film American Pie.

Several of the Zoologist's possible names are references to real-life individuals. The name Bindi is a reference to the real-life Australian zookeeper Bindi Irwin, daughter of the late conservationist and television personality Steve Irwin. The names Jane and Dian are references to real-life primatologists Jane Goodall and Dian Fossey. The name Lilith is a reference to Cenx and Redigit's daughter, also referenced by the item Lilith's Necklace. The name Bindi is a reference to the real-life Australian zookeeper Bindi Irwin, daughter of the late conservationist and television personality Steve Irwin. The names Jane and Dian are references to real-life primatologists Jane Goodall and Dian Fossey. The name Lilith is a reference to Cenx and Redigit's daughter, also referenced by the item Lilith's Necklace.
According to Redigit, the Zoologist is the Golfer 's younger sister, referenced by some of her quotes. [1]
The Zoologist is often referred to as BestiaryGirl in Terraria 's source code.
The Zoologist will not put on a party hat when there is a Party, due to her fox ears.

The quotes " I can't explain it. I have like, a thing for <name of Witch Doctor>. Is it because of the tail? " and " LOVE. STRONG... <name of Witch Doctor>. Yeeyee! " could suggest that the Zoologist has a potential crush on the Witch Doctor.

The Zoologist has a unique quote for being in a loved biome while transformed: " FAVORITE LAND... <name of biome>. DELIGHT. ". This quote cannot be legitimately seen in-game, since Santa Claus is the only NPC with a loved biome.
The Zoologist's attacks look very similar to the attacks of the Terragrim.

The Zoologist's sprite was designed by Lazure, and was first shown in a Twitter post by him. [2] According to Redigit, the sprite was designed a long time ago, but the team did not have a use for it until 1.4.0.1. [3] According to Redigit, the sprite was designed a long time ago, but the team did not have a use for it until 1.4.0.1. [3]
The Bunny Hood can easily be obtained during a Blood Moon by releasing large amounts of caught Bunnies or by using a Bunny Statue.

The Ammo Box can be activated limitlessly with no cooldown period. It is never consumed, and all players may use it to give themselves the buff. (Old-gen console version) Activating the Ammo Box while the buff is already active resets the 10-minute buff duration. (Old-gen console version) Activating the Ammo Box while the buff is already active resets the 10-minute buff duration.

Each banner may be placed in a right- or left-facing orientation, but this is decided by which tile column in the world the banner is placed in. Placing it one block to the left or right will flip the orientation.
The four craftable banners correspond to the team colors in multiplayer, except for pink team, which was introduced after the four banners.
The Gravity Banner seems to resemble the Gravitation Potion 's buff icon.
The War Table Banner is the only one with 2×3 dimension instead of 1×3.

The Sun Stone and its counterpart, the Moon Stone, could be a reference to the platform-adventure action role-playing game Castlevania: Symphony of the Night. There are two items with very similar names, looks, and effects in the game: Sunstone and Moonstone.
The Flame Trap can shoot through a single block directly in front of it.
Among all liquids, the Flame Trap can only function through lava. Its flame will stop premature to its maximum range if it makes contact with other liquids.
Though the Jungle Temple is littered with traps, this type is fairly rare. It is possible that a given map's temple only features a single Flame Trap, or even none.
The Flame Trap fires 18 times per activation, taking a full second (60 ticks) to go through all 18 firings, firing once every 3-4 ticks.

In the Mobile version, the message "<Name of NPC> would like to settle down" used to display when the requirements for an NPC were fulfilled, but there was no housing for the NPC. This was removed in the 1.3.0.7 update.
Although King Slime can spawn naturally, it does not have a message.
The debuff is effective for locating worms while they are traveling through blocks. It can also be used to locate invisible players that are using Invisibility Potions or Shroomite armor.
If the Pet Spider follows the player to an area with fences nearby, the Spider will rapidly hop from the fences to the ground, causing a flickering effect.
The Pet Spider greatly resembles a miniature version of the Wall Creeper. If a red Dye is used on the Spider Egg, the spider resembles a Blood Crawler.

Removing a piece of the armor causes the minion cap to drop, and any minions that were summonable due to its boost will despawn immediately. This can solve issues when a minion failed to be replaced by a newly summoned one.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Both this armor and the Spooky armor can be regarded as the most powerful summoning armor sets. If there is no increase in minion numbers, Tiki armor increases the damage by 650% (with 5 minions), while Spooky Armor increases the damage by 632% (with 4 minions). If the player does not have at least 1 accessory and/or buff that increases their maximum number of minions, Tiki armor will actually cause minions to do more damage, with the upper hand of more defense. When the player can summon 1 extra minion, Tiki armor only increases it by 780%, while Spooky armor increases summon damage by a further 10%. The more minions that can be summoned, the comparatively more damage minions do with Spooky armor.
