If the player is in a Hardmode, non- Expert Mode world but has yet to defeat a mechanical boss, they can easily farm the event with a Blessed Apple or Ancient Horn mount. Simply run back and forth. The damage the mounts do while charging will one-hit kill all enemies besides the Dark Mage.
The Eternia Crystal slowly develops cracks as it gets more damaged.
In the Bestiary, the entries of many enemies depict their Tier 3 variant, including their statistics, before ever reaching the tier.
In the game files, an unused NPC called DD2AttackerTest can be found. It looks identical to the Angry Tumbler enemy.
The maximum amount of health a player can have at once is 600. It can be achieved by using 15 Life Crystals, 20 Life Fruits, and a Lifeforce Potion.

Some events require a player to have a certain amount of health before they can happen: More than 100 for the Nurse to spawn More than 120 for Blood Moons to occur More than 140 for Slime Rains (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to occur 200 or more for the Eye of Cthulhu and Deerclops (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to spawn and for the Goblin Army to invade on their own 300 or more for the Old Man to stop deeming the player unworthy of fighting Skeletron (though Skeletron can still be fought before that) 400 or more for Life Fruit to become usable. More than 100 for the Nurse to spawn More than 120 for Blood Moons to occur More than 140 for Slime Rains (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to occur 200 or more for the Eye of Cthulhu and Deerclops (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to spawn and for the Goblin Army to invade on their own 300 or more for the Old Man to stop deeming the player unworthy of fighting Skeletron (though Skeletron can still be fought before that) 400 or more for Life Fruit to become usable.
Due to its cheap crafting cost, the player can keep making Wooden Swords until they obtain the desired modifier.
Although the forges appear to have glass over the front of the fire, they do not require Glass to craft.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The counter that displays the remaining duration of a buff will begin at one minute/second less than its listed duration and show zero during the final minute/second.
The player can also double tap a buff on the touch screen to deactivate it early, but only in handheld mode.
The Ultrabright Helmet can replace the Mining Helmet in the Mining armor while still triggering its set bonus.
It sells for more than the items used to craft it, if both were drops.
The Shine Potion stacks with the Ultrabright Helmet, but the Night Owl Potion does not stack.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Due to the mechanics of piercing damage, piercing bullets (such as Meteor Shot ) will only hit enemies one time, even if all bullets connect. The remaining rounds can still rebound on objects behind the target (having not caused damage) and hit the target a second time.

Using the Shotgun with Crystal Bullets is effective against large groups. Exploding Bullets can be an alternative for their area damage, although care should be taken not to hurt oneself. The combined knockback of the ammunition and weapon can be effective for holding off enemies in early Hardmode. In PvP, Crystal Bullets are not as effective, because players become momentarily invulnerable when damaged, so the shards will not have any effect. Instead, Cursed Bullets are more useful in this context, as they have a higher damage and inflict the Cursed Inferno debuff. Exploding Bullets can be an alternative for their area damage, although care should be taken not to hurt oneself. The combined knockback of the ammunition and weapon can be effective for holding off enemies in early Hardmode. In PvP, Crystal Bullets are not as effective, because players become momentarily invulnerable when damaged, so the shards will not have any effect. Instead, Cursed Bullets are more useful in this context, as they have a higher damage and inflict the Cursed Inferno debuff.

The Shotgun is effective at short ranges, but rapidly loses effectiveness at longer ranges since the shots spread out the farther they travel. This inaccuracy can be negated by using Chlorophyte Bullets, however.
It is useful for defeating segmented enemies, such as Wyverns, as well as flying enemies with large hitboxes, such as Corruptors.

The Shotgun is one of the 11 guns in Terraria based on a real gun, the others being the Chain Gun, Flintlock Pistol, Handgun, Musket, Quad-Barrel Shotgun (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Red Ryder (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), Revolver (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), Sniper Rifle, Tactical Shotgun, and Uzi.

In Don't dig up worlds, these Chests are replaced by Flesh Chests or Lesion Chests with (almost) the same loot. Due to a probable code mistake, the Eye of the Sun cannot be found in a such Lesion Chest.
Gelatin Crystals can be detected by the Metal Detector.
The Gelatin Crystal glows pink and changes to blue and back in a cycle, which makes it stand out among the similar-looking Crystal Shards.
It can only be used in The Hallow or Underground Hallow. Attempting to use it in any other biome will have no effect, and will not consume the item.
Gelatin Crystals will generate in worlds created before 1.4.0.1 and after, so it is unnecessary to create a new world to obtain them.
Similar to Crystal Shards, Gelatin Crystals can be quickly farmed by placing rows of Pearlstone Blocks or Pink Ice Blocks in straight lines in the Underground Hallow.

Unlike Plantera's Bulbs, another type of naturally spawning boss-summoning item, there is no minimum distance restriction between two Gelatin Crystals. The distance is only restricted by the generation of Crystal Shards. This can lead to two or more of them generating very close together.
Despite the difference, the Gelatin Crystal will be identified as a Crystal Shard on the minimap.
Palladium Ore spawns at any depth in the Underground and Cavern layers.
Selling Palladium Ore will have the same end result as selling Palladium Bars, and both are equally profitable when sold.

In reality, palladium is an element that has similar properties to platinum. Though elemental palladium is silvery-white in color, it forms several compounds with orange or red-brown color. It has a wide range of applications including jewelry and electronics, but its most common use is as a chemical catalyst.
There is a very small chance that a meteor can hit an Altar, spawning a small amount of Palladium Ore, or Cobalt Ore. This will do nothing if it happens prior to entering Hardmode.

The duration of the following debuffs, if inflicted on players, is increased by 100% in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (i.e. doubled) and by 150% in Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) : [1]

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The maximum possible DPS that can be inflicted on an enemy with damaging debuffs is 1217. This can be achieved by consuming a Flask of Cursed Flames, wearing Huntress armor / Red Riding armor and a Magma Stone, firing a Venom Dart Trap, and using the Daybreak, Shadowflame Hex Doll, Blood Butcherer, Ice Boomerang, Bone Javelins and Tentacle Spike,while having an Imp Staff and a Stardust Cell Staff minion, and an Explosive Trap and Frost Hydra active, against a target that has been Oiled (due to the Explosive Trap), and within the range of the Dryad 's aura in a Master Mode world with all bosses defeated. [2]

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Royal Scepter cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
It is one of the only vanity items that is held by the player.
The Royal Scepter appears to float if the player uses an item like a weapon while it is equipped.
The Royal Scepter is internally considered a Balloon, despite not being one. [1]
Dayblooms grow slightly faster during daytime. [1]
The Daybloom is the only herb that can be dropped by enemies. The Daybloom is also the only herb that crafts 2 vanity set pieces. The Daybloom is also the only herb that crafts 2 vanity set pieces.
The Dynamite Kitten was added as a result of a petition. [1]
The buff's tooltip is in reference to the Explosive Bunny 's tooltip, " For use with bunny cannon ".
Despite wearing a miner's helmet, the Dynamite Kitten does not provide any light.

Apprentice armor set has approximately the same magic stats as other post-mechanical boss magic armor (such as Hallowed or Chlorophyte armor ) while lacking the defense of Holy Protection or the offense of the Leaf Crystal. However, its boosts to the Flameburst Tower sentries make it ideal for setting up boss arenas. Three boosted Flameburst Towers with the increased damage from the Apprentice armor can provide significant damage against Skeletron Prime, the Destroyer, or Golem. Alternatively, this set allows the summoning of three Queen Spiders from the Queen Spider Staff with strongly boosted damage. When fighting the Old One's Army, it is better to replace the headpiece with a Forbidden Mask to maximize summon damage, as the increased Flameburst field of view is not as helpful during the event. Alternatively, this set allows the summoning of three Queen Spiders from the Queen Spider Staff with strongly boosted damage. When fighting the Old One's Army, it is better to replace the headpiece with a Forbidden Mask to maximize summon damage, as the increased Flameburst field of view is not as helpful during the event.
All damage inflicted by the Moon Lord's attacks will bypass other invincibility frames. [7]

If the player leaves the world after the message " Impending doom approaches... " is displayed, the Moon Lord will not spawn. This could be useful for players who are not ready or willing to fight the Moon Lord yet and/or if they do not have enough Lunar Fragments to use. This could be useful for players who are not ready or willing to fight the Moon Lord yet and/or if they do not have enough Lunar Fragments to use.

Every NPC takes reduced damage from the Moon Lord, especially the Nurse. They only take 20–35 / 40–60 damage for other NPCs and 10–30 / 25–45 for the Nurse, and for all of them 100–130 / 125–180 for the Phantasmal Deathray attack. However, this changes in later stages of the fight, as the True Eyes of Cthulhu deal around 45–85 / 60–105 damage.

While the Moon Lord is on-screen, the sky will turn completely dark and the world will appear hazy and shadowy with blur effects. In multiplayer, this only happens to players who are within 130 tiles of the Moon Lord's location. This effect can be replicated with the Void Monolith.
In Expert Mode, the Treasure Bag will not drop a Portal Gun if the player opening it already has a Portal Gun in their inventory. However, he will always drop it in Classic Mode.
The Moon Lord appears behind all blocks and walls, similar to a background object.

Keeping a distance while dodging the Moon Lord's attacks is crucial. In particular, his Phantasmal Deathray should be avoided at all costs. Useful items that increase the player's mobility include Gravitation Potions, fast wings like the Fishron, Betsy's, or Empress Wings, the Rod of Discord, items allowing to dash (e.g. the Tabi or its upgrade, the Master Ninja Gear ), the Soaring Insignia, and numerous mount -summoning items like the Gelatinous Pillion, Shrimpy Truffle, Cosmic Car Key, or Witch's Broom. The player might also consider constructing a skybridge made out of Asphalt Blocks or Minecart Tracks (with a minecart boosted by the Minecart Upgrade Kit ). Items that provide high horizontal speed (Minecart Upgrade Kit-boosted minecarts, Soaring Insignia with hoverable wings, Hexxed Branch, etc.) allow the player to outrange the Phantasmal Deathray from the True Eyes of Cthulhu. Using homing weapons or ammo like Chlorophyte Bullets allow the player to focus on dodging. It is possible to avoid the deathray by staying close to the Moon Lord's head, and moving up and around the central eye as it fires the ray. The ray does not sweep as quickly when near its origin point, due to the nature of rotational movement, so being as close to its origin as possible makes it easier to maneuver around. Teleporting away from the Moon Lord to get healing from the Nurse might result in her death, due to the Moon Lord immediately teleporting to the player. In multiplayer, the Moon Lord will attack the nearest player. Players can take turns teleporting home to get healing from the Nurse. In multiplayer, the Moon Lord will attack the nearest player. Players can take turns teleporting home to get healing from the Nurse.

The Moon Lord is vulnerable to almost all debuffs, most notably Ichor and Betsy's Curse, which can dramatically speed up the fight. However, since the Moon Lord's eyes remove all debuffs when they close, the player will have to reapply them accordingly.

It is advisable to kill the eye on the head first. It is the only eye capable of firing the Phantasmal Deathray and remains closed for significantly longer than the eyes in the hands. If the player waits to kill the head last, they may have to deal with two True Eyes of Cthulhu for a longer amount of time.

While the frequently-applied Moon Bite debuff disables the healing effects of Vampire Knives and the Spectre Hood, it does not disable health regeneration boosts, hence the effects of the Nebula armor and the Life Drain are not affected.
Some of the Moon Lord's attacks can be avoided using the 200 NPC spawn limit, and the True Eyes of Cthulhu can be prevented from spawning completely if the limit is reached.
Due to the Moon Lord's attacks bypassing invincibility frames, special setups are recommended to bypass his attacks.

Moon Leech Clots will always reach the Moon Lord's mouth in the same amount of time. They travel toward it at a variable rate, remaining completely stationary (or at least apparently so) if the Moon Lord is in his default position behind the player. As a result of this, though it may seem counterintuitive, it is actually beneficial to be closer to the mouth to destroy Moon Leech Clots, as they will not move away as quickly.
The Moon Lord's eye sockets still deal contact damage during his death animation. It is wise to move away from the boss after he is defeated.

While the Phantasmal Spheres the Moon Lord shoots can pierce all NPCs, the Phantasmal Bolts get destroyed upon contact with an NPC, potentially being a viable option for players trying to avoid the bolts.

For those farming the Moon Lord for the Meowmere and Star Wrath in order to craft the Zenith : For each kill, there is a 58.33% chance of obtaining neither, a 38.88% chance of obtaining one, and a 2.77% chance of obtaining both.

Despite a mid-development comment by Cenx that this would not be the case, the Moon Lord resembles common depictions of Cthulhu, a creature first imagined by H. P. Lovecraft in his 1928 short story “ The Call of Cthulhu ”. Fans commonly speculated prior to the release of 1.3 that Cthulhu would be the final Terraria boss (which in turn arose partly due to an early concept design floated by the development team).
Terraria's final boss was originally going to be the Moon itself descending on the world, but Cenx later stated that this idea had been scrapped. [8] [9]
Due to the colors of the boss and the names of a few of his projectiles, this boss may have been inspired by the Vortex Pillar.
Despite being the final boss, the Moon Lord is one of many bosses with the fewest debuff immunities, being immune only to Confused and Shimmering.

– According to the Terraria lore pages, though it was initially theorized (and joked by staff) that the Moon Lord was Cthulhu's brother, it appears that he is Cthulhu itself, or at least is what it implies. This entity was detrimental to existence, and was finally banished by the Dryads, an ancient race of whom the Dryad NPC is the only survivor, ripped out his organs and banished it to the moon. It further appears that the Celestial Events and his eventual battle are his final attempt at total conquest, as stated directly. In the same post where the developers, namely Arkhayla, joked that the Moon Lord was Cthulhu's brother, they also said his name was Steve. However, this has been confirmed to not be true. In the same post where the developers, namely Arkhayla, joked that the Moon Lord was Cthulhu's brother, they also said his name was Steve. However, this has been confirmed to not be true.
NPCs are unable to attack the Moon Lord.
According to Cenx, spriting the Moon Lord took over a month. [10]
The Moon Lord is the only boss with a unique death animation sequence.

Redigit once joked that if the community could put together 10,000 signatures and 15 dollars, he would make the lower half of the Moon Lord a boss. This was not implemented, but in the 1.4.0.1 update, the legs of the Moon Lord have been introduced as the Moon Lord Legs item, obtainable from Chests in drunk worlds. This was not implemented, but in the 1.4.0.1 update, the legs of the Moon Lord have been introduced as the Moon Lord Legs item, obtainable from Chests in drunk worlds.

The Moon Lord seems to share some mechanics with two pre-Hardmode bosses, including Skeletron, having multiple parts that each are destroyable, and the Brain of Cthulhu, requiring the player to defeat separate parts before truly damaging the boss.
The Moon Lord is one of seven bosses with exclusive boss music, the others being the Queen Bee, Deerclops, Queen Slime, Plantera, Empress of Light, and Duke Fishron.
The Moon Lord is the only boss who drops three Expert-exclusive items in his Treasure Bag.

The Moon Lord drops the most coins of any boss, and overall any enemy, in the game. In Expert Mode and Master Mode, his coin drops are higher than the total coin drops of all the Hardmode bosses in the game. In Expert Mode and Master Mode, his coin drops are higher than the total coin drops of all the Hardmode bosses in the game.
(Desktop version) While fighting the Moon Lord or during the period before it spawns, an eye, presumably the True Eye of Cthulhu in one of the Moon Lord's hands, appears on RGB -enabled keyboards.
In the past Redigit said the Moon Lord is the father of the Guide. This statement was most likely a joke [11] and is not considered official lore. [12]
If a body part of the Moon Lord is spawned in separately, e.g. using mods or hacks, the music track Boss 1 plays instead of the Moon Lord track. Autopause needs to be enabled for this to work.
The Moon Lord's Bestiary entry is the last entry listed and is the only entry that does not have biome/event filters or a background, instead having an empty black background.

A Lantern Night is initiated in the following ways: Defeating any boss for the first time, with the exceptions of the Mourning Wood, Santa-NK1, and Everscream. Defeating any invasion for the first time, with the exceptions of the Frost Moon and Pumpkin Moon. Defeating the Pumpking or the Ice Queen for the first time will start a Lantern Night, however. After defeating the Moon Lord, Lantern Nights may happen randomly, with a 1/14 (7.14%) chance of happening per night. After a random Lantern Night occurs, the next random Lantern Night can occur no sooner than 5-10 nights later. Defeating any boss for the first time, with the exceptions of the Mourning Wood, Santa-NK1, and Everscream. Defeating any invasion for the first time, with the exceptions of the Frost Moon and Pumpkin Moon. Defeating the Pumpking or the Ice Queen for the first time will start a Lantern Night, however. Defeating the Pumpking or the Ice Queen for the first time will start a Lantern Night, however. After defeating the Moon Lord, Lantern Nights may happen randomly, with a 1/14 (7.14%) chance of happening per night. After a random Lantern Night occurs, the next random Lantern Night can occur no sooner than 5-10 nights later.

Only one non-random Lantern Night can be scheduled at once. Thus, if two Lantern Nights are triggered in the same 24-hour period (from one nightfall to the next), only one Lantern Night will actually be scheduled.

Lantern Nights can be pre-empted by certain events. If a boss, invasion, Pumpkin Moon, Frost Moon, Blood Moon, or impending doom is active when night falls, and the night was supposed to be a Lantern Night, then the Lantern Night will not activate. [2] When this occurs, the next night will be eligible for a Lantern Night. Thus, when a Lantern Night is pre-empted, it gets delayed, not canceled. Similarly, the post-Moon Lord random Lantern Nights can pre-empt non-random Lantern Nights: If a given night is eligible for a random Lantern Night and has a non-random Lantern Night scheduled, then if the 1-in-14 random chance succeeds, a Lantern Night will occur randomly, but the non-random Lantern Night will remain scheduled, thereby happening the following night. When this occurs, the next night will be eligible for a Lantern Night. Thus, when a Lantern Night is pre-empted, it gets delayed, not canceled. Similarly, the post-Moon Lord random Lantern Nights can pre-empt non-random Lantern Nights: If a given night is eligible for a random Lantern Night and has a non-random Lantern Night scheduled, then if the 1-in-14 random chance succeeds, a Lantern Night will occur randomly, but the non-random Lantern Night will remain scheduled, thereby happening the following night.

Active Lantern Nights prevent Eye of Cthulhu or any mechanical boss from naturally spawning, and a Lantern Night that lasts until dawn prevents a Goblin Invasion, Pirate Invasion, or Solar Eclipse from starting immediately afterwards. [3]
Because of a significant luck increase, this event is best spent hunting for rare drops.
The Enchanted Nightcrawlers can be caught for easy bait.

This event was teased during the development of 1.4.0.1 as "something straight out of Tangled ", a 2010 Disney film where lanterns are released into the sky to honor the birthday of the character Rapunzel. [4] The scene in question is itself inspired by the real-life Chinese traditional Lantern Festival that marks the final day of the traditional Chinese New Year celebrations. The scene in question is itself inspired by the real-life Chinese traditional Lantern Festival that marks the final day of the traditional Chinese New Year celebrations.
The tooltip of the item is a reference to Winona 's examination quote for the Deerclops Eyeball in Don't Starve Together.
The tooltip of the buff is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for Deerclops in Don't Starve.
The bird carrying Tiny Deerclops appears to be a Snowbird from Don't Starve.
Once it is taken from a shelf, the Water Bolt cannot be placed again whatsoever.
The Water Bolt's projectile does not disappear in lava.
Despite the Water Bolt's projectiles being water-based, they are still slowed when submerged in water and other liquids.
While the Water Bolt can be found placed naturally, it cannot be placed on platforms with the Rubblemaker (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

A Dungeon may contain more than one Water Bolt or none at all. During world generation, there is a 1/2 (50%) chance for each platform in the Dungeon to have a Book placed upon it, with a 1/50 (2%) chance of turning it into a Water Bolt. [1] Therefore, larger worlds have higher chances of containing more Water Bolts than smaller worlds, because of their larger Dungeons and thus higher numbers of platforms.

When the projectile dissipates, the glowing particles it releases will fall through solid blocks and momentarily illuminate the area below, which can be useful for lighting caverns or rooms directly below the player.

On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, it is not explicitly required to defeat Skeletron to obtain a Water Bolt, as platforms with Books can spawn above the surface, sometimes even in the room just past the door into the Dungeon. These can be safely retrieved without causing either Dungeon Guardians or unique Dungeon enemies to spawn. As the Water Bolt remains a powerful weapon up until Hardmode, it can be advantageous to check the Dungeon when starting a new world. While doing so, caution should be taken when venturing deeper into the Dungeon, so as not to spawn a Dungeon Guardian. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is also possible to obtain a Water Bolt prior to defeating Skeletron, albeit very dangerous. If one is spotted near the perimeter of the Dungeon, a hoik can be used to enter the Dungeon and pick up the Water Bolt. A Recall Potion allows retreating without dying, and autopause is useful for timing. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is also possible to obtain a Water Bolt prior to defeating Skeletron, albeit very dangerous. If one is spotted near the perimeter of the Dungeon, a hoik can be used to enter the Dungeon and pick up the Water Bolt. A Recall Potion allows retreating without dying, and autopause is useful for timing.

The durability of the Water Bolt projectile, combined with its ability to ricochet and hit multiple foes, makes it very suitable for fighting groups of enemies, especially in flat valleys and straight, enclosed passageways. Having a velocity of 23 mph, it is slow enough to hit the same enemy more than once even without ricocheting.

The Water Bolt combined with a properly closed arena is a very effective way to fight many pre-Hardmode bosses, especially those with many parts or segments, like the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu.
The Water Bolt can be used to clear and illuminate areas while exploring, such as the pre-Hardmode Spider Nests, easily and safely.

Due to the ricocheting behavior of the Water Bolt's projectile, it can be used to locate Floating Islands by firing it into the sky on the surface. However, the projectiles travel rather slowly, and there are more efficient methods to locate Floating Islands – see Floating Island § Tips.
In pre-release footage of Terraria, both the placed and held Water Bolt sprites were blue. The held Water Bolt sprites were later changed to red, without altering the placed Water Bolt's coloration.
Some Bookcase sprites contain the Water Bolt, but it cannot be looted from them.

During a Blood Moon, the blue water projectile will be pink in the middle and upper portions of the world, similar to how water changes color during said event. When cast within or when traveling upwards from a point between the Underground and Cavern levels, the water projectile can be observed changing color progressively from blue to pink. In lower portions of the world and in The Underworld, the original color is unchanged.

The Water Bolt is one of the very few weapons that can be acquired as physical objects in the game's world, the others being the Enchanted Sword, the Terragrim (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Abigail's Flower (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
At the correct angle, its maximum horizontal range is 46 feet, or 23 tiles.

Using the Goblin Army is a good way to farm this item, as all the enemies qualify for its drop and they spawn constantly. Another way to farm this item, as with all rare drops, is to kill enemies during a Blood Moon. A Water Candle and Battle Potion will increase the spawn rate even more. Another way to farm this item, as with all rare drops, is to kill enemies during a Blood Moon. A Water Candle and Battle Potion will increase the spawn rate even more.
It lasts exactly 60 seconds after being thrown.

Like all boomerangs, the Bloody Machete can pierce an unlimited number of enemies when returning to the player. This is best utilized by throwing the weapon diagonally upwards, as it falls downwards after reaching maximum range, and proves useful during pre-Hardmode invasion events such as the Blood Moon, Goblin Army, Slime Rain, and Old One's Army.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) During Halloween seasons, it is a very powerful weapon when obtained early on, outperforming other early-game boomerangs until the Thorn Chakram is obtained: The Shroomerang and Ice Boomerang have higher base damage, but the Bloody Machete performs better in both short-ranged and long-ranged combat due to its faster use time and projectile speed. While the Trimarang may have better DPS in long-ranged combat, the Bloody Machete has better accuracy (faster projectile) and can be used as a piercing weapon. The Shroomerang and Ice Boomerang have higher base damage, but the Bloody Machete performs better in both short-ranged and long-ranged combat due to its faster use time and projectile speed. While the Trimarang may have better DPS in long-ranged combat, the Bloody Machete has better accuracy (faster projectile) and can be used as a piercing weapon.

This is the iconic weapon of Jason Voorhees, the hockey-mask-wearing serial killer from the American horror film series Friday the 13th. However, Jason mostly uses it in melee combat, whereas in Terraria, the machete is thrown.
This outfit is based on the Grim Reaper from folklore, with its large scythe, skeletal figure and black cloak with a hood.
The scythe is a part of the outfit, and it will always be visible, even when using an item.
If the Flow Invader is killed shortly after it spawns, fewer minions will be launched at the player.
Trying to kill a Flow Invader somewhat on-screen will give the player enough reaction time to dodge the projectiles.

The Flow Invader's minions are technically projectiles, with a Projectile ID of 539. The Flow Invader's minions are also present as an unused NPC, having a graphically identical NPC of them named Mini Flow Invader. The Flow Invader's minions are also present as an unused NPC, having a graphically identical NPC of them named Mini Flow Invader.
The Cobalt Shield and Ancient Cobalt armor are not related to Cobalt ore, and are not craftable. They can only be obtained as loot.
Cobalt has the same value whether it is sold as Bars or raw Ore.
Cobalt is slightly weaker than Palladium in terms of base stats, though Cobalt equipment is cheaper to craft.
Like other hardmode materials, Cobalt Bar can be used to make three different helmets.

Several Cobalt items have a distinctive Eastern theme, the spear being a naginata, the sword somewhat resembling a Katana, or the katana-like Muramasa, the Chinese themed Repeater, and the headgear variations resembling Japanese and/or Chinese headdresses.

Real cobalt is not blue in pure form, but rather a lustrous, silver-gray. Cobalt oxide is used to make a blue pigment, which probably inspired its appearance in Terraria. Historically, cobalt compounds were used for centuries to color glass, glazes, and ceramics in Egyptian sculpture, Persian jewelry, and Chinese porcelain (which may explain its Eastern theme in Terraria).
Explosions from the Fireworks Box are roughly half the size of those produced by Firework Rockets.
Fireworks launch upwards and explode on impact with any foreground blocks, or when they reach approximately 50 feet (25 tiles) in the air.
When fired via wires, the Box has a 0.5 second cooldown.
When fired via a right-click on the Box itself, there is no cool down period, and the Box will fire as rapidly as the player can click.
It has the same color scheme as the Celebration.
Since Tipsy is a debuff, it will be removed by the Nurse. Repeatedly consuming Sake and healing at the Nurse can be a quick and easy way to obtain the The Frequent Flyer achievement.

The Well Fed and Plenty Satisfied (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) buffs partially negate the −4 defense penalty of Tipsy. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The highest tier of said buff, Exquisitely Stuffed, completely negates the defense penalty of Tipsy. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Consuming an Aegis Fruit will also completely negate the defense penalty due to it permanently raising defense by 4. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The highest tier of said buff, Exquisitely Stuffed, completely negates the defense penalty of Tipsy. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Consuming an Aegis Fruit will also completely negate the defense penalty due to it permanently raising defense by 4.
Saké is a Japanese alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice.

The saké bottle appears to have お, the Hiragana character for "O", on it. In Japanese, "O" is a particle used to convey respect of value. For example, sushi and sake are almost always referred to as osushi and osake, respectively.

The tooltip is likely a reference to drunken boxing martial art styles. Despite the name, they are not martial arts used by drunken fighters, but are martial arts that imitate the movements of a drunk person.
If utilizing Autopause, the Corrupt/Crimson Mimic will not spawn until the game is unfrozen again. On Console, the Corrupt/Crimson Mimic will not spawn unless Autopause is disabled.
Placing a Key of Night in a storage item other than a chest (such as a Barrel ) will not spawn the Mimic.
The Biome Mimic does not have to be spawned in The Corruption or The Crimson; it can be summoned anywhere.
The drunk world seed has the potential to spawn either Mimic, depending on which world evil is active.

Placing a Key of Night in a Chest without closing it and directly opening another inventory interface (which is only possible if Autopause is disabled), such as that of another Chest, will not spawn the Mimic.

The effects of the Extendo Grip stack with the Toolbelt 's +1 tile reach and Toolbox 's +1 tile reach. However, the Toolbelt only extends block placement reach, not mining reach, while the Extendo Grip and Toolbox affect both. Therefore, equipping both items will still mean the player will be able to place blocks a single tile farther away than they can mine them.
When combined with a Toolbox and Laser Drill, it is possible to achieve +15 range.

Having this item equipped also allows players to speak to NPCs from a farther distance than normal, as well as activate levers and such. The Architect Gizmo Pack, which retains the effect of the Extendo Grip, can do the same. This can allow for hidden switches for wiring purposes and safely boxed-in NPCs to still be interacted with.
This item can be particularly useful with the Shroomite Digging Claws, as they can counteract the claws' smaller range.
This item, when equipped, can be useful to mine Hellstone at a distance, without the danger of lava.
Cracked Dungeon Bricks are highlighted while under the effects of a Dangersense Potion, unless they are hammered into a slope.

Cracked Dungeon Bricks break off in significantly smaller amounts in multiplayer compared to singleplayer, causing players to take much more time to mine through blocked passages, but also slightly reducing the danger of Spike pits.

Cracked Dungeon Bricks on the floor may conceal rectangular rooms filled with Spikes or water, so care should be taken when exploring the Dungeon. The aforementioned Dangersense Potion is a valuable aid.
Using a mount to enlarge the player's hitbox may make stomping out Cracked Dungeon Bricks easier.
Cracked Dungeon Bricks share some properties of Thin Ice and Sand, although they have distinct differences from both.
The player cannot equip more than one set of wings at a time.
All wings work in water.
Some jump-boost accessories stack with wings to boost flight (see table).

When one wing type is placed in a social slot and the other in an accessory slot, the full animation of the vanity wings are shown, along with any lighting and particle effects. Flight speed and other functional characteristics follow those in the accessory slot.

Wings can be hidden by the accessory visibility setting when equipped. However, they will only be hidden while not in the air, and always visible otherwise ( (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) except when using other items that adds graphics to the player's back, like the Leaf Blower ). They fold into a low-profile image when not used.
The horizontal speed of any midair jumps (such as the Cloud in a Bottle ) are greatly decreased when the player wears wings alongside them.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Wings in vanity slots do not emit light.
Dyes can change the color of the particle effects created by wings, but cannot change the color of the light emitted by them.
An Ice Rod can be used to lay blocks of ice to land in midair, making it possible to remain in the air indefinitely.
The Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) -exclusive Soaring Insignia enables infinite flight.
The slow-fall effect of Featherfall Potion or an Umbrella stacks with wing glide, allowing for very long glides after flight time has been exhausted.

The maximum flight distance of about 1400 tiles can be achieved using the Bundle of Balloons, Frog Leg, Solar Wings (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Frostspark Boots, Flying Carpet, and Featherfall Potion. More can be achieved by using the Umbrella in addition.
The Soaring Insignia negates the low flight time of the Jetpack, allowing the player to take full advantage of its quick vertical acceleration.

Obtaining wings in early Hardmode : Harpy Wings require a bit of luck when farming Harpies. Fortunately, Wyverns spawn at the same altitude, so when a Giant Harpy Feather drops, the odds are good that 20 Souls of Flight will already have been collected. The Giant Harpy Feather can also be collected before activating Hardmode. Angel and Demon Wings require (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 25 of either Soul of Light or Soul of Night. The souls can easily be acquired by staying long enough in Underground Hallow or Underground Corruption / Underground Crimson, since all enemies killed have a chance to drop the respective biome's soul. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Fledgling Wings can be obtained pre-Hardmode, however they lack in mobility compared to Hardmode wings. Harpy Wings require a bit of luck when farming Harpies. Fortunately, Wyverns spawn at the same altitude, so when a Giant Harpy Feather drops, the odds are good that 20 Souls of Flight will already have been collected. The Giant Harpy Feather can also be collected before activating Hardmode. Angel and Demon Wings require (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 25 of either Soul of Light or Soul of Night. The souls can easily be acquired by staying long enough in Underground Hallow or Underground Corruption / Underground Crimson, since all enemies killed have a chance to drop the respective biome's soul. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Fledgling Wings can be obtained pre-Hardmode, however they lack in mobility compared to Hardmode wings.
The Fledgling Wings are the only wings with the 00* rarity.
Dyeing Red's Wings in combination with Hermes Boots or any of its upgrades will change the color of the smoke below the player.

Prior to 1.3.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Red's Wings would allow the wearer to fly infinitely and faster than any other wings if the player managed to obtain them through inventory editors.

Ghostar's Infinity Eight's name comes from the Infinity Eight in the series of single-player action role-playing games.hack//G.U.. Their appearance resembles the sword-wings of the Avatar Skeith in its Xth Form. Its tooltip, "I am right here," is used throughout the.hack//G.U. games.
Despite being non-moving constructs of technology, Ghostar's Infinity Eight and Arkhalis' Lightwings both produce flapping noises.
A mana star will only spawn when one of the falling stars strikes solid terrain. Mana stars will not impact with platforms.
Mana stars will only travel towards the player while the player is within about 20 blocks of them. Outside this range, mana stars will hover in midair.

Due to the above properties, mana stars are difficult to collect when the player is far away from solid terrain. This makes the effect less useful for mostly airborne battles, such as when using Wings, a flying Mount, or a Minecart Track to fight a boss. In these scenarios, players may prefer the similar effect of Magic Cuffs or Celestial Cuffs.
The reduced mana usage does stack with similar accessories like the Magnet Flower or Mana Flower.
Mana Cloak's star's pick up range will not be affected by Celestial Magnet, Celestial Cuffs, or the Celestial Emblem.
If a mana star is added to the inventory through the use of an inventory editor, its sprite appears pure white and hovering over it will show nothing.
While not an especially potent weapon, the Slap Hand's extremely high knockback makes it a good choice for keeping enemies away instead of directly fighting.
With a decent knockback modifier and a Titan Glove (or one of its upgrades) equipped, the Slap Hand can easily catapult most enemies very far away.
It can be useful when spelunking or exploring when the player does not want to fight, due to the ease at which it can force enemies out of one's way.
Hitting a Snow Flinx, wingless Slimer, or especially a Pinky results in massive knockback, as they have negative knockback resistance.
Due to their nature, flying enemies (notably Corruptors ) can be easily sent flying far off the screen with this weapon, causing them to despawn.
A Blood Moon, the requirement for purchasing the Slap Hand, can be summoned manually with a Bloody Tear.

The Jousting Lance and its upgrades have no upper limit on knockback and can thus surpass the Slap Hand's knockback. For instance, the Shadow Jousting Lance inflicts a knockback value of 23.47 if the player is moving at 60 mph.

The Gray and Orange Zapinator can surpass the Slap Hand's knockback as well. Their beam has a 1/20 (5%) chance to multiply the knockback by 9 upon hitting an enemy, increasing it to 54. If the knockback is increased on two subsequent hits ( 1/400 (0.25%) chance), then the beam inflicts a knockback value of 486.
Attempting to catch a Lavafly with a standard Bug Net will deal 1 damage to the player and inflict On Fire! for 5 seconds / 10 seconds / 13 seconds. [1]
Like Fireflies, Lavaflies are difficult to see in the Underworld at high resolutions, appearing as a blinking speck on the screen.
Abeemination is a portmanteau of the words abomination and bee.
(Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) It is the only boss-summoning item that can be crafted By Hand.
The Abeemination appears to be an amalgamation of the crafting recipe's ingredients loosely formed into the shape of a bee, befitting its name.
(3DS version) The recipe requires the blocks that are formed when all three liquids are combined (Honey+Lava, Honey+Water, and Water+Lava).

Since most of the ingredients used to craft it are found in Bee Hives, it was probably created for players who failed to kill the Queen Bee and cannot find a new hive with the larva, to farm the Queen Bee, or for players who wanted to fight her on the surface.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Since Hive Blocks are non-renewable, this summon is non-renewable, making Queen Bee the only boss that cannot be fought an infinite number of times per world. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hive Blocks can also be acquired by dropping Honey Blocks or Crispy Honey Blocks into Shimmer, making them renewable. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hive Blocks can also be acquired by dropping Honey Blocks or Crispy Honey Blocks into Shimmer, making them renewable.
Although the Beetle Shell's set bonus says " Beetles protect you from damage ", it will not prevent the full damage of attacks, but can only prevent a portion of damage instead.
While the Beetle Shell is equipped without any items occupying the social slot, wings will not appear unless the player is in mid-air, similar to the Turtle armor, Leaf Blower, and Heat Ray.
Other damage-reducing effects, like the Endurance Potion, stack with the Beetle Endurance buff.

Beetle armor is not a true upgrade to Turtle armor. The offensive version has lower defense than Turtle armor, and the defensive version has lower offensive bonuses than Turtle armor. Neither version has the thorns effect nor the unconditional 15% damage reduction that Turtle armor has. However, Beetle armor offers more powerful specialization in offensive or defensive playstyles.

When using the Beetle Scale Mail, the Terra Blade benefits greatly from its massive melee speed bonuses. Most other melee weapons do not fire projectiles faster with increased melee speed, making Beetle armor inferior to hybrid sets when using them (unless attacking at close range).

The Beetle armor with the Beetle Shell has the lowest damage boosts out of all Hardmode melee armor sets, with lower offensive boosts than even Molten armor. Due to these low bonuses, players can use ranged or magic weapons and deal similar amounts of damage.

The full set with the Beetle Shell has the highest defense of any pre- Moon Lord armor set. However, even higher defense (80) can be achieved by swapping the head and leg pieces for Hallowed Mask and Valhalla Knight's Greaves, which has the additional benefit of providing far better offensive melee bonuses.
Beetle armor at its 45% state, the Worm Scarf (17%), and the Endurance Potion (10%) will reduce damage by nearly 60%.
With the full Beetle Endurance buff and a Lifeforce Potion (600 HP) and/or Endurance Potion, it is possible to survive a hit from the Dungeon Guardian.
It is the only armor set to have multiple chest piece variants.

Solar Flare armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) provides more defense than either of the chest variants. However, the Beetle Shell provides 45% maximum damage reduction as opposed to the Solar Flare shield's maximum 30% reduction.
The symbol on the Summoner Emblem resembles the Slime Staff.
Lightning bolts cannot strike the player, as lightning is just a visual effect.

Music for the surface Snow, Corruption, and Crimson biomes will not change when a Thunderstorm is occurring. When a Sandstorm occurs in a Desert during a Thunderstorm, the Sandstorm's music will play instead. When a Sandstorm occurs in a Desert during a Thunderstorm, the Sandstorm's music will play instead.

NPCs have special dialogue during Thunderstorms. Contrary to the Guide 's quotes, no new enemies will spawn during a Thunderstorm, and lightning will not zap anything either. Contrary to the Guide 's quotes, no new enemies will spawn during a Thunderstorm, and lightning will not zap anything either.
The Weather Radio will detect Thunderstorms.
There is an experimental features option to disable the flashing effect that comes from lightning.
On older Mobile versions, similar lightning effects would be present when it rained. However, there was no sound of thunder.

The orb's position can be somewhat controlled using the ▲ Up and ▼ Down keys, allowing the player to reorient the orb directly above or below them respectively. This will cause the orb to catch up slightly faster, if it is lagging behind. This will cause the orb to catch up slightly faster, if it is lagging behind.
The orb will emit purple light even if dyed.
When paired with Acid Dye of any color, the orb will have stripes in the color but it will be buggy, as parts of, or even the whole orb itself, can disappear.
It can be paired with Reflective Gold Dye to make the Shadow Orb appear similarly to how it looked prior to 1.2.
Twilight Dye can render the orb almost completely invisible.

Item prices can be decreased by equipping a Discount Card or Greedy Ring (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and on Desktop, Console, and Mobile, prices can also be higher or lower based on the NPC's happiness level. On this wiki, the value displayed in an item's infobox is always the base value, unaffected by these two factors.
(Old-gen console version) The Ruler is an exception: It is sold for 33 SC, which is one third of its price ( 1 GC ) instead of one fifth.
If the player builds a hoik out of Echo Blocks, there will appear to be nothing moving them along.

Regular hoiks can be used by players, enemies, NPCs, the Eternia Crystal, and the invisible Target Dummy entity. Mounted players can use hoiks as well, this includes minecarts. Since a mount increases the size of the player's sprite, the gaps between the teeth will need to be adjusted. Mounted players can use hoiks as well, this includes minecarts. Since a mount increases the size of the player's sprite, the gaps between the teeth will need to be adjusted.
Some hoiks may not work if the player is moving too fast.
In cricket, a hoik is a wild hook shot played without style. The verb to hoik also means pulling, yanking, or hoisting something carelessly or with a sudden, jerking motion.
Gemspark Walls are a solid color, so Emerald Gemspark Walls can be used as a green screen.
The Trifold Map bears a resemblance to the small map icon located near the minimap.
Despite the item's name, the sprite appears to show a map with four creases instead of the two required for a map to be trifold.
If the crafting station does not work, make sure the platform with the Bottle is placed no higher than 2 blocks from the player's feet.
Where a Placed Bottle is required for crafting, the Guide will list the required crafting station as "Bottle".
Placed Lesser Healing and Mana Potions can be naturally found in the Dungeon, (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) but require the use of a Heavy Work Bench to be placed by the player.
All items that can be crafted at a Placed Bottle or Alchemy Table are decrafted into a random subset of their ingredients when thrown into Shimmer (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
While the Alchemy Table is more resource-efficient to use, the Placed Bottle is easier to obtain.
The Water Sphere's damage receives a massive increase in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) during Hardmode, dealing over 100 damage to endgame characters.
The Water Spheres reveal the map as they travel, even while traveling through solid blocks. Therefore, Dark Casters can be used to map areas just outside the dungeon walls.
Just like with other caster enemies, hitting a Dark Caster even once while it is attacking will prevent it from attacking before it teleports to a different location.

Water Spheres look nearly identical to the Water Bolt spell. Be careful when using the Water Bolt in the Dungeon, in case the two are mixed up. Water Spheres can pass through blocks, while the Water Bolt projectiles cannot. If it passes through blocks, it is a hostile projectile. Water Spheres can pass through blocks, while the Water Bolt projectiles cannot. If it passes through blocks, it is a hostile projectile.
The Dark Caster is almost identical with Tim, except for the Wizard Hat.
If the player equips the Skull and the Robe, they will strongly resemble the Dark Caster.
Crimstone is a portmanteau of the words crimson and stone.
In Greek mythology, the goddess Persephone was tricked into becoming trapped in Hades ' realm after consuming six pomegranate seeds while in the underworld.

The Apricot, Cherry, Grapefruit, Plum, Pomegranate, and Spicy Pepper are the only fruits that do not have unique recipes of their own. They can only be used to make Fruit Juice, Fruit Salad, and Ambrosia – recipes that allow any fruit to be used.
Creating a new world and cutting down the numerous trees near the spawn point is an effective way of obtaining large amounts of Wood.
A highly effective way to farm wood is to use the Axe of Regrowth (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Wood has no sell value on its own, but can contribute to a variety of crafted items that can be sold. Crafting any Wood into Kegs will yield about 8.57 CC per Wood or 85 SC 63 CC per 1000 pieces of Wood. However, much greater profits (about 5 GC per 1000) can be had by adding one Gel for each six Wood, and crafting Candelabras. There are some conditions here: Plain Wood will require a Living Loom, Boreal Wood will require Ice Blocks (as many as the Gel) as well, and Dynasty Wood can do better elsewhere; see the making money guide for full details.
None of the wood block types are vulnerable to biome spread ; ebonwood/shadewood/pearlwood will not spread the Corruption/Crimson/Hallow.
Wood armor sets are of the few that can be crafted at a Work Bench, along with Cactus, Necro, Pink Snow, and Pumpkin.
Unlike the other Hardmode Dungeon casters, the Ragged Caster will not teleport immediately after being hit. Verify
Ragged Casters can only teleport onto solid blocks. If there is no valid place to teleport to, they will remain in the same location.
They are only able to teleport while resting on a solid block.
For the banner the kill counts of both variants are added up.
Weapons that stick to enemies (e.g., the Piranha Gun ) are exceptionally useful, as they remain on the Ragged Caster after the teleport.

Weapons that deal high damage in single hits are effective against Ragged Casters. Weapons that fire multiple projectiles simultaneously may be able to land multiple hits before they teleport as well.
Weapons with homing capacities or minions can continue to track Ragged Casters after they teleport.
The Bestiary entry for the Ragged Caster: " With their cursed magic, the members of the Ragged Brotherhood leave their victims helplessly lost in utter darkness. "
The Coconut's tooltip is a reference to a quote from the 1975 British comedy movie Monty Python and the Holy Grail : "Are you suggesting coconuts migrate?"

Its name seems to be based on two types of alcoholic beverages: the Bloody Mary, which is a blood-red drink made from vodka, tomato juice, and an assortment of savory flavors; as well as the Moscato, which is a type of wine created from the Muscat grape family.
Its name might also be a pun on bloody mosquito ; mosquitos are known for feeding on human and animal blood.

Present Mimics are rarer than the other enemies spawned during the Frost Moon. The reason for this seems to be that all Mimics initially behave like still objects. This causes the Present Mimics to spawn off-screen and, unlike the other enemies, stay there until the player gets near it or somehow damages it.
It will chase the player until killed, given the player does not lose sight of it.
Present Mimics spawn during all waves of the event, unlike other enemies, which are specific to certain waves.

Present Mimics drop large amounts of Hearts. This can be very convenient during the event, especially during later waves where the player must contend with much bulkier, harder-hitting mini-bosses where healing may be scarce.

If the player is using Heartreach Potions, it is recommended to keep a farther distance away from Present Mimics at times when the Hearts they drop are not needed, as the buff's extended pickup range for Hearts may cause the player to draw them in and waste their healing.
Present Mimics do not run away once night is over like some other Frost Moon enemies do. Be mildly wary of them when picking up leftover drops after the end of the event.
It is the only Mimic to exclusively appear in an event.
It has the highest damage of all Mimics, including the Biome Mimics.
It is the only event enemy to not appear in the status message when there is a new wave.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Reaching wave 15 of the Frost Moon activates one day of Christmas, which (once daytime begins) does satisfy the conditions for the Present Mimics to drop Presents.
The sun texture with sunglasses has not been updated for the 1.2 sun, and it is likely this is intentional.
The sun on the title screen will still be the sunglasses-wearing sun when upon exiting a world where the player had the Sunglasses equipped.
As the Lavaproof Fishing Hook needs lava-fishing ability to obtain, using lava critters as bait or a Hotline Fishing Hook is required to acquire it.

The Lavaproof Fishing Hook can be used together with a Golden Fishing Rod to essentially convert it to an improved version of the Hotline Fishing Hook with 5% more fishing power, while also allowing a single fishing pole to be used everywhere. However, using both the Hotline Fishing Hook and this item increases catch frequency in lava by more than 50%,  which may be preferable to the slight fishing power bonus. However, using both the Hotline Fishing Hook and this item increases catch frequency in lava by more than 50%,  which may be preferable to the slight fishing power bonus.

A monolith's actual range is relative to the player's resolution size, it will be visible if it is within 30 tiles of the edge of the player's screen. For easier calculation, this is 29 tiles of the edge of the monolith.

Lunar monoliths do not stack their effects. The one placed furthest to the bottom-right takes precedence. If two lunar monoliths, one at the bottom-left, and one at the top-right are active, the one to the top-right will be active. However, the Blood Moon Monolith does stack its effects with the others. Activating a lunar monolith first and then a Blood Moon Monolith will result in different colors than vice versa. For example, activating a Stardust Monolith, then a Blood Moon Monolith will display a dark blue, whereas activating a Blood Moon Monolith, then a Stardust Monolith will display a purple similar to the Nebula Pillar. Activating a lunar monolith first and then a Blood Moon Monolith will result in different colors than vice versa. For example, activating a Stardust Monolith, then a Blood Moon Monolith will display a dark blue, whereas activating a Blood Moon Monolith, then a Stardust Monolith will display a purple similar to the Nebula Pillar.
The monoliths' effects can sometimes raise the apparent light level in an area, which may be useful.
The lunar monoliths have luminescent parts, but they will only glow when they are in areas with light. This can be utilized to make background effects without having the monoliths visible.
The lunar monoliths provide full vision on the surface at night, and can be equipped in the social accessory slot for permanent effect.
When used during a Blood Moon, a monolith will combine its light color with the red tint.

The lunar monoliths appear to be miniature versions of the Celestial Pillars. They are the only Lunar Event items that do not have the 10* base rarity. They are the only Lunar Event items that do not have the 10* base rarity.
The Party Center is internally named PartyMonolith. Unlike monoliths, it triggers an actual Party event instead of only the background adjustment.
The design of the Void Monolith is based on the Monoliths from the science fiction novel series Space Odyssey.
The only pre-Hardmode monolith is the Aether Monolith.

Tim can only spawn at the bottom half of the Cavern layer and below. [2] Due to the randomized world generation, the depth will be different for every world. For example, if the border between the Underground and Cavern layers is at the depth of 650 tiles, and the bottom of the Underworld is at the depth of 1800 tiles in a world, Tim will spawn below the depth of 1225 tiles. In general, areas with lava are a good indicator of where Tim will spawn. In general, areas with lava are a good indicator of where Tim will spawn.
Tim appears to be wearing a Robe and a Wizard Hat.
Tim strongly resembles the Dark Caster, except for the Wizard Hat.

Tim's spawn rate increase is described in changelogs as occurring if the player "need[s] his hat". This increase is actually triggered by equipping one of the gem-crafted variations of Robes – any of which can serve as half of a two-piece Wizard armor set with the Wizard Hat that Tim drops, granting the player a 10% increase in magic critical strike chance.

Tim's name is a reference to Tim the Enchanter from the British comedy film Monty Python and the Holy Grail, as confirmed by former Re-Logic employee Blue on the Terraria IRC. The name of the achievement acquired by killing him is also a reference to his introduction in the movie.
According to the Bestiary, Tim is the Rune Wizard 's younger brother.
The Pretty Pink set closely resembles the magical girl outfit worn by Madoka Kaname from the 2011 anime series Puella Magi Madoka Magica.
The Pretty Pink Stockings are one of the few leg items with two separate sprites; one for each gender.
The Giant Cursed Skull has a cooldown of 2 seconds between firing bolts. [1]
The Giant Cursed Skull will open its mouth prior to firing bolts, and its attack can be interrupted.

It will not usually cast bolts through walls until it has passed into open space or been damaged by the player (using weapons that can pass through walls, such as the Nettle Burst or Death Sickle ). After being damaged or going into open space, it can fire bolts even if inside walls.
The Bestiary entry for the Giant Cursed Skull: " No one knows where these giant skulls came from, but like their smaller cousins, they seek out and curse the living with their magic. "
Since it fires neither arrows nor bullets, the Dart Rifle receives the specialized boosts from the Shroomite Helmet.
The Dart Rifle can also fire Seeds, but it does not allow obtaining them like the Blowgun and Blowpipe.

It can be an extremely deadly mid-Hardmode weapon in the right situations when paired with the right darts: Crystal Darts for enclosed areas or crowded enemies close to each other, and Cursed Darts for groups of grounded enemies. Cursed Darts are also excellent against The Destroyer, granted that they are shot above the boss. Cursed Darts are also excellent against The Destroyer, granted that they are shot above the boss.

Ichor Darts are useful against bosses and enemies with high defense. However, obtaining them requires creating an artificial Crimson biome with Crimson Seeds purchased from the Dryad in a Graveyard, or bringing in materials from another world with Crimson or a drunk world. Ichor Darts are also especially useful in situations where dodging is a high priority, for their unique ability to multiply after a short distance, making it easy for at least one dart to hit. Furthermore, Ichor Darts are useful for applying the Ichor debuff, even post- Moon Lord. The fact that the Dart Rifle uses darts as ammo means the player can freely use other ammo of their choice with other weapons, without having to worry about switching ammo types mid-fight. Ichor Darts are also especially useful in situations where dodging is a high priority, for their unique ability to multiply after a short distance, making it easy for at least one dart to hit. Furthermore, Ichor Darts are useful for applying the Ichor debuff, even post- Moon Lord. The fact that the Dart Rifle uses darts as ammo means the player can freely use other ammo of their choice with other weapons, without having to worry about switching ammo types mid-fight.

With the right gear, the Dart Rifle can do over 200 damage on a critical hit. This damage, combined with the damage over time of Cursed Darts, allows it to pick off powerful enemies with a single shot. It remains useful even past Plantera 's defeat, performing sufficiently well until the Chain Gun becomes available.

The Dart Rifle could be considered the Hardmode version of the Musket, seeing as both are obtainable in worlds containing the Corruption, and both looked almost visually identical before the Dart Rifle's sprite was changed in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). The primary functional difference between the two is that the Musket consumes bullets as ammunition instead of darts.
The Dart Rifle is not capable of using the Rifle Scope or any of its upgrades to zoom in on targets, likely due to it not being considered a gun.
The Dart Rifle and Dart Pistol have around the same overall DPS, despite their differences in damage and use time.

This armor set is very easy to obtain at the beginning of the game: The Diamonds for the Diamond Robe can be easily obtained with a Extractinator and some Silt and Slush, and Tim spawns much more frequently while wearing it, making the Wizard Hat much easier to obtain.

The Mystic Robe and Wizard Hat combination is considered the strongest pre-Hardmode armor for magic users not interested in defense, as their offensive stats greatly surpass those of both Jungle and Meteor armor. Since the set only contains two pieces, another piece of armor from other armor sets can be worn in the leggings slot, further increasing the bonus.
The Wizard set is currently one of two armor sets in the game that comes in two pieces, the other one being the Rain armor.

The grenades fired from the Grenade Launcher are strongly affected by gravity and can inflict massive self-damage. For this reason, using it in any tight area requires exceptional care to avoid it bouncing back to the player.
The grenades cannot be reflected by enemies like the Selenian (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as they will instantly explode on contact.

Compared to the Rocket Launcher, the Grenade Launcher can be obtained much earlier but has an arc and will not explode on contact with blocks right away. The Grenade Launcher also deals (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 33.33% / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 10% more damage. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) However, the Rocket Launcher has a direct hit bonus dealing 83% more damage. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) However, the Rocket Launcher has a direct hit bonus dealing 83% more damage.

The Grenade Launcher resembles the real-life China Lake grenade launcher in design and operation, being a fairly fast-firing grenade launcher. Compared to the real version, the Grenade Launcher in Terraria has a smaller receiver, a longer pump/foregrip, a folding stock and pistol grip, with the trigger moved forwards to around where the loading port is on the real weapon. Compared to the real version, the Grenade Launcher in Terraria has a smaller receiver, a longer pump/foregrip, a folding stock and pistol grip, with the trigger moved forwards to around where the loading port is on the real weapon.

Despite the name, the Grenade Launcher cannot fire Grenades, as they are hand grenades and are incompatible with it. Certain real-life grenade launcher rounds resemble rockets more closely than grenades. Certain real-life grenade launcher rounds resemble rockets more closely than grenades.
Despite being the first launcher that the player can obtain, it fires special projectiles instead of rockets.
Its firing sound is atypical for ranged weapons, resembling that of a spring-loaded mechanism. This makes sense as an explosive propellant would likely detonate the grenade prematurely.

Any enemy that has more than 1 max health, deals more than 0 damage, and drops coins has a chance to drop a Present. [4] Therefore, enemies spawned by statues, enemies from the Old One's Army (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Lunar Events, and the Slimer with wings will never drop Presents.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Presents can be placed down as furniture. The color of the Present changes each time it is placed down.
If a vanity set is dropped, all three parts will drop. The individual pieces never drop alone.
Presents can easily be farmed during events that spawn many enemies, like the Solar Eclipse.
Early on in the game, another easy way to farm for presents is to defeat the Eater of Worlds multiple times.
After the 1.1.1 Christmas update, nearly any item could erroneously drop from presents. [5] This glitch has since been fixed.
One of the variations of a placed Present has the same colors as the old Green Present item.

Increasing the empty wall area (i.e. tiles with only background walls and without other solid blocks/background objects ) of empty houses in the worlds allows NPCs to move in faster. Also, using Sandstone Brick Walls for houses will increase the time for NPCs to move in. [22] This means that a house with no empty wall area can only be assigned by a player. This means that a house with no empty wall area can only be assigned by a player.

Houses may be attached together and share common walls, floors, ceilings, and doors. What looks to the player like a multi-room house or apartment complex looks to the NPCs like a collection of independent houses.

Nearly any NPC house will qualify for a player to place and use a Bed as their spawn point, so long as the tiles immediately above the bed are clear (see the Beds page for full details). The Bed also counts as a comfort item.

If a house with an assigned NPC is destroyed or any of its requirements are invalidated, the NPC will wander the area until a valid house becomes available again. If killed, the NPC will respawn once a valid house is available.

An NPC will not spawn within its house if that house is on the visible screen at the time, and may walk around the area outside instead. At night, when it rains, and during any event, NPCs will be automatically placed inside their houses if the player travels several screens away, or if the player uses any Magic Mirror or the Teleporter.
The edges of the world do not count as part of the frame of a house.
If a background wall has been converted by biome spread (e.g. Stone Wall to Pearlstone Wall ), the house will become invalid as the converted wall is considered unsafe.

Houses in the Corruption or Crimson biomes are usually invalid. This could make purchasing items with biome requirements (most notably for the Painter ) harder. For these circumstances, one can use a King Statue or a Queen Statue to teleport the NPCs and purchase these items. If one does not have access to King or Queen Statues, building a house just outside of the evil score detection range but still within the evil biome (the evil biome's background should be visible) will create a valid house within said biome. If one does not have access to King or Queen Statues, building a house just outside of the evil score detection range but still within the evil biome (the evil biome's background should be visible) will create a valid house within said biome.

Actuators can be used with Blue, Brown, Gray, and Lihzahrd Pressure Plates to allow players entry but prevent enemies from entering or NPCs from leaving. However, if an actuated wall is left open, it can make the house invalid until it is made solid again. Trap Doors can also be used, as neither enemies nor NPCs can open them. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is very useful and convenient to use a "Player Above" sensor instead of pressure plates. Not only does this save some usable floor space, but avoids having the opening accidentally left open by an accidental misstep. Warning : The sensor itself is not a valid block for the house frame; if it is used as part of the floor, ceiling, or side walls (including corners), the house will not be valid. Trap Doors can also be used, as neither enemies nor NPCs can open them. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, it is very useful and convenient to use a "Player Above" sensor instead of pressure plates. Not only does this save some usable floor space, but avoids having the opening accidentally left open by an accidental misstep. Warning : The sensor itself is not a valid block for the house frame; if it is used as part of the floor, ceiling, or side walls (including corners), the house will not be valid.

On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, if a house is built at the world's original spawn point, it is best not to place any solid objects or blocks where characters appear; when the player teleports back or respawns, any blocks or furniture where they appear will be broken, which can invalidate the house.
If absolutely necessary (e.g. on 3DS, where there is no housing menu), players can force an NPC into a particular house by destroying all the others.
As long as the house meets the size criteria, it can be any shape, not just rectangles and squares (e.g. a dome-shaped house would still be viable).

It is a wise decision to build "spare" houses beyond the current number of NPCs: Any new NPCs can move in as soon as they are spawned or found (perhaps unexpectedly). Especially when entering Hardmode, some houses may be invalidated by Corruption or Crimson; having spares will help avoid NPCs being left homeless. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Having extras at each base will help with shuffling NPCs around to manage happiness, and/or make sure pylons remain usable. Any new NPCs can move in as soon as they are spawned or found (perhaps unexpectedly). Especially when entering Hardmode, some houses may be invalidated by Corruption or Crimson; having spares will help avoid NPCs being left homeless. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Having extras at each base will help with shuffling NPCs around to manage happiness, and/or make sure pylons remain usable.
When building homes underground, Sticky Bombs or Scarab Bombs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are a good choice, as they are accurate and break background walls for easier wall placement.

While it may be tempting to tuck all the NPCs into small houses, this will leave little room for decoration or even equipment. Many crafting stations are 3 tiles wide by 3 high, and as the game progresses, a player can obtain paintings and animal skins up to 6 tiles wide by 4 high, and potted plants that are 3 tiles wide and up to 6 high that they may wish to place inside their NPC's houses.

Houses are good places for players to indulge their creativity. It can be entertaining to provide NPCs with decorated and themed homes, even if they would be satisfied with empty cells. The NPC happiness system (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) builds on this source of entertainment, by giving NPCs preferences for their house's location and proximity to houses of other NPCs. That said, NPC happiness is not affected by a house's appearance or decoration, leaving the player with a free hand.

A house that has tiles within 5 tiles from the true edge of the world is considered invalid with the message " We need better text for this!!! " However, it is impossible to achieve the condition without editing the world externally, as the distance between the visible world edge and true world edge is 41 or 42 tiles.
Gemspark Blocks do not count as valid light sources for NPC houses.
When two (or more) Gemspark colored waterfalls of different colors contact each other, the colors will combine.
Vertical waterfalls created by water only supported by a half block do not change their color, even if the half block is a Gemspark.
Actuated Gemspark blocks still provide light.

Only deep paints can be used to alter the main coloration of Diamond Gemspark Blocks or walls, unlike any other gemspark blocks or walls. Deep painted Diamond Gemspark Blocks appear lighter than other painted gemsparks deep painted with the same color, which appears the exact same color for all other gemsparks apart from diamond.
It is possible that Gemspark Blocks, along with several other items and mechanics, were taken from holo the everything, a TConfig mod by Yoraiz0r, former modder and one of Re-Logic's programmers.

Much like the bullets of the Xenopopper, the Twilight Lances fired from this bow will focus on where the cursor is. Thus, when fired when the cursor is close to the player, it will fire in a spread, similar to a shotgun. Pointing the cursor farther away from the player, however, causes the projectiles to hit enemies at a distance more accurately.
Twilight Lances cannot be reflected by Biome Mimics in Expert Mode, Selenians, the Dreadnautilus, and Shimmer Slimes.
The Twilight Lance projectiles travel at a quicker rate compared to regular arrows and have a limited range. Using a Magic Quiver or any of its upgrades will further boost their velocity.

Using an Endless Quiver is effective for events, as the Twilight Lances have the piercing ability. For single targets, Ichor Arrows are preferable for their high base damage and also defense lowering debuff.
The Twilight Lances can damage enemies on the other side of one block thick walls, provided that the player is not too close to the wall.
It's piercing capability and the fact that one shot deals double damage makes it near-equal to the Tsunami in power.
As the weapons that the Empress of Light drops are based on her attacks, the Eventide seems to be based on her Ethereal Lance.
Eventide is Old English for evening time.
Like the Last Prism, the Eventide has secret color themes for developers and beta testers. This is triggered by using a specific set of character names:
The Wild Flower Seeds can grow any flower, while all others can only grow a flower of their respective color.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Vampire Miner does not take extra damage from the Stake Launcher, unlike the Vampire from the Solar Eclipse, even though they are both vampires.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Vampire Miners do not wear the Mining Helmet and do not drop it. However, they still give off light like the Undead Miner.
The Bestiary entry for the Undead Miner: " There's evidence of spelunkers having explored the caverns in the past... as well as evidence of them having died doing so. "
The Sky Dragon's Fury cannot get attack speed and size modifiers.
Melee speed will affect the attack speed of the alternate attack. Due to a bug, at extremely high melee speed only two energy orbs will spawn.
The projectiles created by the alternate attack will also inflict debuffs with the use of items and equipment such as flasks, Frost armor, and the Fire Gauntlet.
The energy orbs from the alternate attack is generated quite far from the player. This allows firing through solid walls that are two to three blocks wide.
The Electrosphere created by the Sky Dragon's Fury's alternate attack and the Electrosphere Launcher cannot overlap. The oldest existing rings will dissipate upon overlapping with a new one.

The Sky Dragon's Fury's alternate attack is comparable to the attack of the Electrosphere Launcher. While the Sky Dragon's Fury fires more rings of electricity and does not use ammunition, the Electrosphere Launcher does more damage and lasts longer.

The Brand of the Inferno, the Sergeant United Shield, the Sky Dragon's Fury, and the Tome of Infinite Wisdom are the only weapons in Terraria to have two separate means of attack triggered by two different buttons.
The projectiles created by the Sky Dragon's Fury's alternate attack share the appearance of those from the uncharged attack of the Charged Blaster Cannon.
Like the other Old One's Army weapons, the Sky Dragon's Fury is a direct reference to the weapon of the same name in Dungeon Defenders 2, due to its implementation as part of a crossover event.
Compared to The Axe, the Luminite Hamaxes have +3 range, which might be an advantage when removing background walls.

The range of this weapon is comparable to that of the Ice Boomerang, but it is less powerful, while also being a rare drop. The Ice Boomerang is easier to find, making it a much more viable alternative.
Shroomerang is a portmanteau of the words mushroom and boomerang.
The Firefly in a Bottle, Lightning Bug in a Bottle, Lavafly in a Bottle, and all "soul in a bottle" variants cannot be toggled on and off via wire.
Unlike the other lanterns, the Chinese Lantern is 2 tiles wide and 2 tiles high, and can be placed underwater.
Lanterns cannot be placed on blocks deactivated by Actuators, and will be destroyed if the block they are hanging off of is toggled by one.
Each world's Dungeon contains three of the seven noncraftable Dungeon-exclusive lanterns. Each section of the Dungeon contains a different type of lantern. Which lanterns are present is randomized.
