If this was tried with a consumable item, it would be used as such. Healing items acted uniquely to this bug; they would still heal the player, but would not inflict Potion Sickness. Update 1.2 had somewhat tried to fix it, but could still be circumvented by using a tool or weapon with continuous use.

The Parrot Cracker is the second most expensive item to buy, more expensive than the Clentaminator ( 2 PC ) and Autohammer ( 1 PC ), but is surpassed by the Companion Cube ( 5 PC ). The Parrot Cracker when sold by a Pirate who is homeless or far from home will cost 5 PC 62 GC 50 SC. This would make it the most expensive item in the game to purchase. The Parrot Cracker when sold by a Pirate who is homeless or far from home will cost 5 PC 62 GC 50 SC. This would make it the most expensive item in the game to purchase.
The pet Parrot is similar to the Parrot enemy, which can potentially cause confusion among idle parrots during a Pirate Invasion.

The pet's buff tooltip, "Polly wants the cracker", is a reference to the phrase "Polly want a cracker", which is said to have originated in the 1883 adventure novel Treasure Island by Scottish author Robert Louis Stevenson, or the popular slogan for the original saltine cracker by the American cookie and snack manufacturer Nabisco in 1876. However, the phrase can be verified to have been in use even before those dates. [1] (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) "Wants" contains an errant apostrophe. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) "Wants" contains an errant apostrophe.

In don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) seeds, the Chain Knife receives the following changes: Switched place with KO Cannon. As a result, it is dropped by Clowns instead of Cave Bats. Damage increased from 12 to 60. Use time decreased from 20 to 15. Value increased from 1 GC 25 SC to 17 GC 50 SC. Switched place with KO Cannon. As a result, it is dropped by Clowns instead of Cave Bats. Damage increased from 12 to 60. Use time decreased from 20 to 15. Value increased from 1 GC 25 SC to 17 GC 50 SC.
It is good at killing quick flying enemies. It is also good at killing large groups of Wall Creepers, and keeping the second form of the Brain of Cthulhu at bay.

A Bat Statue can be used to easily farm bats to obtain the Chain Knife. Note that drop rates from statue enemies are reduced by a factor of 5. If the player finds a Bat Statue Underground before defeating Skeletron, they can put in onto a Wire (in between a trap and its Pressure Plate ) and step on the Pressure Plate to make a crude way of spawning more Cave Bats. If the player finds a Bat Statue Underground before defeating Skeletron, they can put in onto a Wire (in between a trap and its Pressure Plate ) and step on the Pressure Plate to make a crude way of spawning more Cave Bats.
Although the weapon attacks quite quickly, it is very difficult to stunlock enemies with it due to its low knockback.
The weapon is very likely a reference to the Rope Dart, a weapon famously utilized by Scorpion in the Mortal Kombat series.

Wiring for traps is visible to the player if they are holding a mechanism-related item such as a Pressure Plate in their hand. This can make early game exploration safer until items such as the Mechanical Lens and The Grand Design can be obtained.

Randomly generated traps are a very cost-effective method of acquiring Wire and Actuators once the player has a Wire Cutter, saving 5 SC for every bit of wire collected and 10 SC for each Actuator (as opposed to purchasing them from the Mechanic ).
When placed effectively, Traps can be useful in events.
When multiple traps are naturally generated close to each other, their wiring may intersect. This leads to multiple traps with multiple triggers.
Most traps deal double the damage to players in Expert Mode (in addition to the double damage players normally take from traps).
The explosive trap's ore veins are usually bigger than an average vein and can have rare ores in them, so disarming the bomb and mining the ore can prove useful.
Traps have many different ways they can generate making it harder to know one definitive way to deal with a trap.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Despite seemingly being made out of Lihzahrd bricks, the Picksaw or above is not required to mine any of the Lihzahrd-related traps.
In very rare circumstances, sand traps can also spawn inside other structures, including the Pyramid and Jungle Temple.

Thorny bushes will grow on player-planted Corrupt grass and are able to grow up to 4 tiles across and upwards, spreading Corruption to anything they touch, potentially creating unwanted areas of Corruption.
Corrupt grass may also be obtained by planting regular grass and using Purple Solution or Vile Powder on it.

Some bosses' health bars have special displays: The Eater of Worlds ' health bar counts the total health of all segments. The Brain of Cthulhu 's health bar counts the total health of both the Creepers and the Brain itself. Skeletron and Skeletron Prime 's health bars only show the remaining health of the head. Retinazer and Spazmatism have individual health bars. Golem 's health bar shows the total health of the head and the body, but not the fists. The Martian Saucer 's health bar shows the total health of its four weapon parts and the core. All four Celestial Pillars have two bars, a blue-colored one for their shield and one for their actual health. The shield bar will overlay the health bar and shows the remaining enemy kills needed to destroy the shield on the bar if the numeric display is on. The Moon Lord 's health bar shows the total health of all of his damageable parts, including all three eyes and his core. The Eater of Worlds ' health bar counts the total health of all segments. The Brain of Cthulhu 's health bar counts the total health of both the Creepers and the Brain itself. Skeletron and Skeletron Prime 's health bars only show the remaining health of the head. Retinazer and Spazmatism have individual health bars. Golem 's health bar shows the total health of the head and the body, but not the fists. The Martian Saucer 's health bar shows the total health of its four weapon parts and the core. All four Celestial Pillars have two bars, a blue-colored one for their shield and one for their actual health. The shield bar will overlay the health bar and shows the remaining enemy kills needed to destroy the shield on the bar if the numeric display is on. The Moon Lord 's health bar shows the total health of all of his damageable parts, including all three eyes and his core.
The boss health bar will display on the bottom of the screen if the player is using a controller or keyboard and mouse.
The icon on the left of the boss health bar is the map icon for that boss.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This accessory works well with the Shrimpy Truffle, which gives the player a damage and speed boost when at or below 50% life.
The Frozen Turtle Shell is useful for fighting bosses and events, which usually expose the player to constant damage, thus activating the accessory more often than during regular gameplay.
Turning on autopause and swapping to this accessory when below 50% life may be advisable.
Despite it being a Turtle Shell, it is dropped by the Ice Tortoise.
The buff can be canceled, although it will immediately activate again.
It is advisable to keep Evolution Beasts away using weapons with high knockback, in order to avoid the powerful ram which is similar to that of a Unicorn or a Wolf.
The Bestiary entry for the Evolution Beast: " Celestial power fuels the aggression of these violent beasts, allowing them to run down those who trespass the pillar's area. "
Specular Fish share portions of the Common, Uncommon, and Plentiful catch quality slots. As an approximation, they can be considered Plentiful in Snow biomes or Common otherwise.

The Ichor debuff, which reduces defense by (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 15 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 20, can actually amplify the damage of the arrows themselves against an afflicted enemy. This is very helpful for killing bosses like The Twins and Duke Fishron. Note that some enemies are immune to the debuff, in which case the arrows will deal their normal damage (along with armor/weapon bonuses) only. Note that some enemies are immune to the debuff, in which case the arrows will deal their normal damage (along with armor/weapon bonuses) only.

The crafting ingredient Ichor can be difficult to obtain in early Hardmode due to increased difficulty. Hellfire Arrows are helpful for early farming. Alternatively, one can use Unholy Arrows until they acquire Hardmode-tier weapons and armor, at which point Ichor Stickers can be easy to defeat allowing more Ichor to be obtained in masses. Alternatively, one can use Unholy Arrows until they acquire Hardmode-tier weapons and armor, at which point Ichor Stickers can be easy to defeat allowing more Ichor to be obtained in masses.
Moonglows grow slightly faster during nighttime. [1]
Moonglow looks similar to the real-life snowdrop flower.
Beetle armor at its 45% state, Worm Scarf (17%) and Endurance Potion (10%) will reduce damage by nearly 60%.
Percent damage reduction on accessories/potions apply first, then damage reduction on set bonuses are applied (e.g. Beetle armor, Solar Flare armor ).

When fighting the Dungeon Guardian, the Worm Scarf (when combined with a few potions or accessories) can allow the player to survive a hit from the Dungeon Guardian without the use of too many accessories and buffs.

As the game progresses and especially on higher difficulties, enemy damage will start hitting well into the hundreds. The Worm Scarf thus becomes a valuable tool in increasing survivability, especially considering the damage reduction is equal across all difficulties unlike defense.

Since the Worm Scarf can be taken into non-Expert worlds, it is often a good idea to level a character up to near or post-Hardmode gear, create an Expert world, and easily defeat the Eater of Worlds for its Worm Scarf, which remains useful even at endgame.

It is possible to replace any part of the set with one of the Shadow armor 's – the after-image movement effect will remain. (It is unknown if this is also the case on the Old-gen console version, or with other armor sets.) Verify
Aside from its color, Ninja armor is extremely similar in appearance to the armor worn by the Ninja class in the Final Fantasy RPG series, especially from the 1st and 3rd installments.

On average and with 0 luck (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), one needs to kill about (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 65 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 90 Giant Tortoises for a 90% chance to get 3 Turtle Shells (about (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 100 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 140 for 99%). For 4 Turtle Shells, this number is raised to (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 80 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 110 for a 90% chance (and (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 120 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 170 for 99%).

Despite being called a Turtle Shell, it is dropped by the Giant Tortoise. The only turtles in the game are critters ( Sea Turtle, Turtle, and Jungle Turtle ) and summons ( Pet Turtle and Turtle Mount ).
Even though it has a higher drop rate than the Bezoar, it is rarer overall due to the Giant Tortoise's relatively low spawn rate.
The Bestiary entry for the Pirate Crossbower: " Some wee lasses aren't content staying at port waiting for their men to return from a raid, so they join in on the deadly fun! "
The Glittery Butterfly appears to have an animation for teleporting towards the player when they are too far away, but it appears to remain unused.
The buff tooltip "Truly, truly outrageous" is in reference to the theme song "Truly Outrageous" from the 1985 American animated musical television series Jem.
The Glittery Butterfly's wings bear a striking resemblance to the Sparkly Wings (Old-gen console and 3DS versions).

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The following formula is used when determining the amount of damage that will be dealt: [1] If the hit enemy has more than 10% HP: [math]\displaystyle{ \mathit{Damage} \times \left(1 + \frac{5}{3} \times \left(1 - \frac{\mathit{HP_{Current}}}{\mathit{HP_{Max}}}\right)\right) }[/math] If the hit enemy has more than 10% HP: [math]\displaystyle{ \mathit{Damage} \times \left(1 + \frac{5}{3} \times \left(1 - \frac{\mathit{HP_{Current}}}{\mathit{HP_{Max}}}\right)\right) }[/math]

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Keybrand's ability to do more damage against previously injured targets makes it an exceptionally good choice against slow-moving, high-health targets such as Nailhead or the Ogre.

The Keybrand is based on the Keyblade, a weapon used in the action role-playing game series Kingdom Hearts. It bears an especially strong resemblance to the Keyblade named the Kingdom Key, which Sora wields. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Keybrand's visual effects when striking enemies are likely a reference to similar bright effects that appear when striking enemies with the Keyblade throughout the Kingdom Hearts series. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Keybrand's visual effects when striking enemies are likely a reference to similar bright effects that appear when striking enemies with the Keyblade throughout the Kingdom Hearts series.
Despite being a key, it does not unlock anything.
The Keybrand is the best of the weapons that create no projectiles.

Until 1.3.5, items had an unused internal name. Between its introduction and 1.3.0.1, the Keybrand's name was Lockblade, [2] which may have been its original name during development. This name was never visible in-game.
Due to the increased variation of enemy types that appear during Hardmode, The Groom will have a lesser chance of spawning.
The Groom drops the Top Hat, while the other two pieces of the Tuxedo set are crafted using Silk and Black Thread.

Following a Discord message where Redigit jokingly answered a Discord user's question of "who are the angler 's parents" with "they ded", a Reddit user declared "officially starting" a theory of the Groom and the Bride being the Angler's parents, to which Redigit, likewise jokingly, replied "This is now canon." [1]
The Announcement Box's functionality can be disabled by launching the game with a -disableannouncementbox command line parameter.

If the Announcement Box is wired to a time sensor, any message that is tied to that time (for example the message for natural occurring Blood Moon : " The Blood Moon is rising... " ) will be displayed before the message from the Announcement Box.

Since all item tags occupy the same width and height, coupled with the fact that there can only be 10 lines of text in the chat at one time means that one can in theory create a rudimentary animation using mechanisms. Walls are very good for this purpose as they are big squares. Be aware that by doing animations, the messages are spamming the chat which can lead to the annoyance of other players as they can not communicate via chat. It can also make one miss status messages.
The Announcement Box was a suggestion by Master Geass, a user on the Official Terraria Forums. The original post can be found here.
Unlike Rockets I-IV, the light-producing sparks created by the explosion are unaffected by gravity.
This item is a reference to the video game series Fallout, in which Mini Nukes are American Football-sized warheads intended for use in handheld weaponry.
Before 1.2, Feral Claws were the only pre-Hardmode offensive accessory.

Tossing any liquid bomb while already submerged in a liquid will cause it to explode instantly, damaging the player. If the bomb spreads the same liquid that the player is submerged in, none will be placed or removed. If it spreads a different liquid, however, most of it will instantly solidify into Obsidian, Aetherium Blocks, Honey Blocks, or Crispy Honey Blocks depending on the combination. If the bomb spreads the same liquid that the player is submerged in, none will be placed or removed. If it spreads a different liquid, however, most of it will instantly solidify into Obsidian, Aetherium Blocks, Honey Blocks, or Crispy Honey Blocks depending on the combination.
In Hardmode, the Cyborg will sell Dry Rockets, used to craft (the rest of) a similar set of liquid rockets.

Players should always keep at least one of any liquid bomb in storage, such as more can be purchased from the Demolitionist. If every existing liquid bomb in a world is used up, the player will need to fish up Obsidian/Hellstone Crates until they find another Wet Bomb.
The Wet Bomb, inconsistently, is not named "Water Bomb", even though its counterparts share the name of the liquids they spread.

The buff loses some of its usefulness when the Shadow Orb, Crimson Heart, or a Mining Helmet is obtained, as the materials needed to make the potion could be used for more useful potions. However, unlike the Shadow Orb and Crimson Heart, the light source comes from the player, which will not fall behind, and unlike the Mining Helmet, a helmet with more defense can be worn. The light source emitted is also much brighter and the range is larger than the other three, making it slightly more useful.
Sapphire blocks can be mixed up with Diamond blocks, although Diamond is of a lighter color.

Its ability to pass through solid blocks and pierce unlimited enemies allows players to wall themselves off from most threats and still deal damage, or hit worm -type enemies while they are inside walls. Its infinite piercing property is also useful against enemies with multiple parts or minions.

Compared to the Vilethorn, the Nettle Burst deals a little over twice damage, affects an area twice as long, lingers for a slightly longer period, and has a slightly faster use time. Due to the way defense and armor penetration work, however, this doubling in damage results in significantly more damage against Hardmode enemies that would otherwise reduce the Vilethorn's damage to 1.
Compared to its alternate ore version, the Silver Pickaxe, it has more pickaxe power but is significantly slower in terms of mining speed.

When mining blocks with 100 HP (e.g. Stone Blocks ), the Tungsten Pickaxe requires 38 ticks. [1] Thus, it is more efficient to use a Lead (36) or Silver Pickaxe (33), as they will dig faster, despite needing one more hit. However, Tungsten Pickaxe is marginally better than an Iron Pickaxe, which would be 39 ticks.
When mining blocks with 50 HP (e.g. Dirt Blocks ), it is faster to use the Tungsten Pickaxe because it only needs one hit (19 ticks) instead of two.

One pair of Twins counts as one minion toward the maximum minion count. Therefore, a player can get 22 "minions" with maximum minion capacity, as opposed to the usual 11 full-sized minions. Therefore, a player can get 22 "minions" with maximum minion capacity, as opposed to the usual 11 full-sized minions.
Retanimini's laser projectiles travel straight forward, so they may miss against fast or far away enemies. They also emit a small amount of light.

(Old-gen console version) Due to their piercing attacks, the Twins can only hit the same enemy a maximum of 6 times per second, regardless of how many Twins are summoned (this applies to all weapons and summons that pierce enemies except the Razorblade Typhoon at 10 hits/s).
It is possible to get non-matching amounts of Retaniminis and Spazmaminis by maxing the spawn cap and lowering it.
Unlike most flying minions, the Twins will not naturally pass-through blocks unless the player has moved out of range. This makes them very prone to getting stuck in tight areas and caves.
The Spazmamini applies 12 ticks of Static immunity frames upon hitting an enemy
The Optic Staff is effective against bosses, as each Twin attacks individually. It is especially effective against The Destroyer, as the Spazmamini will pierce each segment.
The Twins do not do well against a sparse enemy crowd. Instead, they are better for dense enemy crowds such as those in the Pumpkin Moon, Frost Moon, and Goblin army, as well as in the Dungeon.

The icon indicating that game data is saving on the Nintendo 3DS version resembles the Optic Staff minions, except it resembles more the first stage of a Retinazer, instead of the second, mechanized stage.
Unlike the Twins boss, the minions are not connected by a tendril. Furthermore, Spazmamini does not spew Cursed Flames like Spazmatism does.

There is an occurrence when using the Optic Staff where only one or two Retanimini will remain with the player, while one Spazmamini (or vice versa) will be left behind due to obstacles. This bug is more likely to happen when the player is crossing some obstacles that the minions cannot. This can be fixed by removing the minions and spawning them again.
As the Stalker's Quiver does not boost the damage of ammunition, its actual damage increase is less than 10%.
The 10% arrow damage boost of the Stalker's Quiver can stack with the Magic Quiver and the Molten Quiver ; however, arrow velocity and ammo conservation chance do not stack.

Extra arrow velocity works by setting the arrow's extraUpdates value to 1. This does not affect Jester's Arrows, Ichor Arrows, Venom Arrows, or Stakes, as they already have an extraUpdates value of 1 (or greater).

Since the Stalker's Quiver does not boost the damage of ammunition, it might provide less increase in DPS than its crafting material, Putrid Scent, which provides 5% damage and critical strike chance.
Due to the essentially doubled amount of drops, farming the Brain of Cthulhu, and more significantly, its Creepers can be a reliable way to make absurd amounts of money.
Explosive Bunnies can be collected and used as weapons early on, due to their high damage and abundance. However, caution is advised, as they can easily take out the player as well.
For the worthy directly references the tooltip of the Red Potion, " 'Only for those who are worthy' ".

In For the worthy, several mechanics reference very early versions of Terraria where they were standard behavior: This includes the Locked Gold Chests generating on Floating Islands, all Ruined Houses being made out of Hellstone Bricks, Ash Blocks collapsing at random, and Chests containing an Angel Statue instead of a valuable item.
A For the worthy world is referred to in the source code as getGoodWorld. [25]

The frame of Demonite Bricks / Crimtane Bricks created by the defeat of the Wall of Flesh in For the worthy worlds will be slightly smaller, going from 9×9 blocks to 7×7 blocks, likely to stay consistent with the Wall of Flesh's decreased size.
Chum Buckets do not affect the chances for fishing up enemies during Blood Moons, but fishing using the Chum Caster doubles the chance.
Using a Sonar Potion alongside Chum Buckets is recommended, as it allows the player to save reels for more valuable fishing catches.

The tooltip is a reference to Plankton, the main antagonist of the American animated comedy television series SpongeBob SquarePants, who owns a restaurant named "The Chum Bucket", which quite literally resembles a bucket itself and sells the namesake chum.
In real life, chum is a common bait composed of fresh chunks of fish meat and bone, thrown into the water and used by fishermen to lure and catch large game fish and sharks.
If a Fish Bowl is worn in the equipment slot, the breath meter appears because the player's head is technically underwater. Breathing equipment and potions can still be used to counter this effect.

The lava timer from the Lava Charm and its derivatives overrides the breath meter visually. This means that if the player's head is in water and the feet are in lava, the player will lose breath without seeing the breath meter.
The range of the Paladin's Shield is 50 tiles. Players that are more than 50 tiles away, even if they are on the same team, are not affected. [1]

If two or more players on the same party equip the Paladin's Shield, only the one closest to the damaged party member will take the split damage. If multiple other players with Paladin's Shield are equally far away from the damaged player, the player who joined the server later will take the split damage. [2]

Players equipped with the Paladin's Shield will not split damage to other party members also using the Paladin's Shield – only those party members without the Paladin's Shield will deal split damage to party members with the Paladin's Shield. This means that if all party members are wearing the Paladin's Shield and are within 50 tiles from each other, they will gain a 25% damage reduction at no cost.

Damage taken will first be reduced by the damaged player's defense and damage reduction effects, then be split by the Paladin's Shield. The damaged player takes 75% of this reduced damage, and the wearer of the Paladin's Shield takes 25% of this reduced damage. Damage given to the wearer of the Paladin's Shield will be reduced again by the wearer's defense and damage reduction effects. The wearer will always take at least 1 damage from a teammate being hit. The teammate can receive 0 damage if said teammate takes 1 damage from an attack, and the damage gets split. Damage given to the wearer of the Paladin's Shield will be reduced again by the wearer's defense and damage reduction effects. The wearer will always take at least 1 damage from a teammate being hit. The wearer will always take at least 1 damage from a teammate being hit. The teammate can receive 0 damage if said teammate takes 1 damage from an attack, and the damage gets split.

Receiving shared damage will cause the wearer to react as if they had been hit. This means that: The wearer's invincibility frames will trigger, which is affected by the Cross Necklace. Accessories that trigger when damaged, such as the Star Cloak and Honey Comb, will activate. Dodging effects (e.g. Black Belt, Brain of Confusion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) can also activate. Despite not activating the Turtle armor 's set bonus, shared damage will use the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hallowed armor 's Holy Protection buff / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Titanium armor 's Shadow Dodge buff, and will affect the damage reduction of the Beetle Shell 's Beetle Endurance buff. The wearer's invincibility frames will trigger, which is affected by the Cross Necklace. Accessories that trigger when damaged, such as the Star Cloak and Honey Comb, will activate. Dodging effects (e.g. Black Belt, Brain of Confusion (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) can also activate. Despite not activating the Turtle armor 's set bonus, shared damage will use the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Hallowed armor 's Holy Protection buff / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Titanium armor 's Shadow Dodge buff, and will affect the damage reduction of the Beetle Shell 's Beetle Endurance buff.

Despite the fact that the Paladin's Shield only absorbs damage when the wearer is above 25% health, any split damage exceeding 25% of the wearer's health will kill them if the wearer is at 27% health, for example. Some ways to accomplish this are to receive the split damage from an explosive or, more effectively, a Dungeon Guardian. A large enough amount of fall damage dealt to a teammate will kill the wearer even at full health. When the player is killed by the Paladin's Shield, no death message will be created. When the player is killed by the Paladin's Shield, no death message will be created.
The chance of obtaining a Paladin's Shield after killing n Paladins can be calculated with the following formula:
The Paladin's Shield can synergize with the Brand of the Inferno (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) to block attacks, granting the Striking Moment buff.
The icon of the buff that is received from the Paladin's Shield portrays the old sprite of the item.
The function of the Paladin's Shield may be a reference to the Cover ability of Cecil Harvey from Final Fantasy IV, which allows him to absorb damage dealt to a party member in a similar fashion.
Animal skulls may spawn in the Oasis biome as a type of background object (they will not respawn once destroyed).
Several Oasis biomes may spawn in a single world: up to two in small worlds, three in medium worlds, and four in large worlds. However, it is also possible that none will spawn.
An Oasis may generate on top of any kind of Desert biome, including those with the Underground Desert biome underneath. Although unusual, multiple Oasis biomes can generate in the same Desert.
In the case of the Desert above the Underground Desert, other structures may generate instead of an Oasis. See Underground Desert § Surface Desert for more information.

Fishing in the Oasis biome will sometimes drop Oysters, which can contain Pearls that are the main materials for making various Luck Potions. They will also always produce a Shucked Oyster when opened, but the Well Fed buff it gives is inferior to Plenty Satisfied provided by the other Oasis fish.
A very useful item gained from fishing up Oasis or Mirage Crates is the Magic Conch, which allows the player to teleport to the Ocean biome in similar fashion to the Magic Mirror.
The Boulder traps that are wired to the Dead Man's Chest are rigged with Actuators rather than Active Stone Blocks.
Functionally, the Dead Man's Chest is similar to a Trapped Chest, as it can send signals via wires. However, it only spawns naturally, cannot be crafted, and has functional storage slots.
The Dead Man's Chest will send out a signal whenever it is either opened or closed (with the ⚷ Open / Activate key).
Fairies can lead the player to Dead Man's Chests.
The achievement can still be obtained even if the Chest is renamed.

If Autopause is active, the player will take damage from the Explosives upon opening a Dead Man's Chest. If they survive the explosion, they can access the contents of the Chest. All of the other traps will only be sprung once the player closes the Chest and exits the inventory.
Attempting to use the Block Swap feature to swap out these Chests for harmless ones will still trigger the traps.
While the combination of traps can prove deadly to even a player with end-game gear, most of them can be avoided by simply using solid blocks, and the Explosives can be mined.
Dead Man's Chests are not highlighted by a Dangersense Potion, but the surrounding Explosives, Dart Traps, Boulder traps, and Geysers are.
Using the Mechanical Lens or The Grand Design can easily reveal all the traps around the Chest, and provides lots of Wire and Actuators to harvest.
The most evident giveaway of a Dead Man's Chest is the Boulder traps above it, as they are larger and generally easier to spot than the 1×1-tile Dart Traps and hidden Explosives.
The Dead Man's Chest can only imitate unlocked Gold Chests. Other Chests (e.g. Water Chests) that a Mimic cannot disguise itself as are always safe to open.

The term " Dead Man's Chest " originates from a fictional sea song of the same name from Treasure Island, the 1883 adventure novel by Robert Louis Stevenson. The lyrics for the chorus are, "Fifteen men on the Dead Man's Chest— Yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum!" The term was also used as a film title in the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise, specifically the 2006 film Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest. The term was also used as a film title in the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise, specifically the 2006 film Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest.

It is harder to find the Dead Man's Chests in larger worlds, as the number of them only grow linearly with the width of the world (10–20 in small worlds, 15–31 in medium worlds and 20–40 in large worlds )
Team Dye will not be applied to minions.

Sentries, the Stardust Guardian, and the Forbidden Sign cannot be dyed with the Critter Shampoo. Instead, the Stardust Guardian and Forbidden Sign can be dyed by dying the pet accessory slot, while sentries cannot be dyed at all.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Critter Shampoo cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
The bottle seems to depict a Bunny, similar to the Guide to Critter Companionship, another item sold by the Zoologist.
The player is pushed more if they jump, but less if they are moving themselves left or right.
The player will be pushed west when the Weather Radio indicates that the wind speed is at zero and is under this debuff.
In total, there are 568 unique weapons (and damaging tools).
If an enemy is under the effect of a piercing attack (including explosions), a brief immune frame will be applied to it, making attacks that hit during this interval fail to inflict damage.
Unlike many games, no matter how far an enemy is from the center of the blast radius, they always receive full damage from an AoE attack.

The decently high drop chance, useful set bonus, and defense on par with Gold armor could make this set a good alternative to Gold/ Platinum armor in pre-Hardmode. Hoplites deal high damage, but can also be stunlocked relatively easily, and in addition to the armor they can drop Javelins. The Gladiator armor can be particularly useful for melee players due to its high defense and complete immunity to knockback. The Gladiator armor can be particularly useful for melee players due to its high defense and complete immunity to knockback.
The Gladiator armor can be farmed from a Hoplite Statue. It can be placed on top of a trap, then activated, creating a simple Hoplite farm.

For players who are particularly fond of the complete knockback immunity who commonly opt to equip a Cobalt Shield or Obsidian Shield, this armor set provides decent defense and can let them swap out their shield for another accessory while keeping the knockback immunity. However, it still cannot replace the burn-resistant property of the Obsidian Shield.

Despite being named after the people who fought in the Colosseum in ancient Rome, the Gladiator armor visually resembles the armor of hoplites (a type of soldier in ancient Greece) whom the enemies that drop it are named after as well.
Ravens can be difficult to see during the night in complete darkness, as they have a very dark, almost pitch-black color.
The Bestiary entry for the Raven: " Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. Nevermore. "

Since they do not drop coins, Biome Keys cannot be dropped by Meteor Heads during Hardmode, enemies spawned by a statue, critters, Old One's Army enemies, most boss minions, or any enemy spawned by a Celestial Pillar (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in the Lunar Events (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
Causing a large number of enemies to spawn in the respective biome is an efficient way to farm for the Keys/Key Molds. Events and certain boss fights are especially suitable for this.

Placing the player's spawn point / base in one of the biomes can increase their chances of obtaining a key due to the large number of enemy deaths that occur near player bases. This works particularly well for the Snow biome, which is much less dangerous than the others.
Although there is no Crimson Chest in a world with Corruption, it is possible to obtain Crimson Keys from an artificial Crimson biome, and vice versa.
It is possible to obtain multiple different Biome Keys from the same enemy if it is killed in a hybrid biome, although the chance of this happening is very low.
The Ravens attack notably quickly. As they are also able to fly, this makes them potent melee minions.
The Ravens physically pierce through countless enemies Verify and apply local immunity frames.
The Raven's dark color makes it hard to see at night. This can be remedied by using the Critter Shampoo (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) with a bright, glowing dye.
The Raven Staff can be considered a direct upgrade to the Finch Staff (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as both weapons summon bird minions that attack in a similar pattern.
The Bestiary entry for the Yellow Slime: " A simple, gelatinous creature that swallows anything and everything whole! It takes a long time to digest anything. "
Because they had no sell value, they became almost completely useless once a Pot o' Gold was crafted.

The Guide referenced that the Rainbow Pieces are parts of a greater object, the Prism Danann. However, there was no such item in the game. This may be a reference to the Tuatha Dé Danann, a supernatural race in Gaelic mythology. This may be a reference to the Tuatha Dé Danann, a supernatural race in Gaelic mythology.
Due to the mechanics of both items, it was impossible for a Rainbow Piece and a Fallen Star to be dropped as items in the same world without one immediately disappearing.
Cherry domestication predates recorded history.
Despite the name indicating a single cherry, the sprite depicts two cherries.
It is unrelated to and is not dropped from Sakura trees, even though they are often known as cherry blossom trees.

The Apricot, Cherry, Grapefruit, Plum, Pomegranate, and Spicy Pepper are the only fruits that do not have unique recipes of their own. They can only be used to make Fruit Juice, Fruit Salad, and Ambrosia – recipes that allow any fruit to be used.
The pattern Luminite Bricks show when placed together connects with the pattern of the Martian Conduit Plating.
This item is only obtainable after defeating Skeletron, as it requires Bones to craft, which only drop from enemies in the Dungeon.
The use of bone in its crafting recipe is a reference to bone china.
Pylons emit faint light of their respective color.

When purchasing most pylons (except the Universal Pylon ) from an NPC, the following restrictions apply: The NPC is a "vendor" that normally sells items, other than the Traveling Merchant and the Skeleton Merchant : The NPC is a "vendor" that normally sells items, other than the Traveling Merchant and the Skeleton Merchant :

Pylons can be used during the Lunar Events to traverse the world to combat the various pillars, allowing the player to choose the order they want to fight each pillar more easily. This exception does not extend to the Moon Lord, however, and they are still unusable during other invasions or boss fights.

Early access to all pre-Hardmode pylons can be gained from combinations of NPCs available prior to defeating any bosses, these combinations are the Arms Dealer with the Nurse, or the Golfer with the Angler.

The Pylon Network can be supplemented by several other forms of teleportation or transportation, all of which do work during boss fights and invasions: Each player can use a Recall Potion, Magic Mirror or its upgrades to teleport to their own spawn point (although, doing this while fighting the Wall of Flesh will result in an instant death). The Shellphone and Magic Conch give access to both Oceans (use once for the currently more distant Ocean, then again for the other Ocean). The Shellphone and Demon Conch give access to the center of the Underworld (it may be necessary to build a platform there, especially in drunk world secret world seeds ). Once the Mechanic is rescued, each pylon plus the three Shellphone landing points, can be used as the hub of a local Teleporter network. Even before Hardmode, the pylons and conch points can also be rail hubs. Each player can use a Recall Potion, Magic Mirror or its upgrades to teleport to their own spawn point (although, doing this while fighting the Wall of Flesh will result in an instant death). The Shellphone and Magic Conch give access to both Oceans (use once for the currently more distant Ocean, then again for the other Ocean). The Shellphone and Demon Conch give access to the center of the Underworld (it may be necessary to build a platform there, especially in drunk world secret world seeds ). Once the Mechanic is rescued, each pylon plus the three Shellphone landing points, can be used as the hub of a local Teleporter network. Even before Hardmode, the pylons and conch points can also be rail hubs.

Since the area that the Cavern Pylon can be used in is very large, there are several possible use cases for it: Creating a Cavern Pylon town immediately outside the Dungeon has many benefits, the most obvious being near-instant access to a deeper part of the Dungeon once Skeletron is defeated. It is still possible to build a town prior to defeating Skeletron, as the Dungeon Guardian will not spawn unless a player is actually inside the Dungeon (more specifically, when the player is in front of natural Dungeon Brick Walls ). Since the Dungeon is right next to the Ocean, this means both Oceans can be conveniently accessed, so long as the Ocean Pylon is at the opposite Ocean from the Dungeon. If there are at least three NPCs, part of the Dungeon may be considered part of the town instead. While it is not likely to be a large part, it can provide a relatively safe place to deal with enemies without more immediately spawning (Note that this effect is provided by the town, which does not require a pylon). Later in the game, the player will not have to worry about accidentally triggering a battle with the Lunatic Cultist, as it is more likely they enter the Dungeon via their own entrance than the naturally-spawned one. Aside from the practical benefits, it also provides unique scenery for both the town and the Dungeon. This setup is not recommended in multiplayer games, where a player in the Dungeon can potentially cause Dungeon enemies to spawn within range to teleport to or attack players in the town. Alternately, building the Cavern Pylon at the top of the Underground layer near the player's main base may be convenient, especially in multiplayer or when all players have some form of Magic Mirrors. This allows the player to Hallow their base area without reshuffling pylons, if desired. A Dungeon town can then use the pylon of whatever surface biome it is located in, often Forest, allowing quicker access to the Ocean but still quick access to the Dungeon. Another use for the Cavern Pylon is to put it in or near the Underworld, providing a viable alternative to a conventional Hellevator. The Universal Pylon uniquely works anywhere, and perhaps more usefully, does not require NPCs nearby. It can effectively be a free infinite-use Potion of Return for a player carrying it.
A third-party world-editing program can be used to circumvent the one-of-each-pylon rule. Additional pylons will function normally, as long as enough NPCs are present.
While pylons will still hover and rotate when the game is paused, they will only hover when the game is "tabbed out".

Pylons resemble the building of the same name constructed by the alien race protoss in the 1998 military science fiction real-time strategy game StarCraft. This is also referenced in the Universal Pylon 's tooltip. This is also referenced in the Universal Pylon 's tooltip.

The maximum price for a non-universal Pylon is 9 GC. This is because even though all non-universal pylons have a base value of 10 GC, due to the fact that the NPC that one is buying from must have at least a 90% price modifier from happiness for the NPC to sell the pylon, a pylon can never be bought for its base value. (Except in the Get fixed boi and Don't dig up seeds, where happiness is disabled.)
Pylons can be used when the game is paused if accessed through the minimap.
In the 2016 simulation role-playing video game Stardew Valley, a secret crossover item called the Far Away Stone appears identical to the Forest Pylon's crystal.
If used while moving on a flying mount, its pages spread out.
The right-click attack's whirlwind is great for clearing out plants and thorns in the evil biomes and Jungle. This can help with flower collection or finding Life Fruit.

Although it uses a lot of mana, the Tome of Infinite Wisdom is able to deal a lot of damage in small bursts with quick projectiles, making it useful for the Hardmode Jungle's high-health enemies, as well as against bosses.
The standard attack is highly effective against single enemies, while the tornado attack is effective for clearing out multiple targets.

This weapon can defeat The Destroyer with ease, even in Master Mode, making it a viable weapon choice. However, it requires that The Twins or Skeletron Prime be defeated first before it can be obtained.

The Tome of Infinite Wisdom is fantastic for grinding and shredding through the Old One's Army, allowing for easy farming of Defender Medals. Even during the post- Golem Tier 3 version, it can mow down waves of enemies, making Defender Medals easily obtainable even without defeating Betsy.
Like the other Old One's Army weapons, the Tome of Infinite Wisdom is a direct reference to the weapon of the same name in Dungeon Defenders 2, due to its implementation as part of a crossover event.

The Tome of Infinite Wisdom's right-click attack resembles the Apprentice 's second ability in Dungeon Defenders 2, Tornado. It also uses the same animation as both the Forbidden armor 's set bonus and the Sand Elemental 's "Ancient Storm" attack.

The Brand of the Inferno, the Sergeant United Shield, the Sky Dragon's Fury, and the Tome of Infinite Wisdom are the only weapons in Terraria to have two separate means of attack triggered by two different buttons.

"In all their infinite wisdom" is an expression that is used almost exclusively in a derogatory or sarcastic context to denote a particularly foolish decision made by someone or something. The Tome of Infinite Wisdom's tooltip of " Gotta wonder who stuck a tome of infinite wisdom on a stick..." is clearly a parody of this.
The Bewitching Table can be activated limitlessly with no cooldown period. It is never consumed, and all players may use it to give themselves the buff.
It counts as a valid flat-surface item for housing, but cannot be stood upon.
It counts as a table for crafting purposes, and can be placed on tables.
The Bewitching Table does not have an effect on sentry capacity. The latter can be increased by the War Table.

The staff on the buff icon could be a Raven Staff due to the apparent feather-like purple spikes on the top, however the shape of the shaft much more closely resembles the Slime Staff sprite with what appears to be purple slime dripping off of it. Due to the fact that the buff was added after both the Raven and Slime Staves ( 1.3.0.1 vs. 1.2.1 and 1.2 ) it is likely that the icon is supposed to depict an amalgamation of multiple summon weapons and was purposely meant to be left ambiguous.
The tooltip of the item is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for the Monster Meat in Don't Starve.
The tooltip of the buff is a reference to Woodie 's examination quote for the Pig in Don't Starve.
The Umbrella that the Pig Man carries while flying is ironically made of Pig Skin.
The Eye of Terror in Don't Starve will drop the Monster Meat, but the Eye of Cthulhu in Terraria will not.

Despite having lower damage than the Tempest Staff, the UFO is superior to Sharknados regarding attack speed and accuracy. However, it cannot attack in all directions like the Sharknados. This is usually a problem in tight spaces but not when in open spaces.
The prefix xeno- means foreign, different in origin, and often relates to aliens.
Prior to the 1.3.5 update, the Xeno Staff had an extremely low sell value, making reforging it to a desired modifier very cheap.
The Xeno Staff has the lowest item ID of all items added in the 1.3.0.1 update.

Mithril is a fictional metal in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle Earth writings, where it is a rare and high-quality material used for weapons and armor, and a shirt of mithril chainmail is a significant artifact in these writings. It has since become a widely used material in fantasy works, often under a minor alternate spelling such as mythril.

The zoom function of the Recon Scope only works with guns and tools that use bullets, Candy Corn, Gel, Stakes, or Solutions as ammo. [1] It neither works with other guns, e.g. the Dart Rifle (which uses Darts ), nor with other weapons with "gun" in their name, e.g. Piranha Gun or Rainbow Gun (neither of which use ammo). Thus, the Recon Scope does work with the Candy Corn Rifle, the Flamethrower, the Elf Melter, the Stake Launcher, the Clentaminator, and the Terraformer. The critical strike and damage bonuses are still applied to all ranged weapons. Thus, the Recon Scope does work with the Candy Corn Rifle, the Flamethrower, the Elf Melter, the Stake Launcher, the Clentaminator, and the Terraformer. The critical strike and damage bonuses are still applied to all ranged weapons.

The zoom effect is identical to that of the Binoculars or the Sniper Rifle, but the Recon Scope can be used simultaneously with any applicable gun. The Recon Scope's zoom slightly stacks with that of the Sniper Rifle. [2] The Recon Scope's zoom slightly stacks with that of the Sniper Rifle. [2]
The bonus damage and critical strike chance can stack with the ones from the Sniper Scope, for a total of 20% ranged damage and 20% critical strike chance.
The tooltip is a reference to a voice command of the same name from the first-person shooter series Counter-Strike, a common in-joke through the community.
Oddly, both ingredients to the Recon Scope have a higher rarity than the Recon Scope itself. While it has a rarity of 05*, the Putrid Scent is 06*, and the Sniper Scope is 07*.

Fire Imps require a target space of at least four vertical air spaces and three horizontal air spaces to teleport into a location. Despite this, they only need three vertical air spaces and two horizontal ones to spawn.
Fire Imps account for around 2/33rds of enemy spawns (6.09%) [1].

In for the worthy, Fire Imps will spawn near the closest player while the Wall of Flesh is alive, and get more HP and defense; their fireballs also move faster and become unbreakable. This is limited to a total of 4 imps, averages 1 spawn per 3 seconds, and they will only spawn on solid, unsloped blocks.
The Fire Imp can be stunlocked with many different minions, as their repeated attacks prevent it from firing.
Farming an Obsidian Rose from a Imp Statue is faster than farming one from natural spawns, and this also provides plenty of banners.

The Fire Imps dropping the Plumber's Hat may be a reference to Mario 's ability to shoot fireballs when getting a Fire Flower power-up, similar to the Burning Spheres that Fire Imps shoot. This is further supported by the Obsidian Rose that they drop, which references the Fire Flower power-up.
Fire Imps could originally drop a Green Cap in the Mobile version. Since an unknown update, this is no longer the case.

This item can be a viable alternative to wings until post- Golem, when enemies become significantly harder to reach or avoid. This can be made even more effective with Spectre Boots (or their upgrades) and/or Amphibian Boots. The former gives an extra flight bonus, and the latter grants faster and higher jumps, while both grant higher running speed. In Expert mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Soaring Insignia (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can further improve the mobility of this item by increasing movement acceleration and jump speed. This can be made even more effective with Spectre Boots (or their upgrades) and/or Amphibian Boots. The former gives an extra flight bonus, and the latter grants faster and higher jumps, while both grant higher running speed. In Expert mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Soaring Insignia (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can further improve the mobility of this item by increasing movement acceleration and jump speed.

The extra jumps from the Bundle of Balloons allow for much faster turning and higher vertical acceleration than most early wings at the start of each jump. This can be used to quickly reach top speed or dodge faster ranged attacks.

The key item for crafting this is the relatively rare Sandstorm in a Bottle, which is only available from a Pyramid or Oasis Crates in pre-Hardmode, and Pyramids might not generate in all worlds. The other two extra jump bottles are far more common; the Cloud in a Bottle appears frequently in underground Chests, and both the Blizzard in a Bottle and the Shiny Red Balloons can be obtained by fishing for biome crates if necessary. Entering Hardmode, the Sandstorm in a Bottle can be crafted from Forbidden Fragments, making it much more accessible. The Sandstorm in a Bottle can also be purchased from the Princess in a Desert in Celebrationmk10 worlds. Entering Hardmode, the Sandstorm in a Bottle can be crafted from Forbidden Fragments, making it much more accessible. The Sandstorm in a Bottle can also be purchased from the Princess in a Desert in Celebrationmk10 worlds.
When using a non-flying mount, like a Unicorn or Wolf, the extra jumps can be more useful than wings.
The Frog Leg boosts the effectiveness of the Bundle of Balloons by providing a significant increase to jump height and speed.
The Bundle of Horseshoe Balloons is one of the only pre-Hardmode items that, with a high level modifier, can attain 10* rarity.

Along with the Sniper Rifle, it has the highest ranged velocity in the game. However, the Sniper Rifle automatically converts Musket Balls and Tungsten Bullets (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) into High Velocity Bullets when fired, meaning High Velocity Bullets must be used with the Revolver to truly match the Sniper Rifle's ranged velocity.

The Revolver is one of the 11 guns in Terraria based on a real gun, the others being the Chain Gun, Flintlock Pistol, Handgun, Musket, Quad-Barrel Shotgun (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Red Ryder (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions), Shotgun, Sniper Rifle, Tactical Shotgun, and Uzi.

If other NPCs are waiting to move in, they may move into a Glowing Mushroom biome home before the Truffle can. When attempting to spawn the Truffle, try to make sure enough houses exist for other NPCs that have not yet spawned.
Having too much Corruption or Crimson beneath the house may invalidate the housing.

For the Truffle to move in, the house must be in a Glowing Mushroom biome in the Surface or Space layers. In don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) seeds, the Truffle's housing requirements are unchanged; a valid house must be in the true Surface or Space layers, not the false "surface" in the Cavern layer. In don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) seeds, the Truffle's housing requirements are unchanged; a valid house must be in the true Surface or Space layers, not the false "surface" in the Cavern layer.

Once the Truffle moves in, he can be relocated to a different house, as long as the new house is also in a Glowing Mushroom biome. Trying to move him to an invalid house will result in the status message " This housing does not meet the requirements for a Truffle".

The Truffle can stay in a house after the Glowing Mushroom biome is destroyed. This can be exploited by creating a Glowing Mushroom biome near all of the other houses and NPCs, having him move in, then destroying the corresponding Glowing Mushroom biome blocks, therefore having all of the NPCs in one place outside of a Glowing Mushroom biome. If the Truffle dies, this must be redone.
The Truffle is male and has a chance to be teleported by a King Statue.

Despite his requirement to live in a Glowing Mushroom biome, the Truffle can sell other pylons (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) due to hybrid biomes. The exception to this are the Forest and Cavern Pylons, which are mutually exclusive and only available when not within one of the other biomes.

Almost all of the Truffle's names are types of mushrooms or toadstools or named after parts of one. Agaric refers to a type of fruiting body of a mushroom, characterized by a rounded cap, cylindrical stalk, and lamellae (or gills) within the cap's underside. Amanita and Muscaria refers to the scientific name for the Amanita muscaria, a mushroom species which the Truffle's Shimmered form resembles. Chanterelle refers to several species of edible, warm-colored mushrooms, known for having a mild, peppery taste. Cremini is the browned, immature stage of the portobello mushroom widely cultivated in Eurasia and North America. Enoki is a thin, white mushroom species native to East Asia and commonly used in Japanese and Chinese cuisine. Maitake is a mushroom species that grows at the base of trees and is native to China, North America, and Europe. Morels are a genus of edible fungi characterized by cone-shaped caps with a honeycomb-like appearance. Porcini is an edible mushroom cultivated throughout the Northern Hemisphere known for its versatility in cooking. Reishi is a fan-shaped reddish fungus native to East Asia that grows at the base of trees. Shiitake is an edible brownish mushroom native to East Asia but is cultivated and consumed globally. Shimeji refers to a popular group of edible mushrooms native to East Asia that includes shiitake and enoki mushrooms, among others. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The name Leinspores is a pun on Leinfors, a former QA team member at Re-Logic, and spores, a particle that fungi use for reproduction.
The Truffle's eyes and the top of his head glow in the dark.

The Truffle is often confused as having one eye, despite him having two eyes on the "It Can Talk?!" and "Real Estate Agent" achievement icons, as well as developer confirmation [2]. This confusion stems from the Terraria Jazwares figurine toys.
The Truffle's defensive weapon, the mushroom spores, has the highest DPS of any NPC.
He is the only NPC who sways their arms side to side while walking, rather than keeping them bent the way that the other NPCs do.
He is the only NPC that requires a specific biome to live in.
The quote " You haven't seen any pigs around here have you? My brother lost his leg to one. " is a reference to the historical use of pigs to locate truffles.

The quote " As if living underground wasn't bad enough, jerks like you come in while I'm sleeping and steal my children. " is a reference to players exploring Glowing Mushroom biomes and collecting Glowing Mushrooms.
The quote " I don't know the 'Truffle Shuffle,' so stop asking! " is a reference to the 1985 American adventure comedy movie The Goonies.
The quote " I tried to lick myself the other day to see what the big deal was, everything started glowing blue. " references the use of magic mushrooms as a recreational drug.

The quote " Everyone in this town feels a bit off. I woke up to the clothier chewing on my foot last night. " implies the Clothier wants to eat the Truffle, further supported by " <Name of Clothier> has tried to eat me so many times. I swear, one time they weren't even human! I, obviously, dislike it. " This also hints at the Truffle's awareness of the Clothier's former possession by Skeletron. This also hints at the Truffle's awareness of the Clothier's former possession by Skeletron.
The Truffle's Shimmered form makes him look like the Mushrooms found on the surface.

The Giant Shelly is very similar to the Giant Tortoise and Ice Tortoise. The cooldown between its spin attacks is 6.67 seconds by default. It is reset if the Giant Shelly takes damage. [1] If the Giant Shelly is more than 12.5 tiles away from the player and has an unobstructed line of sight to them, the cooldown is reduced to 2.22 seconds. If it is more than 37.5 tiles away, and has an unobstructed line of sight or is no more than 12.5 tiles above them, it is further reduced to 1.33 seconds. If the Giant Shelly is more than 12.5 tiles away from the player and has an unobstructed line of sight to them, the cooldown is reduced to 2.22 seconds. If it is more than 37.5 tiles away, and has an unobstructed line of sight or is no more than 12.5 tiles above them, it is further reduced to 1.33 seconds.

Each spin attack consists of one second of retracting into the shell, spinning for 1.5 seconds, then decelerating until coming to a stop on a solid surface, and coming out of the shell for one second again. Attacking a Giant Shelly at any time cancels the spin attack. [1]
When in contact with water when ending a spin attack, the Giant Shelly will use the spin attack again immediately.

Although the trajectory of the Giant Shelly during its spin attack is determined the moment it retracts into its shell and is based on the player's position at that time, the enemy does recognize the player's current position, and will slow down very quickly and attempt to drop down as soon as it is above the player.
Any weapon with a high rate of attack is effective, as it prevents the Giant Shelly from using its spin attack.
Melee weapons are useful as long as the player stays close to the Giant Shelly. Even when not attacking continuously, the spin attack cooldown is much higher at close range.
Giant Shellies cannot drop through platforms. Setting up several rows of long platforms significantly reduces the danger of spin attacks.
The Bestiary entry for the Giant Shelly: " To overcome their slow speed, shellies have developed the ability to hide inside their spiked shell and hurl themselves at their foes. "
This item is only obtainable after defeating Skeletron, as Bones, only dropped by Dungeon enemies, are required to craft the Teapot.

The only root ingredient needed to craft Teacups is sand, provided all the other crafting stations to make Bottled Water (as well as the Teapot itself) are available. This makes it one of the most consistently and easily obtainable food items. However, it also has a rather short buff duration of only 5 minutes, making frequent uses necessary.
They shoot at quite a slow pace, and also with poor accuracy. An example of this is when they are in front of the player, the bullets often hit the ground.
Their name Deadeye has a dual meaning, referring both to the term deadeye, or marksman, and to the fact that they have a "dead" eye and wear an eye patch. This is reflected in their Bestiary entry.
Since the Pirate Deadeye appears to have an eye patch while pointing either direction, he has eye patches on both eyes and is therefore blind.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) In the get fixed boi secret world seed, the Mechanical Eye is not consumable and is instead a crafting material for the Ocram's Razor, an item used to summon Mechdusa.
Like other mechanical boss-summoning items, the Mechanical Eye can be brought to pre-Hardmode worlds and will successfully summon The Twins there.
As with several items, the Mechanical Eye has multiple crafting recipes (two in total) due to some items in the recipe allowing substitutes.
The Mechanical Eye is the only mechanical item with no visible winder.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Briefly after being fired, the skulls will partially turn towards the closest player (including the caster), regardless of the presence of enemies and whether or not PvP is enabled. They will not turn if the nearest player is directly behind them. They also turn around if the caster presses any movement keys.
Due to its high damage and piercing ability, the Book of Skulls remains a viable weapon through early Hardmode.
The skulls tend to hit the same enemy multiple times, giving it both good crowd control and single target damage.
A leprechaun is a magical creature resembling a dwarf. They appear in Irish folklore and are said to hoard gold in pots, spend their time making shoes, and possess the power to make wishes come true.
If the Leprechaun Shirt is combined with a Silver Dye, the character will somewhat appear to have a white beard.
The tooltips of the Leprechaun set items are a reference to the 2006 Crichton Leprechaun, a supposed sighting of a leprechaun in a tree in Crichton (Mobile, Alabama). [1]
Extra jumps can be used shortly before hitting the ground to reset fall damage.

The maximum total jump reach from a sextuple jump (obtainable e.g. by equipping a Bundle of Balloons, a Fart in a Balloon, and a Sharkron Balloon (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) is 92.35 tiles (+1372.89%). This can be further increased by equipping some of the boosting accessories : With the Soaring Insignia (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), a Frog Leg, and the Moon Lord Legs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the maximum total jump reach from a sextuple jump would be 238.98 tiles (+3711.48%).
When ringing the Bell, players can also walk backwards.
The Bell and the Whoopie Cushion have similar effects, although the Whoopie Cushion cannot change pitch.
The tooltip is a reference to Walani 's examination quote for the Bat Bat in Don't Starve: Shipwrecked.
While the Bat Bat was updated in 1.4.3.2 to be guaranteed to heal the user on every hit, the description still implies that the heal is not guaranteed.
If the player has an active debuff and is at full health, the heal option will also be available.
If planning on healing and drinking Ale, make sure to drink the Ale after healing, as Tipsy is technically a debuff and will be cured by the Nurse.
The Nurse can survive drowning forever due to the fact that she heals herself.
The Nurse cannot remove Potion Sickness, Water Candle, and Creative Shock, nor does she charge extra for them.
The Nurse cannot heal herself if the player is talking to her.
If a healing syringe thrown by the Nurse does not hit her target, it will begin homing in on them.

The Nurse can be used as a "healing station" when at low health during a boss fight, by teleporting to the spawn point (using a Magic/Ice Mirror or one of its upgrades) where the Nurse is present. Autopause can be used to grant more time. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version this trick is harder to use than on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, as Autopause does not affect NPC dialog menus. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version this trick is harder to use than on the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, as Autopause does not affect NPC dialog menus.

There appears to be conflict between the Nurse and the Mechanic during a Blood Moon. During this time, the Merchant has a chance of saying, " Oh, great. I can hear <name of Mechanic> and <name of Nurse> arguing from here. "

The Arms Dealer seemingly has romantic interest in her according to his quotes when the Nurse is present. This is also reflected in the Nurse's quote " Hey, has <name of Arms Dealer> mentioned needing to go to the doctor for any reason? Just wondering. " The Nurse, through other NPC dialogue, is implied to already be in a romantic relationship with the Arms Dealer as noted by the Stylist in her quote, " Mhmm, I heard from <name of Party Girl> that <name of Mechanic>'s friend <name of Nurse> spent her boyfriend's last paycheck on shoes. "
The Nurse is depicted in a painting called "Nurse Lisa", a reference to the famous portrait painting Mona Lisa by the Italian Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) When talking to the Nurse while in a crowded area, she will say, " Hey, I dislike the lack of social distancing here. " This is a reference to the COVID-19 pandemic that was ongoing at the time of Journey's End 's launch, when the quote was introduced, and the " social distancing " practice people were encouraged to follow by staying six feet or two meters away from one another in public.

During a Party (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), when the Nurse dons a party hat, her hairstyle is different. She wears it down instead of up in a ponytail: This makes sense as wearing a party hat while having hair in a ponytail would be cumbersome.

The Nurse's quote, " I don't give happy endings. " is a reference to happy endings, the practice of masseuses offering sexual favors to their clients at the end of a massage for additional payment. The Nurse will not use this quote if the Blood and Gore setting is turned off. [3] The Nurse will not use this quote if the Blood and Gore setting is turned off. [3]

Although the Zoologist is registered as hated by the Nurse, she does not seem to actually hate her. The dialogue indicates that the Nurse hates the Zoologist's unique anatomy more than the Zoologist herself: " Oh, I hate treating <name of Zoologist>, so difficult! " However, such a phrase is also often used to describe someone who is being difficult, such as refusing to be still while being given a shot. However, such a phrase is also often used to describe someone who is being difficult, such as refusing to be still while being given a shot.

Her quote " I need to have a serious talk with <name of Guide>. How many times a week can you come in with severe lava burns? " most likely refers to the Guide Voodoo Doll being sacrificed in lava or being carried around by Voodoo Demons near pools of lava in the Underworld.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Her interaction phrase " The monsters of <world name> have slain you <number of non-PvP deaths> times already? I wonder which one picked up your banner... ", said when the player was slain between 25 and 99 times inclusive, refers to the fact that most enemies can drop a banner if slain every 50th time, and a few rarer ones drop banners if slain every 25th time.
The tooltip is a play on the phrase "There's nothing more American than apple pie."
Even though apples also exist in Terraria, the Apple Pie cannot be crafted from them.

This item is a reference to Terraria Twitch streamer Badger. The requirement of defeating the Eye of Cthulhu and Wall of Flesh on the same day to obtain the item is a reference to his speedruns, where doing so is an expected strategy.

The first part of the tooltip, " You seem to have a problem with your green screen", is in reference to how the green part of Badger's iconic hat is invisible during his streams due to a green screen. While equipped, the green part of the hat may turn invisible at random times. While equipped, the green part of the hat may turn invisible at random times.
The second part of the tooltip, "'Great for impersonating streamers!'", is both a reference to Badger and to developer items, whose tooltips are similar ( " 'Great for impersonating devs!' " ).
Equipping the hat in the armor slot and the vanity slot at the same time will stack them, creating a taller hat (this behavior is similar to Empty Buckets ).
The hat wiggles back and forth while the player walks.
The hat will appear above the player's character's icon on the map.
The Sonar Potion will detect if a Blood Moon enemy is about to be hooked.
Using the Chum Caster will greatly increase the chances of hooking Blood Moon enemies.

As with any multi-segmented enemy, piercing and explosive weapons can strike multiple segments at once, dealing several times their normal damage. Using a bow or repeater with Jester's or Holy Arrows is a good way to kill the Blood Eel. Thrown flails, such as the Sunfury or the Dao of Pow, can hit many segments at once dealing much more damage than normal. Other useful items for killing Blood Eels and other worms are the Shotgun (with Explosive Bullets ), the Nimbus Rod, the Crystal Vile Shard, and the Medusa Head. The Life Drain, obtained from Crimson Mimics, is also an extremely powerful choice, as it can suck life out of many segments at once. Using a bow or repeater with Jester's or Holy Arrows is a good way to kill the Blood Eel. Thrown flails, such as the Sunfury or the Dao of Pow, can hit many segments at once dealing much more damage than normal. Other useful items for killing Blood Eels and other worms are the Shotgun (with Explosive Bullets ), the Nimbus Rod, the Crystal Vile Shard, and the Medusa Head. The Life Drain, obtained from Crimson Mimics, is also an extremely powerful choice, as it can suck life out of many segments at once.

The head of the Blood Eel has lower defense than its tail or body segments, making it more vulnerable to damage as it charges the player. However, the head also deals twice the damage as the rest of the body on contact, making it risky to face the Blood Eel head on.
The Blood Eel can be easily dodged using the Shield of Cthulhu. As the Eel comes in to attack, perform a dash away from or under the Eel to avoid being hit.
The Bestiary entry for the Blood Eel: " A large, worm-like demon, dripping with blood - both its own, and its victim's. It's a bloody nightmare of a fiend! "

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain this item. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ).

Although the Princess is available in pre-Hardmode in Celebrationmk10 worlds, she will only drop the Resonance Scepter after the Wall of Flesh has been defeated. However, this does make it available prior to defeating Plantera, unlike all other worlds.
The Resonance Scepter is a powerful magic weapon, but it requires every NPC to be present in the world as it is the requirement for the Princess to spawn.
The Princess uses the same attack when threatened by enemies, although the scepter itself is not shown.

The Resonance Scepter can be considered an indirect upgrade to the Life Drain as it is nearly functionally identical, has higher stats, and instantaneously reaches the location the player aims at. The difference is that the Resonance Scepter's projectile will exist for a period of time when canceled, while the Life Drain's will disappear immediately.

The Sickle will harvest Hay from tall grass and flowers growing on pure, Jungle, Corrupt, Crimson, or Hallowed grass. Note that tall plants will yield more than other plants: short plants yield 1 or 2 Hay while tall plants yield 2 to 4 Hay. [1] Note that tall plants will yield more than other plants: short plants yield 1 or 2 Hay while tall plants yield 2 to 4 Hay. [1]

The Sickle facilitates obtaining an infinite source of building material, since tall grass always regrows. Massive amounts of Hay can be created by using the Flower Boots on a patch of grass and swinging the Sickle. The Flower Boots will regrow tall grass as soon as the Sickle cuts it down. Massive amounts of Hay can be created by using the Flower Boots on a patch of grass and swinging the Sickle. The Flower Boots will regrow tall grass as soon as the Sickle cuts it down.
Using the Sickle to cut grass does not prevent the player from obtaining seeds for the Blowpipe.
Ice Elementals can only hover about eight blocks off the ground.
Both the Ice Elementals and their projectiles emit a high amount of light.
Frost Blasts cannot be destroyed by hitting them, unlike many other orb projectiles.
Frost Blasts cannot travel through walls.
Ice Elementals ignore the Shroomite / Vortex armor 's set bonus and they can still fire at stealthly/invisible players.
Although Ice Elementals have a high range, their projectiles travel slowly enough to dodge them.

Elementals are magical entities who embody or personify a force of nature. Historically, elementals personify one of the four classical elements : earth, water, air, or fire (sometimes plants, and later included aether). In the fantasy role-playing game Dungeon & Dragons, elementals which are fusions and other unconventional elementals have been introduced.

Unlike most ice-themed enemies, the Ice Elemental can neither inflict the Chilled or Frozen debuffs. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) They instead inflict the Frostburn debuff, and are the only enemy in the game able to do so. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) They instead inflict the Frostburn debuff, and are the only enemy in the game able to do so.
Multiple statues will not stack their effects. Two Bast Statues in a player's vicinity will still only grant +5 defense.
Bastet or Bast was the Egyptian goddess of protection against disease and evil spirits, cats, perfume, ointments, fertility, pregnancy, children, music, the arts, and warfare.
The buff name "The Bast Defense" is a pun on the phrase " the best defense is a good offense ", a proverb commonly used as the prime strategic principle of war.
A blood orange is an orange cultivar that has a dark, blood-like flesh color.

Using Fertilizer in conjunction with the Axe of Regrowth, with its ability to replant trees as saplings upon cutting them down, allows the player to gather wood quickly and effectively. Keep in mind, however, that Fertilizer can be fairly expensive to mass-produce, due to the tedium of producing Poo and the non-renewability of Ash Blocks. Keep in mind, however, that Fertilizer can be fairly expensive to mass-produce, due to the tedium of producing Poo and the non-renewability of Ash Blocks.
As it is only fired from enemies that are native to the Corruption, one will not see Vile Spit in a Crimson world, unless an artificial Corruption biome is created.
Prior to the 1.2 update, Vile Spit would convert any blocks it came in contact with to their Corrupt counterparts.
Internally, Vile Spit is an NPC instead of a projectile. The reason for this is its ability to be destroyed.
Due to the Stardust armor increasing all summon damage by 66%, including the damage of the Stardust Guardian, its base damage is about ~50.
The Stardust Guardian attacks about once every 5 ticks and will attack a target endlessly until the target dies or is out of range.
No blocks will halt the Guardian's attack on an enemy, and it will move freely to the enemy to continue the attack if it is within range.
Moving too far from the Stardust Guardian while it is attacking will cause it to return to the player as the enemies are no longer within its range.
The Stardust Guardian can be dyed via the pet slot in the player's equipment menu.

Like all armors made from Luminite, equipping Stardust armor makes the player give off light, in this case white. Unlike other Luminite sets, equipping just one piece of the set gives off the full amount of light. Light given out from the armor does not stack with Shine Potion, and the brightness is exactly the same as Shine Potion. Light given out from the armor does not stack with Shine Potion, and the brightness is exactly the same as Shine Potion.
Using Stardust armor and accessories and buffs, it is possible to have 11 minions, not counting the Stardust Guardian.

While it is a potent offensive set, Stardust armor has relatively low defense, and although its ability to attack any enemies that come within a far distance of the player compensates somewhat, the Stardust Guardian does not protect the user against projectiles which leaves them vulnerable. The Valhalla Knight's Breastplate can be substituted into the set to provide much greater survivability, sacrificing the Guardian, and two minion slots. It may be worth it to wear the full Valhalla Knight armor instead of the Stardust armor, as it has much more defense, health regeneration, and 2 extra sentries at the cost of 5 minions, the Guardian, 6% summon damage, and 30% additional whip range.

The Stardust Guardian can move through blocks to attack enemies regardless of whether or not it has targeted the player. This can be exploited by walling oneself in, allowing the Guardian to take care of enemies (this method may be futile to some enemies, such as the Cursed Skull ).
