The Stardust Guardian is affected by whips, including summon tag damage and critical strike chance, and debuffs which take effect when the afflicted target is hit by a minion.
Stardust armor has the lowest defense of the four Luminite armors.
The Stardust Helmet is the only piece of non- Tavernkeep armor that increases sentry slots.

The Stardust Guardian was originally created as a reference to Algalon the Observer from the massively multiplayer online role-playing game World of Warcraft. [1] However, due to the community's enthusiasm in comparing the Stardust Guardian to Star Platinum from Stardust Crusaders, the third story arc of the Japanese manga series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, lead programmer Yoraiz0r has acknowledged the resemblance and said the armor can be a reference. The similarities have become more apparent with the rework of the Star Guardian's attack style in 1.4.0.1 : Its flurry of punches resembles Star Platinum's primary method of attack, " Ora Ora Rush ".
The Code 1 is the strongest pre- Skeletron and pre- Queen Bee yoyo.

The name Code 1 comes from one of the many different yoyos sold by One Drop. Their logo is the symbol listed at the bottom of the item tooltips. CODE1 stands for "Community/One Drop Experiment #1". Its design was created by the YoYoNation community. CODE1 stands for "Community/One Drop Experiment #1". Its design was created by the YoYoNation community.

If the game is in full-screen mode, the title message can generally still be seen by switching to another window to display the task bar, then hovering over Terraria's task bar icon to display a window preview.

In 1.4, the message "Also try Edge of Space!" was replaced with "Also try Breath of the Wild!". This may have been because in the years since 1.3.0.1's release in 2015, Edge of Space was perceived by many players to have been abandoned unfinished by its developers, leading to it attaining a "Mostly Negative" rating on Steam.
The Guide on the Nintendo 3DS version mentions this event, though it was not implemented.

The closer the cursor is to the bottom of the screen, the more accurate the arrows are, and the closer it is to the top, the less accurate. This allows focusing down a strong enemy or cluster of enemies, or shooting arrows to hit more spread-out enemies.
If fired at the top of the map, the bow will only shoot one arrow at a time.

The Meteor Staff can be considered a magic counterpart to the Daedalus Stormbow. The spawned meteors produce an explosion upon impact, similarly to Hellfire Arrows. The lack of universality that comes with Stormbow’s ability to fire any type of arrow is offset by the Staff being easier to obtain, as it is crafted from Meteorite Bars and regular Hallow enemy drops instead of being dropped by Hallowed Mimics.
On the Console version, the bow will point upwards instead of towards the cursor.
When fired with Holy Arrows, a maximum of nine projectiles can be fired while only consuming a single arrow.

Arrows shot with the Daedalus Stormbow have a tendency to impact and be blocked by terrain or other objects above the target (much like the Starfury ). It is therefore best used in wide open areas, especially at the surface, rather than in confined areas.
The Daedalus Stormbow synergizes well with Unholy Arrows or Jester's Arrows against The Destroyer, and Ichor Arrows against The Twins and Skeletron Prime.
Due to the fact that the player can fire at enemies from a safe enclosed area, it is a very useful weapon.
The Magic Quiver 's increase in velocity causes arrows from this weapon to fall faster, but note that this will not work with Jester's Arrows, Ichor Arrows, and Venom Arrows.

In Greek mythology, Daedalus was a skillful craftsman and artist and was seen as a symbol of wisdom, knowledge, and power. He invented and built the Labyrinth for King Minos of Crete, but shortly after finishing it, Minos had Daedalus imprisoned within the Labyrinth. He and his son, Icarus, devised a plan to escape by using wings made of wax that Daedalus had invented. They escaped, but Icarus did not heed his father's warnings and flew too close to the sun. The wax melted and Icarus fell to his death. The wings that Daedalus crafted were made of feathers and curved to look like those of a bird. Fittingly, the Daedalus Stormbow's limbs appear as a pair of feathery wings. The wings that Daedalus crafted were made of feathers and curved to look like those of a bird. Fittingly, the Daedalus Stormbow's limbs appear as a pair of feathery wings.
While the Imbuing Station is available for purchase pre- Hardmode, most flasks require Hardmode ingredients. Only the Flask of Poison, Flask of Party, and Flask of Fire are available pre-Hardmode.
The Imbuing Station is useful to both melee and summon players (although less so to summon players), as its Flasks affect all melee weapons, as well as whips.
Malaise means "a general feeling of discomfort, illness, or uneasiness whose exact cause is difficult to identify", fitting with the general theme of disease in the Corruption.

In order to craft one Ocram's Razor from scratch, the player would need to obtain: 15 Iron / Lead Bars 9 Souls of Light 9 Souls of Night 6 Rotten Chunks / Vertebrae 3 Lenses 30 Bones 15 Iron / Lead Bars 9 Souls of Light 9 Souls of Night 6 Rotten Chunks / Vertebrae 3 Lenses 30 Bones

This item's name is a reference to Ocram, a boss exclusive to the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version of Terraria, and Occam's razor, a problem-solving principle which can be interpreted as "entities should not be multiplied beyond necessity," or more simply, "The simplest answer to a question is the most likely to be correct."

The chest-like appearance of the Ocram's Razor could also be a reference to Pandora's box, an artifact in ancient Greek mythology that unleashed curses upon the world when its owner, Pandora, opened it out of curiosity, leaving behind only the spirit of Hope.

Ocram's Razor is one of only two boss-summoning items that use other boss-summoning items in its recipe. Incidentally, the Suspicious Looking Skull, which is exclusive to the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, also requires other boss-summoning items, and is used to summon Ocram, the boss being referenced in this item. Incidentally, the Suspicious Looking Skull, which is exclusive to the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, also requires other boss-summoning items, and is used to summon Ocram, the boss being referenced in this item.

Because it is only available in a Get fixed boi world, in which the Clentaminator and all Solutions are unavailable, this item, as well as the Waffle's Iron, Mechdusa's exclusive drop, makes it impossible to obtain every item without switching between worlds.
The interval for the Christmas Tree Sword to launch the star-shaped ornament is 0.38 seconds, which can only be affected by the weapon's modifier.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) An effective strategy for using the Christmas Tree Sword during events is to use flasks and rain down ornament projectiles upon groups of enemies from above using wings or other movement accessories.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Since most of Christmas Tree Sword's damage comes from the projectiles, Ichor or Betsy's Wrath debuffs can increase its DPS.
Prior to 1.3.5 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), this item was also referred to as Christmas Sword in the source code.
Selling the Frozen Wings instead of the individual components will be more profitable. The wings sell for 8 GC, whereas the components sell for a collective 2 GC 90 SC.

The Power Cell can be obtained in pre-Hardmode if a Lihzahrd Chest is near the Lihzahrd Door or is at the center of the bottom of the Jungle Temple. Lihzahrds can also sometimes spawn in the entrance if it is long enough and can be farmed for Power Cells. Lihzahrds can also sometimes spawn in the entrance if it is long enough and can be farmed for Power Cells.

With extra Temple Keys and a Picksaw or higher, Power Cells can be farmed by generating new worlds and gathering the cells guaranteed to be in their Jungle Temples' Lihzahrd Chests, rather than having to kill Lihzahrds and Flying Snakes hoping for drops. Since Golem can only be summoned in a world where Plantera has been defeated, Power Cells gathered this way will need to be used in the original world, where it has been defeated. However, it is likely that players well versed with auto-farms would find building a small farm in a central location of the temple more efficient.
The Power Cell is the only item in the game whose midpoint is lower than that of the Copper Coin. Since its rarity is only 00*, it will be destroyed by any lava deep enough to destroy Copper Coins.
The pattern it displays connects with Luminite Brick Walls.
Due to the large size of the Katana, and the fact that it autoswings, it is great for clearing out hordes of flying enemies by knocking them back before they strike.

In Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Katana receives the following changes: Switched place with Keybrand. As a result, it is dropped by the Rusty, Hell, and Blue Armored Bones instead of sold by the Traveling Merchant. Damage increased from 18 to 150. Use time decreased from 20 to 15. Critical strike chance increased from 19% to 33%. Value increased from 10 GC to 20 GC. Switched place with Keybrand. As a result, it is dropped by the Rusty, Hell, and Blue Armored Bones instead of sold by the Traveling Merchant. Damage increased from 18 to 150. Use time decreased from 20 to 15. Critical strike chance increased from 19% to 33%. Value increased from 10 GC to 20 GC.

The katana is a type of Japanese sword, renowned for its superb craftsmanship, which was developed as a result of the poor quality of the iron that medieval Japanese swordsmiths had access to and therefore still achieving "good" sharpness. The word katana is usually written as kanji "刀", but Spike Chunsoft opted to translate it as the katakana name "カタナ" in the Japanese Console version. This decision was likely made because " 刀 " can also mean sword or bladed edge (including, for instance, daggers or even chisels) – not just the historically well-known katana. The word katana is usually written as kanji "刀", but Spike Chunsoft opted to translate it as the katakana name "カタナ" in the Japanese Console version. This decision was likely made because " 刀 " can also mean sword or bladed edge (including, for instance, daggers or even chisels) – not just the historically well-known katana.
See below for the exact chances and amounts of coins dropped by each kind of Coin Stash, and respective average coin value. Each row of the table is treated as an individual event. [1]
The Seaside Crate can be obtained even if the Ocean biome is Corrupted / Crimson or Hallowed.
The crate resembles a washed up nautilus shell with coral growing on the corners.

The counterweights will be a random color every throw, so the use of a different color of Counterweight does not matter when crafting the Yoyo Bag. Both counterweights can be changed to a preferred color by equipping the preferred color below the Yoyo Bag. Both counterweights can be changed to a preferred color by equipping the preferred color below the Yoyo Bag.

The crafting recipe requires the specific use of a White String. Dyed strings cannot be used to complete the recipe. It is possible, however, to still use any preferred color of string with the Yoyo Bag by equipping the desired color of dyed string in a vanity accessory slot. It is possible, however, to still use any preferred color of string with the Yoyo Bag by equipping the desired color of dyed string in a vanity accessory slot.
The Yoyo Bag does not stack with the Yoyo Glove, any Counterweight, or any String.
When used with the Terrarian, the second yoyo will also shoot out homing projectiles.
Only one Yoyo is needed to be equipped to get the "double Yoyo" effect, the second Yoyo will spawn after the first Yoyo strikes an enemy.
The Yoyo Bag is only available in Hardmode, as the Skeleton Merchant will only sell the Yoyo Glove during Hardmode.

The damage increase from counterweights and the second Yoyo is considerable, especially against multi-segmented enemies like the Destroyer. DPS can easily be tripled thanks to the additional damage sources to hit multiple targets. There will be no big increase of damage against single targets, just an increase in usability thanks to the longer range, more opportunities to hit targets, and defensive layer from the counterweights.
The Rock Golem can only spawn on Stone Blocks. It will never spawn in the Ice biome, even if there are Stone Blocks present. [2]

The Rock Golem and Gem trees are the only renewable sources of Stone Blocks in a world. One may also get a renewable amount of stone by shimmering Furnaces bought from the Merchant when he is in the Jungle. One may also get a renewable amount of stone by shimmering Furnaces bought from the Merchant when he is in the Jungle.

In Jewish folklore, a golem ( /ˈɡoʊləm/, GOH-ləm ; Hebrew: גולם‎) is an animated anthropomorphic being that is created entirely from inanimate matter (usually clay or mud). The word was used to mean an amorphous, unformed material in Psalms and medieval writing.
Although they spawn during the Blood Moon event, they cannot drop Bloody Tears.

Vicious Bunnies can be farmed for the Bunny Hood, Crimson Bunny Kite, and Vicious Bunny Banner using a Bunny Statue, a Pressure Plate, Vicious Powder, and Wire. However, statue-spawned Vicious Bunnies do not drop coins.
On the world creation menu, the Vicious Bunny is used as the icon for Master Mode.
Despite its name being the Vicious Bunny, the kite based on and dropped by it is called the Crimson Bunny Kite. The Corrupt Bunny Kite, on the other hand, is correctly named.
Star anise is a spice that originated in Asia, and is popular in Europe. It is commonly used in winter seasonal recipes.

Grass Wall, Flower Wall and Jungle Wall can be used to make Corrupt Grass Wall, Crimson Grass Wall, and Hallowed Grass Wall by using Purple, Red, and Blue Solution, respectively. All three types can be undone with Green Solution, though this will always yield a Grass Wall (even if the original wall was a Flower or Jungle Wall).

Frankenstein is a reference to the 1931 science fiction horror film Frankenstein. This follows the theme of Solar Eclipse Enemies as classic horror film icons. [1] Like most pop culture references, Re-Logic propagates the common misconception that Frankenstein is the name of the monster, whereas, in reality, it is the name of the scientist who created the unnamed monster, Victor Frankenstein.
This item increases the player's base speed from 15 mph to 30 mph.
Sailfish Boots can be equipped with the Hermes Boots or Flurry Boots, but these effects do not stack.
Be careful not to let Mothron lay its eggs on a single block in the air as sometimes it can despawn without dropping anything.

Three of Mothron's drops, the Mothron Wings, The Eye of Cthulhu, and the Broken Hero Sword, explicitly require that all three mechanical bosses have been defeated. [1] This is always the case in regular gameplay, since it is a prerequisite to fighting Plantera and Mothron, but if Mothron is encountered earlier because of mods or other third-party tools, then it will not drop these items. The Mothron Wings and The Eye of Cthulhu furthermore also explicitly require that Plantera has been defeated. The Mothron Wings and The Eye of Cthulhu furthermore also explicitly require that Plantera has been defeated.
Mothron is most vulnerable when laying its eggs, as it remains completely motionless for a few seconds.
When dashing, it is vulnerable to more damage as it rams into the player's projectiles rapidly. Weapons like the Crystal Serpent especially benefit from this.
Mothron Eggs should be destroyed before they hatch, as Baby Mothrons interfere with the fight and drop no loot.

Mothron is best fought in an open, flat arena. Wings or the Gelatinous Pillion help with vertical mobility for dodging the ram attacks. Another possible approach is jumping down a long shaft, such as a hellevator, and shooting up. Another possible approach is jumping down a long shaft, such as a hellevator, and shooting up.

Viable armor choices for fighting Mothron include Hallowed armor, Chlorophyte armor, or Shroomite armor. Melee players should equip Turtle armor or Beetle armor, as their high defense stats can allow them to shrug off a lot of damage from Mothron's charge attacks.

Ranged and magic weapons are ideal against Mothron. The Piranha Gun is exceptional and allows defeating Mothron in 20–25 / 40–45 seconds; other good ranged options are the Venus Magnum, Snowman Cannon, Chain Gun, and Tsunami. Good magic options include the Blizzard Staff, Razorblade Typhoon, Nightglow, Stellar Tune, and the Crystal Serpent due to its splash projectiles.

Melee users can use the Death Sickle to great effect (provided they have obtained one from the Solar Eclipse already), as it can continuously deal damage while Mothron lays eggs and keeps it at bay for a few seconds. Other strong options include yoyos, the Scourge of the Corruptor, Vampire Knives, True Night's Edge, and True Excalibur. Flasks such as the Flask of Venom or Flask of Ichor help immensely.

Mothron is a reference to Mothra from the 1961 Japanese kaiju film Mothra. [2] The subtle change in its name follows the trend of Terraria enemies' and bosses' names ending with the suffix -ron, such as Skeletron, Duke Fishron, and Pigron.

If the Eclipse finishes, or all players die, Mothron floats up to the sky, vertically upwards, and despawns, similar to the Martian Saucer and Pumpkin / Frost Moon event bosses. In addition, it becomes invincible after the end of the Eclipse.

Similar to the Ice Golem, Sand Elemental, and the Dreadnautilus, Mothron is not a boss or mini-boss even though it has stats comparable to a boss. This is evidenced by its lack of a boss health bar, the fact that it drops a banner, not a trophy, and the fact that it does not drop a relic in Master Mode.
Technically, Baby Mothrons should be in their larval state at birth.
Mothron acts similarly to Lepus (3DS version), in the sense that it lays eggs that spawn weaker versions of itself.
Grox The Great presumes that Mothron drops the Broken Hero Sword because it ate the sword. [3]

The Sandstorm in a Balloon can stack with separate double-jump items, such as the Sharkron Balloon and Fart in a Jar. Stacking multiple items that give the same type of double-jump (in this case, Sandstorm) will not increase the effects of the jump.
The double jump can be used to negate fall damage if timed correctly.
The double jump can be stopped midway by releasing the ↷ Jump button.
The Sandstorm jump provides a speed boost when used, which can be used to quickly turn around while retaining some speed.
Pickaxes prior to the Nightmare and Deathbringer Pickaxes are unable to mine Pearlstone Bricks, despite having no special resistance to explosions.
Like any bricks with low saturation, Pearlstone Bricks can only be painted with deep colored paints, black, or white. This also applies to their wall variation.
Pearlstone Brick's counterparts are The Corruption 's Ebonstone Brick, and The Crimson 's Crimstone Brick. All three can be used to create valid housing, without spreading their respective biomes.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Silver Bullets deal 3× damage to Werewolves. [1]
The Werewolf will still attack the player even if the player has the Werewolf buff from the Moon Charm or its upgrades.
Werewolves can spawn during Blood Moons only if it is also a full moon, and without increased spawn rates. [2]

The nights on which Werewolves will spawn can be tracked through the items that certain NPCs sell, as the Painter sells paintings based on the moon phase. The inventories of the Clothier, Dye Trader, Zoologist (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) will also have unique items, though a Sextant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or derived informational item provides this same information much more directly. Additionally, the Zoologist's appearance will change directly during the night of a full moon (or during Blood Moons), which can also be a helpful indicator.
Using a Water Candle and/or Battle Potion can be useful for farming the Moon Shell and later the Celestial Shell.

If under-powered on the night of a full moon Werewolves can be fought regardless using the same strategies one might use against early-game Zombies, such as boxing oneself into safety and opening a small hole from which to release projectiles.

In common lore, the main weakness of werewolves is silver. This is why Silver Bullets in Terraria deal increased damage specifically to Werewolves, in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version. However, no other silver items in the game have any particular benefit in dealing with Werewolves. Werewolves in Terraria also share the trait of roaming during a full moon with common lore werewolves. Werewolves in Terraria also share the trait of roaming during a full moon with common lore werewolves.
Quick Heal works under the debuff.

The debuffs Stoned, Frozen, and Webbed all disable the player's inputs. When more than one of them is active at a time, the priority for the effects is as follows: Stoned → Frozen → Webbed. Note that if the Webbed effect coexists with any of the other effects, the player will not experience the effects of gravity. Note that if the Webbed effect coexists with any of the other effects, the player will not experience the effects of gravity.

Dying from the Stoned debuff will display one of the following unique death messages : " <Player name> shattered into pieces. " " <Player name> can't be put back together again. " " <Player name> needs to be swept up. " " <Player name> just became another dirt pile. " " <Player name> shattered into pieces. " " <Player name> can't be put back together again. " " <Player name> needs to be swept up. " " <Player name> just became another dirt pile. "
Unlike the Flipper Potion, neither itself nor any of its upgrades negate movement penalty while moving in liquids.

Generally, the Forest is the simplest biome in the game as the enemies encountered here are easily defeated once some basic gear has been acquired. The player's first base is often built here, as building materials such as Clay, Stone, and Wood are found quickly, the spawn rates are generally low, and the initial spawn is usually within the Forest.

There is a small chance for low tier ores to spawn on the surface in a forest. The various types of ores that can be found consist of Copper or Tin, Lead or Iron, and sometimes Silver or Tungsten. Pockets of Clay and Stone can also be found on the surface.
Surface Chests can be found scattered all over the Forest and include many exceptional starter items.
In Hardmode, the biome receives a slight buff, with new enemies spawning at night.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sakura and Yellow Willow trees have a 1/20 (5%) chance of replacing a regular Forest tree on world generation.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Fallen Logs can be found in the Forest, where Fairies spawn at night. When broken by an axe they will drop some Wood, and breaking all of them will permanently stop surface Fairies from spawning (although they can still be spawned by shaking trees ).

Regular Forests can be erased by the spread of Corruption, Crimson, and The Hallow. Converted Forests can be restored to their pure form by using Purification Powder purchased from the Dryad or its stronger Hardmode equivalent, the Clentaminator, with Green Solution purchased from the Steampunker.
As of 1.4.0.5 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the Forest has the most of music tracks, having five including those from Terraria: Otherworld.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Forest is the most popular biome for NPC housing : Only two NPCs dislike it and four NPCs like it. In pure numbers this is better than every other biome. The Hallow is the only biome that comes close to this number. Only two NPCs dislike it and four NPCs like it. In pure numbers this is better than every other biome. The Hallow is the only biome that comes close to this number.

The Gi gives a wide variety of damage bonuses, making it more potent than many other pre-Hardmode armors. If the player values damage over defense, and does not want a set bonus, then they can use the Gi with a helmet and leggings from another set. This, combined with the fact that it is obtainable very early, makes it a very powerful piece of armor. This is especially potent for early-game Melee and Ranged damage, as the Gi provides more damage than any other chest piece for both classes before Molten or Necro armor, even taking set bonuses into account. This is especially potent for early-game Melee and Ranged damage, as the Gi provides more damage than any other chest piece for both classes before Molten or Necro armor, even taking set bonuses into account.
A gi or keikogi (稽古着 or 稽古衣) is a traditional uniform worn for training in Japanese martial arts.

With the exception of the Coral Torch (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Cursed Torch, and Ichor Torch, torches do not function under water. A torch thrown into water will not emit light once it submerges, and if a player enters water with a torch selected in the hotbar, the torch will not be visible and will emit no light. Placed torches are freed when water touches them, and drop as items.
Holding the Auto Select key with the cursor over empty space will automatically prepare the torches in the player's inventory, allowing for quick placement or easy access to light.
White Torches appear to produce the most light of any light source in the game.
Torches provide more light when placed than they do when held or dropped, with the exception of the Ultrabright.
Torches are the only item where it is possible to throw (via the Throw key) just one of the item. For all other items, the entire stack gets thrown.

Throwing a torch will cause it to only go a few tiles forwards before falling straight down. For a light source that can be tossed farther, Glowsticks or Flares should be used (though note that Glowsticks are thrown by selecting them and then pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack button, not by pressing Throw ).
Despite appearing dim, Blue Torches can reach a respectable distance with the "Trippy" lighting mode selected, which is extended even farther under the effects of a Night Owl Potion.
While in Smart Cursor mode, the player can only place torches in dark places.
Orange Torches were apparently added because of a "really persistent nagging brit" in reference to the YouTuber ChippyGaming (James Bennett). [4]
Torch flame animations continue to play while the game is paused.
If a block is placed above a torch, the torch will lower. If there is no block above it, the torch gets higher. This can be seen best using a Trap Door and opening/closing it.
The Torch is the most used ingredient, with 245 recipes needing it, followed by Wood that is needed in 157 recipes.
In Constant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Worlds, torches and Campfires exposed to the sky will "turn off" during Rain.

Some Cave Walls can be converted into Crimson walls: Mottled Stone Walls become Crimson Teeth Walls, Fractured Stone Walls becomes Crimson Blister Walls, Worn Stone Walls become Crimson Crust Walls, and Stalactite Stone Walls become Crimson Scab Walls. Using a Clentaminator with Green Solution is the only way to reverse the conversion.

The Fart in a Balloon can stack with separate double-jump items, such as the Tsunami in a Bottle and the Cloud in a Bottle. Stacking multiple items that give the same type of double-jump (in this case, Fart) will not increase the effects of the jump.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Fart in a Balloon is not one of the items required to make the Bundle of Balloons, despite one of the balloons in the sprite being green; instead, the Blizzard in a Balloon is required.
The double jump can be used to negate fall damage if timed correctly.
The double jump can be stopped midway by releasing the ↷ Jump button.
The Fart jump provides a speed boost when used, which can be used to quickly turn around while retaining some speed.
The Vampire Frog minion applies 10 ticks of static immunity frames upon hitting an enemy, meaning it can hit up to six times per second.

This minion can be obtained earlier than the Hornet Staff and is fairly useful for close-range defense and clearing out enemies in open areas. However, Vampire Frogs are prone to getting stuck behind blocks. For more agile minions that can target airborne targets, the Flinx Staff may be preferable.
It can do relatively high damage at this point of the game, especially when paired with the Shark Tooth Necklace.
Because the Vampire Frog deals damage on contact rather than with a bespoke attack pattern, the Vampire Frog is one of the few minions that can be tested on Target Dummies without an enemy on-screen.
The Vampire Frog may be a reference to the Vampyrius vampyrus, also known as the vampire tree frog or vampire flying frog, an endangered frog species endemic to Vietnam.

It is advised to either craft a Wooden Yoyo or to keep one that's already made until Hardmode, as it can be used to craft the Chik, a decently powerful yoyo that is useful throughout the beginning of Hardmode.

A good way of defeating enemies while at low health is to open a door, fling the yoyo through it, and close the door, essentially using the yoyo through walls. This not only applies to the Wooden Yoyo, but any other yoyo as well.
This yoyo and the Valkyrie Yoyo are the only yoyos to have yoyo in their name.
Antlion Swarmers can spawn on the surface wherever naturally-generated desert walls are present. Destroying them will stop their spawning.
Antlion Swarmers are actually based on adult antlions, with the Swarmers' elongated wings and body structure almost identical to the real insect.
When flying around, they seem to emit a slight pulsating/after-image effect (akin to Shadow armor ), but only when they reach max speed.
Strangely, the Antlion Swarmer's attack decreases in Expert Hardmode, rather than increasing.

Due to their high resistance to knockback, using short range weapons, such as swords or spears, is not recommended. One should attack these enemies with long-range projectiles that inflict large amounts of damage such as bows, boomerangs, yoyos, or flails.
The Breaker Blade combined with a Titan Potion provide a close range alternative. The Anomura Fungus's knockback resistance should allow multiple hits while still keeping the enemy at a distance.
Anomura is a group of crustaceans that includes hermit crabs.

The 66% chance not to consume ammo stacks with similar bonuses. Despite the high chance not to consume ammo, its fire rate can still consume a stack of ammo fairly quickly. Despite the high chance not to consume ammo, its fire rate can still consume a stack of ammo fairly quickly.
Shots fired from the S.D.M.G. emit a moderate amount of light for their entire path.

In the Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS version, the S.D.M.G. is unobtainable without the use of glitching or inventory editing, but functional if edited in. Its stats in these versions are vastly inferior to the stats in the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version.

The S.D.M.G. pairs well with certain types of bullets : The Luminite Bullets ' piercing capabilities complement the S.D.M.G.'s high rate of fire and accuracy for crowd control. Using Ichor Bullets is a cheap and powerful alternative to Luminite Bullets. The base damage of 13 in addition to the Ichor debuff makes it a great weapon against powerful enemies such as bosses. The high accuracy of the gun allows for the shards of Crystal Bullets to consistently hit large enemies. The Chlorophyte Bullets ' homing abilities make it easier to hit small targets or dangerous enemies. Additionally, the S.D.M.G.'s ammo conservation helps to conserve resources, because crafting Chlorophyte Bullets is rather costly. The Luminite Bullets ' piercing capabilities complement the S.D.M.G.'s high rate of fire and accuracy for crowd control. Using Ichor Bullets is a cheap and powerful alternative to Luminite Bullets. The base damage of 13 in addition to the Ichor debuff makes it a great weapon against powerful enemies such as bosses. The high accuracy of the gun allows for the shards of Crystal Bullets to consistently hit large enemies. The Chlorophyte Bullets ' homing abilities make it easier to hit small targets or dangerous enemies. Additionally, the S.D.M.G.'s ammo conservation helps to conserve resources, because crafting Chlorophyte Bullets is rather costly.
The stealth mode of the Vortex armor increases the S.D.M.G.'s damage output even more. It is particularly helpful for taking down the Moon Lord.
Compared to the Vortex Beater, the S.D.M.G. is more accurate, but is slightly lacking in crowd control due to the former's homing missiles.
This item is a reference to the game Edge of Space (hence the tooltip 'It came from the edge of space' ), in which Terraria is also referenced.
This weapon goes along with the theme of aquatic automatic weapons, such as the Gatligator, as well as its predecessors, the Minishark and Megashark.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) If the player has consumed the Torch God's Favor, they can toggle Biome torch swap to place Ice Torches instead of regular Torches if they try to place regular Torches when in the Snow biome.
On the Nintendo 3DS version, normal sized worlds only have a 1/3 (33.33%) chance of containing a Snow biome.
Player-created Snow biomes are possible by placing more than (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 1500 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 300 Snow Blocks and/or Ice Blocks in an area.
Water does not turn into Ice Blocks in a Snow biome. Ice Blocks are generated only on world creation.

Snow biomes are somewhat resistant to surface Hallow and Corruption / Crimson spread, since Snow Blocks cannot be transformed. However, Ice Blocks are affected and will be transformed into Pink Ice Blocks (Hallow), Purple Ice Blocks (Corruption) and Red Ice Blocks (Crimson), which mostly affects the Ice biome.
Grass will not grow on Dirt Blocks in a Snow biome.
From surface to underground, the Snow biome initially generates in a trapezoidal shape, before it is overridden by other possible features, like deserts.
The Snow biome will always be located on the opposite side of the world as the Underground Desert and the Jungle. Both the Snow biome and Jungle can generate near or at spawn.

The Angler calls the Snow biome Tundra. This may just be an example of the Angler's usual childish tendencies. It is only partly accurate to classify the Snow biome as a tundra in the physical-geographical sense. Arctic tundra is typically characterized by a very cold climate and permanently frozen soil, supporting only certain kinds of low-growing vegetation. Scattered trees grow in some tundra regions, but due to the frigid temperatures and permafrost they are not as plentiful as in Terraria 's Snow biome. Nonetheless, the Snow biome presents a harsh, cold environment that could be likened to a tundra. This may just be an example of the Angler's usual childish tendencies. It is only partly accurate to classify the Snow biome as a tundra in the physical-geographical sense. Arctic tundra is typically characterized by a very cold climate and permanently frozen soil, supporting only certain kinds of low-growing vegetation. Scattered trees grow in some tundra regions, but due to the frigid temperatures and permafrost they are not as plentiful as in Terraria 's Snow biome. Nonetheless, the Snow biome presents a harsh, cold environment that could be likened to a tundra.
(3DS version) The Angler will still display quests for the Mutant Flinxfin, Pengfish, and Tundra Trout even if the world does not contain a Snow biome.
The name Boreal Wood implies it originates in the far north.

Once rolling, Life Crystal Boulders deal the same amount of damage regardless of their speed. A player or enemy hit by a Life Crystal Boulder that had just begun rolling will take just as much damage as they would from a Life Crystal Boulder moving at a higher speed. This also means that players trying to mine a Life Crystal Boulder while touching it will take damage. If moving along a flat strip of land, this allows it to roll a maximum distance of 1548.6 tiles. [3] If moving along a flat strip of land, this allows it to roll a maximum distance of 1548.6 tiles. [3]

Similarly to regular Boulders, Life Crystal Boulders can be placed atop flat-surface furniture, such as tables or bookcases. Mining the bottom one causes all of them to fall and roll. Unlike Boulders, Life Crystal Boulders cannot be stacked on top of each other.
It is possible for Life Crystal Boulders to roll uphill, as long as there is one flat tile in between each sloped tile.
Life Crystal Boulders sell for the same amount of coins as the Life Crystals used to craft them.

The way to tell whether a Life Crystal is a boulder or not is that Life Crystal Boulders do not emit sparkle particles, unlike actual Life Crystals. Life Crystal Boulders will also not be highlighted by a Spelunker Potion, being highlighted by a Dangersense Potion instead. Life Crystal Boulders will also not be highlighted by a Spelunker Potion, being highlighted by a Dangersense Potion instead.

Life Fruit can spawn on any block of Jungle grass (including player-placed ones) below the surface; it does not have to be in an Underground Jungle biome. However, they will never spawn within a (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 122×122 ( 102×102 ) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 162×162 tile area (centered on the Life Fruit) of each other, [1] i.e. they will be spaced (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 60 ( 50 ) / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 80 tiles apart at maximum concentration.

Like other plants, Life Fruit can be harvested with any weapon or tool; a pickaxe is not required, and any attack can uproot them. They will also be uprooted if the Jungle grass beneath them is replaced. Since they are classified as plants, Life Fruit are also affected by the Guide to Environmental Preservation and its upgrade, the Guide to Peaceful Coexistence. Since they are classified as plants, Life Fruit are also affected by the Guide to Environmental Preservation and its upgrade, the Guide to Peaceful Coexistence.
Life Fruit are highlighted by the Spelunker buff or Spelunker Glowsticks by a yellow glimmer, like ores and treasures.

Life Fruit currently has the highest Metal Detector (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) value. This can make searching for ores or other valuables more difficult once full health has been reached as any errant Life Fruit will be prioritized over everything else in the area.

On the minimap, Life Fruit are 2×2 squares and are a slightly lighter color of green than the rest of the foliage around it. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) When hovered over, they are labeled as " Life Fruit ".
The first Life Fruit obtained should ideally be turned into an Aegis Fruit, as 4 defense provides a greater survivability boost than 5 max health.
A Lifeforce Potion can be used to temporarily increase health capacity even beyond 500, to a maximum of 600.

In order to obtain maximum health, 20 Life Fruit are required. Unlike Life Crystals, Life Fruit have no further use after that, besides being sold for 2 GC each, or being turned into an Aegis Fruit (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) via Shimmer Transmutation.
Farms can be made by making long platforms of Jungle grass underground. Jungle grass spreads with Jungle Grass Seeds.
Fairies (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can often lead the player to Life Fruit.
If the player has explored a large area of the Underground Jungle before defeating a mechanical boss, they can use the Metal Detector in conjunction with the map to find Life Fruit very effectively.

Before defeating all three mechanical bosses, a quick and easy way to find Life Fruit is to use the Clentaminator with Dark Blue Solution specifically, as this will break the Life Fruit and leave them on the ground, and illuminated by the glowing mushroom for the player to see. After the player is done gathering, the biome may be easily switched back to the jungle via Green Solution. However, this method becomes much more dangerous after Plantera's Bulbs begin to spawn, because the conversion will break them and summon Plantera.
The plants on which the fruit grows have three different possible sprites. They are all functionally identical.
The small golden heart on the Life Fruit represents the golden heart obtained when the fruit is consumed.
Liquid traversal items like the Lava Waders will allow it to walk on liquid surfaces as well. It will not vanish when touching a liquid.

Its extreme maneuverability and the fact that it shoots lasers at enemies make it arguably one of the best mounts on land. However, it cannot fly or double-jump on its own (although the good jump height makes up for this).
The lasers fire very quickly and have a large detection radius. Hence, at certain smaller screen resolutions, it will shoot at off-screen enemies.

The Scutlix Mount synergizes well with the Neptune's Shell or any of its upgrades since the maneuverability and lasers of the Scutlix are kept while underwater. Creating entire arenas this way can free an accessory slot which would be used for movement.

Due to the immense land speed and eye lasers, it is quite useful against the Solar Pillar. However, do keep in mind that the mount's lasers can be reflected by Selenians, which can very quickly prove harmful to the player. However, do keep in mind that the mount's lasers can be reflected by Selenians, which can very quickly prove harmful to the player.
Despite its name, it is neither affiliated with the Brain Scrambler enemy nor dropped by it.

The Scutlix Mount and the Santank Mount are the only two mounts with ranged attacks, as well as the only damage-dealing mounts to not do summon damage. Coincidentally, they are both land-based mounts.

In versions prior to 1.4, it could be beneficial for players to aim to destroy a Shadow Orb (or Crimson Heart ) as quickly as possible, as the Meteor armor and the Space Gun make for a strong combination in early pre-Hardmode. In 1.4, Meteorite will not spawn before the player kills the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu, but the  Meteor armor with the Space Gun still remains a very useful combination after that.

Meteorite Bars can be found in Gold Chests in the lower 250 tiles of the Cavern layer above the Underworld, allowing Meteor Armor to be obtained prior to defeating the Eater of Worlds / Brain of Cthulhu. They can also be obtained from Shadow Chests in the Underworld.
Oddly enough, the set bonus also affects the Gray Zapinator and Orange Zapinator, which makes this armor set useful into Hardmode. However, the lack of defense will be a great drawback.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The fire particle effect can be altered by dyes. Using different dye in each slot of the armor causes the colors to blend.
Despite the Meteor Helmet requiring the fewest bars to craft, it sells for the most, which is the case for many armor sets.

Even though the Space Gun, Gray Zapinator, and Orange Zapinator cost 0 mana to use while wearing the full armor set, only the Space Gun has its mana cost tooltip removed. Both the Gray Zapinator and Orange Zapinator state they still cost the full amount of mana.
As long as a Corite is dashing, its acceleration will continuously rise until it either makes too much of a curve or if it contacts the player.

Corites are a major threat to players on the ground; they can always charge the player, while they spend much of their time unreachable by many weapons. High mobility is important, keeping away from Corites and dodging their attacks, while not staying airborne long enough to draw the attention of Crawltipedes. It would be recommended to jump just before they hit the player, as that is one of the few ways to avoid them.

The Bubble Gun, in conjunction with sufficient damage and critical hit rate bonuses and the Spectre armor (with the Spectre Mask), is capable of dealing damage rapidly enough to kill individual Corites before they can reach the player. It must be fired early so that there are lingering bubbles that the Corite will dive into.
The Corite resembles a stronger, Hardmode variant of a Meteor Head.

The Undertaker's stats are similar to that of the Flintlock Pistol, though with more damage and a slower rate of fire. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Compared to the Musket, The Undertaker sells for half the price at 1 GC.
If the player wishes to acquire The Undertaker through fishing, using a Crate Potion will increase the odds of catching a crate by 10%.
It resembles a six shooter.
An undertaker, also known as mortician in American English or, more generally, funeral director, is a professional involved in the business of funeral rites.

Modifier prefixes are added in front of the "The" in its name, which can result in a grammatically incorrect name such as "Keen The Undertaker". It shares this trait with all other items that can obtain modifiers and whose names begin with "The". This error is not present in the Old-gen console version.
The Dart Pistol can be considered a Hardmode version of The Undertaker.
Despite being the cheapest to craft, the hat sells for the most Coins.
Cobwebs cannot grow underwater.
It would be more practical to get Ebonwood Bow or Shadewood Bow as their stats are the same as the Iron Bow but can be acquired much earlier in the game.
The tooltips are a reference to the priest from the 1987 film, The Princess Bride.
The Wisp will often remain deep within the blocks ahead, causing the immediate area around your character to remain dark. To negate this effect, stand still and the Wisp should return.
Jumping will not direct the Wisp upward, and falling will not direct it downward. Instead, the up or down buttons must be used, respectively.
When the player is far ahead, the Wisp will spin to catch up to the player, giving off less light.

The Wisp moves at 26 mph when not spinning, and 61 mph when spinning. The latter is equal to the Unicorn Mount 's top speed. If the player's speed exceeds 61 mph, the wisp will teleport to the player when too far away. If the player's speed exceeds 61 mph, the wisp will teleport to the player when too far away.
On the Console version and Mobile version, the Wisp is controlled with the right joystick and left joystick, respectively.
Dye applied to the Wisp does not change the amount or color of light emitted, even if the Wisp is made invisible.
Grappling a block will allow the player to freely direct the Wisp.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Applying Twilight Dye, Living Ocean Dye or Living Flame Dye seemingly turns the Wisp completely invisible while still providing light, should players wish for such a thing for cosmetic reasons or when fighting Dungeon Spirits. Some other dyes can achieve this effect as well, such as Shadow Dye, Grim Dye, and Reflective Metal Dye, although to a lesser degree.
When directing the Wisp into a Cloud Block, it will glow significantly brighter, unlike most light sources.
The Wisp appears to be a flaming skull.
Wisp refers to Will-o'-the-wisps, mythological ghost lights reported to lead travelers to their death in swamps.
The image on the jar appears to be a flexing arm, representing the Vitamins' abilities to fight off weaknesses and provide strength.
Unlike the Corrupt Grass Wall, the Crimson Grass Wall cannot feature small flowers.

As the Clentaminator affects a rather large area, creating areas of localized Crimson Grass Walls without converting blocks and other wall parts may be difficult, making throwing Blood Water more viable.

The Shark Tooth Necklace is very useful in pre-Hardmode and early Hardmode because it has a fixed armor penetration value, and can be dropped in any Blood Moon. It is easier to obtain this item pre-Hardmode, since the new Hardmode spawns will displace some of the Dripplers and Blood Zombies that drop it. As with all rare drops, placing a Water Candle and/or using a Battle Potion during a Blood Moon can increase the spawn rates to help obtain it. It is easier to obtain this item pre-Hardmode, since the new Hardmode spawns will displace some of the Dripplers and Blood Zombies that drop it. As with all rare drops, placing a Water Candle and/or using a Battle Potion during a Blood Moon can increase the spawn rates to help obtain it.

The Shark Tooth Necklace is great for overcoming the shortcomings of early weapons that have a high fire rate but low damage, such as the Minishark or the Bee Gun, which fall short when fighting enemies with high defense. It increases the weapon's damage by 2 against all enemies with more than 5 defense. For instance, Skeletron 's Hands with 14 defense normally reduce the base damage of a Minishark with Musket Balls from 14 to 6, but the Shark Tooth Necklace increases this to 8, which is equivalent to a +33.33% boost. The damage boost can be increased further by raising the player's armor penetration, e.g. with an additional Stinger Necklace and the Sharpened buff. The damage boost can be increased further by raising the player's armor penetration, e.g. with an additional Stinger Necklace and the Sharpened buff.

When pressed against a 1-block wide wall, a player can launch the Flower Pow through the wall (this goes for every wall, above or beneath the player), making it helpful for attacking enemies from safety.
In the Nintendo 3DS version, the Flower Pow may not always shoot petals at enemies. Verify
Its name is a play on " flower power ", a peace slogan used during the late 1960s to early 1970s.
The petals it fires are similar to the seeds Plantera fires in her first stage.
The Flower Pow is one of three flails that fire additional projectiles, the others being the Drippler Crippler (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and the Flairon.

The Solar Tablet and Solar Tablet Fragments may be available pre-Hardmode – Jungle Temple enemies may occasionally spawn outside the Temple and drop fragments, and there are numerous ways to enter the temple prior to defeating Plantera. Note that the tablet cannot be crafted without a Hardmode Anvil, and it will not work anyway until the world is in Hardmode.

The Kill the Sun achievement is granted at the end of any Solar Eclipse, regardless of how many of its enemies were defeated during it. A Solar Tablet can be used to invoke a Solar Eclipse moments before sunset, when it would naturally end, rewarding the achievement without the player having to endure the event.
While the item itself has no currency value, the Solar Eclipse spawned by it can potentially rake in multiple Platinum Coins.
Demonite Bars are very profitable, selling at 15 GC per stack of 50.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Anchor is called a trophy when hovered over on the map.

The Video Visage will animate based on the conditions below: If the player is in the Corruption, Crimson, or a Graveyard, the screen turns off. If the player's health decreases below one fourth of their maximum health, the screen will turn to monochrome static. If the player is in a liquid, the screen will become dark blue and scroll vertically. If the player is fighting a boss or an event is occurring, the screen will scroll sideways while flashing marine colors. If there is a Lantern Night or Party occurring, or the player is in a town with 3 or more inhabitants, the screen will turn into a purple smiley face. This face also will blink the same way the player does (e.g. taking damage, sleeping, etc.) Additionally, if the player has the Tipsy debuff or the player is sleeping, the face will have its eyes closed. If none of these conditions are met, the screen will display a color test pattern. If the player is in the Corruption, Crimson, or a Graveyard, the screen turns off. If the player's health decreases below one fourth of their maximum health, the screen will turn to monochrome static. If the player is in a liquid, the screen will become dark blue and scroll vertically. If the player is fighting a boss or an event is occurring, the screen will scroll sideways while flashing marine colors. If there is a Lantern Night or Party occurring, or the player is in a town with 3 or more inhabitants, the screen will turn into a purple smiley face. This face also will blink the same way the player does (e.g. taking damage, sleeping, etc.) Additionally, if the player has the Tipsy debuff or the player is sleeping, the face will have its eyes closed. Additionally, if the player has the Tipsy debuff or the player is sleeping, the face will have its eyes closed. If none of these conditions are met, the screen will display a color test pattern.

As first seen in an official trailer for 1.4.1, the Video Visage is always visible, even in complete darkness, despite not giving out any actual light. The only exception to this is when the screen is black.
This set can be crafted pre- Skeletron by using Shimmer on Active Stone Blocks or Explosives to obtain the Wire needed.
This Video Visage's purple smiling effect can be used to easily determine the edge of the town for spawning purposes.

Each item of the set's tooltip contains a reference to the lyrics of a specific song: The Video Visage's tooltip references the song "Cabinet Man" by the musical project and band Lemon Demon. The Lazer Blazer's tooltip references the song "How Bad Can I Be" from the 2012 American computer-animated musical fantasy comedy movie The Lorax. The Pinstripe Pants' tooltip references the song "I Can't Decide" by the American pop rock band the Scissor Sisters. The Video Visage's tooltip references the song "Cabinet Man" by the musical project and band Lemon Demon. The Lazer Blazer's tooltip references the song "How Bad Can I Be" from the 2012 American computer-animated musical fantasy comedy movie The Lorax. The Pinstripe Pants' tooltip references the song "I Can't Decide" by the American pop rock band the Scissor Sisters.
Unlike the other five sets, the TV Head set was not announced as a winner of the Journey's End Vanity Contest, and was only teased one day before the update that introduced it to the game.
Crimslime is a portmanteau of crimson and slime.
Substituting items does not work for armor or weapons that are name-specific to their bar.
Using two different but equal bars for the same item can help conserve bars when the player does not have a large supply.
Dynasty Wood is the only wood that cannot be used in "Any Wood" recipes.
Grapes are the only fruit that cannot be used in "Any Fruit" recipes.
There is an " Any Lunar Fragment " category in the game code that is not used in any recipe. It includes the four Lunar Fragments. [2]
Jungle Sanctums were removed in the Mobile 1.3.0.7 update, no longer generating in newly created worlds. However, they still exist in worlds created prior to that update.
Jungle Sanctums contained Pearlwood Lamps, normally Hardmode furniture items, even though they were accessible in pre-Hardmode.

Due to the medium mana cost and the very fast speed at which it auto-casts, it can be seen as an alternative to the gem staves, doing higher single-target DPS than the highest-tier staves. However, it lacks piercing against multiple targets, and requires visiting a dangerous biome. It can more safely be obtained from fishing in an Oasis.
The zig-zag motion of the projectile facilitates some unusual trajectories, e.g. through a half-tile gap.
In Don't dig up worlds, the Thunder Zapper can be obtained from the lower Chests that spawn below the Underground Desert walls with much less risk.

If a Sandstone Chest contains a Storm Spear or Bast Statue as its primary item, the player is low enough to obtain the Thunder Zapper. Otherwise, they need to dig lower before they have a chance of finding one.
Like many other enemies from the event, its appearance and stats change, depending on which tier of the event is active (see Old One's Army for tier details).
Unlike the Wyvern and its varieties, the Etherian Wyvern is not segmented and does not use the Worm AI.

Because it can fly, it will dodge many shots from the Ballista sentry summons, posing a threat to the crystal if there are not any other summons or if the player does not have any Ranged weapons. This makes the Etherian Wyvern a serious threat to melee players early in Tier 1 as there are few melee weapons pre-hardmode that have a ranged attack. However the Ice Blade, Enchanted Sword, yoyos, and boomerangs can be used as effective melee weapons to defeat this enemy.
Despite the similar name, the Etherian Wyvern has a different appearance than the Wyvern.
Aim for the head as that is where the projectiles are fired from.
The Chaos Balls can be destroyed by hitting them with another projectile or a melee weapon.
The Bestiary entry for the Goblin Sorcerer: " As primitive as they are, some goblins have the potential for manipulating magicked shadow energy through a form of hexing. "

Damage dealt by enemies is doubled in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and tripled in Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) compared to Classic Mode. This means that despite the higher factors of defense in those modes, players will still take more damage than they would in Classic Mode.

Like Fireblossoms and Obsidian, regular Living Fire Blocks are not destroyed when dropped into lava, despite having a rarity of 00*. However, the others types of Living Fire Blocks are not immune to lava. However, the others types of Living Fire Blocks are not immune to lava.
They will not count as valid light sources or background walls for houses.

Their placement behavior is similar to Wooden Beams, except that Wooden Beams can only attach to each other vertically, while Living Fire Blocks can form horizontal arrangements as well. Also, other block types and furniture can be placed on Wooden Beams, but not on Living Fire Blocks, with the exception of platforms. Torches will also not attach to Living Fire Blocks.
Living Fire Blocks can be placed in areas submerged by lava.
While Living Fire Blocks are unable to be hammered normally, halved and sloped Living Fire Blocks can be placed using a world editor such as TEdit.
Living Fire Blocks cannot be dropped from Statue -spawned enemies.
The average drop rate of Living Fire Blocks for every enemy is 0.7.
Living Fire Blocks could be considered more useful than torches because, besides being easy to farm, they can be placed anywhere and are not displaced by liquids.

Summoning King Slime in the Underworld can be an excellent way to farm for Living Fire Blocks. Each of its summoned slimes gives the same chance of dropping Living Fire Blocks as any enemy when killed.
The Moon Leech Clot and the Living Ultrabright Fire Block item sprites are identical.
Living Ichor Block does not contain the word "Fire", unlike all the others.
The Living Demon Fire Block is tied with Shroomite Plating for having the longest crafting tree of a block.
The different colors can be used to differentiate teams in PvP games.

Both the weapon's visual appearance and its sound effect bear a striking resemblance to the fictional energy sword lightsaber featured in the American epic space-opera media franchise Star Wars. This reference is further reinforced by the requirement of crystals and gems in the crafting of Phaseblades and Phasesabers, alluding to the colored kyber crystals which are used in the construction of lightsabers.
The sprites for Phasesabers are visibly brighter than Phaseblades.

In order to fix a bug where Phasesabers placed on Weapon Racks would be unbreakable, the developers remade all Phasesabers into new items (IDs 3764 through 3769), ones presumably that are impervious to the bug. Therefore, the "old" Phasesabers that had negative IDs (IDs -19 through -24) are no longer obtainable; instead, a new one is received. This is most likely the reason the fix is not retroactive yet.
The Guide to Peaceful Coexistence's inactive variation is the item with the highest item ID.
This item increases the player's base speed from 15 mph to 34 mph.
If the player runs into a wall with a 1-block opening in the floor next to the wall, the player will sometimes fall through.

The Lightning Boots are extremely useful for cases that involve lots of dodging such as the fight against the Eye of Cthulhu or The Twins. They are also useful when fighting the Wall of Flesh using the bridge strategy, especially in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
When stacked with Flying Carpet and/or Wings, Lightning Boots prove to be very useful.
Stacking with Amphibian Boots will slow the player's speed down to 30 mph. This will not happen if the Lightning boots are in any accessory slot below the Amphibian Boots.

The Sunflower's Happy! buff stacks with the effect of the Peace Candle (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), as well as the movement speed buff of Asphalt Blocks. This does not affect top running speed when equipped with Movement Accessories such as the Hermes Boots or their upgrades. This does not affect top running speed when equipped with Movement Accessories such as the Hermes Boots or their upgrades.
The buff reduces critter spawns, so if the player would like to collect bait, it is wise to remove any nearby Sunflowers.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sunflowers glow in the dark, though they will not light up the surrounding area, only its flower.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) When placed in a Graveyard biome, Sunflowers do not grant nearby players the Happy! buff.
Sunflowers have a very low chance of spawning more Sunflowers in a small area. Verify

In the release trailer for 1.3, a variant of sunflower was shown with a golden interior as opposed to the regular sunflower (some are seen in the beginning of the trailer). It never ended up in the final update and its effects are unknown.
Sunflowers' ability to resist Corruption and Crimson may be a reference to their real-world reputation for cleaning up nuclear radiation. [4]
A sunflower is used as the loading icon on the Desktop, Console, Mobile, and Switch versions.
Taking damage, using most items, moving, or Bleeding will all reset the health regeneration's acceleration. Using a fishing pole or consuming a recovery potion will not.
If the player is moving at a very low speed, it can still take effect.
Health regeneration is still possible if the player is sitting still while riding a mount or Minecart, or while grappled.

If the player is inflicted with any damage-over-time debuff other than Poisoned (such as On Fire! ), the Shiny Stone will reduce or stop the damage caused by the debuff instead of providing health regeneration.
If the player has a positive health regeneration, it will give an additional 0.5 HP/s regeneration effect.
Teleporting via the Rod of Discord does not count as a movement, but will reset the timer if the player is damaged by the Chaos State debuff.
Teleporting via Teleporters does not count as movement. Therefore, the player can constantly teleport from point to point while keeping the health regeneration and dodging attacks.
The Shiny Stone will slightly amplify the effects of some other healing items or buffs, as well as increasing base healing speed, even when the player is in motion and/or using items.

The Shiny Stone synergizes well with certain other items: Crimson armor increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration effect by 50% and accelerates its buildup by 20%. The Honey buff increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration buildup by 40%. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sitting in a chair increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration effect by 50% and accelerates its buildup by 200%. The Volatile Gelatin and Spore Sac grant the player a passive attack, which is helpful while not moving. The Flying Knife and summon weapons can be used without slowing down the regeneration effect. Shroomite armor provides offensive ranged bonuses when standing still. Crimson armor increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration effect by 50% and accelerates its buildup by 20%. The Honey buff increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration buildup by 40%. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sitting in a chair increases the Shiny Stone's regeneration effect by 50% and accelerates its buildup by 200%. The Volatile Gelatin and Spore Sac grant the player a passive attack, which is helpful while not moving. The Flying Knife and summon weapons can be used without slowing down the regeneration effect. Shroomite armor provides offensive ranged bonuses when standing still.
The Shiny Stone's art is a reference to the Ankh Jewel from the platform-adventure video game La-Mulana.
It takes 34.3 seconds of not moving or being damaged to reach the Shiny Stone's top healing speed. Of course, even with the Lifeforce buff any player is likely to be completely healed by then.

The center point of the Medusa Head's effect is not the raised head, but rather the front of the player's torso, just below their face. As a result, enemies that appear to be targetable may not be affected. In addition, there appears to be an exactly 2-block minimum space requirement for the attack to "pass through" and hit a target, causing walls in narrow vertical tunnels to block attacks going straight up or down due to the start point being off center from the tunnel.

Enemies near walls or slopes can sometimes be completely missed by this weapon's attack, even with no obstructing blocks between the player and the enemy. This seems to happen much more consistently on smaller enemies such as Green Slimes.
The Medusa Head cannot target other players in PvP.

The Medusa Head's rapid short-range attacks make it a great tool for clearing out enemies that are surrounding the player, or for eliminating quick enemies without having to aim. However, given its limited number of targets, it is generally outclassed by weapons with true piercing when fighting worm-type enemies and bosses.
Due to the area-of-effect damage of the Medusa Head, it is useful against events like the Pirate Invasion and Goblin Invasion.
The Medusa Head may indicate a nearby unseen enemy's location through its streaks of light towards it.

Given the hazards of fighting Medusa, the safest way to get hold of one of these is use of a statue farm. However, given the reduced drop chance from statues, this can take quite a long time; even a three-statue farm might take well over an hour of real-time.

The Medusa Head originates from the Greek legend of Perseus, who was commanded by Polydectes to kill the Gorgon Medusa and return with her head. Later on, he used it to save Andromeda by turning the sea monster Cetus into stone.
The Medusa Head does not inflict the Stoned debuff despite its namesake enemy doing so.
When used, Medusa and the snakes on her head will stick out their tongues, and her eyes will flash.
When using a Medusa Head while riding a Minecart on a slope, the head will appear to float.
When fighting Basilisks, fighting them from above or with weapons that deal high knockback is a good idea.

Ranged weapons with a high rate of fire and decent knockback, such as the Megashark, but also the Shadowflame Knife, are effective against Basilisks from longer distances. However, these weapons have limited range, such as the Shadowflame Knife, or in the case of the Megashark, accuracy best used in medium-ranged encounters. Because of that, it is best to walk backward as a Basilisk approaches or use a minion to weaken it.

In European bestiaries and legends, basilisks are often depicted as snake-like creatures that can kill with their gaze or poisonous breath. Contrary to this, the Basilisks in Terraria resemble lizards. They seem to be inspired by the physical appearance of the thorny devil lizard, which is a real lizard that is endemic to the deserts, scrubland, and grasslands of Australia. Also unlike mythological basilisks, the Basilisks in Terraria do not kill the player with their gaze, nor do they have poisonous breath attacks. Contrary to this, the Basilisks in Terraria resemble lizards. They seem to be inspired by the physical appearance of the thorny devil lizard, which is a real lizard that is endemic to the deserts, scrubland, and grasslands of Australia. Also unlike mythological basilisks, the Basilisks in Terraria do not kill the player with their gaze, nor do they have poisonous breath attacks.

The Basilisk can be considered a much stronger version of the Antlion Charger. It is also possible that Evolution Beast, which spawns near Nebula Pillar, may be a stronger form of Basilisk. It is also possible that Evolution Beast, which spawns near Nebula Pillar, may be a stronger form of Basilisk.
The internal name for the Basilisk is DesertBeast.

The Rune Wizard can only spawn below a certain depth level. This level can be determined by adding the absolute depths of the bottom of the underground layer and the bottom of the Underworld, and dividing that by 2. Due the randomized world generation, these values will be different for every world. In general, areas with lava are a good indicator of where the Rune Wizard will spawn. In general, areas with lava are a good indicator of where the Rune Wizard will spawn.

An easy way to fight the Rune Wizard is to continually attack him. This will essentially paralyze him, preventing his attacks and teleportation. Inflicting debuffs like On Fire! can be a very effective way to fight him. Viable weapons for paralyzing the Rune Wizard include the Piranha Gun, weapons with a high rate of fire, like the Megashark, as well as most summoning weapons. Viable weapons for paralyzing the Rune Wizard include the Piranha Gun, weapons with a high rate of fire, like the Megashark, as well as most summoning weapons.

Despite making no attempt to touch players as part of his attacks, the Rune Wizard inflicts extreme contact damage, enough to kill most players in around 3 hits. His projectiles deal far less damage, but he can nonetheless be very dangerous to players with weak Hardmode items, especially if he spawns in an unreachable place. In Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the contact damage is often enough to instantly kill the player. Due to the extreme contact damage, it is advisable to fight the Rune Wizard using long-range weapons. This may prove difficult due to the narrow caves where he spawns, however. In Master Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the contact damage is often enough to instantly kill the player. Due to the extreme contact damage, it is advisable to fight the Rune Wizard using long-range weapons. This may prove difficult due to the narrow caves where he spawns, however.

The Rune Wizard can be considered the Hardmode version of Tim. The vanity items dropped closely resemble the same items dropped by Tim. The two also have similar spawn depths, attack patterns and drop unique items only obtainable by defeating them. Also, according to the Bestiary, the Rune Wizard is Tim's older brother. However, unlike Tim, the Rune Wizard's spawn rate cannot be manually increased by the player at all. However, unlike Tim, the Rune Wizard's spawn rate cannot be manually increased by the player at all.
Due to the Rune Wizard's extremely low spawn rates and its spawn location requirements, he can be considered one of the rarest encountered enemies in the game.

The Rune Wizard inflicts the second-most contact damage of all enemies and the third-most damage in the game. His contact damage is as much as the Pirate Captain 's cannonballs and a Skeleton Sniper 's rifle bullets. His damage is third to the Dungeon Guardian, and the Empress of Light (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) if fought during the daytime.

In multiplayer, any player can pick up Damage Boosters and benefit from the Damage Nebula buff, even if they are not wearing Nebula armor. Additionally, picking up a Damage Booster will grant all nearby players (within a 43.75-tile radius [3] ) one instance of Damage Nebula. If the player acquiring the Damage Booster is on a team, only nearby players within that team will obtain the buff.
The Mushi Ladybug's name may be a double entendre, as "Mushi" sounds similar to "mushroom", but also translates to "bug" or "insect" in Japanese (虫 or むし, mushi ).
Upon dealing damage, the Flymeal produces the fart sound effect that a Whoopie Cushion makes.
The Flymeal completely ignores town NPCs' defense, and deals double its base damage to the Nurse. [1] The latter is most likely to counter her self-healing ability.
Armor sets, accessories, and flasks that allow the player to inflict debuffs can also be used with the Flymeal to apply these to NPCs.
Unlike Rotten Eggs, the Flymeal cannot damage the Eternia Crystal.

The Flymeal has lower damage and knockback than the Platinum Broadsword, despite the latter being one of its possible components, and has the same attack speed. Players who only wish to improve their damage should not upgrade their Platinum Broadsword into a Flymeal.

This item is helpful for getting town NPCs out of the way of things players may use such as Chests or Beds. This is also the easiest method of killing NPCs for certain drops (e.g. Mechanic for Combat Wrench ), as unlike Rotten Eggs or lava, the Flymeal is much more convenient and will not displace furniture. This is also the easiest method of killing NPCs for certain drops (e.g. Mechanic for Combat Wrench ), as unlike Rotten Eggs or lava, the Flymeal is much more convenient and will not displace furniture.
It is more profitable to sell the Flymeal's ingredients, which sell for 68 SC (with Gold Broadsword ) / 77 SC (with Platinum Broadsword ) in total, while the sword itself sells for 35 SC.
The Flymeal shares a very similar tooltip to that of the Rotten Egg, another weapon that can damage friendly NPCs.
The tooltip " Makes others smell like cilantro " is a reference to real-life stink bugs, which produce a chemical that smells like cilantro or coriander.
The Hook can be obtained very early into the game by going to the Jungle, where Piranhas spawn above ground.
It is 6150% more profitable to craft and sell a Grappling Hook with a spare Hook ( 40 SC ), rather than selling it and three Chains individually ( 3 SC 20 CC ).
Since it fires neither arrows nor bullets, the Dart Pistol receives the specialized boosts from the Shroomite Helmet.
The Dart Pistol can also fire Seeds, but it does not allow obtaining them like the Blowgun and Blowpipe.

It can be an extremely deadly mid-Hardmode weapon in the right situations when paired with the right darts: Crystal Darts for enclosed areas or crowded enemies close to each other, and Ichor Darts for bosses or enemies with high defense. Ichor Darts are also especially useful in situations where dodging is a high priority, for their unique ability to multiply after a short distance, making it easy for at least one dart to hit. Furthermore, Ichor Darts are useful for applying the Ichor debuff, even post- Moon Lord. The fact that the Dart Pistol uses darts as ammo means the player can freely use other ammo of their choice with other weapons, without having to worry about switching ammo types mid-fight. Ichor Darts are also especially useful in situations where dodging is a high priority, for their unique ability to multiply after a short distance, making it easy for at least one dart to hit. Furthermore, Ichor Darts are useful for applying the Ichor debuff, even post- Moon Lord. The fact that the Dart Pistol uses darts as ammo means the player can freely use other ammo of their choice with other weapons, without having to worry about switching ammo types mid-fight.

Cursed Darts are useful against groups of grounded enemies, and their combination with the Dart Pistol can make for a powerful method of crowd control with high DPS. However, obtaining them requires creating an artificial Corruption biome with Corrupt Seeds purchased from the Dryad in a Graveyard, or bringing in materials from another world with Corruption or a drunk world. Cursed Darts can also serve as an excellent weapon for The Destroyer, granted that the darts are shot above the boss. Cursed Darts can also serve as an excellent weapon for The Destroyer, granted that the darts are shot above the boss.

The Dart Pistol could be considered the Hardmode version of The Undertaker, seeing how both are obtainable in worlds containing the Crimson and bear some visual resemblances. The only functional difference between the two is that The Undertaker consumes bullets as ammunition instead of darts.
The Dart Pistol is not capable of using the Rifle Scope or any of its upgrades to zoom in on targets, likely due to it not being considered a gun.
The Dart Pistol and Dart Rifle have around the same overall DPS, despite their differences in damage and use time.
Glow Tulips are only generated during the initial world generation. They do not generate during gameplay or regrow after being harvested.

Glow Tulips can only be generated below the surface and more than 200 tiles above the bottom of the world. They cannot be generated more than 320 tiles away from the edge of the world, and can only be generated on Dirt Blocks, grass, Mud Blocks, Hives, Stone Blocks, or Ebonstone / Crimstone Blocks. Multiple Glow Tulips always have at least 120 tiles horizontally or vertically between them. See below for the technical details of the generation process.

As the name suggests, the Glow Tulip glows in the dark. It has the same light color as Xenon Moss, making it very difficult to spot near patches of Xenon Moss. It has the same light color as Xenon Moss, making it very difficult to spot near patches of Xenon Moss.

The Glow Tulip and Caveling Gardener are part of the crossover with Core Keeper, a survival sandbox game. In Core Keeper, the Glow Tulip is a common crop and the Caveling Gardener is an enemy that plants Snare Plants that they use as a means of attack.
Despite its name, it is completely unrelated to Columns such as the Granite and Marble Columns, which are background items.

The Palladium Column is likely a reference to Andrea Palladio, who was an Italian architect in the Renaissance. He was primarily influenced by Greek and Roman architecture, hence the colonnades on many Palladian buildings. He had a huge influence on Western architecture, and was the main inspiration for James Hoban, who designed the original White House.
As Flarefin Koi are only caught in lava, the Lavaproof Fishing Hook, Hotline Fishing Hook, or any pole using Underworld Critters as bait must be used to catch them.
If a Clentaminator is used to spread the Glowing Mushroom biome, the trees that are converted will become surface Giant Glowing Mushrooms, and vice versa.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Painting Giant Glowing Mushrooms, Glowing Mushroom plants (including Mushroom vine and cattail ), and Mushroom grass will change the color of the light emitted from them.
Although in changelogs these have been referred to as Giant glowing mushrooms, or simply Giant mushrooms, in the source code they are referred to as Mushroom Trees.
On the in-game minimap, they are simply labeled as trees.
