This means that the amount of health restored per second during constant combat equals to the recharge rate, while the initial healing burst capped by the maximum value.

One of the most efficient ways to play with this armor is by owning both the Spectre Hood and the Spectre Mask and switching between them, depending on the situation. This way the player will be able to both keep themselves alive and deal continuous high damage.

The average DPS of the Spectre Mask's damage orbs cannot be increased beyond the cap through damage bonuses, but it can be increased through critical strike chance bonuses. As a result, accessory builds that emphasize critical strike chance will be stronger than usual, and weapons with boosted critical rates like the Stellar Tune and Staff of Earth will increase the potency of the set bonus.

Since the base DPS of the damage orbs is essentially a fixed value (400 DPS at max), the Spectre Mask set is a good fit for defensive mages, since the loss of damage from running Warding modifiers instead of Menacing/Lucky does not affect the damage dealt by the set bonus. Using defensive accessories also synergizes well with the Spectre Hood set, since its effect is also defensive.

Spectre armor with the Spectre Hood is widely considered useless against the Moon Lord (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), whose Moon Bite debuff disables lifesteal effects unless one moves far enough to avoid his tongue to latch on. However, such strategy is usually ineffective since the Moon Lord can teleport to the player if they move too far from him.

The lifesteal cap can be somewhat bypassed by dealing an enormous amount of damage in a single hit, such as with the Nebula Blaze. This can be useful when fighting the Moon Lord, to maximize the amount of health gained after Moon Bite wears off but before it is reapplied.
The combined effects of Mana Sickness and the Spectre Hood's damage reduction will render many magic weapons too weak to be effective, so players should find an alternate means of restoring mana.

Magic Cuffs or Celestial Cuffs synergize well with the Spectre Hood as they capitalize on any damage taken; with a highly-damaging weapon like the Razorpine, it is possible to maintain both health and mana at comfortable levels.
The Spectre Hood's stat decrease is only caused indirectly, via the set bonus.

Spectre is another word for ghost or spirit, alluding to the fact that the Ectoplasm, required for crafting the armor set, is dropped by Dungeon Spirits. Although Re-Logic is based in the United States, spectre is the British spelling of the word, with the American spelling being specter. Although Re-Logic is based in the United States, spectre is the British spelling of the word, with the American spelling being specter.
The Shroomite armor 's stealth bonus can give this set an excellent ghost-like effect.
The jump speed and safe falling distance bonuses stack with the Frog Leg and its other upgrades.
The Stardust Cell Shots are fired at a rate of once every 0.6 seconds on average. [2]
The Stardust Cell's attacks cannot be reflected.
Any number of Stardust Cells can damage a target at a time; they have no invincibility frames between each other's hits.
The Stardust Cells have a large attack radius that is equal to that of minions obtainable at earlier stages in the game, such as the Hornet, Imp, Sanguine Bat, and Twins.

Often while the player is traveling across the map, Stardust Cells may seem to be lazily veering away from the summoner towards something off-screen. This is because they have targeted a far-away enemy that is moving into teleport range.

Shots from the Stardust Cell can never miss until the target is defeated. Because of this, the minion does not need to aim and can shoot mini-cells regardless of the speed, distance, or the maneuvering of its target as long as it is within teleportation range. This is a notable difference from the Xeno Staff : the Xeno Staff's UFO must catch up to the enemy first before it can fire, which some fast enemies or bosses can outrun. This is a notable difference from the Xeno Staff : the Xeno Staff's UFO must catch up to the enemy first before it can fire, which some fast enemies or bosses can outrun.
Damage ticking from mini-cells retains its original pace regardless of when additional mini-cells were added.

The Stardust Cell Staff is generally considered to be an upgrade to the Xeno Staff. Unlike the Xeno Staff's UFOs, however, the Stardust Cells do not re-target instantly after an enemy has been defeated. This increased targeting speed can bring the Xeno Staff on par with the Stardust Cell Staff under certain circumstances, such as against larger groups of enemies.
Its male and female variants look identical.
Apples are native to regions in Central Asia, and various species can be found worldwide.
The Apple's tooltip is a nod to the proverb " an apple a day keeps the doctor away " and the enemy Doctor Bones.
Despite the similarities in name, it cannot be used to make the Apple Pie.
The item tooltip is nearly identical to that of the Regal Delicacy, the Queen Slime's pet-summoning item, which reads 'A dessert fit for a queen!'.
The pet that is summoned is very similar to that summoned by Jewel of Light and has the same flight patterns.
As the Clentaminator affects a rather large area, creating areas of localized Crimstone Walls without converting blocks and other wall parts may be difficult, making throwing Blood Water more viable.
While it is named Crimstone Wall, it resembles Crimtane Ore.
Despite Gemstone Blocks selling for 5 SC, Gemstone Walls have no value.
Since Amber cannot generate as an ore, there are no naturally generated, unsafe Amber Stone Walls that can be found.
Safe Sandstone Walls can be converted into natural, unsafe walls by spraying solutions onto them.
Despite being called the Martian Hover Chair, it cannot be placed in midair.
While sitting on a chair, chairs within a maximum of 2 tiles horizontally can also be sat on.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Chairs slightly increase health regeneration on top of the bonus from standing still, a feature shared with sleeping in a bed. This can be most easily seen by comparing health regeneration right after standing still, moving, and sitting in a chair.

Even though the Dynasty Chair's sprite might seem like it's only 1 tile high, and sitting on it positions the player on a lower level than when sitting on other chairs, it is still 2 tiles high when placed, like any other chair.
The Toilet and the Golden toilet also work for crafting purposes with the Work Bench / Table but no other toilets seem to work.
The Crystal Chair, Sandstone Chair, and Martian Hover Chair seem to be the only chairs with a "backwards" inventory sprite.
The Gothic Chair is the only chair found in the Dungeon that is not specific to the Dungeon's color.
An NPC and a Town Cat (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can sit in the same chair at once.
The Dynasty Chair is the only chair that NPCs can not sit on, despite it counting for the requirement of a home.

The game uses the player's Fishing Power to determine the minimum and maximum amount of Frost Daggerfish fished in a single pull. Then, the maximum amount has four independent chances to be increased by 6, also based on Fishing Power. [1] The minimum amount and maximum amount is determined by following formulas. Decimals are always rounded down after each division. Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 4 + 15 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 2 + 40 ) ÷2 Then, roll four integers from these intervals: [0, 49], [0, 99], [0, 149], [0, 199]. The maximum amount is increased by 6 for each integer that is less than player's Fishing Power (e.g. if the four integers are 49, 56, 90, 36 while Fishing Power is 90, the maximum amount will be increased by 18). Finally, roll a random integer from this interval: [Min, Max]. This integer would be the amount of Frost Daggerfish fished up. The minimum amount and maximum amount is determined by following formulas. Decimals are always rounded down after each division. Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 4 + 15 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 2 + 40 ) ÷2 Minimum amount: Min = ( Fishing Power ÷ 4 + 15 ) ÷2 Maximum amount: Max = ( Fishing Power ÷ 2 + 40 ) ÷2 Then, roll four integers from these intervals: [0, 49], [0, 99], [0, 149], [0, 199]. The maximum amount is increased by 6 for each integer that is less than player's Fishing Power (e.g. if the four integers are 49, 56, 90, 36 while Fishing Power is 90, the maximum amount will be increased by 18). Finally, roll a random integer from this interval: [Min, Max]. This integer would be the amount of Frost Daggerfish fished up.
The Frost Daggerfish is one of three fished consumables, the other two being the Honeyfin and the Bomb Fish.
The player can be seen strumming the Stellar Tune as it is used.

In order from closest to furthest away from the player, the chords played are as follows: G major – A minor – B minor – C major – D major – E minor. When the item is selected in the hotbar, the chord the instrument will currently play will be displayed underneath the cursor.
While pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack key repeatedly increases the rate at which notes are played, the rate at which projectiles are fired actually decreases.
As the weapons that the Empress of Light drops are based on her attacks, the Stellar Tune seems to be based on her Everlasting Rainbow.
The name Stellar Tune might be a reference to the Stellartone brand of tone controls for electric guitars and bass.
The Venom Dart Trap can shoot through a single block directly in front of it.
The Venom Dart Trap is one of the few types of traps that cannot be found naturally, the others being the Trapped Chest and the Land Mine.
Despite being called thieves, they never steal anything (except for dropped money in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ). This is referenced by one of the Goblin Tinkerer 's quotes.
The Bestiary entry for the Goblin Peon: " Common footsoldiers of the Goblin Army, these foul creatures are good for little more than cannon fodder... and breaking down doors. "
This pet is not affected by liquids but will play a "splashing" sound when entering any liquid.

In real life, only adult hornets feed on nectar, along with plant foods rich in sugar, and only attack and kill other insects to feed to their offspring. Hornet larvae then produce a sweet secretion, containing sugars and other essential nutrients, that is consumed by adult workers and queens.
The Chlorophyte armor 's Leaf Crystal may fire at the Tablet, which may lead to the player accidentally making the Cultists aggressive.
The Tablet is not a light source, despite the fact that it appears to be surrounded by a flame-like energy.
The Moon Lord cannot be summoned using the Celestial Sigil if the Mysterious Tablet is visible to any player.
The Mysterious Tablet resembles the Celestial Sigil, a boss-summoning item used to summon the Moon Lord. It appears to have the Moon Lord's face on it.
The Mysterious Tablet, along with the Cultists, can have its spawn slightly changed by moving the blocks directly above and below them.
If the Tablet is spawned in and made vulnerable using third-party software, it can be heard that the hurt sound is the same as the mechanical bosses ', and the death sound is an explosion.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) In For the worthy and Get fixed boi worlds, Moss Hornets fire stingers roughly twice as quickly and release a burst of stingers in random directions upon death.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Moss Hornets contribute towards the total for dropping the Hornet Banner and do not have their own banner.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Even though the Moss Hornet seems to have a stinger on its sprite, they do not drop Stingers.
Demonite Ore and Crimtane Ore do not spread the Corruption and Crimson during Hardmode.

Hardmode enemies will begin spawning as soon as the Wall of Flesh is defeated. The stripes of Corruption/Crimson and Hallow, however, need to be generated by the game, and the message " The ancient spirits of light and dark have been released. " will appear when the generation is finished. The generation time depends on world size. If the player exits the world before the message appears, the loading description " Setting hard mode " [ sic ] will appear and the player has to wait for the game to generate the Hardmode biomes before returning to the main menu. The generation time depends on world size. If the player exits the world before the message appears, the loading description " Setting hard mode " [ sic ] will appear and the player has to wait for the game to generate the Hardmode biomes before returning to the main menu.

It is not possible to revert a Hardmode world into pre-Hardmode unless a third-party map editor is used. Beyond toggling the Hardmode state this approach would still involve tedious work if the player wishes to completely restore, either by gameplay or map viewer tools, the world as it was before Hardmode. For re-experiencing pre-Hardmode, it is advised to either backup the world before entering Hardmode or simply make a new world.
During Hardmode, Hellstone can be destroyed with Dynamite and Bombs.

When beginning Hardmode, a player can easily become overwhelmed by the difficult new enemies, which have health and damage many times greater than pre-Hardmode enemies. It is advisable to start by identifying the player's most damaging weapons and investing money in reforging them to acquire high damage bonuses, as well as reforging their accessories to boost stats. Low-tier Hardmode weapons begin at around 40 damage, so pre-Hardmode weapons of use will be the Sunfury, Night's Edge, and Flamarang as melee options, the Molten Fury, Hellwing Bow, or guns like the Pheonix Blaster for ranged, the Flower of Fire and Flamelash for magic, and the Spinal Tap (or Firecracker if one is dropped by the Wall of Flesh) and Imp Staff for summoners. Reforging these and making use of other damage boosts from accessories or armor bonuses can easily push these weapons into damage ranges that will make Hardmode fights relatively balanced.

Because Hardmode relies more upon drops than treasure chests (which have mostly been looted by then), players will need to kill large numbers of the tougher enemies for essential crafting materials. Consider building dedicated farming areas.
Mechanical bosses and invasions can take the player off guard. It is advisable to leave and rejoin if the player is ill-prepared.
The start of hardmode offers several viable and even top-tier weapons, such as the Shadowflame Knife and Spider Staff.
Tin Shortsword is the second weakest of all the shortswords, being only more effective than the Copper Shortsword.
Despite being the counterpart of the Copper Shortsword, it cannot be used to craft the Zenith.
Due to the fact that the Tin shortsword is a Copper shortsword tin equivalent, and is also less known and used, it has gained a slight memetic effect on the community.
Melee speed does not affect the rate of fire on the Vampire Knives, instead only increasing the velocity and distance its projectiles travel.
Because the lifesteal effect is rounded down, the Vampire Knives will not heal the player if the knives deal less than 14 damage.

At full speed (when first thrown), the projectiles travel at 77 mph. Due to their high speed, some of them can travel through 1-tile thick walls. Due to their high speed, some of them can travel through 1-tile thick walls.
The player is healed immediately upon dealing damage, rather than when the red beams touch them.
The Vampire Knives cannot be obtained in Corruption worlds as they lack a Crimson Chest. Instead, the Dungeon has a Corruption Chest containing a Scourge of the Corruptor.
Reflected red knives (e.g. from a spinning Selenian (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) ) that hit the player will not trigger lifesteal.
The projectiles may disappear visually a few tiles before they actually become ineffective.
One of the red knives will always aim at the cursor's location.

At least 4 red knives will always be thrown. There are 4 independent chances (1/2, 1/4, 1/8, and 1/16) to increase this number by 1, [1] resulting in a maximum possible number of projectiles of 8. The following table visualizes the number of projectiles and the respective chances:

Despite the Vampire Knives having very low damage for its tier, they are one of the only methods to gain lifesteal in the game, the other being the Spectre armor with the Hood. The lifesteal effect makes the weapon helpful to have as a sidearm (even towards endgame) or with a tank build. With proper preparation, it can be impossible to die.

The Vampire Knives are less useful against the Moon Lord (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) because of the Moon Bite (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) debuff it can apply to the player, disabling the lifesteal effect.
The Flask of Ichor increases damage dealt per hit, and thus increases lifesteal.

The Vampire Knives will lifesteal 10x the normal amount from Crawltipede (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) as they take 10x damage from attacks. However, this makes the gaps between heals longer due to how lifesteal works.
The Vampire Knives were Leinfors ' favorite weapon. [2]

The pet is the female counterpart of the Slime Prince, spawned with the Royal Delight. The buff tooltip, "She is the higher authority", is connected to the Slime Prince buff's tooltip, "He answers to a higher authority". The buff tooltip, "She is the higher authority", is connected to the Slime Prince buff's tooltip, "He answers to a higher authority".
When the player is far enough away, the Slime Princess will fly to the player with her wings, similar to Queen Slime.

Following community suggestions, developers toyed with the idea that the Royal Delight and Regal Delicacy could be crafted together into one pet-summoning item. However, this was not implemented until 1.4.4. [1]

If any background objects or solid blocks obstruct the pot's path from the player to the cursor's location when the Snake Charmer's Flute is used, it will be placed at the nearest solid block or placed next to or on top of the object closest to the player. This means that it cannot be used directly in front of particularly tall trees, and will sit on top of tall grass, cacti, tree branches, other pots, and the like.
The pot and snake can be summoned in lava where the default variety of rope cannot be placed.

This item is a good pre-Hardmode alternative to the Ice Rod for building into the sky, as blocks can be placed next to the snake. Related to that, it is possible to easily climb to the top of the Space layer by alternating between using the flute and placing blocks next to the snake. Using this method makes it very easy to search for floating islands in early pre-Hardmode. Related to that, it is possible to easily climb to the top of the Space layer by alternating between using the flute and placing blocks next to the snake. Using this method makes it very easy to search for floating islands in early pre-Hardmode. Using this method makes it very easy to search for floating islands in early pre-Hardmode.
It seems that the pot cannot be summoned off-screen. As a result, it cannot be used to lower oneself into a pit.
It has one of the slowest use times in the game, tied with the Magic Conch, Demon Conch, Magic Mirrors, Cell Phone, and Shellphone.
Explosives can be used to break the snake, causing it to split and reveal its tail unobscured by the pot.
In Journey Mode, Golden Delight can be quickly researched after using Cans Of Worms, which can give Gold Worms and only require two cans to be researched.
The Golden Delight's tooltip ' (Au)some!' is a pun on the interjection "Awesome!" and the chemical symbol for gold, "Au".
The Golden Delight has the longest buff duration of any food item.
The Golden Delight's achievement sprite resembles Beef Wellington, a dish made of steak wrapped in pastry.
The Frost Hydra does no contact damage to enemies. However, if a player contacts it in PvP, it will deal full damage and disappear.
Once cast, the player can switch to another weapon and the Hydra will remain and still do damage.
The Frost Hydra provides a large burst of light on its initial appearance. Its projectile also produces moderate light.
The Hydra can be summoned within solid blocks, which can be used to find ores and caves.
The Frost Hydra inflicts summon damage, so it will only benefit from minion damage bonuses. However, certain magic bonuses will affect the Staff's initial summoning (e.g. decreased mana use).
The Frost Blast applies 10 ticks of static immunity frames upon hitting an enemy. Due to the lack of local immunity frames summoning more than one will cause them to interfere with each other.
The Frost Hydra remains even if the player dies.
The high damage, versatile remote placement capability and lighting effect makes this Staff a valuable auxiliary weapon.

The remote capabilities of the Frost Hydra make it useful for battles and invasions, since it can be placed and left alone to slay enemies while the player does other things, such as making purchases, hiding, or fighting enemies in a different location.
The Frost Hydra will fall when blocks below it are removed, making it useful for guarding the player while digging vertical tunnels.
The Frost Hydra can also be useful in exploring caves as it can be summoned inside blocks and emits light.
Despite being named after the Lernaean Hydra in Greek mythology, the Frost Hydra sentry only has one head.
The Frost Hydra measures approximately 4 tiles wide by 3 high and is semi-transparent.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Crafting the Fire Gauntlet from the Mechanical Glove does not reduce any of its stat boosts, making it strictly an upgraded version of the latter.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) One may probably find it more useful to keep the Mechanical Glove, since, unlike many other combined accessories, the Fire Gauntlet loses some functionality of its constituent parts. The Mechanical Glove gives 3% more damage and speed in its boost than the Fire Gauntlet, and the On Fire! damage from the Fire Gauntlet is negligible.

The Fire Gauntlet can be worn alongside the Mechanical Glove with the effects of both stacking, greatly boosting damage and melee speed. This is useful for the few hardmode weapons significantly affected by melee speed such as the Psycho Knife or Fetid Baghnakhs.
The Gladius can be considered the pre-Hardmode version of the Starlight, due to its similar attack style.
The tooltip is a reference to the 2000 epic historical drama movie Gladiator.
Gladius is Latin for sword. It also refers to the specific weapon commonly used by ancient Roman foot soldiers.
Although related to lava, they can be placed in water, and used for underwater lighting.

In Don't dig up and Get fixed boi worlds, the Ash Wood armor receives the following changes: Each set piece only has 1 defense, for a total of 3. The set bonus reduces lava damage from 200 to 72, [1] a decrease of 64% instead of only 50%. The set bonus reduces the duration of the On Fire! debuff to 7 / 14 / 17.5 seconds. [1] This is the same absolute decrease as in other worlds, but the relative bonus is only a 33.33% decrease instead of 50% since the debuff normally lasts for 10.5 / 21 / 26.25 seconds in Don't dig up and Get fixed boi. Each set piece only has 1 defense, for a total of 3. The set bonus reduces lava damage from 200 to 72, [1] a decrease of 64% instead of only 50%. The set bonus reduces the duration of the On Fire! debuff to 7 / 14 / 17.5 seconds. [1] This is the same absolute decrease as in other worlds, but the relative bonus is only a 33.33% decrease instead of 50% since the debuff normally lasts for 10.5 / 21 / 26.25 seconds in Don't dig up and Get fixed boi.
The Ash Wood armor's set bonus stacks with the Obsidian Rose and its derivatives. If both are equipped, the player is fully immune to damage from lava.

The player likely already has better armor at the point that Ash Wood armor is usually obtained. However, it may still be useful due to its set bonus, especially if the player intends to spend more time around lava.

The Flask of Ichor will make melee weapons and whips glow when they are used. In combination with yoyos (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or whips (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), it can be a good lighting source in dark areas. The light being emitted from the weapon provides the same amount of light as the Ultrabright Torch. The light being emitted from the weapon provides the same amount of light as the Ultrabright Torch.
The Flask of Ichor offers the greatest DPS increase of any flask as long as the player deals damage at least (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 4 times per second.

Due to its ability to phase through blocks, extra care should be taken when AFKing the Pirate Invasion event, as the Curse can quickly kill an unwary player, especially in Expert or Master Mode. A solution might be to summon a minion that will take care of the Curse.

Its skeletal appearance and the fact that it spawns after the Pirate Captain is killed, as well as its name, are likely references to the 2003 American fantasy swashbuckler film Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl, as the film featured pirates who were cursed to never die and appear as skeletons in moonlight.

The Pirate's Curse, Jungle Mimic, Golden Slime, and Spiked Slime are the only killable enemies without Bestiary entries. Furthermore, it is the only killable enemy without a Bestiary entry which can be encountered on any world, regardless of seed and difficulty.
The Endurance Potion, Beetle armor at its 45% state, and Worm Scarf (17%) will reduce damage by about 60%.
The Endurance Potion is more effective than the Ironskin Potion against attacks that deal more than 40 / 60 / 80 damage; however, it is most effective to use both at the same time.

The Switch is identical in operation to the Lever, except Switches cannot be placed on platforms. The Lever is also easier to see and provides a larger clicking target, whereas Switches can be more difficult to spot and click on due to being only a single tile in size (which may actually be a benefit in PvP, should a player wish to hide a trap mechanism). Switches can be painted like most other blocks, allowing them to be camouflaged to blend in with their surroundings.

If the sand projectile lands on an already occupied tile, it will disappear, without turning into a Sand Block. If the projectile lands on a mid-air tile, it will turn into a falling sand ball. Just like a regular falling sand ball, it cannot land on various things, like Saplings and Minecart Tracks. Instead, the Sand Block will (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) turn into its item form / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) disappear. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) When the projectile lands on a statue [2], it will turn into a Sand Block and turn the statue into its item form. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) When the projectile lands on a statue [2], it will turn into a Sand Block and turn the statue into its item form.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Sandgun receives the specialized boosts from the Shroomite Helmet.

The Sandgun can often create sandy messes, and can also block the player from being able to land another hit on an enemy. Using it to fight enemies can become difficult. An effective way to utilize the Sandgun in an arena without creating a mess is to utilize a background object to destroy Sand Blocks or turn them into items, allowing for no sand build-up and easy sand recovery. The best option for this is Minecart Tracks, which are cheap to craft and place faster than any other block. Torches or Coin Piles (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) are also options. An effective way to utilize the Sandgun in an arena without creating a mess is to utilize a background object to destroy Sand Blocks or turn them into items, allowing for no sand build-up and easy sand recovery. The best option for this is Minecart Tracks, which are cheap to craft and place faster than any other block. Torches or Coin Piles (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) are also options. The best option for this is Minecart Tracks, which are cheap to craft and place faster than any other block. Torches or Coin Piles (Desktop, Console, Old-gen console and Mobile versions) are also options.

The Sandgun is incredibly strong for when it can be obtained, falling just shy of the Handgun in raw damage and speed. However, the resulting Sand can impede the player if they miss enough shots. Consider using a Featherfall Potion and shooting downwards to avoid the falling sand. With Ebonsand or Crimsand ammo, the Sandgun can deal 1 more damage than the Handgun with Meteor Shots in exchange for 1 slower use speed. If using this for exploration, however, be aware that the sand will spread evil biomes in Hardmode. With Ebonsand or Crimsand ammo, the Sandgun can deal 1 more damage than the Handgun with Meteor Shots in exchange for 1 slower use speed. If using this for exploration, however, be aware that the sand will spread evil biomes in Hardmode.

The Sandgun is a good option against Skeletron and for exploring the Dungeon, with Dungeon Bricks preventing evil biome spread in Hardmode and getting similar damage to the Molten Fury with faster projectile speed and infinite piercing.

Using the Sandgun to fight against the Wall of Flesh can be effective because the boss forces the player to continually move away, thus avoiding the resulting Sand. However, fallen Sand can disrupt placed stairs, meaning a hell bridge made of platforms might have to be repaired after the battle. The piercing capability of biome Sand Blocks is also ideal for damaging the Hungry and the Wall of Flesh at the same time. If the Corruption or Crimson does not naturally affect a Desert in the world, Vile or Vicious Powder can be used to get ammo. The piercing capability of biome Sand Blocks is also ideal for damaging the Hungry and the Wall of Flesh at the same time. If the Corruption or Crimson does not naturally affect a Desert in the world, Vile or Vicious Powder can be used to get ammo.
While a regular Sand projectile can only hit one enemy, the falling sand ball generated by it will deal considerable damage to enemies it strikes as it falls.
The Sandgun can function as a more reliable (albeit slower to spread) version of Thrown Water due to its ability to shoot sand of all types.
The ability to place sand can be useful in blocking tunnels or filling lava -filled gaps from a distance.

The Gravedigger's Shovel (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can synergize very well with the Sandgun. Both are obtainable at the start of the game with no prior requirements (other than to craft them). The Gravedigger's Shovel can dig up massive quantities of ammo for the Sandgun and allow for very quick and easy sand clean-up without relying on explosives or higher-tier pickaxes. However, it requires a Graveyard (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) mini-biome to be present, which may be difficult to obtain very early on for Hardcore characters.

The Sandgun's sprite resembles the Illegal Gun Parts that are used to craft it. This is because when the Sandgun was introduced, it was the only item to use Illegal Gun Parts in its recipe. This is because when the Sandgun was introduced, it was the only item to use Illegal Gun Parts in its recipe.
The Sandgun is the only weapon crafted at a Furnace.

Despite the large cost to obtain this weapon ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 20 GC / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 25 GC for Illegal Gun Parts, and getting 10 Antlion Mandibles can be tedious because of the low drop rate), its sell price is absurdly low ( 20 SC ), reducing the potential cost that a player will need to get a good modifier.
It is the only gun -styled weapon whose ammunition can be retrieved.
The gun works with the same mechanics that the Antlion uses. This could be why Antlion Mandibles are used to craft the gun.

Despite Amber being found exclusively in Desert biomes and having a much closer relation to sand, the Sandgun uses Topaz in its crafting recipe. This is likely because the Sandgun was introduced before Amber was.

The Gingerbread Cookie's tooltip, ' Not the gumdrop buttons!', is a reference to a line from the Gingerbread Man in the 2001 animated film Shrek, who says the line while being interrogated by Lord Farquaad.
If Ancient Shadow armor is equipped in social slots, the visual after-image effect will still appear, even though the set bonus will not be given.
The set bonus is still given if Ancient Shadow armor and Shadow armor are mixed. However, the visual after-image effect that comes with either set will not be given.
The visual after-image effect will not appear if something else is equipped in one of the three social armor slots.
With a decent amount of gear with a new player, Eaters of Souls can be farmed to skip to Shadow armor very early on.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The Corrupt Statue allows this armor to be obtained even in Crimson worlds.

Despite its very low drop chance, it is actually quite easy to farm. Simply make two sloped sides leading onto lava. The Eater of Souls' AI will simply fly at the slopes and be guided onto the lava, allowing the player to farm mostly AFK. It is wise to build it in the air to make sure Devourers do not disturb the farming process.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It can be very profitable to turn gems into stained glass and sell that instead of selling the gems outright due to the low value of the materials required.
One can achieve a Stained Glass look on foreground Glass blocks by simply painting the Glass in a deep color.
Diamond is the only gem without a stained glass variant, likely due to its white color.

Despite having its own variant, Orange Stained Glass, Amber is not used in the crafting recipe for Multicolored Stained Glass. This is probably because Orange Stained Glass was introduced in 1.4.0.1 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), whereas the multicolored variant was added in 1.2.

Players without the ability to mine Ebonstone and who have not yet obtained a climbing aid like Grappling Hooks will want to avoid falling into chasms. Some chasms can be very difficult or impossible to climb out of by merely jumping between ledges.
Beginning players may want to cover corruption chasm entrances with Blocks or Platforms to avoid inadvertently falling in when traversing the surface.
Running Platforms across the shaft at intervals can help, as can running Ropes down the length of the shaft.
Using Purification Powder on the Ebonstone will turn it into Stone, which can be mined with any Pickaxe. This is useful for getting to the Shadow Orbs without access to explosives.
Krampus is known in Alpine folklore as the evil version of Santa Claus (or a companion of Saint Nicholas), punishing or capturing children who misbehave during the Christmas season.

Early into Hardmode, it is usually preferable to save Titanium for armor and weapons, as the Titanium Drill does not allow mining any new blocks that the Mythril and Orichalcum pickaxes and drills would not mine.
Tombstones are always dropped when the player dies, regardless of the difficulty setting.

In worlds with a Hardcore character, the Angler and Princess will not drop a Tombstone, as they leave instead of being slain. The Traveling Merchant will drop a Tombstone despite not being a town NPC, but the Old Man and Skeleton Merchant will not.

Tombstones can be easily farmed by placing Hellstone or Meteorite directly under the world spawn point and then creating a new character. The player will die and respawn continuously, creating a Tombstone each time. Alternatively, it can be done by digging straight down from the spawn point so the player will die from fall damage. The spawn point can also be flooded with water to drown the player, but it is less efficient than other methods. The spawn point can also be flooded with water to drown the player, but it is less efficient than other methods.
In Journey Mode, even when the enemy spawn rate is set to 0× the normal rate, mining up Tombstones may still cause Ghosts to spawn.
Golden Tombstones, like all other tombstones, have no sell value.

On the Xbox 360 version, before an unspecified patch, certain terms which could be considered profanity or sexual content written on Tombstones would have resulted in the Tombstone saying "(Censored)".
There is no golden variant of the Obelisk in any version of the game.
The Strange Looking Tombstone is part of the Worms 3 crossover.
Like all Sandstorm enemies, the Sand Elemental is subject to certain spawning restrictions. She can only spawn on Sand Blocks (of any variant) and requires enough Sand Blocks nearby.

The Ancient Storms cannot pass through blocks. Standing underneath a platform of solid blocks will make the Sand Elemental unable to hit the player with Ancient Storms. However, this may leave the player vulnerable to burrowing enemies, specifically Dune Splicers and Sand Sharks.

Using the Rod of Discord to teleport to the other side of the Ancient Storms may be useful; however, it inflicts the Chaos State debuff after use, so the player should be careful with how often they use it.

The Sand Elemental deals much more damage with her Ancient Storms than by contact, which can be exploited to avoid most of her damage through invincibility frames or through absorbing the damage with high defense.

It might be preferable to lure the Sand Elemental out of the Desert biome to avoid the other powerful enemies that spawn during a Sandstorm, like Dune Splicers and Sand Sharks. Alternatively, a mount that offers infinite flight could be used to avoid these enemies. In Master Mode, the Pirate Ship Mount can be obtained from the Pirate Invasion before fighting any major Hardmode bosses. Alternatively, a mount that offers infinite flight could be used to avoid these enemies. In Master Mode, the Pirate Ship Mount can be obtained from the Pirate Invasion before fighting any major Hardmode bosses.

Elementals are magical entities who embody or personify a force of nature. Historically, elementals personify one of the four classical elements : earth, water, air, or fire (sometimes plants, and later included aether). In the fantasy role-playing game Dungeon & Dragons, elementals which are fusions and other unconventional elementals have been introduced.
The Sand Elemental is the only Hardmode surface Desert enemy that has no Corruption, Crimson, nor Hallow variations.

Similar to the Ice Golem, Mothron, and the Dreadnautilus, the Sand Elemental is not a boss or mini-boss even though she has stats comparable to a boss. This is evidenced by her lack of a boss health bar, the fact that she drops a banner, not a trophy, and the fact that she does not drop a relic in Master Mode.
There are no potted variants of Corruption / Crimson trees, or boreal trees.
Potted Bamboos appear to have a woody stalk, unlike the solid green color of actual Bamboo.
It was originally suggested by Leinfors, a former Terraria forum moderator, beta tester, and programmer. Verify
As with all piercing projectiles, spear will inflict invincibility frames.
(Old-gen console version) In singleplayer, Spear Traps inflict the Frostburn debuff if the player wears Frost armor.
Spear Traps are good for battle arenas.
When actuated, Spear Traps can be used as a very efficient way to kill off bosses, or clear waves in events like Pumpkin Moon and Frost Moon, easily.
The Slime Banner can be farmed using Slime Statues.
It somewhat resembles the Mushroom Wall.
Shroomite Plating Wall is tied with the Zenith for having the longest item decrafting tree (through shimmer ).

Due to the Sphere's high defense, Vampire Knives and Spectre Hood 's self-healing effect may not work on them if the player does not have enough damage buffs; the attacks will not deal enough damage to give health back.
Since they cannot get close to the player if blocks are in their way, blocking them off is enough to avoid taking damage from them.
Due to the Deadly Spheres' small size, minions and homing weapons are the most effective way to take them out.
Deadly Spheres have one of the highest defense ratings out of any enemy in the game, making weapons that deal large amounts of damage particularly useful.
Deadly Spheres are a reference to the 1979 American science fantasy horror film Phantasm. [1]
Deadly Spheres have an alternate form that remains unused in the game's files.
With 80 defense, it has the third highest defense of all non-boss, non-invincible enemies, topped only by the Sharkron and the Dungeon Guardian.

All informational items except the mechanical ones combine into the PDA, taking one watch for all of them. Nearly all the mechanical accessories ( (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) except the Mechanical Ruler ), combine into The Grand Design. Similarly, most of the status-resistance items (and two related items) combine into the Ankh Shield. (Notable exceptions: Hand Warmer ).

Although it is possible to equip an accessory and its materials at the same time, such as Spectre Boots and Hermes Boots, their effects will not necessarily combine. Stat-boost items are more likely to stack with their own components (for example, the various Emblems), but this is not universal. Check the items' respective pages for which accessories can stack their effects.

Informational accessories (notably all components of the PDA ) do not have to be worn in the accessories slot. They will still provide information if they are in the player's main inventory, but their modifiers will have no effect.
Equipping an accessory which provides immunity to a certain debuff will also remove the debuff if the player is suffering it. This can be a lifesaver, especially if Autopause is turned on.

When multiple accessories that are visible on the same location are worn, such as a Panic Necklace and a Cross Necklace, the accessory on the lowest vanity slot will be visible. If no vanity accessories are worn, the accessory on the lowest equipment slot will be shown.
Accessories that show up on the head, such as a Nature's Gift or Diving Gear, will not show up if a helmet is worn, unless a Familiar Wig is worn over it.
Dyes will affect Wings even if they are not normally visible.
Accessories that have no appearance when worn can still be placed in the vanity slots.

If spare vanity accessory slots are available, it is useful to put "backup" accessories in them. (Again, Autopause is helpful.) For example, the Megaphone can be placed in the vanity slot; if the player gets silenced, the Megaphone can be swapped in to clear the debuff (and if autopaused, exit the inventory for a moment to restart time). Then just switch back as needed. This also makes it easier to swap in swimming buffs when taking to the water. Alternatively, Loadouts (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be used for this purpose. Alternatively, Loadouts (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be used for this purpose.

Contrary to most items, the damage from the Lawn Mower is not affected by damage boosts of any type, and cannot deal critical strikes. However, its damage is still affected by defense, banners, and armor penetration.
It is able to mow grass vertically (by jumping at the side of a grassy Dirt Block with the Lawn Mower equipped), and in reversed gravity.
The Lawn Mower works with the Smart Cursor and will mow grass at any orientation so long as it is in range. This includes tiles of grass embedded completely in dirt.
The Seeds used by the Blowpipe cannot be planted. Conversely, seeds that can be planted cannot be used as ammo for the Blowpipe.
It cannot be obtained from Wooden Crates, despite the fact that many other rare items found in Wooden Chests can.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) It does not receive any specialized boosts from the Shroomite armor headpieces, though it still receives the stealth boost.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It receives boosts from the Shroomite Helmet.

The Blowpipe is an efficient early-game weapon for eliminating distant foes, with a significantly higher range than the Wooden Boomerang. One advantage it has over bows is that its ammunition can be obtained for free.

In early Hardmode, the Blowpipe and Blowgun are useful for firing Cursed or Ichor Darts. While the Blowgun is stronger overall, the Blowpipe fires faster and can be obtained without a Witch Doctor. Cursed Darts deal decent damage and the necessary Cursed Flames can be obtained in the surface Corruption. Ichor Darts are among the first items that can inflict the handy Ichor debuff. The Ichor needed to craft the darts can only be obtained in the Underground Crimson, though, an area that might be challenging at that stage of the game. Cursed Darts deal decent damage and the necessary Cursed Flames can be obtained in the surface Corruption. Ichor Darts are among the first items that can inflict the handy Ichor debuff. The Ichor needed to craft the darts can only be obtained in the Underground Crimson, though, an area that might be challenging at that stage of the game.
In order to parry an attack, the enemy must collide with the shield before hitting the player.
Due to its high velocity and slow use time, the Sergeant United Shield will usually return to the player a few seconds before it can be thrown again.

The damage dealt by parrying an attack is decreased by banners (25% in Classic or lower, 50% in Expert or above), rerolled inversely by luck (having negative luck will give a chance to increase incoming damage, and increase reflected damage as a result) and capped is at 1,000 damage.

The Sergeant United Shield's parry ability can only be used to parry contact damage from enemies (including enemies that ignore dodges like the Dungeon Guardian ). Fall damage, lava damage, enemy projectiles, and traps will still harm the player. It can, however, reduce damage from these sources with the 20 defense gained while pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button. It can, however, reduce damage from these sources with the 20 defense gained while pressing the ⚷ Open / Activate button.
Parrying in Journey Mode with Godmode enabled will do nothing.
The act of gaining the Striking Moment buff and switching to a more powerful weapon like the Psycho Knife or Meowmere has the potential for massive damage.
This weapon will home in on the separate segments of worms, making it an excellent weapon against them.

The Brand of the Inferno, the Sergeant United Shield, the Sky Dragon's Fury, and the Tome of Infinite Wisdom are the only weapons in Terraria to have two separate means of attack triggered by two different buttons.

This weapon is a reference to the vibranium-steel alloy shield of fictional superhero Captain America, who appears in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. Its tooltip is one of his most iconic lines in the Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.

The Shadow Hand projectile deals 18 base damage and no knockback. [1] It can pierce up to two enemies, dissipating upon hitting a third one, and applies a 15% damage penalty to the next hit for each enemy the projectile pierces. [2] The damage is classless, i.e. it is not affected by specific bonuses to melee/ranged/magic/summon damage. The projectile also has 20 armor penetration. [2] The damage is classless, i.e. it is not affected by specific bonuses to melee/ranged/magic/summon damage. The projectile also has 20 armor penetration. [2]
After summoning a Shadow Hand, the Bone Helm has a cooldown of between 0.33 seconds and 1.67 seconds until it spawns the next Shadow Hand. [1]
The accessory targets any random enemy that is within 31.25 tiles from the player. [1]
The Bone Helm is very useful in tier 1 of the Old One's Army, since the Shadow Hands can pierce many enemies and will also target the Etherian Wyverns.
Like other passively attacking accessories, it can be useful during menial tasks such as fishing or automated farming.

The Bone Helm is the third passively attacking accessory, following the Volatile Gelatin and the Spore Sac. All of these items are exclusive to Expert Mode, but only the Bone Helm can be obtained pre-Hardmode.
Despite being an accessory, the Bone Helm's sprite will override any cosmetic in the player's helmet slot.
The tooltip is a reference to Willow 's examination quote for the Bone Helm in Don't Starve Together.
When wearing Yoraiz0r's Spell and the Bone Helm, the eye glow will be moved up to match the Bone Helm's eye socket, resembling the Ancient Fuelweaver from Don't Starve Together.
Toilet and Golden Toilet are considered as chairs for crafting station purposes.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Several "joke toilets", most notably the Terra Toilet and Diamond Toilet, are obtainable in game and are characterized by their absurd crafting cost.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) The increased Fishing Power when sitting on a Toilet is an effect which started as a joke during beta testing. [2]
Most critters will spawn in the place of enemies near NPCs. Mice, however, will generally not spawn near NPCs.

The spawn rates and spawn caps of critters are affected by many of the same factors as those of hostile enemies, so Water Candles, Peace Candles (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Battle Potions, adjusting the Enemy Spawn Rate slider in Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Calming Potions and Sunflowers will affect critter spawns.
Critters caught with a Bug Net when the player has a full inventory will be dropped in the world as items rather than released.
Critters regenerate health, this can be seen by hitting them with a low damage weapon/tool, like a Copper Axe, Copper Pickaxe or a Wooden Hammer.
Trying to release a Goldfish will cause the goldfish to be consumed.

Once a critter is put inside a cage, bottle, or jar, that single critter can no longer be released, and will stay in there forever. An alternative is to simply release the critter into an enclosed area, though the critter can then despawn if a player travels too far away.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Attempting to catch an Underworld critter with an ordinary Bug Net will result in the player being set On Fire! for 5 seconds and the critter will not be picked up.

Many critters which appear to be two or even one blocks tall in fact require a full three blocks height to move.  If manually placed in a two-block high space they will be unable to move. Three-block-high critters only includes Penguins. In contrast, Worms, Snails, Mice, Sluggy, Grubby and Buggy can crawl in one-block high spaces. Butterflies can fly in one-block-high spaces. Grasshoppers, if placed in a small space, can jump downward through the blocks beneath them until they reach open space. Birds in a one-high space can fly upwards through at least the block above them. Three-block-high critters only includes Penguins. In contrast, Worms, Snails, Mice, Sluggy, Grubby and Buggy can crawl in one-block high spaces. Butterflies can fly in one-block-high spaces. Grasshoppers, if placed in a small space, can jump downward through the blocks beneath them until they reach open space. Birds in a one-high space can fly upwards through at least the block above them.
With several NPCs acquired, keeping Water Candles around suitable housing will cause more critters to spawn, without spawning enemies.

To find exactly how much damage an enemy does, a critter can be placed on the enemy. Critters have 0 defense and enemy damage to it will not vary unlike most situations of dealing damage. Projectiles from enemies will do varying and reduced damage to critters, so it will not work for measuring projectile damage.

For eligible critter types, 1/400 spawns get a valuable golden critter. But since all critters are subject to a spawn cap, few new ones will spawn unless the player is industrious about collecting all those "worthless" critters, increasing turnover.

During a Blood Moon, Bunnies, Goldfish, and Penguins will transform into hostile enemies: Corrupt Bunnies, Corrupt Goldfish and Corrupt Penguins in a Corruption world ( (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Vicious Bunnies, Vicious Goldfish and Vicious Penguins in a Crimson world). So it is recommended for players who are ill-equipped or have low health to either kill or capture any bunny, goldfish, or penguin in their vicinity before nightfall happens. Critters that have been placed in inventory, storage, or cages will not be affected. These same critters can be transformed manually into their corruption form by throwing Vile Powder at them, and their crimson form by throwing Vicious Powder (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). All Bunnies, Goldfish, and Penguins spawned from statues will transform into enemies if they are spawned during a Blood Moon. Once these critters have transformed into hostile enemies, they can no longer be caught with a Bug Net.

Having a Guide to Critter Companionship (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in the inventory will prevent the player from dealing damage to all critters, except for the Explosive Bunny. This includes traps placed by the player.

Lava critters like Hell Butterfly, Lavafly or Magma Snail may be useful for players wanting to fish in lava with any poles (on version 1.4.0.1 or higher), but can be difficult to find. Critters spawn faster when the player does not move much, coming from the sides of the screen. Staying in the same place in The Underworld and killing the various enemies around seems to be the best way to get many lava critters.
On platforms with stereo sound, critter sounds will indicate the critter's direction (left or right).  This is particularly useful for various birds (including owls and ducks), and for frogs.
Birds placed in a Terrarium peck in ascending order, the Blue Jay once, the Bird twice, the Cardinal three times and the Gold Bird four times.
The Bunny, Bird, Goldfish, and Penguin are the only four critters that have banners of themselves.
All of the gem bunnies and squirrels are the same price when sold, despite representing gems of various, often higher prices.
Before 1.4.0.1, the Gold Mouse was probably the rarest non-unique creature in the game; as of 1.4.0.1, the place has probably been taken by either the Gold Seahorse or the Gold Water Strider.
Plastic flamingos are a common lawn ornament in the United States and are often examples of kitsch aesthetics in public media.
Crimera is a portmanteau of the words crimson and chimera, a mythical beast made of parts from different animals.
Crimeras can sometimes be seen flying in the background of the Crismon as ambiance.
The Fish is significantly less rare in Frozen Crates than in Frozen Chests, where it can only be found at a 1 in 50 rate.
While Stoned, the player can still consume recovery potions, via Quick Heal.
If Stoned while grappling or riding a Minecart, the player will disengage and fall.
Only one Medusa can spawn in the world at a time, unless a Medusa Statue is used.

In rare cases, a naturally generated Medusa Statue overlaps with a functional trap. This allows them to be spawned pre-Hardmode when the trap is activated; however, they will only drop the Medusa Banner.

Being inflicted with the Stoned debuff is very dangerous: If the initial fall does not kill the player, the few seconds of stun time could be long enough for Hoplites, Cave Bats, Giant Bats, and other cavern enemies to finish the job. Be wary of large, vertical areas in the caverns (such as the Underground Jungle and player-made hellevators ), especially when there is a Marble Cave nearby. The potential fall damage by itself can easily kill an endgame player. Be wary of large, vertical areas in the caverns (such as the Underground Jungle and player-made hellevators ), especially when there is a Marble Cave nearby. The potential fall damage by itself can easily kill an endgame player.

Note that attacking Medusa with most weapons will cause the player to turn towards her. Try not to engage her until she is within range or use a very accurate ranged weapon, so that she will become stun-locked before she has a chance to attack.
Facing away from Medusa while fighting off other enemies is recommended.

Yoyos, the Magic Missile, and the Flying Knife make great weapons against Medusa as they can be used from behind, and around corners, out of her line of sight. White String will extend the reach of yoyos by 4 or 5 tiles. Ironically, the Medusa Head is also a great weapon against Medusa, as the player can use its "stare" while looking the other way. Ironically, the Medusa Head is also a great weapon against Medusa, as the player can use its "stare" while looking the other way.
Using the Featherfall Potion or equipping Djinn's Curse can still protect the player from taking fall damage, even when they are Stoned.
In Greek mythology, Medusa was a monster, a Gorgon, generally described as a winged human female with living venomous snakes in place of hair. Those who gazed upon her face would turn to stone.
The word marble is of Greek origin, as are Medusa and hoplite. In Terraria, Medusas and Hoplites both spawn in Marble Caves.

The banners of Medusa and the Hoplite do not show the image of the enemy on their corresponding banners. Instead, the Medusa and Hoplite Banners display a snake and helm, respectively, with golden Greek-style patterns.
Although having a similar name, Medusa does not have any connection with Mechdusa.
The female Treasure Hunter set is a reference to Lara Croft from the media franchise Tomb Raider, who is a well-known treasure hunter.
The male Treasure Hunter set is a reference to the Nathan Drake from the action-adventure third-person shooter platform video game series Uncharted.

Unlike most accessories, informational accessories such as the Metal Detector do not need to be equipped in an accessory slot. The Metal Detector may be carried in the player's inventory without loss of functionality, unless equipped to a social slot. Additionally, the info it provides will be shared with players of the same team in multiplayer that are within 50 tiles. Keep in mind modifiers will no longer apply to the player when not equipped.
It does not display the specific type of detected Chest.

The Spelunker Potion and Magic Lantern pair well with the Metal Detector, as they will also reveal the item's location. Additionally, they reveal items the Metal Detector cannot detect, such as gems, and display lower-tier ores when higher-tier ores are masking their detection from the Metal Detector. Additionally, they reveal items the Metal Detector cannot detect, such as gems, and display lower-tier ores when higher-tier ores are masking their detection from the Metal Detector.

Since Life Fruit and Life Crystals are prioritized over ores, it may be preferable to continue collecting them even if they are no longer needed, to prevent them from blocking the display of other valuable items.

There is a trick to help narrow down the location of uncommon ore or other items, such as Adamantite Ore or Strange Plants. Maintaining the same vertical position, mark the points to the left and right in which the Metal Detector no longer detects the item. The item will likely be above or below the midpoint. Alternatively, this can also be done by maintaining the same horizontal position and marking the points above and below. In this case, the item will likely be to the left or right of the midpoint. This is easier with a Compass or a Depth Meter, as exact depths or latitudes for the midpoints can be calculated. The exact measurement is a horizontal radius of 85 tiles (170 feet) and a vertical radius of 60 tiles (120 feet). Verify Another trick is to zoom out and use either Binoculars, Sniper Rifle, or Rifle Scope and its variants paired with Spelunker Potions. This is easier with a Compass or a Depth Meter, as exact depths or latitudes for the midpoints can be calculated. The exact measurement is a horizontal radius of 85 tiles (170 feet) and a vertical radius of 60 tiles (120 feet). Verify The exact measurement is a horizontal radius of 85 tiles (170 feet) and a vertical radius of 60 tiles (120 feet). Verify Another trick is to zoom out and use either Binoculars, Sniper Rifle, or Rifle Scope and its variants paired with Spelunker Potions.
Though they are all detected by the Metal Detector, Life Fruit, Sturdy Fossils, Strange Plants, and pots are not metallic.
Despite the tooltip, it also detects objects other than ores.
Even though Hellstone is the most powerful ore in pre-Hardmode, it will not be detected. Other valuable items like gems are not detected either.

Christmas can be "activated" by setting the device's date to any date within the respective Christmas timespan. Change the computer's date to any day between December 15th and 31st. Disconnect from Xbox Live / PSN and change the console time. Disconnect from automatic date/time updates and change the time manually. Note that this does not work for some devices. Go to "System Settings" and go to "Other Settings, click on "Date and Time", then "Today's Date" and "Current Time" and set the date and time there. Go to "System Settings" and go to "System", click on "Date and Time", turn off "Synchronize Clock via Internet" and set the time there. Change the computer's date to any day between December 15th and 31st. Disconnect from Xbox Live / PSN and change the console time. Disconnect from automatic date/time updates and change the time manually. Note that this does not work for some devices. Go to "System Settings" and go to "Other Settings, click on "Date and Time", then "Today's Date" and "Current Time" and set the date and time there. Go to "System Settings" and go to "System", click on "Date and Time", turn off "Synchronize Clock via Internet" and set the time there.
The flower petals will destroy most background objects, like Pots or the Larva inside a Bee Hive, which can lead to accidentally summoning the Queen Bee.
The flower petals can be triggered by minion attacks and the stars from the Star Cloak.
To color-match items to Orichalcum armor, use Violet Dye instead of Pink Dye.
Orichalcum armor's set bonus is powerful against worm-type enemies like Wyverns or The Destroyer, as the petals will hit all of the worm's segments if they enter at a lucky angle.
This armor is effective with high fire-rate weapons such as the Clockwork Assault Rifle, which can trigger the set bonus constantly.

Orichalcum is a metal mentioned in ancient writings, but its nature and means of creation is lost to history, leaving it known only by name. It is frequently used in fantasy works as a material more valuable than real-world metals, but there is little consistency between its properties in popular culture.
Snails seem to spawn frequently in the Jungle Temple.
Snails are also found in the Underground Jungle and sometimes in Glowing Mushroom biomes.
Snails in Terraria only have two eye stalks, unlike snails in real life, which have two eye stalks and two feeling stalks.

Pedguin's set can be easily obtained using one or more Penguin Statues and a timer. During a Blood Moon, activate the timers and keep killing the Corrupt or Vicious Penguins until all pieces are obtained.
This set is a reference to Terraria streamer and YouTuber Pedguin.
Its tooltip, "'Great for impersonating streamers!'", is both a reference to Pedguin and to developer items, whose tooltips are similar ( " 'Great for impersonating devs!' " ).
Pedguin's set, 0x33's Aviators, and Chippy's Couch are the only pre-Hardmode items to have the 09* base rarity. These items are also all references to Terraria streamers.

If the Cursed Sapling gains too much distance from the player, it will propel itself toward the player while emitting a trail of flames, ignoring blocks and giving off a decent amount of light. If it cannot reach a stable spot to stand on, the Cursed Sapling will start flying around the player in circles. This is a useful feature as a pet, as the light it provides when flying helps find nearby caves. It can, however, make fishing more difficult as the sound the sapling makes when hitting water is identical to that of a bobbing line, forcing the player to rely on sight (or the use of Sonar Potions ) to determine whether anything has been hooked. This is a useful feature as a pet, as the light it provides when flying helps find nearby caves. It can, however, make fishing more difficult as the sound the sapling makes when hitting water is identical to that of a bobbing line, forcing the player to rely on sight (or the use of Sonar Potions ) to determine whether anything has been hooked.
Unlike most pets, the Cursed Sapling item has the same name as the pet it summons.

This behavior can be generalized to all blocks via an Actuator. It allows turning any block inactive via wiring. While Active and Inactive Stone Blocks are obtainable from the beginning of the game, Actuators require defeating Skeletron to gain access to the Mechanic. However, unlike actuated blocks, Inactive Stone Blocks is not a valid support for placing other blocks adjacent to it. This is due to its technical status as a background object. While Active and Inactive Stone Blocks are obtainable from the beginning of the game, Actuators require defeating Skeletron to gain access to the Mechanic. However, unlike actuated blocks, Inactive Stone Blocks is not a valid support for placing other blocks adjacent to it. This is due to its technical status as a background object.

Furniture placed on Active blocks that are turned Inactive will be freed and fall as dropped items. Blocks placed adjacent to them will remain in midair, the same as if the other blocks had been mined away.
Inactive Stone Blocks can be mined with a pickaxe or drill as normal. Furthermore, they will be freed by explosions.

When in a Hardmode biome, it can be easy to spot these naturally generated Active Stone Blocks if the surrounding blocks are in Corruption, Crimson or Hallow because, unlike regular stone blocks, they cannot be corrupted.

Even without the Mechanic (required to obtain wiring tools), this item still has use if harvested from naturally-occurring Boulder traps underground. The player can select this item in the hotbar to see a layout of all wires on screen, which is useful for detecting and avoiding natural traps.

A vertical strip of three Active Stone Blocks wired to a nearby Switch or Lever serves as a good alternative to doors that only players can open. NPCs will not be able to use them to stray outside, and no enemy can ever open them. Note that this will not fulfill a house 's entrance requirement, so at least one actual door will still be required in order for an NPC to move in (though the door need not lead "outside", and can merely open into another room of a larger structure). Using Blue Pressure Plates on either side causes the "door" to turn inactive for a moment, then return to active the very instant the player reaches the other side. As Blue Pressure Plates are only triggered by players, this can also keep Zombies and such out during a Blood Moon. It is also possible to make an airlock-type double door system using 3 Active Stone Blocks and 3 Inactive Stone Blocks (or 6 of one or the other and activating only one side inactive/active) while still only allowing access for players only. This is useful for underground housing to keep underground enemies out. It is also possible to make an airlock-type double door system using 3 Active Stone Blocks and 3 Inactive Stone Blocks (or 6 of one or the other and activating only one side inactive/active) while still only allowing access for players only. This is useful for underground housing to keep underground enemies out.
To conserve storage space, consider switching all Inactive Stone Blocks to Active Stone Blocks, or vice versa. This can easily save an inventory or storage slot by combining the stacks.
The Bone Glove is a useful weapon inside the Dungeon 's tight corridors due to being capable of ricocheting up to three times.
The interval between cursed flames are spawned is randomly determined between 0.1 seconds and 0.33 seconds. [1]

Initially, the Cursed Dart can fly for 5 seconds before disappearing. After spawning a cursed flame projectile, if the remaining time of a Cursed Dart is more than 0.67 seconds, it will be reduced by 0.33 seconds. [3]
While they still fire well beyond the boundaries of the screen, Cursed Darts travel an unexpectedly short distance for ranged weapons, despawning after about 200 tiles (400 feet).
Shooting the dart directly upwards will create a "rain" of flame drips onto a single spot.
Shooting at a diagonal upwards multiple times will result in a wall of flames.
The flames left by the dart can be laid horizontally, resulting in great damage against worm -type enemies, including The Destroyer.
The flames pierce their target, so they will do immense damage against vertically positioned worm-type enemies as well.
Hat Racks are an efficient way to display boss masks, using 24 less Wood than Mannequins or Womannequins would for each 2 masks displayed.
Like with Mannequins and Womannequins, the Familiar Wig cannot be displayed on the Hat Rack.
The Rabbit Perch will not be animated if displayed on the lower part of the Hat Rack.
Its color and pattern schemes are strikingly similar to those of the Star Cloak.

The Alchemy Table counts as a valid flat-surface item for NPC houses. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It also counts as a table for the purposes of crafting watches. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) It also counts as a table for the purposes of crafting watches.

On average, using the Alchemy Table for bulk production can produce up to about 50% more potions than a Placed Bottle with the same quantity of ingredients. However, this is very random, and if one ingredient is in short supply (e.g., pearls for Luck Potions ), the results will be dominated by how often that ingredient happens to not be consumed. Similarly, if two or more ingredients are in short supply, either (any) of them can run out "early" (not making their 1/3 (33.33%) chance as often) and limit production.
Unlike the Placed Bottle, the Alchemy Table can be placed on any block rather than just flat furniture items.
All items that can be crafted at an Alchemy Table or Placed Bottle are decrafted into a random subset of their ingredients when thrown into Shimmer.
The Alchemy Table combined with harvesting plants with the Staff of Regrowth can yield significantly more potions for the same amount of work.
The Alchemy Table's sprite appears to depict a Lesser Restoration Potion, or a Lesser Healing Potion.

In the real world, demons are supernatural beings prevalent historically in religion, occultism, literature, fiction, mythology, and folklore; as well as in media such as comics, video games, movies and television series.
Despite inflicting the Darkness debuff, Demons do not drop the Blindfold.
It must be equipped to work in the Old-gen console version. It will not display the time if it is in the inventory.

While "bouncy" items never come to rest and will continue to bounce for quite some time, they lose energy, and given time will lose height until their bouncing more resembles perpetual rolling. This is true of all bouncy throwables, but is only truly observable with Bouncy Glowsticks, as the others explode well before this effect can occur.
All slimes drop differently colored Gel (which spontaneously changes color when stacked with other colors), but Pink Gel is the only color of Gel that is an actual different item.
Pink Gel was introduced following the suggestion by Terraria Community Forums user Ilmarinen. [1]
Pink Gel cannot be used as ammunition for the Flamethrower or the Elf Melter.
This is the only dedicated summoner armor piece that can be obtained prior to fighting a boss.
On the Console version, the Snowfall Block is simply called "Snowfall", unlike related blocks like Waterfall Block or Lavafall Block. Verify

The Honey Comb will always spawn 1 bee projectile, with two independent 1/3 (33.33%) chances to spawn an extra bee. With the Hive Pack (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) equipped, there is an additional 1/3 (33.33%) chance for an extra bee to be summoned. [1] The average amount of bees summoned per hit is 1.66, or 1.99 with the Hive Pack equipped.

Bees summoned by the Honey Comb have a base damage of (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 13 / 19 / 26 / (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) 7. Giant Bees spawned by the Hive Pack have a base damage of 18 / 27 / 36. [1]

The Bee projectiles from the Honey Comb have a 1/2 (50%) chance to deal 1 extra damage, can pierce enemies or ricochet off solid blocks 3 times in total, and last 10 seconds. With the Hive Pack equipped, all Bee projectiles have a 1/2 (50%) chance to be converted into Giant Bee projectiles, which always deal 1-3 extra damage, have a knockback of 0.5 (Extremely weak), can pierce enemies or ricochet off solid blocks 4 times in total, fly noticeably faster, and last 11 seconds. Both kinds of bee projectiles will dissipate immediately on contact with water or lava. [2]

The bee spawning effect of the Honey Comb, Sweetheart Necklace, Honey Balloon, Bee Cloak, and Stinger Necklace (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) do not stack. The same amount of bees will appear after being damaged no matter how many of these items are equipped.
The Honey Comb works well with a full set of Orichalcum armor as the bee damage will activate the armor's set bonus and causes the flower petals to attack.
Its sticky counterpart, the Sticky Bomb, can be easier to handle and to use for mining ores like Demonite and Crimtane, otherwise requiring an upgraded pickaxe.
The Bouncy Bomb can be very useful in PvP, as it is unpredictable and can easily confuse opponents.
Three out of five of the balloon's tinkers are used in the Bundle of Balloons ; the two that are not used in that tinker are the Fart in a Balloon and Honey Balloon.
The Tsunami in a Bottle is the only double-jump accessory that cannot be tinkered with the Shiny Red Balloon; the Balloon Pufferfish must be used, instead.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Sleeping in a bed causes the Shiny Red Balloon (and its variants) to appear as if it is floating horizontally.
Reforging the Flesh Knuckles to the Warding modifier will grant the player a total of 12 additional defense, a very significant boost for boss fights.

If playing in cooperative multiplayer, the Flesh Knuckles synergize well with Turtle armor, Beetle armor, and Solar Flare armor, as all of these armor sets have the same effect as the Flesh Knuckles – drawing enemy aggro more frequently, likely sparing teammates with less defense from taking as much damage. The Paladin Shield, Hero Shield, and Frozen Turtle Shell can also be equipped for a "tank" build.
It can be used in multiplayer when most of the players are at low health (during boss fights or events) and only one has a good amount of health to avoid further damage to the others.
It and its upgrades can be used to make AFK farms more efficient.

The Flesh Knuckles are The Crimson 's counterpart to The Corruption 's Putrid Scent, since they decrease damage received and increase the odds of being targeted, whereas the Putrid Scent increases damage dealt and decreases odds of being targeted. This is also supported by the fact that both are dropped by their respective Mimics. This is also supported by the fact that both are dropped by their respective Mimics.

Flesh Knuckles are based on real-life brass knuckles, implements worn on one's hands to both increase the damage caused by a punch and reduce the damage from the shock on the user's hands. Despite the name, they are available in several materials, including non-metals such as carbon fiber. The Flesh Knuckles' palm grip, in addition to being made of bone, appears to be spiked, which would make them realistically impractical to wear due to it stabbing into the wearer's hand. The Flesh Knuckles' palm grip, in addition to being made of bone, appears to be spiked, which would make them realistically impractical to wear due to it stabbing into the wearer's hand.

All seasonal events can be "activated" by setting the device's date to any date within the respective event's timespan. Change the computer's date to any day within the timespan. If changing the computer's system date is not desired, applications like RunAsDate can launch Terraria with a specific date. Disconnect from Xbox Live / PSN and change the console time. Disconnect from automatic date/time updates and set the time to any day within the timespan. Note that this may not work for some devices. Go to "System Settings" and set the date there. Change the computer's date to any day within the timespan. If changing the computer's system date is not desired, applications like RunAsDate can launch Terraria with a specific date. If changing the computer's system date is not desired, applications like RunAsDate can launch Terraria with a specific date. Disconnect from Xbox Live / PSN and change the console time. Disconnect from automatic date/time updates and set the time to any day within the timespan. Note that this may not work for some devices. Go to "System Settings" and set the date there.
(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Completing the Pumpkin Moon or Frost Moon event will also unlock the Halloween or Christmas seasonal event for one in-game day.
All 3DS Seasonal Events are also on Windows Phone.

This content is transcluded from NPCs/dropnote. Since town NPCs cannot be damaged by players normally, external damage sources must be used to obtain the Red Hat. The Flymeal (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is one of the easiest options; other effective options include traps, lava, drowning, Boulders or Rolling Cacti (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies, Explosive Bunnies, Land Mines, or the Halloween -exclusive Rotten Eggs (in tandem with Frost armor ). In addition, equipping the Clothier Voodoo Doll allows the player to damage the Clothier with any weapon. In addition, equipping the Clothier Voodoo Doll allows the player to damage the Clothier with any weapon.
While wearing the Red Hat and speaking to the Clothier, he will sometimes say " That Red Hat of yours looks familiar... ".
Despite its name, the Red Hat can be dyed. However, the Clothier still says that it is red, as if it was not dyed.

Due to the low cost and ease of amassing large amounts of Wood, it may be a good idea to craft Wooden Bows until one has the Demonic modifier. In this way the Wooden Bows are superior to base ore bows.
On the first night, a Wooden Bow is a good way to keep Zombies and Demon Eyes at bay, rather than a Wooden Sword which requires getting up close.

Some Cave Walls can be converted into Corrupt Walls: Mottled Stone Walls become Corrupt Pustule Walls, Fractured Stone Walls becomes Corrupt Tendril Walls, Worn Stone Walls become Corrupt Growth Walls, and Stalactite Stone Walls become Corrupt Mass Walls. Using a Clentaminator with Green Solution is the only way to reverse the conversion.
The Gold Ring can be useful for picking up dropped coins from flying enemies or collecting coins from an enemy farm.

Farming for a Lucky Coin / Discount Card /Gold Ring is most efficient from Flying Dutchmen, rather than from common pirates.
