After getting event progress to 50%, one can ensure 10 Flying Dutchmen per event by getting high enough above the ground (using a small platform or flying mount ), but not too high, so that spawned enemies will be in the "Active Rectangle" and will despawn after 12.5 seconds, and then spawn again. Using this method, only Flying Dutchmen and Parrots can reach the player. Parrots can be killed safely as they do not count towards event progress.

The Gold Ring is visually very similar to the Diamond Ring. While the Gold Ring's gems have a slightly blue hue and the gem in the middle has small golden spots on the side, the Diamond Ring consists of completely white gems.
The Gold Ring is the least rare of the ingredients for the Greedy Ring.
The Hand Warmer is the sole debuff-negating accessory that is not used to craft the Ankh Shield. This is probably due to the fact that the Hand Warmer can only be obtained during the Christmas event.
Like Clay and Silt, Slush cannot be converted to Corruption, Crimson, or Hallow.

As with other blocks that possess gravity, Slush can be easily harvested by digging below the block holding the Slush then place a Torch or piece of Minecart Track in its place. The last step then is to break the supporting block & let the Slush fall in.

Completing the Old One's Army event on any difficulty sets a hidden attribute for both the world it was completed on and the character who completed it. Any characters, including newly made ones, who visit that world may then use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world. The character who completed the event may also use Rods, Canes, and Staves on any world.

The Flameburst Towers' projectiles will explode on impact, damaging enemies within a 6×6-tile rectangle centered on the impact location. When wearing the Dark Artist armor, this area will be increased to a 13×13-tile rectangle area. [1]
The Flameburst Tower has a cooldown of 1.33 seconds (Rod) / 1.17 seconds (Cane) / 1 second (Staff) after attacking. [2] Verify

The Flameburst Tower only fires at enemies that are 56.25 tiles or less away, measured from the "mouth" shooting the projectiles. If the player has the Apprentice armor or Dark Artist armor equipped, this limit is increased to 84.375 tiles. [3]
Since the Flameburst Tower inflicts On Fire! / Hellfire, it pairs well with the Explosive Trap sentries when wearing Huntress or Red Riding armor, as they inflict the damage-boosting Oiled debuff.

Unlike the other sentries sold by the Tavernkeep, its area of effect is not large enough to hit more than 2 or 3 Old One's Army enemies at once. It also does not gain any extra damage output when used with Apprentice or Dark Artist armor, though the increased view range allows the towers to be placed at the center of the arena while still actively targeting enemies. Although it is generally the weakest of the four sentries, it has the benefit of always concentrating its attacks on the Old One's Army's front line.
Placing Flameburst towers on a platform some distance from the ground allows them to more reliably hit Etherian Wyverns and Kobold Gliders.
The Flameburst Tower emits light, so it can be useful when exploring caves to locate undiscovered sections.

Its item sprite appears to be inspired by that of a soul, despite not being one. Yoraiz0r's Spell was also introduced in 1.3, the same update which resprited all souls, making it likely for this to be the case. Yoraiz0r's Spell was also introduced in 1.3, the same update which resprited all souls, making it likely for this to be the case.
While this debuff is active, moving causes sounds and dust effects similar to those of the Hermes Boots.

Chilled even affects movement on certain mounts. Saddles, Blessed Apple, Fuzzy Carrot, Goat Skull, Hardy Saddle, Hexxed Branch, Reindeer Bells, and Scaly Truffle are all slowed down under the effect of this debuff.

When entering water while this debuff is active, the timer on the debuff will be invisible. This does not apply when player has the debuff longer than 5 seconds inside the Tundra biome. This does not apply when player has the debuff longer than 5 seconds inside the Tundra biome.

As with other types of grab bags, it is always worthwhile to open Oysters. Along with the edible Shucked Oyster, which can be sold for 20 SC, the pearls will sell for, on average, 51 SC 11 CC per Oyster.

The Vortex Beater is unique in that its stated stats do not correspond to actual stats of the projectiles. These stats include: [1] Use time : the bullets' fire rate corresponds to a use time of 5 (Insanely fast), while the Vortex Rockets' fire rate corresponds to a use time of 35 (Slow). These use time stats cannot be changed by speed bonuses. Velocity : the bullets' velocity is 14, while the Vortex Rockets' velocity is 8. Use time : the bullets' fire rate corresponds to a use time of 5 (Insanely fast), while the Vortex Rockets' fire rate corresponds to a use time of 35 (Slow). These use time stats cannot be changed by speed bonuses. Velocity : the bullets' velocity is 14, while the Vortex Rockets' velocity is 8.

Technically, when the Vortex Beater is being used, it spawns a gun projectile which can deal 100% of the weapon's damage (50 base damage) on contact. The gun projectile then spawns bullets and Vortex Rockets based on built-in fire rates. [2]

While the Vortex Beater fires both bullets and rockets, it consumes only bullets as ammunition. It cannot use any form of rocket or explosive as ammunition, and will therefore not benefit from the Shroomite Helmet.

Due to the inaccuracy of the bullets, the Vortex Beater is somewhat better suited against larger enemies and bosses (which may be immune to the knockback effect of the rockets, however). A better ranged weapon for single-target damage would be the Phantasm. Using Chlorophyte Bullets, which home in on enemies, helps counter the low accuracy. Still, the Phantasm has generally higher single-target DPS. Using Chlorophyte Bullets, which home in on enemies, helps counter the low accuracy. Still, the Phantasm has generally higher single-target DPS.

Since the rockets do not hurt the user, the Vortex Beater is an ideal gun for close-quarters combat – it has a high DPS (about 1,500 single-target DPS with standard bullets and no damage-enhancing armor or accessories), and the explosions knock enemies back.

Although the Vortex Beater has an animation of acceleration, it does not actually accelerate the rate of fire. This may indicate that this weapon was originally designed with an accelerating fire rate in mind, just like its counterpart, the Phantasm.
The Vortex Beater was formerly called the "Blackhole Beater", as seen in a spoiler released on YouTube on May 27th, 2015, 33 days before the release of the 1.3.0.1 update.
It is one of two firearms in Terraria to feature an operating secondary gun, the other being the Onyx Blaster.

After a short delay once the player stops firing, a click of the gun reloading can be heard. However, this has no effect on firing, as the player can fire a continuous stream of bullets without requiring any reloading. This sound effect is used by other shotgun-type weapons, specifically the Onyx Blaster, Boomstick, Shotgun, and Quad-Barrel Shotgun.

The weapon plays the sound of a shot twice for every bullet fired, proven when the weapon is shot once. This, combined with the Vortex Rockets, may make it the loudest gun in the game. This, combined with the Vortex Rockets, may make it the loudest gun in the game.
Due to its ability to turn damage taken into mana, the Magic Cuffs are a very valuable accessory when regularly using any kind of magic weapon.

Self-inducing damage proves to be a reliable source of mana restoration. With a reasonable amount of defense, the damage taken can be reduced to a negligible amount, while the mana restored equals the base damage. Damage can be self-induced by, for example, traps (including Spikes and Wooden Spikes ), explosives, or Exploding Bullets.
In comparison to the Mana Flower, the Magic Cuffs may be preferred due to the Mana Sickness debuff which consuming Mana Potions causes.

The Spectre armor set bonus pairs well with this, as using a magic weapon costs mana and restores health, and when the player takes damage the mana is restored, causing the process to repeat as long as the player is not taking too much damage and dealing magic damage.

Crafting the Magic Cuffs requires a Band of Starpower. This content is transcluded from Band of Starpower § Crimson worlds. Getting a Band of Starpower takes special measures in Crimson worlds, since it is normally dropped from Corruption -exclusive Shadow Orbs. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Band of Starpower can be crafted in the Graveyard, from a Panic Necklace and a Mana Crystal. It is also obtainable in Hardmode by fishing up Defiled Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in an artificial Corruption biome, which can be made with Corrupt Seeds from the Dryad when in a Hardmode Graveyard. On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Band of Starpower can be found in Living Wood Chests. On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, the Band of Starpower can be crafted in the Graveyard, from a Panic Necklace and a Mana Crystal. It is also obtainable in Hardmode by fishing up Defiled Crates (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) in an artificial Corruption biome, which can be made with Corrupt Seeds from the Dryad when in a Hardmode Graveyard. On the Nintendo 3DS version, the Band of Starpower can be found in Living Wood Chests.
None of the Horseshoe Balloons can be crafted with an Obsidian Horseshoe. The original Lucky Horseshoe must be used.
The double jump can be stopped midway by releasing the ↷ Jump button.
The Fart jump provides a speed boost when used, which can be used to quickly turn around while retaining some speed.
Dark Blue Solution can break a Plantera's Bulb when the Jungle blocks beneath it are converted to Glowing Mushroom biome blocks.
Solutions are consumed every 30 ticks (1/2 seconds) per use, while Brown, White and Yellow solutions are consumed every five ticks (1/12 seconds).
On the Desktop version, tags can be used when renaming chests. However, the total count of the characters is very limited (only up to 20 characters), including the characters used for tags.
This event is unique in that the player only needs to dodge and survive to complete it. There are no enemies or bosses to attack.

The Torch God is tied to one player at a time. In multiplayer, only one player is targeted by the torch fireballs and is affected by the Blackout debuff. Other players who have consumed the Torch God's Favor still hear the change of music for nearby players' events.
Torch fireballs match the color of torch they are fired from. This is purely cosmetic; all fireball colors have the same behavior and stats.
If the world is left while the Torch God is still ongoing, spent torches will not re-light. They will have to be reactivated or replaced.
Passing the event, dying, or leaving the world temporarily invalidates the existing torches. They can re-initiate the event after a short delay if the area is re-entered.
Any combination of torch types can be used to summon the Torch God.
Torches placed during the event can fire off at the player too.
Torch fireballs do not harm critters, enemies, or players who have already consumed the Torch God's Favor.
After the Torch God ends, there is a 60-second cooldown before the event can start again for a player. [5]
The Bestiary entry of the Torch God is unlocked once the Torch God's Favor is consumed.
Starting the event in an open area offers the player more room to dodge.
Only proper torches become part of the Torch God. Non-torch light sources like lanterns can provide light to the area without becoming fireballs.
Items that give the player a dodge chance, such as the Brain of Confusion, work against torch fireballs.
Taken as an agility challenge, having mobility items like grappling hooks is preferred to help dodge the torch fireballs.
Taken as an endurance challenge, having armor, buffs, and accessories that offer high defense is preferred to reduce the damage from the torch fireballs.

The player can lessen enemy spawns using a Calming Potion and Peace Candle to reduce dangerous distractions from enemies, allowing the player to focus on dodging the fireballs. Alternatively, the player can activate the event in a town for a greater spawn reduction. If the player fails, however, that town may become inaccessible until the player either completes the event or removes the torches. Alternatively, the player can activate the event in a town for a greater spawn reduction. If the player fails, however, that town may become inaccessible until the player either completes the event or removes the torches.

Some torches make their associated fireballs harder to see, while other torches make it easier to see. The best, brightest torch for dodging purposes is the White Torch, but is made from Diamonds and thus may be resource intensive. The second best torch is the Ultrabright Torch, and it is uncommonly sold from the Traveling Merchant. The third best torch is the Ichor Torch. Depending on the environment, the Ice Torch, Hallowed Torch, and Jungle Torch might be the fourth best.
The Torch God's Favor does not count as being in the inventory if it is in the trash slot, in a storage item like a Chest, or tossed to the ground. A player can use this to repeat the event.

The Torch God, as well as its reward, was most likely introduced as a response to the controversial " bad torch luck " feature introduced in 1.4.0.1 and removed in 1.4.0.3, which would punish players for using the wrong torch type in a given biome (e.g. using Ice Torches in the Underground Jungle as opposed to Jungle Torches).

The Torch God was initially discussed on live stream by Terraria streamer Pedguin on May 24th, 2020, as a way for Redigit to punish players for placing the wrong Torch. Redigit commented in the chat that he liked the idea.
The Torch God event is called HappyFunTorchTime in the game's source code.
When shot, each fireball emits the sound https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Item_8.wav used by several casters and magic weapons.
The Torch God is one of the few entities in the Bestiary that has a 5-star rating, making it one of the only 4 bosses with a 5-star rarity.

A Torch God NPC exists in-game, with the NPC ID of 664. It seems to be used for displaying the required info of the Torch God's Bestiary entry. If it is summoned via third-party software or mods and is killed, it would only drop 5–15 Lesser Healing Potions and some Hearts. Doing so will also unlock the Torch God's Bestiary entry. If it is summoned via third-party software or mods and is killed, it would only drop 5–15 Lesser Healing Potions and some Hearts. Doing so will also unlock the Torch God's Bestiary entry.

Tagging an enemy with a different whip will not cause the snowflake to disappear. This allows it to be used as a support weapon for crowd control. Although the snowflake does not disappear, it will remain stationary at the position of the last killed enemy. It will not move until another enemy gets into its range. Although the snowflake does not disappear, it will remain stationary at the position of the last killed enemy. It will not move until another enemy gets into its range.
The Cool Whip and its tooltip, ' Let me have some of that cool whip', are a reference to the brand of imitation whipped cream of the same name.

The Cool Whip's tooltip is also a reference to " Barely Legal ", the eighth episode of the fifth season of the American animated sitcom Family Guy, in which Stewie asks Brian for some Cool Whip, but pronounces it as "Cool Hwip."
The name of the Cool Flake's buff is a pun on the words nice and ice.
With perfect timing, it is possible to summon a snowflake at the same time the previous one is about to despawn. This way players can have multiple snowflake summons.
Hair color will also change dynamically on the map/minimap.

If the player does not wish to equip a watch, the Time Dye can act as a less precise Copper or Tin Watch to save room. However, they will need to equip a hat in the vanity slot (or not equip a helmet) that shows hair. Using a Familiar Wig can overcome this problem.
The Time Hair Dye's effect is shown while on the character select screen.
Although the Money Hair Dye only costs 10 GC, the player needs to have at least 1 PC in their inventory for the Stylist to sell it.
The player must be in a multiplayer world to purchase Team Hair Dye.
The Party Hair Dye will spawn confetti even if wearing a helmet that renders hair completely obscured.

Team Hair Dye works differently when compared with Team Dye and the player is not on a team (or in singleplayer): Team Hair Dye will make the hair white, while Team Dye will not work, as if having no dye applied to the item.
Biome Hair Dye uses the water color of the current biome. Activating a Water Fountain will change the hair color to that of the Water Fountain's biome despite not changing the biome.

Although Pixies appear to "fly", they are only capable of hovering about four tiles above the ground at most, limiting them to a similar horizontal "jumping" range as a Zombie. However, Pixies can also "climb" vertical walls in order to reach the player, limiting the effectiveness of pit traps.

Pixies' movement patterns complicate farming, as they float above shallow pools of lava and their bobbing movement makes it difficult to hit them with stationary traps. Minions with close-range attacks, such as Spiders, Ravens and Deadly Spheres, can mitigate this difficulty.

Pixies can drop the Megaphone and Fast Clock at the same time. When one of them is dropped (a 1/100 (1%) / 1/50 (2%) chance), there is a 1/100 (1%) ( 1/50 (2%) ) chance to drop the other one as well. [1] Therefore, the chance to drop both is 1/10000 (0.01%) ( 1/2500 (0.04%) ).
The Fairy Bell summons a Fairy which looks similar to a Pixie and serves as a light source to players.
The Pixie's design is a nod to a fairy design from the fantasy action-adventure video game franchise The Legend of Zelda, in which some fairies are spheres of colored light with wings.
In some older versions, Pixie sound effects, along with a few others, would become distorted under certain conditions. Verify
The idle sound the Pixie makes can sometimes still be heard a few seconds after it is killed, due to the sound being very long.

If the surface of the Hallow does not spawn in a world (such as if the Jungle already occupies that space), it may be necessary to buy Hallowed Seeds from the Dryad to spread the Hallow in another location, or farm Pixie drops in another world.

Despite increasing block placement speed, neither the Builder Potion, Brick Layer, nor Architect Gizmo Pack cause blocks to be processed more quickly. The speed depends solely on the block's use time. [2]

The world-generated ores appear with equal chances as their alternatives, e.g., the Extractinator produces an equal chance of Gold Ore and Platinum Ore, regardless of which is found underground in that world.

Unlike crates, the Extractinator will not provide Hardmode ores even if the world is in Hardmode. It will not produce high-tier pre-Hardmode ores such as Demonite, either. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This can be resolved by upgrading the Extractinator into a Chlorophyte Extractinator. (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) This can be resolved by upgrading the Extractinator into a Chlorophyte Extractinator.

999 Silt or Slush Blocks yield a fair collection of loot. The table below breaks down, prorates, and summarizes the sale prices. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Most of the gems are much more valuable when crafted into Stained Glass : Each gem except Diamond makes 1 GC worth of Stained Glass. The gems can also be crafted into Gemcorns, to grow more gems directly. Diamonds cannot be turned into Stained Glass or anything else with a higher sale price than the gems. Amber can be crafted into Crate Potions, which allow fishing for crate loot worth far more than the Amber's sale price. If processing Desert Fossils, the resulting Sturdy Fossils have no sell value themselves, but used in a number of recipes, notably Scarab Bombs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Any excess can be turned into Bone Throwing Knives and sold that way. Notice how much of the total average payoff comes from the small chance of obtaining Platinum Coins. The total yields are normally 8 GC or 9 GC or so lower, but with a 6%–7% chance per 1000 blocks of a platinum jackpot. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Most of the gems are much more valuable when crafted into Stained Glass : Each gem except Diamond makes 1 GC worth of Stained Glass. The gems can also be crafted into Gemcorns, to grow more gems directly. Diamonds cannot be turned into Stained Glass or anything else with a higher sale price than the gems. Amber can be crafted into Crate Potions, which allow fishing for crate loot worth far more than the Amber's sale price. The gems can also be crafted into Gemcorns, to grow more gems directly. Diamonds cannot be turned into Stained Glass or anything else with a higher sale price than the gems. Amber can be crafted into Crate Potions, which allow fishing for crate loot worth far more than the Amber's sale price. If processing Desert Fossils, the resulting Sturdy Fossils have no sell value themselves, but used in a number of recipes, notably Scarab Bombs (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Any excess can be turned into Bone Throwing Knives and sold that way. Notice how much of the total average payoff comes from the small chance of obtaining Platinum Coins. The total yields are normally 8 GC or 9 GC or so lower, but with a 6%–7% chance per 1000 blocks of a platinum jackpot.
If processing a large quantity of blocks, it may be helpful to clear out inventory space (16 or 17 slots) so the rewarded items are not deposited on the ground.
When trying to find an Extractinator it is easiest to look in the Underground Desert (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) since most underground houses have an Extractinator.

Due to the dangers of the Underground Desert, the lower chances of getting ores/coins/gems (but Amber) and how common Silt is in other biomes, Desert Fossil is a less viable option for getting ores/coins/gems.
The sound that is played when picking up an item https://terraria.wiki.gg/wiki/File:Grab.wav is played every time an item is processed, even if the result is not picked up.
The Goblin Warlock can jump and fly fairly high into the air, almost as high as a player with wings.
Knockback can stop the Goblin Warlock from flying to the player.

She can be easily defeated with a ranged weapon (a rapid-fire ranged weapon that has enough knockback to freeze her in place proves useful), a long platform suspended high in the air, and Hermes Boots (or a Unicorn Mount / Minecart Track ). Simply run away from the Goblin Warlock continuously – if she is constantly moving she will not summon the Shadowflame Apparitions.
The Goblin Warlock is explicitly confirmed to be female through her Bestiary entry, even though the term warlock is typically used to describe a male practitioner of witchcraft.
Although the Goblin Warlock drops various Shadowflame weapons, she will never use any of them in battle. Even the Shadowflame Hex Doll, which is clearly part of her sprite, is never used.
The Goblin Warlock is the only Hardmode-exclusive goblin. She is also the only goblin with unique hurt and death sounds, as well as a custom idle sound.
If one slows down the death sound of the Goblin Warlock by about 50%, then they will be left with an audio that sounds like she screams "Help!".
The item's tooltip refers to the term al dente, which describes pasta or rice that is cooked to be firm to the bite.
Neither of its bonuses stack with the Apprentice's Scarf, Monk's Belt, or Squire's Shield.
Unlike most other shield accessories, the Huntress's Buckler does not synergize with the Brand of the Inferno to block attacks.
The Huntress's Buckler and the Squire's Shield are the only shield accessories that do not grant defense.
Capes are still visible in merfolk or werewolf form.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Capes cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
The Crimson Cloak can be purchased even in worlds generated with Corruption. Its name refers to the cape's actual color, for which the infectious biome is also named.
Though any equipped shields will correctly be displayed under any of the capes, the walking animation will cause the shield to clip through the capes.
Living Mahogany Trees can spawn in all parts of the Cavern layer instead of only Underground Jungle in drunk worlds (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).
When mined (with a Pickaxe or Drill ), the blocks drop Rich Mahogany, while Mahogany Leaf Blocks are destroyed without dropping items.
A Living Mahogany Tree may spawn over a Jungle Temple, replacing some Lihzahrd Bricks with Living Mahogany, allowing early access in some cases.
The Last Prism consumes significantly less mana while unfocused. Consider firing in short holds if there is no need for the concentrated beam, such as when facing large enemies or groups.
While held, the Last Prism's aim works in a sweeping motion, so the turn rate is reduced.
Due to the rapid hits of the converged beam, it is possible for the lifesteal set bonus from the Spectre Hood to not produce a healing orb when using the converged beam to attack enemies.
The beam will stop firing after 1 minute of continuous use but will continue to drain mana.

The beam may partly clip through blocks visually, although it cannot pass through blocks. Due to its hitbox, it is possible for the beam to deal damage to targets directly behind a 2-tile thick wall, but this feature has little practical usage.

When combining the Last Prism's base damage of 100 with accessories such as the Celestial Emblem, Sorcerer Emblem, Avenger Emblem, and other damage boosters such as Nebula armor or the Clairvoyance buff from the Crystal Ball, it is possible to double its damage output.

Although Super Mana Potions are the only effective way to continuously fire the beam, the Mana Sickness debuff they incur heavily reduces its damage output. If this is not of the player's concern, the Mana Flower can be a helpful asset. If it is, there are quite a few other workarounds: It is also possible to set up statues of enemies with a 1 Second Timer and use minions or traps / lava to kill them. Then, using the Celestial Magnet or its upgrades, the player continuously picks up mana Stars. Statues of the Skeleton, Crab, Slimes, and other less mobile enemies with lower health values are recommended. One can also use Magic Cuffs (or Celestial Cuffs ) while standing on Spikes to fire the beam indefinitely. With a Celestial Stone, this results in very slow health loss, such that one can recover with potions. While not effective against many fast-moving bosses, it can be useful in events such as the Old One's Army. Although Spikes inflict the Bleeding debuff on contact, this can be remedied by equipping an Adhesive Bandage or its upgrades. It is also possible to set up statues of enemies with a 1 Second Timer and use minions or traps / lava to kill them. Then, using the Celestial Magnet or its upgrades, the player continuously picks up mana Stars. Statues of the Skeleton, Crab, Slimes, and other less mobile enemies with lower health values are recommended. One can also use Magic Cuffs (or Celestial Cuffs ) while standing on Spikes to fire the beam indefinitely. With a Celestial Stone, this results in very slow health loss, such that one can recover with potions. While not effective against many fast-moving bosses, it can be useful in events such as the Old One's Army. Although Spikes inflict the Bleeding debuff on contact, this can be remedied by equipping an Adhesive Bandage or its upgrades.

With Nebula armor, an enemy statue farm (provides buffs ), magic-boosting accessories, and a proper arena, it is possible to reach 250,000 points in the Pumpkin Moon. A similar effect can be achieved in the Frost Moon.
With an enemy statue farm, it is possible to use the Last Prism almost infinitely by collecting the Stars dropped by killed enemies. Star Statues can also help with this.
With Nebula armor, a Mana Flower, the Crystal Ball 's buff, and Magic Power Potions, the Moon Lord can be defeated far before the 60-second use time of the Last Prism expires.
It is only recommended to use it in open-area combat as the beams cannot go through solid blocks. The Lunar Flare, another magic weapon dropped by the Moon Lord, serves better for this purpose.
The Last Prism beam has the same sound effect as the Phaseblade and Phasesaber.

This item could be considered an upgrade to the Charged Blaster Cannon, as both have a high- DPS beam. The super beam is similar to the Phantasmal Deathray launched by the Moon Lord and the True Eyes of Cthulhu. The super beam is similar to the Phantasmal Deathray launched by the Moon Lord and the True Eyes of Cthulhu.

The Last Prism used to have the highest overall DPS of any weapon in Terraria, but it has since been surpassed by the Zenith. However, it still possesses the highest magic DPS in the game, capable of reaching up to 15,000 DPS against a single Target Dummy. However, it still possesses the highest magic DPS in the game, capable of reaching up to 15,000 DPS against a single Target Dummy.

The beams change to various different colors if the character's name is one of the following names listed below, which are the names of various testers for Terraria. Having the name "Random" will also randomize the colors. The same effect is true of the weapon drops from the Empress of Light (aside from the Kaleidoscope ).

The Nebula Arcanum can consume mana very rapidly under constant use. Players should have items that provide mana at the ready when using this item, such as the Mana Flower and Mana Regeneration Potions.
The lasting duration, homing properties, and orbiting projectiles make the Nebula Arcanum a very effective crowd-clearing weapon.
The Nebula Arcanum is capable of dealing more DPS than any other pre- Moon Lord magic weapon, but has difficulty striking fast enemies and bosses.

If attempting to clear the Celestial Pillars as a magic user; the Nebula Arcanum can be incredibly effective at destroying each of the pillars when their shields are down, as they do not move and have enormous hitboxes, allowing all of the effects of the weapon to deal full damage.

The Nebula Arcanum's damage output is high enough that it can be used to skip most of the Empress of Light (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) 's attack rotations, making it much easier to fight during the daytime.
When using the Nebula Arcanum, the player holds a dark purple orb orbited by a pink ring. The projectiles appear to emerge from this orb.
The projectile shares a sprite with the Lunar Portal as well as the portals that appear in the Vortex area, although they are not the same color.
The item's inventory sprite resembles typical depictions of a crystal ball, which are often wrapped in cloth for safekeeping.
The Nebula Arcanum greatly resembles the Arcane Orb from the 2012 hack-and-slash action role-playing game Diablo III in both appearance and function.

This content is transcluded from Vanity Accessories/tip. Because vanity accessories such as the Hunter Cloak cannot be reforged to grant any benefits besides appearance, it is recommended to equip them in the player's social accessory slots.
Armor with large shoulders, such as Spectre armor, will partially clip through the cloak.
Having a shield or pair of wings visible will override the cloak.

This item is a reference to the Survey Corps cloak in the Japanese manga series Attack on Titan. [1] Additionally, the protagonist of the series is named Eren Yeager. Yeager is a transliteration of the German word Jäger, which means hunter. A full Survey Corps uniform could be imitated by wearing the Hunter Cloak with the Pirate Pants and Steampunk Shirt. Additionally, the protagonist of the series is named Eren Yeager. Yeager is a transliteration of the German word Jäger, which means hunter. A full Survey Corps uniform could be imitated by wearing the Hunter Cloak with the Pirate Pants and Steampunk Shirt.
The cloak being sold separately to players with a high golf score likely refers to the golf tournament The Masters, which has a tradition of awarding a green jacket to its winner.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Due to the fact that it can very cheaply be upgraded into an Enchanted Boomerang, players who find a Wooden Boomerang should upgrade it as soon as possible for the major stat increases. Since this also increases the sell price to multiple times its original, it is worth upgrading boomerangs as they are found.
It cannot be obtained from Wooden Crates, despite the fact that many of the other rare items found in Wooden Chests can.
Like most projectiles, the Flairon moves slower in liquids. However, as it emits bubbles while deployed, increasing the time it remains extended also increases its damage output.

On the Desktop, Console, and Mobile versions, the Flairon's bubbles will not inflict debuffs, do not carry fire effects from the Magma Stone, its derivatives, or the Frost armor set bonus, and do not trigger the Hallowed armor 's set bonus. The head, however, will carry all of these.

Without modifiers, the head travels at a speed of 102 mph. This can be seen by using a Mechanical Cart (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) (which travels at 102 mph according to the Stopwatch ), and firing the direction opposite of where the player is going.
The Flairon and its projectiles can go through one-block-thick walls. By standing against the wall and horizontally launching the Flairon, it will sometimes go through the wall.
In order to maximize the damage output, it is beneficial to try and run away from the direction the Flairon is thrown in.

Because the Flairon produces the bubbles while it is being swung, it is more effective if aimed slightly away from desired targets. The bubbles do the same amount of damage as the main projectile but have the additional bonus of homing and frequency.

On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, the Flairon is one of most powerful melee weapons available. On the Desktop, Console, and Mobile versions, it is outclassed by the Solar Eruption, although its homing abilities make it useful in the endgame.
The name Flairon is a portmanteau of flail and fishron.
Re-Logic has referred to the Flairon as "Flailron" in patch notes. [1]

This is one of only three flails that fire additional projectiles, the others being the Flower Pow and the Drippler Crippler (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). Of these, the Flairon is the only launched flail out of the three.
The Cobalt Sword has a lower use time than all of the other Hardmode ore swords.

The Cobalt Sword bears a strong resemblance to the Muramasa and the Japanese katana ( which is also in Terraria ), and fits with the "feudal Asia" theme of other Cobalt weapons and armor. The real-life katana is a very light, thin blade, which is represented in Terraria by the Cobalt Sword's high speed. The real-life katana is a very light, thin blade, which is represented in Terraria by the Cobalt Sword's high speed.

In 1.4.4 and 1.4.4.9, the Muramasa and Katana were given curved blades to make them look more like real-world Katanas. However, despite also receiving a sprite change in 1.4.4.9, the Cobalt Sword did not receive a curved blade.
Because of its lack of color, it may be hard to dye a beanie with regular dye. Try combining the dye with Black Dye, or swap in a Strange Dye.
Jim's Wings act similar to the Hoverboard in the fact that when not in use, they do not appear on the characters back.

All ranged damage bonuses from equipment will be applied to the traits of the coins used to fire it (a Destroyer Emblem will add an 8% critical strike chance to the Coin Gun and Gold Coins, but will only add the 10% damage bonus to the Gold Coins).
The Coin Gun does not receive the specialized damage boost from any of the three headpieces of Shroomite armor. [b]
Ammo conservation effects such as those of the Ammo Box, the Ammo Reservation Potion, or Shroomite armor work normally with the Coin Gun.

(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Coins are consumed from the designated coin slots first, then the inventory (from top left to bottom right). (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Coins are consumed from the inventory first (from top left to bottom right), then the designated coin slots. (Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Coins are consumed from the inventory first (from top left to bottom right), then the designated coin slots.

In Celebrationmk10 (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Coin Gun can be purchased from the Princess for 30 GC after completing a Pirate Invasion for the first time.
If used with Platinum Coins, the Coin Gun is easily one of the most powerful weapons in the game, though this can make combat prohibitively expensive.

Combining the Coin Gun with either the Lucky Coin, Coin Ring (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), or Greedy Ring (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), can establish a somewhat infinite supply of ammo, as long as combat is intensive.
The Coin Gun becomes much more viable in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) due to the larger volume of coin drops.
It pairs well with Vortex armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) or Shroomite armor as it greatly increases the DPS and reduces coins used.
The Coin Gun firing Platinum Coins has a similar damage output per shot as the Sniper Rifle, but with nearly five times the fire rate.

In Journey Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), the player can duplicate infinite amounts of Gold/Platinum Coins starting with just one Silver Coin, thus making the Coin Gun an extremely powerful weapon for Journey Mode.

Without taking defense into account, it is more cost-efficient to convert coins to lower denominations for ammo. However, this comes at the cost of a lower damage rate. Because 1,000,000 Copper Coins can be made from a single Platinum Coin, Copper Coins are 125,000 times more resource-efficient than using platinum to achieve the same damage.

The Coin Gun requires a constant craft of 100 low-tier coins because the pickup of coins can convert the stacks with lower than 100 coins into a higher-tier coin, otherwise, it can eventually use unwanted coins. It requires constant attention to the ammunition amount indicated. If there is less than 200 ammo, it can start using Silver, Gold, or Platinum Coins. The Encumbering Stone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be useful to ensure that extra coins are not picked up accidentally over the course of a battle. The Encumbering Stone (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be useful to ensure that extra coins are not picked up accidentally over the course of a battle.

The Coin Gun remains an extremely rare item. Before 1.3, it took an average of 66–67 Pirate Invasions to be completed before it dropped. With the addition of the Flying Dutchman in 1.3.0.1, there is an increased chance for the Coin Gun to be dropped, but it is still very rare.

The quote by the Goblin Tinkerer, " Goblins are surprisingly easy to anger. In fact, they could start a war over cloth! ", references how Tattered Cloth is used indirectly to summon a Goblin Army (via crafting it into a Goblin Battle Standard), starting a small war.
When Deerclops is alive, the opacity of the Blizzard visual effect will be reduced.

If all players are dead or there are none nearby, Deerclops will wander around/go to the tundra it spawned in instead of immediately despawning. Note that if all players die in a virtual tundra biome deerclops will wander around there instead of its original spawn. This will happen until a player gets close to the boss, at which point the fight will resume as normal. Once one in-game day (24 real-world minutes) has passed since Deerclops's spawn, it will despawn as soon as no players are near. Leaving and re-entering the world will also cause it to despawn. Like all other bosses, Pylons cannot be used while Deerclops is alive in a world, and time cannot be accelerated by sleeping in a bed. Like all other bosses, Pylons cannot be used while Deerclops is alive in a world, and time cannot be accelerated by sleeping in a bed.
Deerclops cannot pass through solid blocks, but if the player is above it, far enough away, and Deerclops cannot reach them, it will quickly rise through the blocks in order to reach the player.
Defeating Deerclops is not required for the Slayer of Worlds achievement.

There are no prerequisite bosses that are required to be defeated in order to summon this boss. However, Deerclops' strength may warrant waiting until the player has defeated the Eater of Worlds or the Brain of Cthulhu to fight it. With sufficient skill, the Deerclops can be defeated earlier in game progression, which can be helpful to the player during pre-Hardmode. With sufficient skill, the Deerclops can be defeated earlier in game progression, which can be helpful to the player during pre-Hardmode.

A Warmth Potion is useful when fighting Deerclops, as the boss is affected by its buff. In addition, one may find it useful to bring a Hand Warmer to the battle, since the Frozen debuff can easily cause the player to die quickly if inflicted.

Building a platform of non-solid blocks about 6 tiles (twice the height of the player) up in the air, along with staircases made of solid blocks on either side to allow Deerclops to get on, can elevate it high enough above the ground to prevent the boss from using its debris attack entirely, making the fight much easier.
Due to being able to inflict Slow from a large range, accessories like the Anklet of the Wind or Magiluminescence alongside Swiftness Potions can help make the fight much more manageable.
Avoid lingering directly above Deerclops, as the Shadow Hands it summons in this situation are very dangerous.
The player can run between Deerclops's legs without taking damage. This is useful for avoiding the first two Ice Spike attacks, but the player should not stick around for the third.

Players should place their spawn point away from where Deerclops can wander, as it can stay around the spawn area. This is especially recommended for Mediumcore players, as they can be left defenseless near Deerclops if they die in the middle of the fight. This is especially recommended for Mediumcore players, as they can be left defenseless near Deerclops if they die in the middle of the fight.

The Frozen debuff from the Ice Spike attack is capable of interrupting a player's extending grappling hook, causing them to drop to the ground. Avoid moving over large gaps to prevent unnecessary damage.
Deerclops is part of the Don't Starve Together crossover. Many of the items of this crossover are dropped by Deerclops.
Deerclops's purple invulnerable form in Terraria resembles its Winter's Feast form in Don't Starve Together.
Deerclops is a portmanteau of deer and cyclops.
It is the only non-event boss in Terraria to not despawn immediately after killing the player.

Deerclops is one of the two bosses that consists of a single destructible entity, the other being the Empress of Light. All other boss fights are composed of either multiple bosses, multiple segments, or summoned minions that play a part in their battles. Between the versions 1.4.3 and 1.4.3.6, there was an NPC named DeerclopsLeg in the files which did not appear during the fight. It was invincible [4] and had its own AI [5]. It was removed in the 1.4.4 update, with its NPC ID replaced with that of the Stinkbug. All other boss fights are composed of either multiple bosses, multiple segments, or summoned minions that play a part in their battles. Between the versions 1.4.3 and 1.4.3.6, there was an NPC named DeerclopsLeg in the files which did not appear during the fight. It was invincible [4] and had its own AI [5]. It was removed in the 1.4.4 update, with its NPC ID replaced with that of the Stinkbug.
Deerclops is the first non-event crossover boss, as well as the first pre-Hardmode crossover boss.
Deerclops is one of seven bosses with exclusive boss music, the others being the Queen Bee, Queen Slime, Plantera, Empress of Light, Duke Fishron, and Moon Lord.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Despite a faster swing speed, the Reaver Shark has the same mining speed as the Molten Pickaxe ; both are still somewhat slow in mining blocks that are easily broken in one hit, such as Dirt.

In Don't dig up (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and Get fixed boi (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) worlds, the Reaver Shark is obtainable in the middle of the world, in or just above the Glowing Mushroom layer.

(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Obtaining Hellstone Bars via Reaver Shark allow the player to craft Hellstone equipment, which is a major skip of typical gameplay progression. On top of that, the Reaver Shark is capable of mining Cobalt and Palladium ore after the player enters Hardmode, meaning a Molten Pickaxe does not need to be crafted.

The Reaver Shark is relatively easy to obtain. A Reinforced Fishing Pole with some bait is all that is needed. Sonar Potions can be created using ingredients found near the Ocean and are very helpful too.

It bears some visual resemblance to a hammerhead shark. The most notable difference is that the Reaver Shark has its head in a vertical direction instead of a horizontal direction. This being said, however, the Reaver Shark is not a real creature.
There are three fish tools that can be obtained through fishing: the Sawtooth Shark (a chainsaw), the Reaver Shark, and the Rockfish (a hammer).
They can be found in large quantities in Spider Nests. These caves can be identified by large amounts of Cobwebs surrounding the cave's walls.

On the Desktop version, Console version, and Mobile version, Wall Creepers can still spawn, albeit rarely, in Hardmode. On the Old-gen console and 3DS versions, Black Recluses completely replace them once Hardmode starts. This means that in these versions, Wall Creepers, as well as their enemy banner will be rendered unobtainable once Hardmode begins in that current world.
Like all spiders, Wall Creepers cannot travel through a 2-tile wide shaft.
They can crawl through one-tile wide/tall holes in background walls.
Despite the in-game variant being a spider, in real life, the wallcreeper is a small passerine bird found throughout the high mountains of the Palearctic from southern Europe to central China.
A quote of the Skeleton Merchant (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) suggests that he may have become skeletal due to this spider.

Worms, Grasshoppers, and Jungle baits ( Buggy, Grubby, and Sluggy ) have a chance to spawn when destroying background objects on the surface (see table below). If the number of bait critters existing in the world has reached its upper limit, no more will spawn. The three types of Jungle baits share a total upper limit of 8.
The Guide to Critter Companionship (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can be helpful for gathering baits.

Using Ladybugs as bait can be beneficial. Although the decrease in fishing power from the bad luck of "killing" two ladybugs (averaging out to roughly -30% fishing power) outweighs the +20% bonus provided by rain, only the first two ladybugs decrease the player's luck (the rest only refreshing the penalty's duration), and all of them refresh the duration of the increased chance of rain, so ladybugs can be continually used as bait until the rain starts. Rain lasts at least for 8 minutes (roughly 20 minutes on average), while bad luck from killing ladybugs will wear off in only 3 minutes.

Fishing itself can be a viable way of obtaining bait: Using Crate and Sonar Potions, and refusing common catches like Bass, the Angler Bait obtained from the crates is generally more than what was used, and Master Bait with its 50% bait power (and thus, durability) will rapidly replace any other kind of bait. However, gathering bait critters is fairly easy in the Forest, Jungle, or Hallow biomes. The options depend on biome and time of day. Rows of Mud Blocks with Jungle Grass Seeds on them can be used as a farm, as they will grow background plants which can be harvested for Jungle bait critters. Remember that a total of 8 Jungle bait critters can exist at a time. The spawn rates and spawn caps of critters are affected by many of the same factors as those of hostile enemies, hence Water Candles, Peace Candles (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Battle Potions, Calming Potions, and Sunflowers will affect critter spawns. As such, when attempting to farm critters, it is advised to use a Battle Potion and either hold or place a Water Candle nearby. In all cases, nearby NPCs improve the proportion of critters as compared to enemies. Provided enough are nearby, they can even suppress enemy spawns completely, which results in critters being the only creatures able to spawn. When in the Underworld or in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies may still occasionally spawn, even when many NPCs are nearby. Flower Boots (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are an excellent means to farm bait. They work on all types of grass whose plants are suitable for spawning critters – regular, Jungle, and Hallowed. Bait can be farmed by running across a stretch of grass with Flower Boots on, then removing the boots and destroying the flowers. This is a bit slow, but it remains the only way to produce bait on demand without relying on natural critter spawns. However, gathering bait critters is fairly easy in the Forest, Jungle, or Hallow biomes. The options depend on biome and time of day. Rows of Mud Blocks with Jungle Grass Seeds on them can be used as a farm, as they will grow background plants which can be harvested for Jungle bait critters. Remember that a total of 8 Jungle bait critters can exist at a time. When in the Underworld or in Expert Mode (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), enemies may still occasionally spawn, even when many NPCs are nearby. Flower Boots (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) are an excellent means to farm bait. They work on all types of grass whose plants are suitable for spawning critters – regular, Jungle, and Hallowed. Bait can be farmed by running across a stretch of grass with Flower Boots on, then removing the boots and destroying the flowers. This is a bit slow, but it remains the only way to produce bait on demand without relying on natural critter spawns.
The names of the three bait types are based on the three ranks of craft guilds, Apprentice, Journeyman (or fellow), and Master (sometimes grandmaster).

The Master Bait's name is a double-entendre on the word masturbate. This is a common joke in the fishing industry, used by real-life fishermen, bait shops, and in numerous hook baiting tutorials. [4] According to Redigit, adding the joke to Terraria was Cenx ' idea. [5]

Like the Cochineal Beetle, the Lac Beetle exists in the real world, but is a scale insect, not a beetle. It secretes lac, which can be used as a dye, or converted into shellac, a brush-on colorant, food glaze, and wood finish. Just like in Terraria, real-life lac dye is processed primarily into red or violet hues.

Since the projectile itself is comparably large and its return trip can pierce unlimited enemies, throwing it past a group of enemies and pulling it through them is an effective strategy, making the Anchor very useful for controlling large groups of enemies.
It is most useful in early Hardmode, quickly being outclassed by better weapons as the player progresses.
The Anchor can be considered a Hardmode upgrade of the pre-Hardmode Harpoon.
The crate resembles the sprites of Forbidden armor.
Although the crate contains the same primary items as a Sandstone Chest, it will not contain a Desert Minecart or an Encumbering Stone.

Stat-wise, Spooky armor is roughly tied with Tiki armor, and beaten by Stardust armor (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions). While Spooky armor has noticeably higher bonus damage compared to Tiki armor, this comes at the cost of 5 defense and a 30% increase to whip range.
If combined with the Necromantic Scroll, Hercules Beetle, Summoner Emblem, and Papyrus Scarab, the total increased summon damage will be 113%.
With an exchange rate of 50 CC per unit of Spooky Wood, crafting and selling Spooky Helmets is the most efficient way to convert Spooky Wood into coins.

The Spooky Leggings increase walking movement speed from 15 mph to 18 mph. However, if the player already has boots equipped (e.g. Hermes Boots ), the Leggings' movement speed will not have that noticeable an increase to the player's movement speed.
The only difference between male and female sets of Spooky armor seems to be the orange/red markings on the upper breastplate.
Spooky armor is both the strongest and costliest armor that is crafted with a form of wood.
The Moon Lord 's screen effect causes the Spooky armor to lose its orange/red markings.

When the player is stuck in Cobweb tiles and does not leave them, a single Cobweb tile is broken after a random period between 0.33 seconds and 1.67 seconds. Additionally, Cobwebs immediately break if the player collides with them when riding a minecart. [1]
Placed Cobwebs do not impede the movement of enemies, NPCs, or critters.
Although Cobwebs have no sell value, they can be crafted into Silk, which has a sell value of 2 SC. At 7 Cobwebs per Silk, this results in a sell value of 28 CC for a Cobweb.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Placed Cobwebs can support falling blocks like Sand and Silt ; removing the Cobwebs allows them to fall, causing damage to whatever they hit.
Because they slow player movement, Cobwebs can be used in the construction of pits to prevent fall damage.
It is more resourceful to make Silk Rope instead of Web Rope, as using Silk consumes less Cobweb and yields more rope.
An easy way to find Cobweb is to use a Dangersense Potion as it highlights the Cobweb on the screen.
The Bestiary entry for the Zombie Elf: " Elves that used to work for Santa, but have since been zombified. They don't complain much, so they are still pretty good helpers. "
The Houndius Shootius is the only pre-Hardmode sentry which is not a Tavernkeep's Sentry.
The tooltip is a reference to Wortox 's examination quote for the Houndius Shootius in Don't Starve Together.

Since the Berserker's Glove has increased defense and its autoswing and melee speed boost applies to whips, it can be a good option for a summoner-class player, albeit at the cost of being targeted more often in multiplayer. The other fork in this crafting tree, the Mechanical Glove and its upgrades, does not apply any damage boost to whips, making the Berserker's Glove superior for summoners.

The Universal Pylon can be used as a kind of reusable Potion of Return, allowing players to place the Universal Pylon, teleport to their base, and then teleport back to the Universal Pylon from a pylon in their base.

Notable places that do not have their own pylons include the Dungeon, Jungle Temple, and Space. While the Underworld does not have its own pylon, the Demon Conch is available to teleport to there from anywhere. Additionally, a Cavern Pylon will function in the Underworld. While the Underworld does not have its own pylon, the Demon Conch is available to teleport to there from anywhere. Additionally, a Cavern Pylon will function in the Underworld.
The tooltip is a reference to the 1998 military science fiction real-time strategy game StarCraft. [1]
Although spawn rates are significantly increased during a Blood Moon, it is not guaranteed that a Clown will spawn.
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) Although the Bananarang is a weapon, due to its stackable nature (a feature shared only with Light Discs ), the Clown may drop multiple Bananarangs at a time.
In the Getfixedboi and Don't dig up Secret world seeds, Clowns will drop the Chain Knife instead of the KO Cannon.

This enemy is modeled after the archetypal evil clown, which has been a recurring urban legend in the United States since the 1900s. The archetype was popularized in 1940 by the Joker from DC Comics, and again in 1986 by Pennywise from the horror novel It by Stephen King.

According to Yoraiz0r, the Pixel Box "was an attempt at a single-block light that would be easier to use to make things light up or not, but it ended up not satisfactory" and was thus originally not made obtainable. [1]

The bee spawning effect of the Honey Comb, Bee Cloak, Sweetheart Necklace, Honey Balloon, and Stinger Necklace (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) do not stack. The same amount of bees will appear after being damaged no matter how many of these items are equipped.

The falling star effects of the Star Cloak, Mana Cloak (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), Bee Cloak, and Star Veil also do not stack. The quantity and damage of falling stars from the effect will not be affected by having multiple of these items equipped.

Because the Bee Cloak is obtainable much later in the game than other bee summoning items, bees as a damage source are likely obsolete by the time it becomes craftable. However, it can also be used to receive the (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Honey buff and to activate the following set bonuses: Orichalcum armor (Flower Petals) (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Titanium armor (Titanium Barrier buff) Palladium armor (Rapid Healing buff) Orichalcum armor (Flower Petals) (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) Titanium armor (Titanium Barrier buff) Palladium armor (Rapid Healing buff)
(Old-gen console and 3DS versions) The Bee Cloak's, Star Cloak 's, and Star Veil 's projectile is called Hallow Star.
